Cut to Aang and Bumi in one of the transport bins rocketing down the slide. The flashback ends, but it is clear that Aang, Katara and Sokka are now at the same place in the city where the flashback occurred. The view pans up to the top of the slide where the three are now sitting one of the transport bins, teetering. Aang is excited, the other two are leery.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: One ride, then we're off to the North Pole, Airbender's honor.<br><b>Katara</b>: This sounded like fun at first, but now that I'm here, I'm starting to have second thoughts!<br><br><i>(As Katara finishes her sentence the view cuts to an overhead shot that shows the initial vertical drop. It is intimidating. As she finishes, the bin drops into the chute and they rocket away. As the accelerate down the chute, a neighboring chute becomes visible in the background. It is clearly going to merge with the chute our group is in. A rack of spears is dropping down this other chute and after the two paths merge, Sokka is soon ducking to avoid getting killed. Katara and Sokka start making distressed noises as they try and avoid the spears.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I'm on it! I'm on it!<br><br><i>(Aang starts rocking the bin back and forth in the chute. He soon derails them out of the chute and their bin freefalls onto a rooftop below. Cut to a view of a group of Earth Kingdom soldier being addressed by an officer.)</i><br><br><b>Officer</b>: Men, you'll be going off to combat soon. It's important that you be prepared for anything.<br><br><i>(At this moment, the bin with our group falls into view, shocking the audience. The frame stops with the accompanying sound effect of an egg-timer going off.. Aang has grabbed the front of the bin and is apparently trying to pull it up, his foot in Katara's face. Sokka is panicking in the back. The frame rate speeds up again as Aang airbends to propel the bin back into the air and out of the screen. Within a shot or two they have managed to drop back into a chute and are rocketing down once again.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, do something! Use your airbending!<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh! Good idea! That'll make us go even faster!<br><br><i>(Aang blasts air behind them, making them speed up. Cut to city dwellers looking at them in alarm as they whiz by down the chute. As they approach the drop down of the last major chute, they all screen as they see the off-load point just in front of them. The off-load has a package on it that they will hit. An earthbender next to it moves the package. Cut to the kids, who breathe a sigh of relief. Cut back to the earthbender, who raises another package into the off-load point. Cut back to the kids, who scream again. Rather than hit the package, they hit the side of the trench and run off the track again. They all fall out of the bin and are falling, but Aang airbends them each back into the bin. They bounce off a roof and into a man's work room, destroying his pottery. They bounce of his floor and out the window opposite the one they came in.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sorry!<br><br><i>(They drop into someone's living room and fly through their house. Outside they crash through the wall of the balcony and drop again, screaming. Cut to the merchant from the earlier scene, fondly shaking one of his cabbages. The sound of a bomb falling is heard. He looks up and jumps back as the bin and the kids fall onto the cabbage cart, totally destroying it, blowing cabbages all over the place. The kids land in a heap and Aang's disguise is now gone.)</i><br><br><b>Cabbage Merchant</b>: My cabbages! You're gonna pay for this!<br><br><i>(The three are quickly surrounded by soldiers.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(sheepishly)</i>: Two cabbages please.<br><br><i>(Fade to scene of King Bumi's throne chamber. It is decorated in shades of Earth Kingdom green. The aged King sits on his throne in the distance, for it is a large room. Cut to the King, who wears the same crazy expression as in Aang's flashback, though he is now clearly ancient. The King looks upon the three, and the guards behind them force them to kneel.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Mmm?<br><b>Guard</b>: Your majesty, these juveniles were arrested for vandalism, traveling under false pretenses and malicious destruction of cabbages.<br><br><i>(Screen pans right to reveal the irate cabbage dealer.)</i><br><br><b>Cabbage Merchant</b>: Off with their heads! One for each head of cabbage!<br><b>Guard</b>: Silence! Only the King can pass down judgment. What is your judgment, Sire?<br><br><i>(Close up of King Bumi. He looks at each in turn. Sokka is nervous, Katara hopeful, and Aang tries to act like he's invisible.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Throw them... a feast!<br><br><i>(Guards make noises of surprise, the merchant of chagrin. Carnival music plays in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Huh?<br><br><i>(Fade to a table loaded with food, camera pans right. Momo eats goodies on the right side of the table. Cut to the three seated, with Aang in the middle. Behind them King Bumi stands.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Heheh! The people in my city have gotten fat from too many feasts, so I hope you like your chicken with no skin.<br><b>Aang</b>: Thanks, but I don't eat meat.<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(to Sokka)</i>: How about you? I bet you like meat. <i>(He sticks the drumstick in Sokka's mouth.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(chewing)</i>: Mmm!<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(to Aang)</i>: Is it just me, or is this guy's crown a little crooked? <br><br><i>(She makes cukoo motions at the side of her head as she says the latter. Cut to King Bumi moving to take his seat at the opposite end of the table.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: So, tell me young bald one. Where are you from?<br><b>Aang</b>: I'm from... Kangaroo Island.<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Oh, Kangaroo Island, eh? I hear that place is really hoppin!<br><br><i>(Cut to the three. Silence is broken by Sokka's laughter, the other two look at him like he has grown a third head.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What? It was pretty funny.<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(yawns)</i>: Well, all these good jokes are making me tired. Guess it's time to the hay.<br><br><i>(As he ends his sentence, he suddenly throws another drumstick at Aang, who airbends it to a standstill, though he is very surprised. It spins in the air in front of him. The guards draw breath in surprise.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: There's an airbender in our presence and not just any airbender, the Avatar! <i>(He stands. Aang drops the drumstick, trying to act like he did not just reveal himself.)</i> Now what do you have to say for yourself, Mr. Pipinpadaloxicopolis?<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Long shot of the city, cut back to the feast table. Aang stands and spreads his arms wide in a gesture of defeat.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Okay! You caught me. I'm the Avatar, doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out <i>(looks under the table)</i>, no firebenders here. So, good work everybody. <i>(Puts his arms around his companions and together they stand.)</i> Love each other, respect all life and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!<br><br><i>(The three have been walking backwards to the door, but the guards stop them. The shot widens to show the back of King Bumi in the foreground looking at them.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: You can't keep us here. Let us leave.<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Lettuce leaf? <br><br><i>(He picks up a lettuce leaf from the plate in front of him and takes a bite. Cut to the three as Sokka leans over to speak in a low voice to the others. The carnival music has begun to play in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We're in serious trouble. This guy is nuts.<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(now very serious, the music stops)</i>: Tomorrow the Avatar will face three deadly challenges. But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.<br>Guard: My liege, do you mean the good chamber, or the bad chamber?<br><b>King Bumi</b>: The newly refurbished chamber.<br><b>Guard</b>: Wait, which one are we talking about?<br><b>King Bumi</b>: The one that used to be the bad chamber, until the recent refurbishing that is. Of course, we've been calling it the new chamber, but we really should number them. Uh, take them to the refurbished chamber that was once bad!<br><br><i>(Cut to the three being led out by guards, then a close up of King Bumi looking mad and chomping on lettuce. Cut to a wall that is torn open by earthbending. The three are thrust in and the “door” is closed by earthebending. The chamber is beautiful, spacious and furnished with three comfortable beds.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: This is a prison cell? But it's so nice.<br><b>Aang</b>: He did say it was newly refurbished.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Nice or not, we're still prisoners.<br><b>Aang</b>: I wonder what these challenges are gonna be.<br><b>Katara</b>: We're not sticking around to find out. There's gotta be some way outta here.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(smiling and pointing o.c.)</i>: The air vents!<br><b>Sokka</b>: If you think we're gonna fit through there then you're crazier then that king.<br><br><i>(Cut to view of the air vent. It is a small circular hole in the wall.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: We can't, but Momo can.<br><br><i>(Cut to view of Momo sprawled on the bed, gorged on an apple, his tongue still licking the fruit. The shot expands to show Aang entering from the right.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Momo, I need you to find Appa and bust us outta here!<br><br><i>(Camera switches to a view from inside the air vent. The light from the room is blocked as Aang stuffs Momo face first into the vent. Soon Momo's face is right up against the camera. Cut to shot of Aang stuffing the little animal into the vent and having some trouble.)</i> <br><br><b>Aang</b>: Go on, boy, get Appa!<br><br><i>(He stops, only to have Momo's behind dangle from the vent. He is stuck.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway?<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(from o.c., as Momo tries to free himself, but fails)</i>: Appa is a ten ton flying bison, I think he could figure something out.<br><b>Katara</b>: Well, no point in arguing about it now. <i>(She gets in a bed.)</i> Get some rest, Aang. Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow.<br><br><i>(Aang walks dejectedly over to the last unoccupied bed. Fade to a shot of Aang asleep, snoring loudly. The room shakes as an earthbender opens the “door.” Aang opens his eyes to see the other beds empty.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sokka! Katara! <i>(Turning to guards)</i> Where are my friends?<br><b>Guard</b>: The King will free them if you complete your challenges.<br><b>Aang</b>: And if I fail?<br><b>Guard</b>: He didn't say. Your staff please?<br><br><i>(Aang gives the staff to the guard. Cut to Aang entering the throne room flanked by two guards. King Bumi's torso appears on the left side of the screen. He is wearing a horrible, blue, purple and light green robe.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: First, Avatar, what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion. <br><br><i>(Cut to Aang who has no reaction. A cough is heard in the background. Cut back to the King.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: I'm waiting.<br><b>Aang</b>: I... guess it's fine.<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Excellent! You passed the first test.<br><b>Aang</b>: Really?<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(thinking)</i>: Well, not one of the deadly tests. The real challenges are much more... challenging.<br><br><i>(Aang's expression becomes angry. He airbends his feet to run in an instant up to King Bumi.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I don't have time for your crazy games! Gimme my friends back! We're leaving!<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Ohh, I thought you might refuse... <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot with the King on the left, Aang on the right, and a view of the wall of the chamber between them. At this moment a “door' is opened by guards holding Katara and Sokka in the corridor beyond. The guards place small rings on one of their fingers which contract to fit snugly as soon as they are worn. Sokka and Katara struggle to take off the rings, but can't.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: ...so I will give your friends some special souvenirs. Those delightful rings are made of pure genemite, also known as creeping crystal. It's crystal that grows remarkably fast. By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it. Terrible fate, really. I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.<br><br><i>(Close up of the ring on Sokka's finger. It grows in front of the camera. Cut to Sokka's face.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Ah! It's already creeping!<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(to King Bumi)</i>: I'll do as you want.<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(grinning evilly)</i>: Mmm!<br><br><i>(Fade to new scene of a cavern. Camera pans left to reveal Aang standing on a small stone parapet with a waterfall in the background. The cavern floor is covered in stalagmites. In the upper left corner of the screen, King Bumi, the guards and the prisoners stand on a balcony. Crystal already covers the forearms of both. King Bumi laughs.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: It seems I've lost my lunch box key and I'm hungry.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up shot of a key hanging by a long chain in the middle of the waterfall. A ladder reaches up from the ground of the cavern to about where the key dangles.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Ooo, there it is. Would you mind fetching it for me?<br><br><i>(Aang jumps into action. Using his airbending skills he bouces from stalagmite to stalagmite. He charges into the waterfall, holding his breath, and begins to climb the ladder. The force of the water stops him from making progress, though.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Ooo, climbing the ladder. No one's thought of that before.<br><br><i>(Aang loses his grip and is shot out of the waterfall. He is about to get impaled when he recovers and slides between two stalagmites, one foot on the side of each. He breathes a sigh of relief. He looks up at his friends and regains his determination. This time he flies up to the stalactites on the ceiling and is soon looking down at the key. He concentrates, jumps into the waterfall, and is shot right back out, managing to grab onto a stalagmite. Cut to King Bumi and the prisoners. The crystal now covers them up to the shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: That's right. Keep diving head in, I'm sure it'll work eventually.<br><br><i>(This gives Aang an idea. He breaks off the top of the stalagmite he is holding and throws it at the chain holding the key. Using his airbending skills he makes sure it breaks the chain and carries the bottom part of it along with the key up to the balcony. The tip of the stalagmite embeds itself like a spearhead into the top of the doorway. The key now dangles just over the surprised King's head.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: There, enjoy your lunch! I want my friends back, now!<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Uh, not yet. I need help with another matter. It seems I've lost my pet Flopsy.<br><br><i>(Cut to a fluffy bunny sitting on a rock. The scene expands to show Aang landing in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Okay, found him!<br><br><i>(The view expands again to reveal Aang and the bunny in the middle of a shallow arena. King Bumi and the prisoners are at the railing around the top of the arena.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Bring him to me! Daddy wants a kiss from Flopsy!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang and Flopsy. Behind Aang a huge monster is landing.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Come here, Flopsy!<br><br><i>(Aang turns around to face the monster while the bunny squeaks and runs off. The monster crushes a huge boulder in front of Aang. He flips backwards and lands as the bunny runs by him, squealing in terror.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Flopsy, wait! Flopsy! Flopsy!<br><br><i>(Aang chases the bunny while the monster chases Aang. Cut to King Bumi, who is cackling maniacally. The bunny runs into a rabbit hole in the wall of the arena. Aang slides up next to it and sticks his hand in the hole. He rummages around, but finds nothing. Meanwhile, the monster closes in. Aang has another idea. He stands up and faces the monster just as it arrives.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(to monster)</i>: Flopsy?<br><br><i>(The monster stops instantly and wags its tail. Flopsy picks Aang up tenderly, making gentle noises. Aang is surprised and starts screaming. He stops when Flopsy gives him a huge lick.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Flopsy! <br><br><i>(He rubs Flopsy's head. Flopsy's drops Aang and scales the arena wall in response to King Bumi's o.c. whistling and kissing noises. He flops on back in front of King Bumi. Carnival music begins to play.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Awww, that's a good boy! Yes, who has a soft belly? <br><br><i>(He begins to rub Flopsy's belly. Flopsy's left leg paws the ground in pleasure. Cut to Aang jumping up onto the railing of the arena. Katara is in the foreground, covered from head to ankle in crystal. The carnival music stops.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Guys, are you ok?<br><b>Katara</b>: Other than the crystal slowly encasing my entire body, doing great.<br><br><i>(Camera pans right to Sokka who is in similar straits. A new length of crystal grows on the left side of Sokka's head. He loses his balance and keels over. Cut to King Bumi rubbing Flopsy's belly.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Awww, yes.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(looking severe)</i>: Come on. I'm ready for the next challenge.<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Ahh! Hahaha!<br><br><i>(Fade to next scene with King Bumi still laughing maniacally o.c. The new scene is of an earthbending arena. It is ill-lit and largely featureless except the dirt floor. Cut to two balconies, Aang and King Bumi on one, the prisoners, now encased in crystal except for their faces and feet, on the other.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Your final test is a duel and as a special treat you may choose your opponent. Point and choose.<br><br><i>(Two enormous gladiator type characters show up to flank King Bumi. The champion on the left is a muscular man with a nasty smile and a huge axe. The champion on the right is a mammoth fighter whoe looks like he relies upon brute strength. Aang is terrified.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(thinking)</i>: So, you're saying whoever I point to, that's the person I get to fight?<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Choose wisely.<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang's p.o.v. as the camera ranges between the King and the two champions.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I... choose... you! <i>(He is pointing at King Bumi.)</i><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Haha! Wrong choice!<br><br><i>(King Bumi, with some effort, corrects his lumped posture. He dumps his robes to reveal a surprisingly muscular physique for such an old man. He is clearly formidable and Aang recoils, realizing his mistake. The King is also apparently a master earthbender, for he immediately stamps the ground, blowing Aang far out into the arena. He lands in the dust. King Bumi launches himself off the balcony and lands close to Aang. He laughs evilly as the scene cuts to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act III</b></u><br><br><i>(Return to a long shot of the arena. Cut to King Bumi staring Aang down.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: You thought I was a frail old man, but I'm the most powerful earthbender you'll ever see.<br><b>Aang</b>: Can I fight the guy with the axe instead?<br><b>King Bumi</b>: There are no ‘take-back-sees' in my kingdom. You might need this!<br><br><i>(King Bumi motions to a guard who throws Aang his staff. King Bumi immediately launches several boulders at him which Aang dodges.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Typical airbender tactic: avoid and evade. I'd hoped the Avatar would be less predictable.<br><br><i>(He launches another boulder at Aang, who dodges and launches himself into the air.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Don't you have any surprises for me? Sooner or later, you'll have to strike back.<br><br><i>(The King launches another stone at Aang which misses, but explodes upon impacting the ceiling of the arena. The debris knocks Aang to the ground and he loses his staff as he falls. Aang gets back up as King Bumi begins walking around. With each turn he makes a huge pillar of rock block Aang's path. One of them catches Aang in the gut as it rises into the air.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Oh, you'll have to be a little more creative than that!<br><br><i>(Aang jumps off the pillar, riding one of his famous airballs. He rides the wall of the arena and approaches the King from his right. He launches a huge gale at his opponent, who blocks it with a sheet of stone raised from the floor of the arena. Cut to the King emerging from behind the stone shield, a smile on his face. The carnival music plays again.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Did someone leave the windows open? It feels a little drafty in here! <i>(Screen zooms to a close up of the King, who drops his smile.)</i> Are you hoping I'll catch a cold?<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang dropping off his airball and a quick cut back to the King, who kicks over the stone sheet and begins to raise it on earth dug out of the arena's surface. He shoots the earth underneath the stone sheet at Aang which knocks him over. The King strikes the ground with his fist, sending a shock wave through the arena surface right at Aang. The Avatar flips backwards and avoids the shock wave, but now is close to the rear wall of the arena.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: How are you going to going to get me from way over there?<br><br><i>(Aang looks determined and begins to run to his opponent. Cut to King Bumi who uses the side of his foot to dash the earth. The ground around Aang becomes quicksand and he falls in. The King raises two boulders and sends them to smash the struggling Aang. He escapes just in time as the rocks smash together. Aang jumps straight at his opponent, unleashing a blast of wind that knocks him and the stone sheet he stands upon back against the wall of the arena. The King raises one of the boulders from where he had just failed to crush Aang and pulled it back towards him at frightening speed. The Avatar sees it just in time and does a backflip that barely allows him to get up and over the flying boulder. The boulder of course moves on to almost crush the King, but he breaks it into many pieces as it reaches him. With tremendous effort, King Bumi tears the entire gate area of the arena out of the ground and holds it over his head. Aang screams in terror and begins to run in circles, creating a tornado. The King throws the massive earth mound, but the tornado grabs it and throws it back at him. As it reaches King Bumi he bisects it neatly in two. Aang appears between the rock pieces and pins the King with his staff. The King smiles and looks up. Cut to Aang who also looks up as a little piece of rock bounces off his head. Overhead hovers one of the two halves of rock, ready to crush them both.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Hehe! Well done, Avatar. You fight with much fire in your heart.<br><br><i>(The King throws the rock to the side of the arena. He then falls backwards into the floor, disappearing and leaving a Bumi shaped hole. Aang is flabbergasted.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Huh?<br><br><i>(Cut to the prisoners. A hole opens up in the floor of the balcony and the King emerges, the hole closing instantly beneath him. Aang, using his staff as a helicopter blade, lands on the balcony.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: You've passed all my tests. Now, you must answer one question.<br><b>Aang</b>: That's not fair! You said you would release my friends if I finished your tests.<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Oh, but what's the point of tests if you don't learn anything?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh come on!<br><b>King Bumi</b>: Answer this one question and I will set your friends free. <i>(Cut to a close up of King Bumi's face)</i> What... is my name? <i>(Cut to Aang, who does not have a ready answer.)</i> From the looks of your friends, I'd say you only have a few minutes. <i>(Exit King Bumi.)</i><br><b>Aang</b>: How am I supposed to know his name?<br><b>Katara</b>: Think about the challenges, maybe it's some kind of riddle.<br><b>Sokka</b>: I got it!<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh?<br><b>Sokka</b>: He's an earthbender, right? Rocky! <i>(Silence, followed by a cough in the background.)</i> You know, because of all the rocks?<br><b>Katara</b>: We're gonna keep trying, but that is a good backup.<br><b>Aang</b>: Okay, so back to the challenges. I got a key from the waterfall. I saved his pet and I had a duel.<br><b>Katara</b>: And what did you learn?<br><b>Aang</b>: Well, everything was different than I expected.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(a piece of crystal growing into her cheek)</i>: And...?<br><b>Aang</b>: Well, they weren't straightforward. To solve each test, I had to think differently than I usually would. <i>(Realization sweeping his features.)</i> I know his name!<br><br><i>(Fade to the King's throne room. Aang and the King stand opposite each other. King Bumi is once again hunched over and in his regular green robes.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I solved the question the same way I solved the challenges. As you said a long time ago, I had to open my brain to the possibilities. <i>(Cut King Bumi, who begins to laugh and snort, just as the younger version had in the flashback.)</i> Bumi, you're a mad genius! <i>(He runs and hugs the old King.)</i><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Oh, Aang. It's good to see you. You haven't changed a bit. Literally.<br><br><i>(Aang's old friend rubs Aang's head. Katara and Sokka approach from the left side of the screen, still encased in crystal. Cut to Katara's face, which is now all that is visible.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Uh, over here!<br><br><i>(Pan to Sokka's mouth, which is all that is visible of him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Little help?<br><br><i>(Cut to the King and Aang, the former of which makes a pulling back gesture with a fist, shattering the crystal from around both water tribe members. Crystal flies all over and King Bumi catches a piece.)</i><br><br><b>King Bumi</b>: Genemite is made of rock candy. <i>(He takes a bite)</i>. Delicious!<br><b>Katara</b>: So this crazy king is your old friend, Bumi?<br><b>King Bumi</b> <i>(annoyed)</i>: Who you calling old? <i>(Pause.)</i> Okay. I'm old.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Why did you do all this instead of just telling Aang who you were?<br><b>King Bumi</b>: First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people, hehe <i>(snort! snort!)</i>, but I do have a reason. <i>(Turning to Aang)</i>. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord, and when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius! <i>(Cut to Aang, who smiles, clasps his hands together in thanks, and bows.)</i> And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation. <i>(Momo jumps onto Aang's shoulder.)</i> And you'll need Momo too.<br><b>Aang</b>: Thank you for your wisdom. But before we leave, I have a challenge for you!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the city. Pan right to reveal a chute. A moment later a delivery bin flies by, King Bumi at the front, Aang in the back. Both are having a blast as the air rushes by them. Cut to long shot of the city where a plume of dust and smoke rises after an impact sound is heard.)</i><br><br><b>Cabbage Merchant</b> <i>(in anguish)</i>: My cabbages!<br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>Imprisoned</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=82">Matthew Hubbard</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=84">Miyuki Hoshikawa</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=85">Justin Ridge</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> JM Animation Co, Ltd<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Acastus<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(The scene opens with a view of a forest canopy. The camera pans down to reveal Aang and Katara sitting on a natural stone patio. A noisy little stream exits the ground from underneath the stone ledge. Katara is folding her sleeping bag while Aang lies back in the exposed roots of an overturned tree. Cut to a view from behind Katara to see Sokka walking up the stream path. He is holding a sack.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Great, you're back! What's for dinner?<br><b>Sokka</b>: We've got a few options. First, round nuts and some kind of oval shaped nuts, and some rock shaped nuts that... might just be rocks. Dig in!<br><br><i>(Sokka throws one of the nuts that might be a rock over his shoulder. It lands near Momo. Aang and Katara look at each other then back at Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Seriously, what else ya got?<br><br><i>(Sokka peers with one eye into the bag, hoping to find something else. Cut to Momo, eyeing the nut like object with suspicion. He chitters and picks it up. He taps it on a nearby stone to no effect. The he cocks back and raps it hard on the stone. At that moment, a huge, startling noise disrupts the forest's calm. Cut to a wide shot of the ledge and a clearing to the right where Appa was resting. The group and Appa look up at the noise.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What was that!?<br><br><i>(Cut to Momo looking befuddled over at Sokka. He turns to look back at the nut like object in his hand. He blinks twice to a cute effect. He drops the nut onto the stone and another huge sound echoes through the forest, startling Momo again. He jumps out of the frame. Cut to another wide shot. The three are looking left o.c. to where Aang points.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: It's coming from over there!<br><br><i>(Aang and Katara rush off in the direction of the noise, leaving Sokka waving his arms at them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Shouldn't we run away from huge booms – not toward them?<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of a fallen tree, behind which Aang and Katara appear, followed closely by Sokka. The p.o.v then switches to behind them, where we can see that they are looking down a river bed. The river has been reduced to a small stream. A young earthbender is practicing his art in the river bed, and the three watch him move around a huge boulder. Cut back to a close up of the three.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: An earthbender!<br><b>Aang</b>: Let's go meet him!<br><b>Sokka</b>: He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.<br><br><i>(Cut instantly to Katara who has clearly ignored her brother's warning by running way out into the river bed to address the young earthbender.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hello there, I'm Katara! What's your name?<br><br><i>(The young earthbender looks over at Katara in surprise, drops his rock and runs back down the river bed. As he runs, he earthbends a load of rock into the riverbed, blocking pursuit.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Nice to meet you!<br><b>Katara</b>: We just wanted to say “hi”.<br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, that guy's gotta be running somewhere, maybe we're near a village and I bet that village has a market!<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(excited)</i>: Which means no nuts for dinner! <i>(Aang and Katara run o.c.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts! <i>(Momo flies off-screen to join the others, Sokka looks downcast)</i> Yeh, I hate'em too.<br><br><i>(Cut to a few overhead shots of a walled Earth Kingdom village in a steep valley. Cut to Aang, Katara and Sokka in a market. Aang is at a stall trying out a hat.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Great hat. I'll trade you some nuts for it.<br><br><i>(Aang turns to Sokka with the hat on and laughs. Meanwhile, Katara has noticed the young earthbender from the river bed enter a nearby building.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey!<br><br><i>(Katara runs off-screen in pursuit. Cut to the young earthbender in a long, mostly empty room with an older woman, his mother.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: Hi, mom.<br><b>Mother</b>: Where have you been, Haru? You're late! Get started on your chores.<br><br><i>(Katara opens door and enters, framed in sunlight pouring in behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey, you're that kid! Why did you run away before?<br><b>Haru</b>: Uh, you must have me confused with some other kid.<br><br><i>(Aang and Sokka enter.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: No she doesn't, we saw you earthbending.<br><br><i>(Cut to an exterior shot of the building where the door closes and the windows get shut.)</i><br><br><b>Mother</b> <i>(hands still on the window she just closed)</i>: They saw you doing what?<br><b>Haru</b>: They're crazy, mom, I mean, look at how they're dressed!<br><br><i>(All three look at their clothing.)</i><br><br><b>Mother</b>: You know how dangerous that is! You know what would happen if they caught you earthbending!<br><br><i>(From outside a heavy knock on the door is heard and Sokka quickly parts the window blinds to identify the intruders.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b> <i>(from o.c.)</i>: Open up!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Fire Nation! Act natural!<br><br><i>(Haru's mother opens the door and a Fire Nation soldier enters. Cut to a view of the others caught freeze-frame in the midst of some very unconvincing “normal” poses. The top of the barrel that Aang is leaning upon shifts and his hand goes into the water up to his shoulder. Cut back to the soldier and Haru's mother.)</i><br><br><b>Mother</b>: What do you want? I've already paid you this week.<br><b>Soldier</b>: The tax just doubled. Wouldn't want an accident, would we?<br><br><i>(The soldier produces a fireball in his hands and smiles. Cut to a wider shot, where everyone takes a step back from the soldier.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: Fire is sometimes so hard to control.<br><br><i>(Haru's mother's expression melts from defiance to fear and resignation. Cut to a view of her hands placing a small chest on a table. She opens it to reveal a few miserable coins. She takes most of them out and gives them to the soldier. He dumps the small ones on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: You can keep the copper ones.<br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot of the room, with the soldier exiting in the foreground, the rest clearly visible behind him. They are all unhappy. Haru's mother picks up the copper coins.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here?<br><b>Mother</b>: Five years. Fire Lord Ozai uses our town's coal mines to fuel his ships.<br><b>Haru</b>: They're thugs; they steal from us, and everyone here is too much of a coward to do anything about it.<br><b>Mother</b>: Quiet, Haru. Don't talk like that.<br><b>Katara</b>: But, Haru's an earthbender, he can help.<br><b>Mother</b>: Earthbending is forbidden. It's caused nothing but misery for this village. He must never use his abilities.<br><b>Katara</b>: How can you say that? Haru has a gift. Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.<br><b>Mother</b>: You don't understand.<br><b>Katara</b>: I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?<br><b>Mother</b>: They could take Haru away! Like they took his father.<br><br><i>(Cut to side view of Haru's face, with a wide-eyed Katara visible in the background. Both look pained. Fade to a view of the surrounding hillsides. It is late afternoon. The view pans right to reveal the outbuildings of a farm. Cut to a view from inside one of these barn like structures. Haru and our group have entered, the open double door visible behind them. The late say sun pours in.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: My mom said you can sleep here tonight, but you should leave in the morning.<br><b>Aang</b>: Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay.<br><br><i>(Quick pan right to reveal Appa with his mouth stuffed with hay. He looks over at Aang, who is o.c., stops chewing for a few seconds. Then begins chewing again. Cut to Haru and Katara leaving the group of buildings, apparently going for a walk.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father.<br><b>Haru</b>: That's ok. It's funny, the way you were talking back in the store, it reminded me of him.<br><b>Katara</b>: thanks.<br><b>Haru</b>: My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one, but they fought back anyway.<br><b>Katara</b>: He sounds like a great man.<br><b>Haru</b>: After the attack, they rounded up my father every other earthbender and took them away. We haven't seen them since.<br><b>Katara</b>: So, that's why you hide your earthbending?<br><b>Haru</b>: Yeh. The problem is that the only way I can feel close to my father now is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.<br><br><i>(Katara and Haru have now walked up onto the crest of a small hill that overlooks the surrounding countryside. Haru has knelt down and begun twirling some small stones while he speaking about his father. When he is done, he turns the stones to sand, which falls through his fingers. Katara comes up and sits next to him. She points to her necklace and begins to speak.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: See this necklace? My mother gave it to me.<br><b>Haru</b>: It's beautiful.<br><b>Katara</b>: I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid. This necklace is all I have left of her.<br><b>Haru</b>: It's not enough, is it?<br><b>Katara</b>: No.<br><br><i>(Katara and Haru sit on the hill, the fading glory of the setting sun visible in the space between them. Fade to Katara and Haru walking down a path towards an open mine entrance some way ahead. A boom is heard and rocks and dust come out of the mine entrance. The sound of an old man, probably hurt, can be heard.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: Help!<br><b>Haru</b>: The mine!<br><br><i>(They both rush to the mine. Cut to the blocked up mine entrance, the old man has almost been buried by the cave in.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: Help me!<br><br><i>(The ground still shakes a bit, and more earth threatens to fall on and crush the old man. Katara and Haru enter the view. Haru tries to prevent any more earth falling on the old man by bracing the collapsed mine entrance frame, while Katara tries to get the old man free.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(struggling)</i>: It's not working, we have to get help.<br><b>Haru</b>: There's no time – pull harder.<br><b>Katara</b>: Haru, there's a way you can help him.<br><b>Haru</b>: I can't.<br><b>Katara</b>: Please, there's no one around to see you, it's the only way.<br><br><i>(Indecision dominates Haru's face for a few moments, but then he moves in front of the old man and turns to look back into the min entrance. He concentrates and with a quick move of his hands and feet he pushes the obstruction of earth and stone back deep into the mine, freeing the old man, whom they help get up.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Haru, you did it!<br><br><i>(Cut to a night scene. Momo is sitting in the window of the outbuilding on Haru's farm that the group is sleeping in. Cut to a wider shot that shows the group ready for bed and in their sleeping bags. Aang lies over the top of Appa, looking at Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man.<br><b>Aang</b>: You must have really inspired him.<br><b>Katara</b>: I guess so.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Everyone should get some sleep. We're leaving at dawn.<br><b>Katara</b>: Dawn? Can't we sleep in for once?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Good night.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(with a sly grin on her face)</i>: I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Good night.<br><br><i>(Aang and Katara laugh, then Katara blows out their lamp. Cut to an exterior view of their outbuilding which zooms outward, showing the full moon. Clearly some time passes before the next scene, but it is still night. Fire Nation troops walk along a path leading to Haru's farm. Lamps on polls swing back and forth as they march. The soldier who extorted the money from the previous day leads the column. He wears a helmet with horns on either side of his head. He knocks on Haru's house's door three times. The door opens to reveal Haru. He draws an intake of breath in surprise. Cut to a side view of the house, where see Haru on the right, the Fire soldiers on the left, and in between, pointing an accusatory finger at Haru, is the old man saved by Katara and Haru.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: That's him! That's the earthbender!<br><br><i>(The solder pushes the old man out of the way and approached Haru. Cut to a frontal shot of Haru with the soldier's hands entering from the side of the frame. He is grabbed and pulled towards the camera, which has the effect of going straight into Haru's pupil. Cut to commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(When the show returns we see an overhead shot of Katara exiting the outbuilding. It is dawn. Cut to a closer shot of Katara walking up to a water pump to get some water. She carries a pot which she places under the spout. Rather than wok the pump, however, she gracefully waterbends some water out of the pump and/b into the jar. She picks up the pot and, as she turns to go back to her friends, she notices Haru's mother looking out over the farm. She turns and it is clear she is crying. Katara drops her water pot and it breaks. Katara's eye betray her realization that Haru has been captured. Cut to an interior shot of the outbuilding where the others are packing their gear. The door opens and Katara steps in, tearing at her hair in anguish.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: They took him! They took Haru away!<br><b>Aang</b>: What?<br><b>Katara</b>: The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation. It's all my fault, I forced him into earthbending.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Slow down, Katara, when did this happen?<br><br><i>(Sokka puts his arm around her shoulder and holds her hand in genuine concern.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(dropping her hand)</i>: Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.<br><b>Katara</b>: We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru.<br><b>Aang</b>: ...and why would they do that?<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(determined)</i>: because they're going to arrest me for earthbending.<br><br><i>(Sokka and Aang both looked concerned before cutting to a scene with Katara and Sokka rolling a boulder on top of air grate.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines, all Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and – tada! Fake earthbending.<br><br><i>(When Katara and Sokka and finish rolling the boulder on top of the vent, cut to a wider shot showing the nearby vent that Aang will airbend into. It is partially obscured from the path they are on by a large boulder. Cut to Sokka leaning on the rock they have just moved with a self-satisfied grin on his face. When he is done, the screen widens to show a none-too pleased Katara, hands on her hips, looking over at Aang who is o.c.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Aang. Did you get all that?<br><br><i>(The screen pans rapidly over to Aang, who is paying no attention at all. He sits cross-legged in front of the vent, blowing air and a little butterfly in front of him while Momo watches.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sure, I got it.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Do you remember your cue?<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, yeh, just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this.<br><b>Sokka</b>: By “this” do you mean intentionally getting captured by an army of ruthless firebenders?<br><b>Aang</b>: Exactly! That's fun stuff.<br><br><i>(Cut to wide shot that shows Katara and Sokka on the left, Aang in the middle behind his rock, and a band of Fire Nation soldiers coming down to the path towards them on the right.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Here they come! Get in your places!<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of the three soldiers marching down the path. Cut to view from behind the soldiers. Sokka runs in from the left, Katara from the right, meeting right in front of the soldiers.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(in a slightly exaggerated voice)</i>: Get out of my way, pipsqueak!<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(also in a slightly exaggerated voice)</i>: How dare you call me “pipsqueak” you giant-eared cretin!<br><b>Sokka</b>: What did you call me?<br><b>Katara</b>: A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things. <i>(She puts her hands up to her ears and fans out her fingers in imitation of huge ears)</i> Do herds of animals use them for shade?<br><b>Sokka</b>: You better back off! <i>(Placing his hand to partially block his mouth from the soldier's view)</i> Seriously – back off.<br><b>Katara</b>: I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!<br><b>Sokka</b>: That's it – you're going down!<br><b>Katara</b>: I'll show you who's boss – earthbending style!<br><br><i>(Katara assumes a mock earthbending stance as she shouts her challenge. The background music changes to indicate almost supernatural powers and the background itself changes to show earth colored patterns flashing by at high speed. Both effects stop abruptly to show Katara frozen, with the rock she is supposed to be “earthbending” still sitting over the grate. After a few moments of embarrassed silence, she repeats herself angrily.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I said, “earthbending style!”<br><br><i>(Cut to the other side of the rock where Aang finally reacts, jumping up into the air and coming down onto the grate. He airbends into the grate. Cut to a view of the rock on top of the other grate. The air rushing up raises the rock to reveal Momo behind it.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b> <i>(pointing at Momo)</i>: That lemur! It's earthbending!<br><b>Sokka</b>: No, you idiot! It's the girl!<br><b>Soldier</b> <i>(embarrassed)</i>: Oh, of course.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Sokka and Katara as the rocks falls back onto the grate).</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(in an exaggerated voice, his hands on Katara's shoulders)</i>: I'll hold her! <i>(Then sotto voce)</i> You've got 12 hours to find Haru, we'll be right behind you.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara being led off by the soldiers. She looks back to see Sokka and Aang, with Momo on his shoulders, standing in the road. Sokka turns to Momo.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Momo, you have some big ears!<br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot of the village's port where a Fire Navy ship is docked, then cut to a downcast Katara wearing a brown sackcloth over her blue robe. She is in a wheeled transport with other prisoners being taken to the prison ship. Aang and Sokka are in the crowd watching her being taken aboard. Cut to a sky shot of Appa following the Fire Navy ship from afar. In the distance, a rig or offshore platform is seen. This is the Fire Navy ship's destination. Cut to a close of the rig. It is huge, dark, industrial and foreboding. In the background a bloody sunset casts its last rays of light over the complex. Switch to Aang in Appa's driver's seat, Sokka in the passenger section.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: She'll be fine, Aang, Katara knows what she's doing.<br><br><i>(Cut back to a long shot of the prison rig where the sun has now set. Switch to an overhead shot of a prisoner line up. The Warden is addressing the new prisoners.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: Earthbenders, it is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners, but as honored guests, and I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host. You will succeed here if you simply abide –<br><br><i>(The Warden's speech is interest by a prisoner, who is visible behind the warden, who begins to cough. The Warden's look hardens instantly. Cut to a side shot where the Warden suddenly leaps away from the prisoner line up, turns and firebends a hug gout of flame at the coughing prisoner. The targeted man jumps backwards.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b> <i>(angry)</i>: What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him!? Take him below! <i>(Then quietly)</i> One week in solitary will improve his manners. (He puts his face up to Katara's, but still speaking to the group) Simply treat me with the courtesy I give you and we'll get along famously. You will notice earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth, so if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people, forget them. It is impossible. Good day.<br><br><i>(During the latter part of the Warden's speech, the view has shifted between various shots of hopeless prisoners on the rig. When the Warden is done, he turns and walks o.c. as the prisoners are led away. Cut to a rolling pan up where the camera finally reveals an open area on the rig where hopeless and forlorn looking prisoners roam around. Cut to a view of Katara being thrust through a narrow door and out into the open area. A double gate drops behind her, then cut to Katara's p.o.v. as she surveys the prisoners on the deck. Cut to a side view of the deck. Katara enters from the left. As she passes a prisoner sitting on the deck, he turns and it is Haru.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b> <i>(standing up)</i>: Katara?<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(running and hugging him)</i>: Haru!<br><b>Haru</b>: What are you doing here?<br><b>Katara</b>: It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you.<br><b>Haru</b>: So, you got yourself arrested?<br><b>Katara</b>: It was the only way to find you.<br><b>Haru</b> <i>(folding his arms across his chest and smiling)</i>: You got guts, Katara, I'll give you that. <i>(Taking her shoulder)</i> Come one, there's someone I want you to meet.<br><br><i>(Cut to overhead shot that pans right over several groups of prisoners. Haru and Katara have approached the last one.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: Katara, this is my father, Tyro. Dad, this is Katara.<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of older man's face who is sitting on the ground in one of the groups of prisoners. He is eating, but he turns to his son's voice and sees Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(bowing)</i>: It's an honor to meet you.<br><b>Tyro</b> <i>(handing Katara a bowl)</i>: Have some dinner, Katara.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(taking the bowl her hungry expression turns to disgust)</i>: Eruhh!<br><b>Tyro</b>: It's not as bad as it looks.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(sitting down and eating a spoonful)</i>: Erahh!<br><b>Tyro</b> <i>(smiling apologetically)</i>: It's still pretty bad though.<br><br><i>(A hand appears on Tyro's shoulder, another prisoner trying to get Tyro's attention.)</i><br><br><b>Prisoner</b>: Tyro, the prisoners are complaining there aren't enough blankets to go around.<br><b>Tyro</b>: I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.<br><b>Katara</b>: If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan?<br><b>Tyro</b> <i>(suspiciously)</i>: Excuse me?<br><b>Katara</b>: You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny? Sabotage?<br><b>Tyro</b>: The plan? The plan is to survive - wait out this war. Hope that one day some of us can get back home and forget this ever happened.<br><b>Katara</b>: How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up.<br><b>Tyro</b>: Katara, I admire your courage and I envy your youth, but people's lives are at stake here. The Warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(standing up, grim determination on her face)</i>: We'll see about that.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara standing up on a small raised platform in the open area. She bangs the lid of a pot with her spoon several times to get everyone's attention.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child of my water tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders. <i>(Cut to a view of the Warden watching from one of the catwalks above, Katara continues from o.c.)</i> Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend, but they can't take away your courage and it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home. It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are, hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage, earthbenders, let us fight for our freedom!<br><br><i>(The scene concludes with a close up profile of Katara's face, etched in determination. After a few moments pass, her expression weakens. Cut to a view of the groups of prisoners, who turned away from her and go on with their conversations. Katara is crushed. Cut to the Warden, who smiles and walks away. Shift to a view of the rig's lighthouse lamp rotating in the darkness. A few shots of the rig fly by to be replaced by a view of Aang peeping up over the edge of the rig. Then cut to Katara sleeping on her mat. Aang wakes her up and she starts to cry out, but Aang “shh's” her. He leads back to the edge of the rig's main platform where Appa and Sokka are waiting.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Your 12 hours are up, where's Haru? We've got to get out of here.<br><br><i>(Aang hops off the platform and onto Appa. Sokka holds her arm out to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I can't.<br><b>Sokka</b>: We don't have much time, there are guards everywhere. Get on.<br><b>Aang</b>: Katara, what's wrong?<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(close up, the lighthouse lamp playing directly behind her head)</i>: I'm not leaving. I'm not giving up on these people.<br><br><i>(Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act III</b></u><br><br><i>(When the show returns, Sokka and Aang have jumped off Appa, who floats in the air beside the platform, and are sitting in a triangle on the rig's edge.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What do you mean you're not leaving!?<br><b>Katara</b>: We can't abandon these people. There has to be a way to help them.<br><b>Aang</b>: Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka?<br><b>Sokka</b>: I say you're both crazy! <i>(A searchlight comes close by and they hunker down until it passes.)</i> Last chance, we need to leave – now!<br>Katara: No.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(shaking his head)</i>: I hate when you get like this. <i>(Another search light comes close)</i>. Come on, we better hide.<br><br><i>(The three exit the frame. Cut to Aang whispering something to Appa, who flies off silently. Aang then exits the screen, which then pans northeast to show two Fire Soldiers turning the corner on the rounds. As the round the bend, Appa flies by and the guards notice and look up.)</i><br><br><b>Guard</b>: Look!<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of the back of the Warden's head. He turns quickly to address the guards who just saw Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: Tell me exactly what you saw.<br><b>Captain</b>: Well, Sir, it looked like a flying bison.<br><b>Warden</b>: What?<br><b>Guard</b> It was a giant flying buffalo, Sir, with an empty saddle.<br><b>Warden</b>: Which was it? A buffalo or a bison?<br><b>Captain</b>: Uh, I'm not sure what the difference is, but that's not really the point is it, Sir?<br><b>Warden</b> <i>(angry)</i>: I'll decide what the point is, fool!<br><br><i>(Warden throws the Captain over the railing. A scream trails off into nothing as a splash of water is heard. Cut back to the Warden and the remaining guard.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: You! Wake up the Captain. Search the entire rig!<br><b>Guard</b>: Sir?<br><b>Warden</b>: What!?<br><b>Guard</b>: That...was the Captain you just threw overboard, so...<br><b>Warden</b>: Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the rig, still on the same night. The view pans north to reveal a loading docks with many crates on it. Cut to a closer shot of Momo peeping over one of the crates, then shift to Katara, Aang, and Sokka crouching amongst the boxes.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We don't have much time. What are we gonna do?<br><b>Aang</b>: I wish I knew how to make a hurricane. (Cut to Katara and Sokka looking unhappy at this idea.) The Warden would run away and we'd steal his keys!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?<br><b>Aang</b>: I'm just tossing ideas around.<br><b>Katara</b>: I tired talking the earthbenders into fighting back, but it didn't work. If there was just a way to help them help themselves.<br><b>Sokka</b>: For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock... something they can bend.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(touching the rig platform)</i>: But this entire place is made of metal.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(looking up and pointing o.c.)</i>: No, it's not. Look at the smoke. I bet they're burning coal – In other words, earth.<br><br><i>(As Aang is speaking, the view cuts to a shot of the smokestacks on the upper reaches of the rig. Behind the stacks, the sky is clearly getting lighter. Cut to a long shot of the rig, dawn is clearly close at hand. Cut to Katara and Sokka back in the prisoner deck area where Katara gave her speech. They are looking down into an enormous ventilation shaft which is capped by a grate similar to the ones seen earlier near the mine where Katara got arrested.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: It's almost dawn, we're running out of time! Are you sure this is gonna work?<br><b>Sokka</b>: It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale. <br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the rig as Sokka explains from o.c. how the plan is going to work. As he speaks, the camera view moves or cuts to show what he is talking about.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo, and the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending, the coal only has one place to go – right back here.<br><br><i>(The view ends up back with Katara and Sokka as he concludes his explanation. It is now morning. A moment later, however, the shot widens to show them surrounded by six Fire Nation soldiers poiting there spears at them and prisoners, including Tyro and Haru. More Fire Nation guards ring the bottom edge of the shot.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: There's the intruder!<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(drawing his boomerang)</i>: Stay back, I'm warning you!<br><b>Tyro</b>: Katara stop! You can't win this fight!<br><br><i>(Cut from Tyro to Haru, who looks stunned at his father's pronouncement. The camera pans right across him, then cut to Katara with an equally stunned looked, the camera slowly panning left. Then from o.c., but switching to show him after a few words, the Warden arrives.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: Listen to him well, child. You're one mistake away from dying where you stand.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot of the two surrounded by the soldiers, who begin to close in. Then switch to a close up of the grate, where air begins to rush out, followed by dust and pebbles. Then a living river of coal erupts from the grate, eventually tearing it away. Cut to a very wide shot showing the eruption of coal as it shoots high into the air over the deck, blasting the grate away. Cut to the Warden, clearly shocked and dismayed. The coal lands in a massive pile between the earthbenders and the firebenders, followed by a shot of Haru. The shot then widens to show the prisoners looking at the pile of earth that has just appeared. Cut to a view of the top of the coal pile. Aang drops from the top of the screen and lands on it, covered in coal dust. He coughs it off as Katara runs up to the top of the coal.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Here's your chance, earthbenders! <i>(She grabs a lump of coal and raises it high.)</i> Take it! Your fate is in your own hands!<br><br><i>(Haru begins to move forward, but Tyro stops him. Switch to a view from within the crowd. Various prisoners begin to shrink backward, eschewing open conflict. Cut to a view of Katara, still holding up the lump of coal, with the Warden and his men visible over her shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: Hahaha! Foolish girl! You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. <i>(Cut to a panning shot of the prisoners, who do look sad.)</i> There spirits were broken a long time ago. Oh? But you still believe in them? </i>(Katara lowers the coal, shock on her face.)</i> How sweet. They're a waste of your energy, little girl. You've failed.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot of Katara standing on the coal, her shoulders slumped, looking defeated and lonely. The Warden turns to walk back into the rig. As he does, a lump of coal flies on screen and hits him in the back of the head. He turns in anger. Cut to Haru, prisoners standing behind him, twirling some lumps of coal above his raised left hand. His expression is severe. Cut back to the Warden, who launches a blast of fire at the boy. The gout of flame is about to engulf Haru, who braces for death, when it is blocked by a wall of coal. Cut to a shot of Tyro, in an earthbending stance, who has clearly stepped forward to protect his son. Cut to a wider of what is about to become the battlefield, before shifting the Warden and his men, now in a firing line.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: Show no mercy!<br><br><i>(The Fire Nation line charges forward, unleashing a wall of flame. Tyro and the three nearest earthbenders, including Haru block it with a huge wall of coal. The coal absorbs the flames.)</i><br><br><b>Tyro</b>: For the Earth Kingdom, attack!<br><br><i>(Tyro slams the palms of his fists on the deck of the rig, throwing the wall of coal forward towards the Fire Nation line. The Fire Soldiers deflect some of the rocks with flame. Cut to an overhead shot of the prisoners, all of whom have joined the rebellion and have assumed earthbending stances. The camera pans south to show the firebenders in a similar pose. General melee ensues. One on one the earthbenders block fire attacks with coal shields and knock out firebender by striking htem huge lumps of coal thrown at high speed. Cut to a view of the carnage below from one of the catwalks. Heaps of burning coal now litter the deck. Switch back to the middle of the deck where Katara, Sokka and Aang are rushing forward. A Fire Nation soldier enters the screen, but Sokka cuts off the head of his spear with his boomerang and throws the spearhead with a small shaft still attached to it to Momo who is flying close overhead. Momo then collects spears as they are thrown by Fire Nation soldiers, rendering them harmless. Cut to Tyro and Haru in front of the coal dump. They raise a huge amount of coal, and then mash it between them to create a boulder. Cut to a quick view of the Warden rapidly shooting fireballs at targets o.c., before switching back to Haru and Tyro throwing the boulder at the door into the rig. It blasts a boulder shaped hole in the door.)</i><br><br><b>Tyro</b>: Get to the ship! We'll hold them off!<br><b>Warden</b>: Do not let them escape!<br><br><i>(The Warden rallies a few his troops and they begin to barrage the exit with flame. Cut to Aang, Katara and Sokka trying to exit. When they see the flames hit the wall in front of them, they turn and Aang airbends a small tornado into existence, the end of which is aimed at the firebenders.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Guys, throw me some coal!<br><br><i>(Sokka and Katara start dropping chunks of coal into the top of the little whirlwind, which accelerate down the wind tube and exit at high speed towards the Warden's men. Then all get knocked down. Cut to Tyro and two other earthbenders who earthbend the entire coal dump, with the Warden and all his men on it, out of over the open water.)</i><br><br><b>Warden</b>: No, please! I can't swim!<br><b>Tyro</b>: Don't worry, I hear cowards float.<br><br><i>(Tyro drops them all into the ocean below. Fade to a scene of several Fire Nation ships, now under the command of the former prisoners, steaming away from the rig. Appa with Sokka and Aang swim next to the point ship. Cut to Katara, Tyro and Haru on the deck of the point ship. Katara beams, looking back at the prison they leave behind. She is missing her necklace.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: I want to thank you for saving me. For saving us.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(embarrassed)</i>: All it took was a little coal.<br><b>Haru</b>: It wasn't the coal, Katara, it was you.<br><b>Tyro</b> <i>(putting a hand on her shoulder)</i>: Thank you for helping me find my courage, Katara, of the water tribe. My family and everyone here owes you much.<br><b>Katara</b>: So, I guess you're going home now?<br><b>Tyro</b>: Yes, to take back my village. <i>(Raising his voice and raising his left hand in a fist, just as Katara had done and looking back over the ship to address the former prisoners)</i> To take back ALL of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of three of the ships, Tyro's ship in the middle and ahead with Appa swimming on the right. The shot pans from left to right, showing cheering earthbenders on the decks of every ship. Cut back to Haru and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: Come with us.<br><b>Katara</b>: I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Aang in the foreground sitting on Appa, airbending a little chunk of coal around. Katara and Haru are visible on the upper deck on the point ship.)</i><br><br><b>Haru</b>: That's him, isn't it? The Avatar. Katara, thank you for bringing my father back to me. I never thought I'd see him again. I only wish there was some way...<br><b>Katara</b>: I know. <i>(She reaches for her necklace and starts in surprise when it is gone.)</i> My mother's necklace! It's gone!<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up shot of the necklace lying on the deck of the rig. An arm in a Fire Nation uniform grabs it. The screen pans up to reveal Zuko, wreathed in the glory of a fiery red sunset holding the necklace. He looks out over the ocean to the setting sun, back to the camera. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>The Spirit World (Winter Solstice Part 1)</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=71">Aaron Ehasz</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=77">Lauren MacMullen</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> x <br><b>Animation By:</b> DR Movie<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Acastus<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(Wide shot of the open sky over a lush river valley. It is a beautiful day with lazy, puffy white clouds and sunshine. Cut to an overhead view of the valley floor, clouds moving below. A red bird moves into view, soon engulfed in an Appa shaped shadow. Cut to a long shot of Appa moving slowly through the clouds, replaced quickly by a pan left showing Aang in Appa's driving seat, leaning back, enjoying himself with a reed in his mouth. As the camera pans left, Katara stretches out on her stomach looking over Appa's side, while Sokka whittles.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(from o.c. at first)</i>: Those clouds look so soft, don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft cottony heap.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Maybe you should give it a try.<br><b>Katara</b>: You're hilarious.<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang, whose head pops towards the camera, almost smashing into it, a wide grin on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I'll try it! Yehhhh!<br><br><i>(He jumps right off Appa's side, laughing and hurtling down through the clouds with his staff. Sokka and Katara look over the side of Appa as he plunges through a cloud. A moment later Aang lands next to them with his glider. He is soaking wet.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Turns out clouds are made of water!<br><br><i>(He airbends himself dry. Sokka and Katara eye him strangely. Suddenly, Katara turns and looks ahead.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey, what is that?<br><br><i>(Cut to a forward view. Up ahead, the floor of the valley below around the river is black instead of vegetation green.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: It's like a scar.<br><br><i>(Cut to a scene on the floor of the valley in the damaged area. Burnt tree stumps dot the barren landscape. The three have dismounted Appa and are walking around. Aang is in the foreground, Katara on his left back near Appa and Sokka to his right.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Listen, it's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.<br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, are you ok?<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of footprints on the burnt ground. Sokka is examining them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for – <br><b>Katara</b>: Shh!<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(whispering)</i>: What? I'm not allowed to be angry?<br><br><i>(Katara points ahead. Cut to Aang, standing ahead, clearly upset. He sinks to his knees in the dust and sighs. Cut to a frontal shot of Aang, who begins to run his hands through the burnt earth.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Why would anyone do this? How could I let this happen?<br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, you didn't let this happen. It has nothing to do with you.<br><b>Aang</b>: Yes it does. It's the Avatar's job to protect nature. But, I don't know how to do my job.<br><b>Katara</b>: That's why we're going to the North Pole to find you a teacher. <br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, a waterbending teacher, but there's no one who can teach me how to be the Avatar. Monk Gyatso said that Avatar Roku would help me.<br><b>Sokka</b>: The Avatar before you? He died over a hundred years ago, how are you supposed to talk to him?<br><b>Aang</b>: I don't know.<br><br><i>(Momo jumps into his lap and begins to chitter. Aang pets his back. Fade to a scene of Prince Zuko emerging from tall reads into a clearing.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(yelling)</i>: Uncle! It's time to leave! Where are you? Uncle Iroh!<br><br><i>(The camera pans left to follow Zuko. A fire soldier uniform becomes visible hanging from the low branches of a tree as the screen pans. Cut to Iroh in a hot bath, the tub made out of rock and it is fed by a stream coming out of the rocks behind it.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(happily)></i>: Over here.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Uncle? We need to move on, we're closing in on the Avatar's trail and I don't want to lose him!<br><b>Iroh</b>: You look tired, Prince Zuko. Why don't you join me in these hot springs and soak away your troubles.<br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(angry)</i>: My troubles cannot be soaked away. It's time to go!<br><b>Iroh</b>: You should take your teacher's advice and relax a little. The temperature's just right. I heated it myself.<br><br><i>(Iroh shifts position slightly, puts his hands together and breathes steam from his nostrils. Cut to Zuko, obscured by steam, who swats it away.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Enough! We need to leave now! Get out of the water!<br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(rising)</i>: Very well.<br><br><i>(Cut to view from behind Zuko, where Zuko has put his hand up to strategically block the view of Iroh. Cut to view from Iroh's p.o.v.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: On second thought, why don't you take another few minutes, but be back at the ship in half an hour or I'm leaving without you.<br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(leaning back, happily)</i>: Ahhhh!<br><br><i>(Cut back to an overhead shot of Aang still kneeling in the wasteland. Katara approaches him from behind.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey Aang, are you ready to be cheered up?<br><b>Aang</b>: No.<br><br><i>(An acorn flys by from o.c., hitting Aang on the side of the head.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Ow!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot of Aang looking at Katara, now in the foreground bouncing another acorn up and down in her right hand.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, how was that cheering me up?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Hehe, cheered me up.<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka, who promptly gets whacked by an acorn from Katara on this side of his head.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Ow! Yeh, I probably deserved that.<br><b>Katara</b>: These acorns are everywhere, Aang. That means the forest will grow back. Every one of these will be a tall oak tree someday, and all the birds and animals that lived here will come back. <br><br><i>(In the background Momo digs furiously in the scorched earth, emerging with a double handful of acorns. Katara places an acorn in the palm of Aang's hands and closes it.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(smiling)</i>: Thanks, Katara.<br><br><i>(Katara smiles and then makes a startled sound, looking o.c. Cut to a shot of an old man in green using a walking stick approaching the group, then cut back to the group as the old man enters the screen from the right and walks up to Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Hey, who are you?<br><b>Old Man</b>: When I saw the flying bison, I thought it was impossible, but those markings... are you the Avatar child?<br><br><i>(Aang turns to Katara, who nods her head. He turns back to the old man and nods his head in turn.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: My village desperately needs your help.<br><br><i>(Cut to a late afternoon shot of the sun about to go down beneath hills in the distance. The bottom of the screen shows the upper part of the walls of an Earth Kingdom village. Cut to an overhead shot of the group following the old man into the village. Much of it has been burned out and destrioyed. Sad music plays. They enter one of the buildings where some villagers are gathered. As the Old Man introduces Aang to the people, a man, probably the village chief walks over.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: This young person is the Avatar.<br><b>Chief</b>: So the rumors of your return are true. (He bows.) It is the greatest honor of a lifetime to be in your presence.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(bows)</i>: Nice to meet you too. <i>(Pause)</i>. So...is there something I can help you with?<br><b>Chief</b> <i>(looking o.c. with a pained expression)</i>: I'm not sure... <br><b>Old Man</b>: Our village is in crisis, he's our only hope. For the last few days at sunset a spirit monster comes and attacks our village. He is Hei-Bai, the black and white spirit.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Why is it attacking you?<br><b>Chief</b> <i>(moving to the threshold of the doorway that the group just entered, looking at the setting sun)</i>: We do not know, but each of the last three nights he has abducted one of our own. We are especially fearful because the winter solstice draws near.<br><b>Katara</b>: What happens then?<br><b>Old Man</b>: As the solstice approaches, the natural world and the spirit world grow closer and closer until the line between them is blurred completely.<br><b>Chief</b>: Hei-Bai is already causing devastation and destruction. Once the solstice is here there is no telling what will happen.<br><b>Aang</b>: So, what do you want me to do exactly?<br><b>Old Man</b>: Who better to resolve a crisis between our world and the spirit world than the Avatar himself? You are the great bridge between man and spirits.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(clearly lacking confidence)</i>: Right...that's me.<br><b>Katara</b>: Hey, ‘great bridge guy', can I talk to you over here for a second?<br><br><i>(Katara walks over to a nearby window. Aang and then a bit later Sokka enter screen from the right. Maybe whatever I have to do will just... come to me.<br><br><i>(Momo jumps onto Aang's shoulder and chitters. Aang is surprised, but then smiles. Who's there?<br><br><i>(Switch to Iroh's p.o.v., his head clearly scanning back and forth over the forest in front of him. A small rodent jumps onto the lip of the bath. He lets it jumps onto his outstretched hand.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: A meadow vole! I should have known. You startled me, little one. <i>(Lets vole go and leans back in the bath and puts his hands behind his head.)</i> Ehh, seems I've dozed off and missed my nephew's deadline, but it was a very sweet nap.<br><br><i>(The vole starts hopping up and down on the lip of the bath and making chittering noises. Suddenly it stops, the ground starts shaking from deeper in the forest. It flips around to see dust clouds rising from the forest and then hops away. Switch to a panning shot from the forest's p.o.v. The camera pans up as the ground disturbance or tremor moves. Soon it reaches Iroh's bath and we see that two other shock waves have approached the bath from Iroh's left and right. The old general has been caught by surprise and when the shockwaves reach his tub he is quickly held fast by three triangular stones that have been pushed into the tub. A second later, three earthbenders appear next to the tub behind each of the three stone projectiles that are holding Iroh imprisoned. Cut to an Earth Kingdom soldier taking Iroh's uniform off the tree, screen pans right to show an officer walking up to the bath.)</i> <br><br><b>Soldier</b>: He's a Fire Nation soldier.<br><b>Captain</b>: He's no ordinary soldier. The screen pans down and fades to Aang exiting the meetinghouse building where he had met the chief. The doors close behind him. Aang begins to walk through the village, hands defensively wrapped around his staff.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hello? Spirit, can you hear me? This is the Avatar speaking. Suddenly a massive shape emerges from the forest, its huge feet making large thudding sounds each time they hit the ground. Maybe we should go help him?<br><b>Old Man</b>: No, only the Avatar stands a chance against the Hei-Bai.<br><b>Katara</b>: Aang will figure out the right thing to do, Sokka.<br><br><i>(Momo appears to Sokka's right in the window, his eyes blinking widely. The Captain raise two huge sheets of rock and Zuko looks afraid, but then chains wrap around the Captain's feet and his is pulled to the ground by Iroh. The rocks land on top of him.
