Run!<br><br><i>(The creature roars and runs toward another building, but Aang runs underneath its legs and then jumps up onto its forehead. His hand glows light blue, and Aang sues a panda bear superimposed over the monster. Aang jumps back to the porch of a nearby building.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: You're the spirit of this forest. Now I understand. You're upset and angry because your home was burned down. When I saw the forest had burned I was sad and upset. But my friend gave me hope that the forest would grow back.<br><br><i>(The spirit stands still while Aang speaks. When he is finished, he shows Hei-Bai the acorn that Katara gave him. The spirit smiles and Aang places the acorn on the porch. The monster picks up the acorn and transforms into a panda, who turns and walks away from the village. Cut to Aang standing on the porch. The shot widens to show Katara and the other villagers coming up behind him. The scene then shifts to the panda exiting the gate. Behind him a thicket of bamboo grows to man height in seconds. A moment later, Sokka and a few villagers exit the thicket looking confused.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Sokka!<br><br><i>(She runs to hug him, as other villagers hug their loved ones.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What happened?<br><b>Katara</b>: You were trapped in the Spirit world for 24 hours. How are you feeling?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(looking pained)</i>: Like I seriously need to use the bathroom!<br><br><i>(Cut to the chief flanked by two villagers on each side. It is sometime later that night.)</i><br><br><b>Chief</b>: Thank you, Avatar. If there only were a way to repay you for what you've done.<br><b>Sokka</b>: You could give us some supplies and some money.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(angrily elbowing her brother)</i>: Sokka!<br><b>Sokka</b>: What? We need stuff.<br><b>Chief</b> <i>(bowing)</i>: It would be an honor to help you prepare for your journey. <i>(He exits.)</i><br><b>Katara</b>: I'm so proud of you, Aang. You figured out what to do all on your own.<br><b>Aang</b>: Actually, I did have a little help. And there's something else. <br><br><i>(Aang looks downcast, cut to a flashback of the comet vision.) </i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What is it?<br><b>Aang</b>: I need to talk to Roku and I think I've found a way to contact his spirit.<br><b>Katara</b>: That's great!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Creepy, but great.<br><b>Aang</b>: There's a temple on a crescent shaped island, and if I go there on the solstice I'll be able to speak with him.<br><b>Katara</b>: But, the solstice is tomorrow.<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, and there's one more problem. The island is in the Fire Nation.<br><br><i>(Music gets dramatic and cut to the terrified faces of Sokka and Katara. Camera pans up to the moon over the hills.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

The camera pans down to Aang and Appa in the square of a village. Aang is frustratedly pulling on Appa's reins.)</i><br><br><b>Aang </b>(<i>groaning and pulling on the reins</i>): Let's go Appa! Come on, boy!<br><b>Appa</b>: GRRRRRRR<br><br><i>(Appa and Aang face each other.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Look, I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us. Sokka, Katara and members of the village are standing behind Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I think his big butt is trying to tell you something.<br><b>Katara</b>: Please don't go, Aang. He gets up from the ground and walks towards Sokka and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: But I have to talk to Avatar Roku to find out what my vision means. I need to get to the Fire Temple before the sun sets on the Solstice. That's today. <br><br><i>(Aang jumps up onto Appa's back and looks back hesitatingly at Sokka and Katara. Sokka and Katara jump in front of Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: We're not letting you go into the Fire Nation, Aang.<br><b>Sokka</b>: At least not without your friends. We got your back.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to Momo jumping up onto Aang's arm. Momo chitters happily. Scene cuts to a wide view of Aang, Appa, Katara and Sokka. Appa licks Sokka from to head.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: EWWWWW<br><b>Chief</b>: It's a long journey to the Crescent Island. <i>(He hands Aang a parcel.)</i> You'll have to fly fast to have any chance of making it befor/ie sundown. Good luck.<br><b>Aang</b>: Thank you, for your...<br><b>Chief </b>(<i>urgently pointing away</i>): Go!<br><br><i>(Appa takes off and the scene cuts to an aerial view of the village. Scene cuts to the Chief coming out of a door. He is sighing and rubbing his forehead. He walks directly into Prince Zuko. Zuko is accompanied by General Iroh on the back of a war rhinoceros.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Having trouble sleeping? <i>(Zuko pushes the Chief back into the doorway. Camera cuts to a close up of Zuko's face.)</i> Seen the Avatar lately?<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to an ocean view. The sun is high in the sky. The camera pans to Appa flying through the clouds and zooms in on Katara, Sokka and Aang on Appa's back. Aang looks over his shoulder at the rising sun. He turns forward with a determined look on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Come on, boy! We've got a long way to go! Faster! <br><br><i>(Scene cuts to a wide view of Appa flying. He pumps his large tail and growls in assent. Scene cuts again to Zuko's ship racing through the ocean.  Camera zooms in on the ship's deck. Cut to a close up of General Iroh's face.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b> (<i>concerned and frustrated</i>): Sailing into Fire Nation waters... of all the foolish things you have done in your 16 years, Prince Zuko, this is the most foolish.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to a close up of the deck of Zuko's ship. Zuko is in the forefront looking through a high powered spy glass. A guard is behind Zuko to the left. Iroh is behind Zuko to the right.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: I have no choice, Uncle.<br><b>Iroh</b> (<i>angrily</i>): Have you completely forgotten that the Fire Lord banished you?!?!? <i>(With a look of anguish and worry)</i> What if you're caught?<br><b>Zuko</b> (<i>turning around from the spy glass</i>): I'm chasing the Avatar. My father will understand why I'm returning home.<br><b>Iroh</b>: You give him too much credit. My brother is not the understanding type.<br><br><i>(Zuko turns back to the spy glass. Behind him are the Fire Nation soldier and General Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b> (<i>pulling on his beard thoughtfully</i>): Technically you are still in Earth Kingdom waters. Scene cuts to a long distance view of all the war ships in the blockade launching fire balls at the same time. His hands are tight around Appa's reins as he tries to help the Bison avoid the fire balls. Scene cuts to a close up of a fire ball. The fire ball grazes Appa's back. One fireball lands extremely close to the ship and generates a wave that breaks across the deck. Another fireball hits the back part of the ship. Prince Zuko braces himself against the catapult. Scene cuts to Appa bursting through the clouds, a cumulus trail in his wake. The camera zooms in on Aang from behind. He is trying to help Appa avoid the fireball bombardment. In front of them, 12 fireballs shoot through the clouds, smoke trailing behind them. Appa swerves to miss one on his left. Scene cuts to a long distance view of Appa diving to avoid the fireballs. The smoke trails from multiple fireballs surround Appa. Appa flies directly past the camera. The camera now picks up the view from Appa's eyes. Fireballs continue to shoot through the sky. Two fireballs collide and explode directly in front of Appa. Appa growls and rears up to avoid the combustion. He bucks and Sokka is thrown from his back. Katara screams and reaches out for Sokka. Sokka begins to fall and disappears into the clouds below. The camera zooms in on Aang's face. He screams Sokka's name and pulls hard on Appa's reins. Appa dives to catch Sokka before he hits the ocean. The camera follows Appa's dive and Sokka's fall. Appa gets beneath Sokka. As Sokka continues to fall, Katara reaches out her hand to catch him. The camera zooms in on Katara and Sokka's hands as they clasp. Appa hits the water, each of his six legs using the ocean's surface like a trampoline. He begins his ascent. The camera cuts to a close up of Sokka and Katara sitting in Appa's saddle. A large pink fish is thrown up from the ocean and hits Sokka directly in the face. Sokka gasps and falls backward. The fish bounces off his face to be caught by a chittering Momo. The scene cuts to the Fire Navy ships as they let loose another barrage of fiery missiles. Appa, still close to the surface of the water, swerves back and forth as fireballs land in the ocean. Zhao is standing in the foreground, a fully loaded trebuchet in the background. Aang loses his balance amidst the flying rubble and is thrown back onto Appa's shoulders. Sokka and Katara grab his arms to steady him. Appa flies through the Fire Nation blockade. Scene cuts to Appa flying through Fire Nation air space. Appa grunts. Appa continues to fly. His tail begins to droop and his legs slacken as he gets more and more tired. A Fire Sage is hard on his heels.)</i> Wrong way!<br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Come back!<br><br>(<i>Aang, Sokka, Katara and Momo continue to race around corner after corner trying to lose the pursuing Shyu. The secret passage is revealed. A long staircase carved into the rock of the mountain disappears into the dark below.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu </b>(<i>gesturing towards the secret passage</i>): This way.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to Aang, Katara and Sokka, their faxes still showing apprehension and distrust. Suddenly a voice from behind Shyu says, “Find them.” The camera cuts back to Shyu. He looks quickly and nervously behind him and turns back to Aang, Katara and Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Time is running out. Quickly!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to Aang, Katara and Sokka. Aang and Katara look at each other and nod in agreement. All three start towards the opening to the secret passage. Shyu follows them into the passage. He touches a lever and closes the door behind them. Scene cuts to Prince Zuko's damaged ship sailing through the water. Dark black smoke billows from the back of the ship. The camera cuts to an extreme close up of Prince Zuko's hand gripping a bar. His hand clenches. The camera zooms out to Zuko and Iroh on the deck of the ship.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: What's he up to, Uncle? Why didn't Commander Zhao arrest me?<br><b>Iroh</b>: Because he wants to follow you. He knows you'll lead him to the prize you're both after...the Avatar.<br><b>Zuko</b>: If Zhao wants to follow our trail of smoke, then that's exactly what I'll let him do.<br><br><i>(The camera zoom in on Zuko's determined face. Scene cuts to Aang, Katara, Sokka, Momo and Shyu walking down the stairs and into a vast and cavernous system of tunnels. They continue to walk through the tunnels, the live magma from the volcano to their right.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Avatar Roku once called this temple his home. He formed these secret passages out of the magma.<br><b>Aang</b>: Did you know Avatar Roku?<br><b>Shyu</b>: No. But my grandfather knew him. Many generations of Fire Sages guarded this temple long before me. We all have a strong spiritual connection to this place.<br><b>Aang</b>: Is that how you knew I was coming?<br><b>Shyu</b>: A few weeks ago, an amazing thing occurred. The statue of Avatar Roku, its eyes...began to glow!<br><b>Katara</b>: That's when we were at the Air Temple. Avatar Roku's eyes were glowing there too! <br><b>Shyu</b>: At that moment, we knew you had returned to the world.<br><b>Aang</b>: If this is the Avatar's temple, why did the Sages attack me?<br><b>Shyu</b>: Things have changed. In the past, the Sages were loyal only to the Avatar. When Roku died, the Sages eagerly awaited for the next Avatar to return. But he never came.<br><b>Aang</b> (<i>pausing and leaning against the tunnel wall</i>): They were waiting for me.<br><b>Sokka</b> (<i>putting his arm around Aang's shoulders</i>): Hey, don't feel bad. You're only a hundred years late.<br><br><i>(Aang glares at Sokka. The camera zooms in on Shyu as he speaks.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: They lost hope the Avatar would ever return. When Fire Lord Sozen began the war, my grandfather and the other Sages were forced to follow him. (<i>shaking his head in dismay</i>) I never wanted to serve the Fire Lord. When I learned you were coming, I knew I would have to betray the other Sages.<br><br><b>Aang</b> (<i>bowing slightly to Shyu</i>): Thank you for helping me.<br><br><i>(The camera cuts to a close up of Shyu's face. He smiles warmly at the young Avatar. Scene cuts to Shyu, Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo climbing up steps in the tunnel.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary. <i>(Scene cuts to a long deep spiral of stairs. The party continues to climb up and up.)</i> Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to the light from a single window shining into an otherwise dark room. Suddenly, the floor lifts up and Shyu's head appears. He walks up the final steps into the temple, followed by Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo. The camera zooms out as they proceed towards the doors to the sanctuary. Shyu gasps suddenly.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: NO!<br><b>Aang</b>: Shyu, what's wrong?<br><b>Shyu</b>: The sanctuary doors, they're closed.<br><b>Katara</b>: Can't you just open them with firebending? Like you opened that other door?<br><b>Shyu</b>: No. Only a fully realized Avatar is powerful enough to open this door alone. Otherwise the Sages must open the doors together with five simultaneous fire blasts.<br><br><i>(The camera cuts to a close up of Sokka's face. He scratches his chin thoughtfully.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Five fire blasts, huh? (<i>Sokka's face lights up with an idea. The camera pans up to a lantern, in lieu of a light bulb, directly above his head. The “ding” of discovery sounds.)</i> I think I can help you out.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to Prince Zuko's ship. Smoke is still pouring out of the damaged rear engine. The camera pans to the back of the ship. Zuko has instructed the men to open the back hatch of the ship. A smaller vessel is being lowered into the ocean. Scene cuts to a close up of Prince Zuko. He is speaking to Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Uncle, keep heading north. Zhao will follow the smoke trail while I use it as a cover.<br><br><i>(Camera cuts to Iroh. He grunts, strokes his beard and shakes his head disapprovingly.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Hmmmm<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to the smaller ship being deployed. It lands safely in the water and disappears into the smoke. Scene cuts to the view from Commander Zhao's spyglass. Just as Zuko predicted, all he can see is the black smoke from the damaged ship. The camera cuts to a close up of Zhao's face. He lowers the spyglass. Scene cuts back to Sokka, Shyu, Aang and Katara standing in front of the doors to the Fire Temple Sanctuary. Sokka is sitting on the floor, Momo on his knee. Sokka is filling small sacks.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and tada! Fake firebending!<br><b>Katara</b>: You've really outdone yourself this time, Sokka.<br><b>Shyu</b>: This might actually work.<br><br><i>(Sokka stuffs the animal skin sacks into the mouths of the five lion heads guarding the door to the sanctuary. Sokka runs away from the doors. He joins Katara, Aang and Momo behind the nearest columns for protection from the blasts.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: The Sages will hear the explosions, so as soon as they go off, you rush in.<br><b>Katara</b> (<i>turning towards Aang</i>): Its almost sunset. Are you ready?<br><b>Aang</b>: Definitely.<br><br><i>(Shyu sends a small stream of fire past the five lion heads. The twine ignites. Shyu joins Aang behind the column. Sokka crouches and holds tightly onto Katara's skirts. The small bombs go off and smoke fills the chamber. Aang runs towards the doors and pulls on the handles. The doors will not budge.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: They're still locked.<br><b>Shyu</b>: It didn't work.<br><br><i>(Aang sinks to the floor. Scene cuts to an outside view of the Fire Temple. The sun is setting. Fade to black.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The scene opens with a shot of the Fire Temple lit by the setting sun. Scene cuts to Aang. Katara, Sokka, Shyu and Momo standing in front of the doors to the sanctuary. Aang is angrily hurling air blasts at the locked doors.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Why won't it open! Aargh!<br><b>Katara</b> (<i>grabbing Aang's arm</i>): Aang, stop! There's nothing else we can do.<br><b>Aang</b> (<i>hanging his head</i>): I'm sorry I put you through all this for nothing.<br><br><i>(Sokka approaches the doors. He runs his finger through the soot produced by the blasts. Momo chitters and crawls over the lion faces.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I don't get it. That blast looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.<br><b>Katara</b>: Sokka! You're a genius!<br><b>Aang</b>: Wait, how is Sokka genius? His plan didn't even work.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Come on Aang, let her dream.<br><b>Katara</b>: You're right. Sokka's plan didn't work...but it looks like it did.<br><b>Aang</b>: Did the definition of “genius” change in the last hundred years? <br><br><i>(Scene dissolves to Shyu leading the four other Fire Sages to the sanctuary's doors.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Hurry! The Avatar has entered the sanctuary.<br><b>Fire Sage</b>: How did he get in?<br><b>Shyu</b>: I don't know. But look at the scorch marks and down there!<br><br><i>(Shyu points to the space between the doors and the floor. A shadow, as if of two feet, moves back and forth.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Sage</b>: He's inside. Open the doors immediately before he contacts Avatar Roku.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to Aang perched on the dragon's tail wrapped around the columns. He slowly inches he way to the floor, ready to run the minute the Fire Sages open the doors. The camera pans to the five Fire Sages in firebending pose. They shoot five fire blasts into the lion's heads on the face of the door. Smoke appears around the door jambs. Scene cuts to a close up of the lock mechanism on the face of the doors. As the fire blasts work their way through the lock, the doors begin to creak and open slowly. The light from the interior of the sanctuary is initially blinding. As it begins to dissipate, the Fire Sages see a lone Momo inside the sanctuary. Momo sneezes and looks quizzically at the Fire Sages.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Sage</b>: It's the Avatar's lemur! He must have crawled through the pipes! We've been tricked!<br><br><i>(Momo suddenly leaps at the Fire Sage's face, knocking him down. Katara and Sokka jump from behind two columns and grab the two nearest Fire Sages. They pull the Fire Sages' clothes over their heads. Shyu grabs the last Fire Sage. All four Fire Sages are subdued.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Now, Aang!<br><b>Katara</b>: Aang! Now's your chance!<br><br><i>(Prince Zuko and Aang appear from behind a column. Zuko has taken Aang prisoner. He is holding Aang's arms tightly behind his back.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: The Avatar's coming with me!<br><br><i>(The tables turn for Katara, Sokka, Shyu and Momo. Momo flies towards the ceiling. Katara, Sokka and Shyu are tied with chains to the nearest column. Zuko pushes the struggling Aang towards the opening in the floor that leads to Avatar Roku's secret tunnels.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Close the doors! Quickly!<br><br><i>(Aang looks over his shoulder at Sokka and Katara. As he and Zuko reach the opening, he makes several swift moves and knocks Prince Zuko off balance. Aang kicks Zuko down the stairs and turns around quickly. As Zuko tumbles down the stairs with a grunt, Aang runs towards the doors of the sanctuary which are beginning to close.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Go!<br><br><i>(Aang banks left and jumps into the air to avoid a fire blast. He does several turns in mid-air. Aang uses the heads of two of the Fire Sages as stepping stones on his way to the doors. He sails through the doors just as they are closing. The doors shut and the locks grind.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: He made it!<br><br><i>(A blast of bright white light comes from behind the sanctuary doors. Scene cuts to Aang inside the sanctuary. He crouches on the floor in front of Avatar Roku's statue. The setting sunlight comes through an octagonal window at the top of the sanctuary. The light is reddish and moves slowly up the great statue.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> (<i>standing up</i>): The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening?<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to the entryway. Four of the Fire Sages and Prince Zuko assume firebending poses. They shoot five simultaneous fire blasts at the doors. This time, however, the lock mechanism does not respond. The camera cuts to a close up of Zuko's face. He is extremely aggravated.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Why isn't it working? It's sealed shut!<br><b>Fire Sage</b>: It must have been the light. Avatar Roku doesn't want us inside.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to a panoramic view of the outside of the Fire Temple. The sun is sinking slowly into the sea. Scene cuts again to the interior of the sanctuary. Aang stands in the center of the sanctuary facing Roku's statue. The light from the window is now on Roku's chest.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please, Avatar Roku, talk to me!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to a close up of the Avatar Roku's face. The sunlight moves up his face. When the light hits the statue's eyes, they begin to glow. The sanctuary is filled with white smoke. When the smoke clears, Aang is standing face to face with Avatar Roku. They are on the top of a mountain range.)</i><br><br><b>Roku</b>: It's good to see you, Aang. What took you so long?<br><br><i>(Camera cuts to a close up of Aang's face. He is shocked and amazed. He bows deeply to Avatar Roku. The scene cuts back to the entryway to the sanctuary. Shyu is kneeling on the floor in front of Prince Zuko. His hands are tied behind his back. The four Fire Sages stand behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Why did you help the Avatar?<br><b>Shyu</b>: Because it was once the Sages' duty. It is still our duty. <br><br><i>(Suddenly, from behind Prince Zuko, comes the sound of one pair of hands clapping. Scene cuts to Commander Zhao approaching with Fire Nation troops.)</i><br><br><b>Zhao</b>: What a moving and heartfelt performance. I'm certain the Fire Lord will understand when you explain why you betrayed him.<br><b>Fire Sage </b>(<i>bowing</i>): Commander Zhao...<br><b>Zhao</b>: And Prince Zuko, it was a noble effort. But your little smoke screen didn't work. Two traitors, in one day, the Fire Lord will be pleased.<br><br><i>(A Fire Nation soldier moves towards Zuko and grabs him. Zuko struggles.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: You're too late, Zhao. The Avatar's inside and the doors are sealed.<br><b>Zhao</b>: No matter. Sooner or later, he has to come out.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to a close up of Sokka and Katara. They exchange worried glances. Scenc cuts back to Avatar Roku and Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Roku</b>: I have something very important to tell you, Aang. That is why, when you were in the spirit world, I sent my dragon to find you.<br><b>Aang</b>: Is it about that vision? The one with the comet?<br><b>Roku</b>: Yes.<br><b>Aang</b>: What does it mean?<br><br><i>(The camera pans so that Roku's face is on the left of the screen. The light of the mountain range fades into a starry night sky. The comet slowly crosses the screen from left to right as Avatar Roku speaks.)</i><br><br><b>Roku</b>: One hundred years ago, Fire Lord Sozen used that comet to begin the war. He and his firebending army harnessed its incredible power and dealt a deadly first strike against the other nations.<br><br><i>(The camera follows the arc of the comet across the sky. The scene slowly fades to the light of the mountain range as the comet approaches Aang.. Aang is standing on the right of the screen as the comet fades away.)</i><br> <br><b>Aang</b>: So the comet made them stronger?<br><b>Roku</b>: Yes. Stronger than you could even imagine.<br><b>Aang</b>: But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the war now? <br><b>Roku</b>: Listen carefully. <i>(Scene cuts to a close up of Fire Lord Ozai. His body is black against a wall of flames.)</i> Sozen's comet will return by the end of the summer. And Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the war once and for all. <i>(Ozai takes a deep breath, raises his head, and screams a burst of fire from his open mouth. Scene cuts back to Avatar Roku.)</i> If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang, you must defeat the Fire Lord before the comet arrives.<br><b>Aang</b>: But I haven't even started learning waterbending, not to mention earth and fire.<br><b>Roku</b>: Mastering the elements takes years of discipline and practice. But if the world is to survive, you must do it by summer's end.<br><br><i>(The camera zooms in on Aang's face. Fear and worry wash across his features. The scene fades into bright white light. When the light fades out, the scene is a close up of Commander Zhao and his troops standing in front of the sanctuary doors, waiting for Aang to emerge. The troops assume the firebending pose.)</i><br><br><b>Zhao</b>: When those doors open, unleash all your firebending power.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to Sokka, Katara and Shyu chained to a column.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: How's Aang going to make it out of this?<br><b>Sokka</b>: How're we going to make it out of this?<br><br><i>(The camera pans to the Fire Nation troops, standing ready to attack. A bright white light takes us back to Avatar Roku and Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail?<br><b>Roku</b>: I know you can do it Aang, for you have done it before. The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways...for now.<br><b>Aang</b>: But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you? <br><b>Roku</b>: I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way. <i>(The camera zooms in on Roku's face. He closes his eyes. The scene dissolves to Commander Zhao's ships waiting in the bay outside the Fire Temple.)</i> A great danger awaits you at the temple. <i>(The scene dissolves back to a close up of Roku's face.)</i> I can help you face the threat. <i>(The scene dissolves from a close up of Roku's face to a close up of Aang's face. Dissolve to Commander Zhao and his troops in battle positions outside the sanctuary doors. Dissolve to a close up of Aang's face. The arrow on his head begins to glow.)</i> But only if you are ready.<br><br><i>(Aang opens his eyes. They are glowing. He opens his mouth to speak. His mouth is glowing.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I'm ready.<br> <br><i>(The camera zooms out to a shot of Roku and Aang on the top of the mountain. Smoke begins to swirl faster and faster around them. The scene dissolves to the door of the Fire Temple sanctuary. A blinding white light is coming from inside the sanctuary. Commander Zhao and his troops are silhouetted against the light. Smoke billows out into the entryway from the bottom of the door. The camera follows the smoke to where the Fire Sages are standing. They look at the floor in shock and fear. Scene cuts to Sokka, Katara and Shyu tied to a column. The light from the sanctuary continues to grow. All three turn their heads away to shield their eyes. Scene cuts back to Zhao and his troops in front of the door. The door begins to open, slowly. Scene cuts to Prince Zuko tied to another column. He too turns his head away from the light. Scene cuts back to a close up of Zhao and two of his soldiers standing ready to attack. The camera pans to the left, showing the rest of Zhao's soldiers.)</i><br><br><b>Zhao</b>: Ready...<br><br><i>(The camera continues to pan to the door of the sanctuary. The light fades. As the doors begin to fully open, two large glowing eyes are visible in the dark of the sanctuary. Smoke continues to emanate from the sanctuary. Scene cuts to Sokka and Katara struggling against their chains.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: No! Aang!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to a close up of Commander Zhao in firebending pose.)</i><br><br><b>Zhao</b>: Fire!<br><br>(<i>Zhao shoots a fire blast into the sanctuary. Scene cuts to several pairs of hands shooting fire blasts into the sanctuary. The camera zooms out to take in all of Zhao's soldiers. In total, nine soldiers, including Zhao, are concentrating all their fire power at the entrance to the sanctuary. The fire blasts are not entering the sanctuary. They are being held at the door and manipulated into a gigantic ball of swirling fire. The camera zooms in on the fire ball. It slowly begins to open. At the heart of the fire ball is Avatar Roku, his eyes glowing. The camera cuts to a close up of Zhao's shocked face. Scene cuts to Sokka, Katara and Shyu.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Avatar Roku!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to Avatar Roku. He draws the fire ball back towards himself and shoots it out into the room. Zhao and his soldiers are knocked to the floor. The heat of the blast melts the chains holding Sokka, Katara, Shyu and Zuko. Zuko, now free, runs. Scene cuts to the outside of the Fire Temple. Avatar Roku's blast has breached the temple walls. Scene cuts back to Avatar Roku. His entire body is now glowing. The camera zooms in on his face as he turns to look at the cowering Fire Sages. They take fright and run for their lives. Scene cuts to Sokka, Katara and Shyu.)</i><br><br><b>Shyu</b>: Avatar Roku's going to destroy the temple! We have to get out of here!<br><b>Katara</b>: Not without Aang!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts back to Avatar Roku standing in the doorway to the sanctuary. He raises his arm and brings it down on the floor of the temple. The force of his strike rends the floor. Molten lava rises to the surface. The camera zooms in on Roku's hand. He lifts it up, pulling the magma from deep within the volcano. Scene cuts to the volatile lava spurting and rising. A wall of magma shoots up through the entire temple structure. The lava explodes out of the very top of the temple. Scene cuts to Zhao and his men racing down the stairs. Scene cuts back to the entryway to the sanctuary. Sokka and Katara are crouched behind a column for protection. Avatar Roku lowers his hands. The camera zooms in on Roku. He takes a deep breath and pushes his breath down. Scene cuts to the statue of Avatar Roku. The sunlight moves up his face. The eyes of the statue are no longer illuminated by the setting sun of the solstice. Scene cuts to a close up of Avatar Roku. The smoke created by Roku's pyrotechnics are sucked back towards him. He is completely shrouded in the smoke. As the smoke swirls and dissipates, Aang is standing in the entryway to the sanctuary. His eyes are glowing. He closes his eyes, groans and sinks to the floor. Katara and Sokka run to his side.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We got your back.<br><b>Aang</b>: Thanks. Where's Shyu?<br><b>Katara</b>: I don't know.<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to the outside of the Fire Temple. Molten lava is pouring down the sides of the volcano. Smoke is billowing from the bottom of the temple. The temple begins to sink. Scene cuts to Sokka, Katara and Aang. They approach the stairs that will lead them out of the temple. Lava has reached all but the top few steps. They realize that they are trapped. One of the columns crashes to the floor behind them. The gasp and run towards the hole in the temple wall created by Roku's blast. They see that the temple is being devoured by the volcano. Scene cuts to their dismayed faces. Suddenly, they gasp. Scene cuts to Momo and Appa flying full speed towards the temple. Sokka, Aang and Katara slide down one of the peaks of the temple onto Appa's back. Appa zooms away just as the temple sinks further. Scene cuts to a close up of Aang, Sokka and Katara on Appa's back. Aang is in the foreground. His arm rests on a bundle of scrolls. Momo hops up onto his lap, chittering. Momo has the hat of one of the Fire Sages on his head. Scene cuts to a panoramic view of the temple with Zhao's ships in the bay. The temple explodes. The camera zooms in on Zhao as he watches Appa fly off into the sunset.)</i><br><br><b>Zhao</b> (<i>angrily</i>): No prince. No Avatar. Apparently the only thing I do have is five traitors.<br><b>Fire Sage</b>: But Commander, only Shyu helped the Avatar.<br><b>Zhao</b>: Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you're all guilty! Take them to the prison hold!<br><br><i>(Scene cuts to Appa caught in Prince Zuko's spyglass. He watches the bison fly away. He slowly lowers his spy glass. The scene cuts to Zuko's ship sailing away from the ruined Fire Temple. Scene cuts to Appa flying through the night sky. He is surrounded by puffy clouds. Scene cuts to Appa flying towards a bright full moon. The moon is large in the background. Aang, Katara Sokka and Momo are silhouetted against the light of the moon. Aang has drawn apart from his friends. His head hangs down with the weight of what he has learned. First Katara gets up and moves towards Aang. She sits next to him and puts her arm around his shoulders. Next Sokka, gets up and moves toward Aang. He sits next to Aang, his hand on Aang's arm. Finally, Momo flies towards Aang. He chitters and comes to rest directly in front of Aang. Appa growls lovingly, his tail rising and falling. The light from the moon grows brighter and brighter. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Cut to Aang pacing up and down Appa's back, a worried expression on his face and then Sokka driving Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Would you sit down? If we hit a bump you'll go flying off! What's bugging you anyway?<br><b>Aang</b>: It's what Avatar Roku said. I'm supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Well, let's see, you've pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you 112 years... I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(a frightened expression on his face)</i>: I haven't even started waterbending and we're still weeks away from the North Pole! What am I gonna do!?<br><br><i>(Aang has put his head in his hands in frustration. Cut to a view of the side of Aang's body, his left arm now hanging loose. Katara's arm appears as she grabs his hand. She pulls him to her where she is kneeling in the passenger area. Aang kneels beside her as she takes his hands in his.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Calm down. It's going to be okay. If you want, I can try and teach you some of the stuff I know.<br><b>Aang</b>: You'd do that?<br><br><i>(Katara nods her head and smiles. She and Aang then crawl over to the edge of the saddle to look down.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: We'll need to find a good source of water first.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a huge waterfall followed by a rapid zoom backward to show the river running away from the bottom of the fall. Katara, Sokka, Aang and Momo are on the left bank. Cut to close shot of Sokka and Katara. He looks a little sour, she looks up in excitement and happiness at the mighty waterfall. Screen pans left to show Aang with an expression similar to Katara's.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Nice puddle.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the three from a p.o.v. out in the catch basin of the water fall. Appa swoops in overhead, grunts loudly and drops himself into the water. Cut to Momo on a rock in the catch basin. The sun is blotted by a shadow – the wave of water from Appa's messy swan dive. The wave crashes over him and he is soaked. Cut to Appa rolling over in the water, relaxing. Switch to Aang who has removed everything but his underwear and is ready to join the fun. Katara, visible in the background, does not look pleased.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Yehhh! Don't start without me, boy!<br><b>Katara</b>: Remember the reason we're here.<br><br><i>(Caught at the moment of running to jump in the water, stops and looks back to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Oh right, time to practice waterbending. <br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot of the three on the bank. Aang pulls up his pants.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Great. So what am I supposed to do?<br><b>Aang</b>: You could... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes?<br><br><i>(Aang picks up a leafy branch and holds it out to Sokka, who folds his arms across his chest.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking the mud out of a giant bison's feet?<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(smiling)</i>: Mud and bugs!<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(pausing for a second)</i>: Okay.<br><br><i>(Sokka grabs the branch and walks away, resigned to his task. Cut to Appa resting low in the water, where he is blowing bubbles. Fade to a view of a Fire Navy ship's prow as it breaks the water. As the camera zooms backward, a jet of fire erupts off the main deck. Cut to Prince Zuko firing blast after blast of fire at his sparring opponent. Suddenly the ship tilts to starboard, knocking both combatants off balance.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Someone's changing our course!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the bridge from Zuko's p.o.v., then cut to a shot of helmsman at the wheel. No one told you to change course!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from behind Zuko and the helmsman to reveal Iroh and some other crewman playing Pai Sho nearby.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Actually, someone did. Just push and pull the water like this... <br><br><i>(She begins to bob gracefully back and forth, the water on the river edge moving back and forth with her.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: The key is getting the wrist movement right.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(getting up and imitating Katara)</i>: Like this?<br><b>Katara</b>: That's almost right, if you keep practicing, I'm sure eventually – <br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, I'm bending it already!<br><br><i>(View pans left to show Aang moving around a respectably sized wave of water. I'm lucky enough to have a great teacher.<br><b>Katara</b>: Thanks.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of Katara and Aang from the p.o.v. of the top of the waterfall.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: So, what's next.<br><b>Katara</b>: This is a more difficult move. I call it "streaming the water."<br><br><i>(Cut to closer view of the pair. They groan pitifully. Cut to the kids running down another alley, but when they turn the next corner they are met by the pirate salesmen and his men. Cut the to Pirate Barker and his mates now blocking the entrance.)</i><br><br><b>Pirate Barker</b> <i>(dual wielding a pair of long knives)</i>: Now, who gets to take the steel of my blade first?<br><b>Aang</b>: No thanks!<br><br><i>(Aang airbends a huge gust of wind at the Pirates, who are blinded with dust and disoriented. Aang gets up, an unhappy look on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: No way.<br><b>Katara</b>: Isn't it great?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(entering from right)</i>: No wonder they were trying to hack us up. You stole their waterbending scroll.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(self satisfied)</i>: I prefer to think of it as "high-risk trading."<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(smiling)</i>: Haha! I always say the only thing better than finding something you were looking for, is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain!<br><br><i>(In the middle of Iroh's saying, a parade of Fire Nation soldiers walks by carrying armloads of merchandise that Iroh has just bought. There was that time you – <br><b>Katara</b> <i>(angrily again)</i>: No more apologies!<br><br><i>(Fade back to a shot of Zuko's ship. They stole a waterbending scroll, right?<br><b>Pirate Captain</b>: Uh huh.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Then they'll be on the water.<br><br><i>(Fade to a night scene, the camera focused on the full moon in the sky. Come on water, work with me here!<br><br><i>(She lifts a globe of water out of the river and tries to manipulate it, each of her mistakes being punctuated by a verbal exclamation of "okay", "stupid!" or something else. She is surrounded by the pirates and Zuko's soldiers.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Tell me where he is and I won't hurt you or your brother.<br><b>Katara</b>: Go jump in the river!<br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(trying to be reasonable)</i>: Try to understand, I need to capture to restore something I've lost. You promised the scroll!<br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(producing the scroll and making fire in his hand beneath it)</i>: I wonder how much money this is worth? <i>(The pirates gasp and some cry, "no!")</i>. A lot, apparently. Now you help me find what I want, you'll get this back and everyone goes home happy. Search the woods for the boy and meet back here.<br><b>Pirate Captain</b> <i>(sullen)</i>: Fine.<br><br><i>(Cut back to a dawn scene at the waterfall. A shot of the waterfall is replaced by Aang and Sokka still sleeping. Sokka rolls over, starting to wake. He notices Katara's empty sleeping bag in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Huh? Where did she go? <i>(Cut to Sokka searching Aang's bag, Aang waking up in the foreground.)</i> I don't believe it.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(yawning)</i>: What's wrong.<br><b>Sokka</b>: She took the scroll! She's obsessed with that thing. It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep –<br><br><i>(He is cut off when his hands get wrapped in a sling thrown from off-screen. He is pulled right off his sleeping bag screaming. He lands on the ground and is faced by a pirate who throws another sling at him. He rolls out of the way, picks up his spear and charges the intruder. Aang, in the background, turns to see a huge beefy pirate hefting two crossbows with a net tied between them. He aims and fires. Aang fires an air ball at the approaching net, but the air passes right through it. The net rolls him up into a nice neat bundle and he is thrown backwards onto the ground, where another pirate begins dragging him away. They instantly leave Sokka alone, who gets up, his pride hurt.)</i><br><br><b>Random Pirate</b>: I got him, come on!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh, what? I'm not good enough to kidnap?<br><br><i>(He is answered by another net which scoops him up. He screams as they drag him towards the camera and then o.c. Cut to a view of the pirate ship beached on the river bank, the pirates, Zuko and his men lined up facing each other. Katara is still bound to the tree, Iroh standing next to her. The pirates have Sokka and Aang tied up, Zuko holds the scroll.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Nice work.<br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, this is all my fault.<br><b>Aang</b>: No, Katara it isn't.<br><b>Iroh</b>: Yeh, it kind of is.<br><br><i>(Cut to Zuko's face.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Give me the boy.<br><b>Pirate Captain</b>: You give us the scroll.<br><b>Sokka:</b> You're really gonna hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment!?<br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(pointing at Sokka)</i>: Don't listen to him! He's trying to turn us against each other.<br><b>Pirate Captain</b> <i>(looking at Aang)</i>: Your friend is the Avatar?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(appearing at the Captain's side)</i>: Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market then that fancy scroll.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Shut your mouth, you water tribe peasant!<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(concerned)</i>: Yeh, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth...<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(looking sweetly at the obviously very interested pirates)</i>: I'm just sayin', it's bad business sense. Just imagine how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar. You guys would be set for life!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the two opposing groups. The Pirate Captain points to Zuko.)</i><br><br><b>Pirate Captain</b>: Keep the scroll! We can buy a hundred with the reward we will get for the kid.<br><br><i>(The pirates begin to walk away with the kids. Cut to Zuko's face.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: You'll regret breaking a deal with me!<br><br><i>(Zuko and the guards on either side of him unleash a torrent of flame, which bathes the ground underneath the pirates who jump out the way. General melee begins. The Pirate Salesmen jumps into the midst of the firebenders with a cry. Zuko and his men bear down on the still bound Aang and Sokka. As the get near, four pirates jump into the frame to defend their captives. They drop smoke bombs and the battlefield instantly becomes a foggy mess. The remaining Fire Nation soldiers approaches the edge of the crowd and are instantly pulled in by the arms of pirates emerging from the smoke. Cut to an overhead shot of Katara still bound to the tree. Momo climbs down the trunk and chew open her bonds.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(smiling)</i>: Thanks, Momo. I owe you a bushel of apples.<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang running through the smoke, coughing, his hands still bound. Near misses with a throwing star and a spear cut Aang's bonds. Cut to the exterior of the smoke cloud where Zuko emerges. He puts the waterbending scroll through his waistband on his back. He turns around to just avoid a sword stroke. Zuko assumes a firebending stance, then cut to the Pirate Captain pointing a sword at him. They struggle, but no one gains advantage. From off-screen a sling removes the scroll from Zuko's waistband. Cut to the pirate who threw the sling. Momo intercepts the sling as it returns to the pirate and takes the scroll, flying o.c.. Momo in turn is pursued by the Pirate Captain's green parrot, which tackles Momo in mid-air. The lemur drops the scroll and it falls back down into the smoke filled battlefield, jets of flame erupting from it at various points. Cut to Sokka crawling on the ground, the sound of steel on steel all around him. Out of the smoke a machete buries itself in the ground in front Sokka, scaring him. He uses its blade to cut his arm bonds.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Aang, are you there?<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang airbending himself up over the smoke cloud, then dropping back down.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I'm over here, follow my voice!<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(from o.c.)</i>: Where? I can't find you!<br><b>Aang</b>: I'm right here!<br><br><i>(The Avatar assumes an airbending stance and blows away the smoke from the immediate area to reveal a mix of Fire Nation soldiers and pirate in combat. They freeze and look at him. He closes the smoke back up around them.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Uhh, never mind! I'll find you!<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka crawling out of the smoke and getting up. As he does, Aang jumps out of the smoke over Sokka's head.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Run!<br><br><i>(They run towards the pirate ship, which Katara is trying to push off the beach.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Katara! You're okay!<br><b>Katara</b>: Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get out of here!<br><br><i>(All three begin to push on the boat, but nothing happens. They stop and look up at the prow.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.<br><b>Aang</b>: A team of rhinos... or two waterbenders.<br><br><i>(Katara looks at Aang and smiles. Cut to Aang and Katara pulling the river back and forth up the beach, slowly raising the water level around the prow. The ship floats.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Everybody in!<br><br><i>(Cut back to the duel between Zuko and the Pirate Captain. Iroh breaks it up.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?<br><b>Zuko</b>: We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!<br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(pointing o.c.)</i>: It's no proverb.<br><br><i>(Cut to a quick shot of the pirate ship sailing downriver, then back the Captain, Zuko and Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>Pirate Captain</b>: Bleeding hog-monkeys! <i>(He runs o.c..)</i><br><b>Zuko</b>: Haha!<br><br><i>(Cut to pirate ship, now far away, as the screen pans left to reveal Zuko's ship following it, loaded with pirates, one of whom moves to moon Zuko and his Uncle, but is cut off by shift back to Zuko and Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Hey! That's my boat! <i>(He runs o.c.)</i><br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(scratching his chin)</i>: Maybe it should be a proverb.<br><b>Zuko</b> <i>(from o.c.)</i>: Come on, Uncle!<br><br><i>(Cut to shot of Aang's back. He looking astern at the pirates as the close in. He turns to yell forward.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sokka! Can't you make it go any faster?<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang's p.o.v, showing Sokka's back as he stands at the wheel of the ship).</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I don't know how. This thing wasn't made by the water tribe.<br><br><i>(Cut back to side view of Aang, where the smokestack of the cutter ship is visible in the background. The pirates are passing them. When they draw parallel, pirates begins jumping onto the kid's ship. Cut to a view of the aft deck, where Katara faces the camera in the background and two pirates advance on her in the foreground. As she backs up, Aang, who is visible on top of the cabin, waterbends a huge wave onto the deck that washes one of the pirates overboard. Katara, afraid at first, but then gaining confidence and determination in her continence, creates a water whip and smacks the other one overboard. Cut to Katara, beaming, Aang visible in the background still on top of the cabin.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, you did the water whip!<br><b>Katara</b>: I couldn't have done it without your help!<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka on the bridge with a beefy pirate and the pirate salesmen on him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Will you two quit congratulating each other and help me out!<br><br><i>(Momo flies across the screen at this point, closely pursued by the Captain's parrot. The pursuit ends when Momo traps the parrot by wrapping him in the pirate vessel's black flag. Cut back to Sokka being held aloft by the beefy pirate. Sokka screams as the pirate throws him into the sail in front of him. Sokka falls with a thud to the deck below.)</i><br><br><b>Pirate Barker</b>: That's good!<br><br><i>(Aang drops into the scene from the left and throws the Pirate Salesmen threw the guard rail and o.c. with a huge blast of air. He twirls the beefy pirate around on a whirlwind of air for a few minutes before ejecting him high into the air. He comes back down in the background, landing with a splash in the river. Cut to a view from the floor of the foredeck, Sokka's supine form in the foreground, Katara and Aang visible on the bridge deck above. Aang jumps down to Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(pointing forward)</i>: Aang, look!<br><br><i>(The sound of falling water is heard as she speaks. Cut to p.o.v. down the river looking back upriver at the ships. Camera zooms out to reveal that they are rapidly approaching a large waterfall. Cut back to Aang as the screen expands to reveal the Pirate Barker behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Oh, no!<br><br><i>(The Pirate Barker draws his blade, making a distinctive sound. Aang turns to face him and draws his bison whistle in response. He blows the whistle furiously to no seeming effect. Cut back to the unimpressed Pirate Barker, who is promptly round-kicked overboard by Sokka who has just entered the shot from the right.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(tapping the side of his head)</i>: Have you lost your mind!? This is no time for flute practice!<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Aang looking over the starboard railing at the rapidly approaching waterfall. Cut to a view of the prow almost at the lip of the fall. Katara speaks from o.c.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: We can stop the boat! Aang, together, push and pull the water!<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Aang on the foredeck waterbending in unison, making pushing and pulling motions. Cut to overhead shot of the boat, which is now turning around right at the lip of the fall.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: It's working! It's slowing down!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang and Katara bending, then back to the ship which is now at a 90 degree angle to the lip of the fall and motionless. Cut back a side shot of Aang and Katara, Sokka in the background. Beyond Sokka, the smokestack of the cutter can be seen growing larger.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: We're doing it!<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(pointing to the cutter)</i>: But we have another problem!<br><br><i>(The camera zooms over the railing to show a close of the cutter bearing down on the pirate ship. Cut to a view of the pirate ship hovering at the lip of the fall from the p.o.v. of someone sitting on the river bank. From the left the cutter enters the scream and rams the pirate ship amidships. Cut back to the kids who yell "whoa!" at he impact, which lifts the starboard side of the pirate ship out of the water and, consequently, making the ship list badly to port. The list rapidly becomes so bad that the three fall off the ship and over the falls, the pirate ship falling behind them. Cut to the three falling. Appa swoops in and they land on his backs. He exits just in time to avoid the falling pirate ship. Cut to a wide shot of the waterfall from its base. The pirate ship disintegrates when its hits the bottom in a cloud of water and debris. Appa and the kids swoop out of the scene. Cut to a close up of the bison whistle, then zoom backwards to reveal the kids on Appa's back, Momo landing on Sokka's shoulder in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I knew a bison whistle would come in handy. Thanks, Appa.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Yeh, we owe ya one.<br><br><i>(Cut to Appa's face. He grunts back to them. Then cut to Zuko running up to the river bank near the waterfall, Iroh huffing and puffing behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: My boat!<br><b>Iroh</b> <i>(finally regaining his breath)</i>: Hehe, Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. The missing lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time!<br><br><i>(He produces the missing lotus tile with a huge smile on his face. Cut to wide shot of Iroh still holding out the piece, Zuko trying to control his breathing and his temper. Cut back to Iroh holding the piece, which disappears fast as lightning when Zuko snatches it from him. Zuko throws it as far as he can. Cut to the pirates floating downstream. The piece lands on the Pirate Barker's head. Cut to a long shot of Aang breaking through the clouds.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, I still owe you an apology. <i>(Cut to the three in the saddle, Katara kneeling and looking down at nothing.)</i> You were just so good at waterbending without really trying. I got so competitive that I put us all in danger. I'm sorry.<br><b>Aang</b>: That's okay, Katara.<br><b>Katara</b>: Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway.<br><br><i>(Pan left to reveal Sokka's hand holding the scroll.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Is that really how you feel?<br><b>Katara</b>: The scroll!<br><br><i>(She reaches for it, but Sokka pulls it away and gives her the heisman with his other hand.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: First, what did you learn?<br><b>Katara</b>: Stealing is wrong. <i>(She takes the scroll.)</i> Unless it's from pirates!<br><b>Aang</b>: Haha! Good one, Katara.<br><br><i>(Cut to Appa flying off into the clouds. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>Jet</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=91">James Eagan</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=84">Miyuki Hoshikawa</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=85">Justin Ridge</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> JM Animation Co, Ltd<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Fledgling<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(OPEN on a pale blue sky, panning down to reveal the tops of a vast deciduous forest. The trees are blanketed in leaves of fiery reds and oranges; there is just a hint of green left on one or two. The air is alive with the CHIRRPS and WHIRRS of insects. The pan stops on wide branch. A little yellow beetle scuttles from around the backside of the branch, toward the trunk.  The bug is suddenly covered in a rapidly growing shadow as MOMO swoops in from above. Before he can catch it, the beetle's carapace opens like a ladybug's, and it flies off while he peeks under his paws to see if he got it. Discovering he hasn't, Momo leaps after it.<br><br>Cut to the forest from just below canopy level, looking up. The beetle flies up the tree trunk with Momo climbing in pursuit and CHITTERING. They ring the tree then descend.<br><br>Cut to the base of the tree. A pile of slightly lumpy red nuts sits in the foreground. The beetle enters from OC and lands on the ground. Momo lands in a pounce from the same direction, but once again the beetle flies off before he can catch it. He watches it, then notices the fruit.<br><br>The camera pulls back to reveal the neat pile of about a dozen or so apple-like nuts sitting on a pile of leaves. Other than the leaf pile, the ground is bare dirt. Momo's ears prick straight up.<br><br>Cut to the little clearing with the pile of fruit. Momo pounces on it from OC. Suddenly, copper-colored slats snap up from the leaves and surround him in a globe. The snare's slats run longitudinally; the “poles” are parallel to the ground. The globe shifts so that the ‘north pole' is on top and the camera pans up into the canopy as the snare and its cargo spring into the air, where two other snares hang.<br><br>Cut to a place just below canopy level. Momo's snare comes to a jerking stop at about the same level in the air as the two other snares. They are also occupied: large brown baboon-like animals BARK noisily, as they hold onto the slats like prison bars and pull on them. The momentum of the ascent leaves Momo's snare—and Momo—spinning. <br><br>Cut to another clearing in the forest.  Between trees AANG, KATARA, SOKKA and APPA are visible at the far end, taking a break from travel.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Where's Momo?<br><br><i>(Momo's yowl echoes through the forest.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Aang standing in the foreground with Katara and Sokka sitting on the ground. They look around, trying to tell where the call came from.<br><br>Fade to the clearing with the snares, looking up from ground level. Aang wanders in from OC, drawn by Momo's urgent CALLS. With a sweep of his arms, He airbends to leap, climbing to Momo's height by rebounding up off close-by tree trunks.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Hang on Momo!<br><br><i>(Cut to a tree branch. It extends out of a main part of the tree. Attached to the trunk is a small winch. A rope enters the winch from lower on the trunk OC, then continues up to an eyeloop bolt attached to the underside of the branch, before hanging straight down. Aang ascends in from OC. He sits, then flips over the branch and dangles beneath it like an acrobat on a trapeze. He grabs the rope, releases a latch on the winch, and carefully feeds more line.<br><br>Cut to the ground, as Sokka and Katara ease the snare down to the ground between them and together pull the squeaky slats apart enough to make an exit. Momo immediately hops out and runs to the foreground to finish a handful of the nuts, his peril forgotten. Sokka and Katara release the snare, and Sokka GROANS and slaps his forehead at the lack of gratitude. Aang jumps down from above and looks up. Sokka and Katara also look up.<br><br>Cut to the other two snares. The Hog Monkeys in them MOAN pleadingly. The traps are suspended near each other on a different branch.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> All right—you too.<br><br><i>(He crouches, then springs up in a spiraling column of airbent wind that carries him up to the camera and OC. Sokka reaches behind.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: This is gonna take forever.<br><br><i>(Sokka throws his boomerang in one fluid move; with a WHIZ it zips up and OC.<br><br>Just below the branch, the ropes come from opposite directions, but they parallel each other as they hang down from curved staples. With a WHIZ, the boomerang enters and exists the scene, cutting the both ropes in the process. The ropes fall away; There's the sound of CRASHES and panicked beast BARKS.<br><br>The camera pans slightly as Aang arrives from OC: he's hanging below the branch and hugging it as he inches over to the first staple. He pauses to look upside-down at the ground below.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> That works...<br><br><i>(On the ground, the hog monkeys are loose; their cages like open clamshells. They walk on all fours to the foreground. One disappears between the framing trees, the other climbs up the tree framing the left and disappears. Sokka approaches one of the busted snares and kneels to examine it, as Aang enters by skidding down the trunk and root of a tree in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> These are Fire Nation traps—you can tell from the metalwork. We'd better pack up camp, and get moving.<br><br><i>(Sokka's hands pull taught the bindings on a roll of gear.<br><br>Cut to the clearing from over Aang's shoulder. Katara hands a gear roll up to Aang, who is sitting on Appa's head. Sokka sees this. He leaves his roll and walks over to them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Ah-ah...no flying this time.<br><b>Katara:</b> What?<br><br><i>(Aang hands the roll to Sokka, who puts it on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Why wouldn't we fly?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Think about it. Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us. It's because they spot Appa—he's just too noticeable.<br><b>Katara:</b> What! Appa's not too noticeable!<br><b>Sokka:</b> He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head—it's kinda hard to miss him!<br><br><i>(Appa turns his head and GROANS at Sokka. Aang is in the ‘driver's seat' holding his reigns.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> (gently to Appa): Sokka's just jealous ‘cause he doesn't have an arrow.<br><b>Sokka</b> (to Aang OC): I know you all want to fly, but my instincts tell me we should play it safe this time and walk.<br><b>Katara:</b> Who made you the boss?<br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm not the boss—I'm the leader.<br><b>Katara</b> (incredulous): You're the leader? But your voice still cracks!<br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm the oldest and I'm a warrior. (tries to speak deeper) So...I'm the leader!<br><b>Katara:</b> If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean, he is the Avatar.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Are you kidding—he's just a goofy kid!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang, dangling from Appa's horn: upside-down by his hands with his legs sticking out into space. Appa looks rather unimpressed.)</i><br> <br><b>Aang:</b> He's right.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Sokka again. Sokka has his pack on his back.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader? I bet you wouldn't be so bossy if you kissed a girl.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I-I've kissed a girl—you...just haven't met her.<br><b>Katara:</b> Who? Gran-gran? I've met Gran-gran.<br><b>Sokka:</b> No—besides Gran-gran. Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot and a leader has to trust his instincts.<br><b>Katara:</b> Okay, we'll try it your way Oh Wise Leader.<br><br><i>(Aang steps over, now wearing a backpack. Momo is sitting on the top.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Who knows—walking might be fun.<br><br><i>(Cut to the forest. Between trees the group trudges along, with Sokka in front, followed by Aang/Momo, Katara and Appa)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?<br><b>Katara:</b> I don't know Aang. Why don't you ask Sokka's instincts—they seem to know everything.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Ha ha. Very funny.<br><b>Aang:</b> I'm tired of carrying this pack.<br><b>Katara:</b> You know who you should ask to carry it for a while? Sokka's Instincts!<br><b>Aang:</b> That's a great idea! Hey, Sokka's Instincts, would you mind—<br><b>Sokka:</b> Okay, okay—I get it. Look guys, I'm tired too. But the important thing is that-- <i>(He pushes the branches from two rust red-leafed bushes and holds them, focussing his attention on Aang and Katara.)</i> --we're safe from...the— <i>(He finally turns around to see what's beyond the bushes.)</i> --Fire...Nation...<br><br><i>(Sokka, Aang Katara and Momo have just walked into a clearing with a Fire Nation encampment in it. On the opposite end of the clearing are three Pavilion tents, and an active fire pit with logs as benches on two sides. The camp is occupied.<br><br>Cut to the reaction of the soldiers—most of them seated or crouching near the fire with bowls in hand. The surprise of others. On a couple of soldiers seated closest to the tents, which have doorflaps with the Fire Nation emblem on them. One of these soldiers has a patch over his left eye.<br><br>Back to Momo and the Trio.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> RUN!<br><br><i>(As they drop their packs, The soldiers leap up from the logs, swords out. The one-eyed soldier takes a bender's stance and launches a fist-full of fire at them. The fire misses them—mostly—but sets the bushes behind them alight.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> We're cut off! <i>(Meanwhile, the left sleeve of his tunic is on fire.)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> Sokka, your shirt!<br><br><i>(Sokka looks, and YELLS in panic.<br><br>Katara uncorks a skin container and begins to bend the contents—water—into a flowing ribbon. The ribbon splashes against Sokka's tunic, putting it out. Katara redirects the ribbon back into the waterskin and replaces the cap.<br><br>The trio is surrounded: the burning bushes behind them, the soldiers all around. They put their backs together and face the warriors, ready to fight if necessary.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.<br><b>Katara</b> (quietly): What are you doing?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Bluffing?<br><br><i>(The One-eyed Captain smiles from his lines.)</i><br><br><b>Captain</b>: You? Promise not to hurt us?<br><br><i>(There is a quiet ZIP and THUD. The Captain looks surprised for a moment, then groans and collapses face first on the ground. His men lower their weapons a little.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Nice work, Sokka! How'd ya do that?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Uh...instinct?<br><b>Katara:</b> Look!<br><br><i>(She points to somewhere above.  Blur to a figure standing on the massive branch of a nearby tree. The person drops something  and draws two blades from the middle of his back.. He steps off the back of the branch, his weapons held high. Instead of falling straight down, the weapons seem to catch on the branch, allowing him to sling himself in the direction of the camp. The stranger kicks over two of the soldiers farthest from the Trio; he lands with a foot on each of their backs.<br><br>He is JET. He is a young man—about Sokka's age. Except for a red vest, he's dressed from neck to toe in dark green clothing. What little armor he has (shoulder caps and hip/upper thigh covers) are mismatched. He has a shaggy mane of brown hair, and a twig held in his teeth.<br><br>He rushes forward, his shuang gou (twin hook sword) in each hand. He hooks a leg each on another pair of soldiers and sends them head over heels. With a polished body flip, he launches them through the air. They end up in a heap on top of their prone captain.<br>Jet lands on his feet, ready for more.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Down you go.<br><br><i>(The trio looks up from the little pile-up at him. They've gone from surprise to varying degrees of pleasure (Katara) awe (Aang) and incredulity (Sokka).<br><br>A soldier rushes up from behind Jet, sword raised. The young man hooks his opponent's sword hand as he spins. Jet finishes where he started—ready to face a new opponent—while his opponent is sent flying. The man lands at the feet of a quartet of sword holders. The closest then looks up.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: They're in the trees!<br><br><i>(A small boy drops from above and lands on the soldier's shoulders, then spins his helmet around, blinding him. He staggers off, his small attacker still on his shoulders and laughing all the while. He reaches for a quiver on his back and fits two arrows to the string of his bow. The archer swings backward, until he is hanging beneath the branch by his knees. He lets his arrows fly.<br><br>Cut to another quartet of soldiers. This freedom fighter ducks, lets the swordsman run into <i>(and across)</i> his back, and tosses his opponent up onto the branch with a shrug. The second swordsman is more cautious, but with speed and strength the rebel grabs him, spins him around and throws him. The barehanded rebel turns and heads for new targets before his old one hits the ground. Meanwhile, a boy with a knife and red facepaint drops to the foreground and runs off to fight.<br><br>Cut to Jet, who watches over his shoulder as Katara uses her water to take on an OC foe and beside her Aang bends the air, dragging two soldiers in a dusty circle around the pair.<br><br>Cut to Sokka, boomerang raised in both hands, shouting a war cry. Sokka stops shouting and sags out of his battle stance.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b>  Hey, he was mine!<br><b>Jet:</b> Gotta be quicker next time.<br><br><i>(Jet turns and rejoins the battle. The grinning giant simply reaches over his shoulder and pulls out a log thicker than a man's leg. He raises it two-handed over his head, and with a growl lowers the boom.<br><br>Jet turns from his current opponent to watch the two swordsman backing away, their swords bent beyond use. He looks at the downed man.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> (frustrated): Man!<br><br><i>(Another spearman attempts to strike at Jet from behind. Pfft. There were only, like, twenty guys!<br><b>Jet:</b> My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters. Sneers-- <i>(The Weaponless rebel, who is eating from one of the soldier's bowls)</i> --Longshot <i>(The archer; he raises his paddy-hat covered head at his name)</i> --Smellerbee <i>(The rebel with the facepaint and knife. His knife between his teeth, a captured Fire Nation Sword slung across his back and he has one in each hand.
