They pull it to their height, then send it toward the river where it continues to flow like a giant garden hose. The water quickly joins the river.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Yes! Good job! This river empties into the reservoir--a few more geysers and it'll be full.<br><b>Aang:</b> Look, there's another steam vent.<br><br><i>(Aang and Katara walk off in its direction.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Okay. You two keep it up—I'll go check on things at the reservoir. <i>(He turns and walks away.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> When we're done we'll meet you over there.<br><b>Jet:</b> Actually...probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you're done.<br><br><i>(Jet resumes walking away Aang and Katara bend the next geyser into another fountain.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> ...I bet that's enough—and I'm not just saying that to be lazy.<br><br><i>(Around them, a half dozen fountains flow into the river.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir.<br><b>Aang:</b> I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout. <br><b>Katara:</b> Well, we finished early--I'm sure he'll be happy to see us.<br><br><i>(Fade from Katara to a path in the forest. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee follow Sokka, who has his hands tied behind his back. Smellerbee gives his prisoner a shove; Sokka stumbles but remains on his feet.)</i><br><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> Come on—move along!<br><b>Sokka:</b> How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?<br><b>Pipsqueak:</b> Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader. We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay.<br><br><i>(Sokka notices a couple of snare leaf-piles nearby. They identical to the one that enticed Momo, right down to the pile of nuts.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> If that's how Jet leads, then he's got a lot to learn.<br><br><i>(Sokka sprints off in the direction of the snares. Smellerbee makes a grab for him, but misses.)</i><br><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> Hey!<br><br><i>(They give chase. Sokka leaps over the leaf piles. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee don't, and end up snared and hanging many feet up in the air.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> While you two are up there you might want to practice your knot-work. <i>(He holds up his now-worthless bindings, then turns and walks away.)</i><br><b>Pipsqueak:</b> Hey Smellerbee—you gonna eat your leechee nuts? <i>(A nut strikes him in the head and lands in the pile he's holding.)</i> Ooh. <i>(He picks one up and licks his lips.)</i><br><br><i>(Katara and Aang are standing on the edge of the cliff. At the base of the dam, four of Jet's people are unloading barrels from the wagon and arranging them.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> ...What are they doing?<br><b>Aang:</b> Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.<br><b>Katara:</b> Why would they need blasting jelly?<br><br><i>(Zoom on Aang, as he gets it.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Because Jet's gonna blow up the dam.<br><b>Katara:</b> What? No--that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that.<br><br><i>(Aang snaps his glider wings open.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I've gotta stop him. <i>(He runs for the edge.)</i><br><b>Katara</b> (less convinced): Jet wouldn't do that.<br><br><i>(Before Aang can reach the edge, Jet crosses his path from behind and snatches the glider. Aang is left wobbling precariously on the edge, and uses an airbending move to get himself back on stable footing.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Yes I would.<br><b>Katara:</b> Jet—why?<br><b>Jet:</b> Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think. Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother—we can't let them do that to anyone else, ever again.<br><b>Katara:</b> This isn't the answer!<br><b>Jet:</b> I want you to understand me Katara. I thought your brother would understand, but—<br><b>Katara:</b> Where's Sokka?<br><br><i>(Tears fall from her eyes. Jet reaches out and touches her face.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Katara.<br><br><i>(She bows her head, then with a SHOUT sends Jet flying with the water from her waterskin. She draws it back into the skin when she's done.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I need to get to the dam.<br><br><i>(Aang's closed glider is on the ground. As he reaches for it, the crescent end of one of Jet's shuang gou pins it like an axe. Jet has the two weapons hook to hook; with a yank he pulls the sword and Aang's glider to him.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You're not going anywhere without your glider.<br><br><i>(Jet swings the swords—still hook to hook—at Aang. Aang summersaults backwards to avoid the extra reach. Aang finishes his retreat in a nearby tree.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I'm not gonna fight you, Jet.<br><b>Jet:</b> You'll have to if you want your glider back.<br><br><i>(Aang retreats back into the forest, as Jet hooks the branch and pulls himself up. Katara follows on the ground. Jet attacks; Aang defends himself with balls of air, which Jet ducks. Jet attacks head on, but Aang blocks with his arms and sends his opponent flying into a tree trunk with an air kick. Jet combines his swords again and advances. Aang avoids the flail-like move and sends another air blast. Jet stoops down and lets the air flow over and past him, then lunges.<br><br>They continue the chase through the many levels of the forest. Jet catches up to Aang and sends them both freefalling, attacking as they go. They both end up on a branch. Jet continues his attack. Aang avoids it all. Jet charges again, but Aang hits him with a jetstream of air. Jet falls. He recovers, but looses the glider in the process. Before Aang can get to the ground Jet kicks him into a trunk. He lands with a thud next to his glider.<br><br>A small tributary flows past him. Aang is slow to get up. Before Jet can take more than a step however, he his hit by a large water strike. Katara is there; she uses water from the river to throw Jet against the trunk of the tree. Over and over she attacks; Jet is unable to cut the water and its force plasters him against the trunk. She bends the water to ice; the soggy renegade is left frozen from toe to neck.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. You lied to me—you're sick and I trusted you!<br><br><i>(A signal call is heard. Katara and Aang are startled, then look to the valley beyond—where it's coming from. Jet gives an answer call.)</i> <br><br><b>Katara:</b> What are you doing?<br><b>Jet:</b> You're too late.<br><b>Katara</b> (horrified): No!<br><br><i>(Aang snaps open his glider and runs for the nearby cliff/waterfall. His glider's wing is so shredded however, that he has no lift and slams back into the ground near the edge. Katara runs over to help him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Sokka's still out there—he's our only chance.<br><b>Katara:</b> Come on, Sokka. I'm sorry I ever doubted you. Please.<br><br><i>(Cut to a tree. Longshot stands on a branch, his bow pulled. He has a fire arrow on the string He sights, then lets it fly. <br><br>It arcs down to the base of the dam.<br><br>Katara watches.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> (whisper): No...<br><br><i>(The center of the dam explodes in a cloud of smoke and fire. Katara and Aang watch a massive wall of water go over the ‘dry' falls and down to the town.<br><br>Inside the town the streets are empty except for the occasional barrel and a market table with cabbages. The water rushes through the open gate, as a cresting wave dwarfs it. The wall and gate are swallowed as the wave strikes the town.<br><br>The flotsam carried away includes a smiling doll in a purple dress.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Sokka didn't make it in time.<br><b>Katara:</b> All those people...<i>(She turns in rage back to Jet.)</i> Jet—you monster!<br><b>Jet:</b> This was a victory, Katara. Remember that. The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.<br><b>Sokka:</b> It will be safe—without you.<br><br><i>(In shock, Jet looks up to see Sokka, Appa and Momo rise from below the level of the cliff. Sokka has Appa's reins.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka!<br><b>Sokka:</b> I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.<br><b>Jet:</b> What!<br><b>Sokka:</b> At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me—the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time.<br><br><i>(What Sokka describes is seen in monochrome pictures.<br><br>The townsfolk are seen on high ground above the river, on the bank opposite the town. A LITTLE GIRL runs down to the water's edge as the doll floats by. She retrieves it.)</i><br><br><b>Little Girl</b> (Happily): Missus Pretty! <i>(She hugs her doll.)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> Sokka, you fool! We could've freed this valley!<br><b>Sokka:</b> Who would be free—everyone would be dead.<br><b>Jet:</b> You traitor!<br><b>Sokka:</b> No, Jet. You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.<br><b>Jet:</b> Katara. Please—help me.<br><b>Katara:</b> Goodbye Jet.<br><br><i>(Sokka gives Appa's reigns a flick.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Yip yip.<br><br><i>(Jet is left behind on the ground, still frozen to the tree.<br><br>The sky they fly in is empty, save a few wispy clouds.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> We thought you were going to the dam. How come you went to the town instead?<br><b>Katara:</b> Lemme guess—your instincts told you.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey—sometimes they're right.<br><b>Aang:</b> Um...Sokka? You know we're going the wrong way, right?<br><br><i>(Sokka is surprised, but quickly recovers.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> ...And sometimes they're wrong. <i>(With a grin, he pulls Appa's reigns. They fly off screen, then reappear going in the opposite direction. FADE OUT.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]
<b>The Great Divide</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="">John O'Bryan</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=73">Giancarlo Volpe</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=72">Michael Dante DiMartino</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=73">Giancarlo Volpe</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=102">Chris Graham</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=103">Kenji Ono</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> DR Movie<br><b>Transcribers:</b> Acastus, Unbridled Joy of Flight<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(Opening shot of the sun setting behind some tall rock outcroppings. The sky is mostly cloudy and the clouds reflect the light of the dying sun. Pan down to show a patched up tent being jostled about from the inside. A rolled up tarp lies next to the tent. Inside the tent, Sokka can be heard grunting and fussing about as he tries to finish setting up the shelter.<br><br>Finally, the tent is raised and Sokka emerges from behind the tent's flap opening. As he does, Katara enters the frame, her back to the camera, carrying an arm load of wood.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Um...aren't you forgetting the TARP?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Right...got it.<br><br><i>(He picks up the rolled up tarp and throws it through the open flap and into the tent.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(crossly)</i> Sokka, you're supposed to put the tarp on TOP of the tent. You know, so we don't get RAINED on.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the two, Sokka gesturing widely as he replies to his sister.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Ordinarily you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not. Besides, that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.<br><b>Katara</b>: But what if it DOES rain?<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(spreading his arms wide in exasperation)</i> But what if it doesn't? Then I would have put the tarp up for nothing.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(stomping the ground and gritting her teeth)</i> Ur...arg! You're infuriating!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Katara, why don't you worry about gathering the firewood because that kindling's looking PRETTY sorry.<br><br><i>(Cut to a brief close up shot of the firewood in her hands, then cut to her face.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(looking sullen, then exploding in anger)</i> Well if you don't like my firewood... <i>(throws the wood at her brother) </i>have it!<br><br><i>(Sokka raises his hands to shield himself, a shocked expression on his face. He stands in anger after the hail of sticks subsides.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Fine by me! If you're not going to do your job <i>(he yanks the rope securing the tent to its to one of its supports. It falls down in a heap)</i> ...urg!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot as the tent collapses to reveal Aang approaching from behind it. His hands are full of some kind of food and Appa rests in the background. Katara and Sokka stand on opposite each sides of the screen, the fallen tent between them. They glower at each other.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Okay, I got the grub if you guys got the... <i>(Katara and Sokka turn away from each instantly, their arms across their chests, expressions of sullen anger on their faces)</i> Hey, where's the campfire? And what happened to the tent?<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(still facing o.c.)</i> Why don't you ask Miss Know It All? Queen of the Twigs!<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(whipping around to yell at her brother's back)</i> Oh yeah? <i>(Pointing an accusatory finger)</i> Well you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the <i>(she bends down quickly, picks up a twig, and throws it at her brother)</i> ...Tents!<br><br><i>(The twigs hits Sokka in the back of the head. He whips around to face her.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(laughs, and spreads his arms wide in a gesture of conciliation) </i>Okay, listen guys. Harsh words won't solve problems, action will. Why don't you just switch jobs?<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(concurrent with Sokka</i>) Sounds good.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(concurrent with Katara)</i> Whatever.<br><br><i>(Both begin their new tasks, but each is still fuming at the other.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(smiling in a self satisfied manner)</i> You see that? Settling feuds and making peace. All in a days work for the Avatar.<br><br><i>(Aang's smile breaks as he looks off screen at the sound of Momo chittering. Cut to Momo desperately trying remove a melon that Appa is holding upright with one of the digits of his left forepaw. Momo struggles and even tries to fly away from it, but cannot move the melon. He gives up and begins to walk away, depressed. Appa groans, opens his mouth, and his tongue scoops up the melon. As he is about to close his mouth, Momo returns, grabs the melon and runs away. He runs into Aang who takes the melon, throws it into the air and slices a small piece of it off with a jet of air. The large piece lands in front of Appa who eats it, and the small piece lands in front of Momo, who turns to Aang and lets a chirp of protest.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Come on Momo, that's fair. <i>(Motioning to Appa)</i> Appa's got FIVE stomachs.<br><br><i>(Fade to a daytime, panorama shot of a Grand Canyon like scene. The view is from the rim of the canyon looking across it. Momo flies across the screen, chittering. The camera pans right to follow him, revealing Aang, Katara and Sokka on the rim looking out over the breathtaking expanse.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Here it is, guys, the Great Divide.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Wow! I could just stare at it forever.<br><br><i>(Zoom backwards to show Sokka in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(unimpressed, the music slurs to a halt in the background)</i> Okay. I've seen enough.<br><b>Katara</b>: How can you not be fascinated, Sokka? This is the largest canyon in the entire world.<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka standing next to Appa and holding his reigns, obviously ready to leave.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.<br><br><i>(Suddenly a man in an ornate white robe rushes past Sokka from o.c. He rudely pushes Sokka out of the way.)</i><br><br><b>Scout</b>: <i>(aggressively)</i> Hey! If you're looking for the Canyon Guide, I was here first!<br><br><i>(Cut to profile shot of Katara who is joined moments later by the Scout and Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(clasping her hands in front of her in a gesture of hope) </i>Ooooo...canyon guide. Sounds informative.<br><b>Scout</b>: Believe me, he's more than a tour guide, he's an earthbender. And the only way in and out of the canyon is with his help. And he's takin' MY tribe across next!<br><br><i>(While he is speaking, cut to a front shot of the Scout. As he yammers, Sokka emerges from behind him and silently starts to mock him by opening and closing his hand in the "this guy talk too much" gesture. At the conclusion of the Scout's talk he looks at Sokka, who feigns innocence and walks off screen to Katara and Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Calm down, we know you're next.<br><b>Scout</b>: <i>(pointing at Sokka o.c.)</i> You wouldn't be calm if the Fire Nation destroyed YOUR home and forced YOU to flee. <i>(He gestures to the vast canyon system in front of them)</i> My whole tribe has to walk thousands of miles to the capital city of Ba Sing Se!<br><b>Katara</b>: You're a refugee.<br><b>Scout</b>: Humph. Tell me somethin' I don't know.<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Katara and Aang looking at the Scout o.c., then cut to a view of the path leading up the canyon rim back through the surrounding forest. In the distance, a mass of people approaches.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Is that your tribe?<br><b>Scout</b>: It most certainly is NOT. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the people approaching the group. They are dressed in rude animal skins and look generally unkempt.)</i><br><br><b>Scout</b>: <i>(continuing from o.c.) </i>That's the Zhang tribe. A bunch of low-life thieves. They've been the enemies of my tribe for 100 years. <i>(Cut back to the Scout, who whistles rudely at the Zhang) </i>Hey Zhangs! I'm savin' a spot for my tribe so don't even THINK of stealing it!<br><br><i>(A huge Zhang woman enters the frame and walks up to the Scout menacingly. The Scout leans back, somewhat intimidated.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Where are the rest of the Gan Jin? Still tidying up their campsite?<br><b>Scout</b>: <i>(leaning forward to push the Zhang Leader back)</i> Yes! But they sent me ahead of them to hold a spot.<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: I didn't know the canyon Guide took reservations.<br><b>Scout</b>: Heh! Of course you didn't. That's the ignorance I'd expect from a messy Zhang! So unorganized and ill prepared for a journey.<br><br><i>(The entire Zhang tribe begins to grumble loudly at this. An angry mob is about to form. Cut to Aang and Katara looking disconcerted, Momo behind them in the background sitting on a piles of rocks on the lip of the canyon. Suddenly, the sound of moving earth is heard and the camera cuts to Momo. The rocks underneath him quiver and begin to split apart. Momo jumps out of the screen as the rocks are picked up and thrown out of the screen by an old man, the Canyon Guide, in a straw hat and green clothing.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: <i>(grunting) </i>Sorry about the wait, youngsters. <i>(Gesturing to the majestic canyon below them)</i> Who's ready to cross this here canyon?<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara, Sokka and Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Um... <i>(pointing to her right, o.c.) </i>one of them I think.<br><br><i>(Camera pans left to reveal the Zhang and the Scout, the latter of which runs forward.)</i><br><br><b>Scout</b>: I was here first! My party's on their way!<br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: I can't guide people who aren't here.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot showing the Zhang filing past the three kids and the fuming Gan Jin Scout.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: <i>(with mock sadness)</i> Guess you guys'll have to make the trip tomorrow.<br><br><i>(The shot shifts to a close up the scout, whose eyes twitch in anger. The camera zooms backward and pans left to reveal another tribe entering the canyon entrance area. The Scout points to them in triumph.)</i><br><br><b>Scout</b>: Wait! Here they come!<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of several Gan Jin walking in stately order towards them. They are all dressed elegantly and wear formal expressions on their faces. The music changes to a dainty, spring ball type ballad that helps to signify the demeanor of the Gan Jin. Cut to the Zhang Leader who whips around to look at the newcomers, then cut to an overhead wide of the two tribes now facing each other with Appa and the kids between them.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: <i>(pointing a finger at the Canyon Guide's chest)</i> You're not seriously going to cave into these spoiled Gan Jins! I mean, we're refugees too! And we've got sick people that need shelter.<br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: <i>(holding out the palms of his hands in a gesture of placation)</i> I...uh...well...<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the Gan Jin. A white haired man, the Gan Jin Leader, stands next to the Scout.)</i><br><br><b>Scout</b>: We've got old people who are weary from traveling.<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Sick people get priority over old people.<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: Maybe you Zhang's wouldn't have so many sick people if you weren't such slobs.<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: If you Gan Jins weren't so clean, (cut to the kids as the war of words between the two leaders continues o.c.) maybe you wouldn't live to be so old.<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: <i>(from o.c.) </i>I could smell your stink a mile away.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(As Gan Jin Leader speaks)</i> Well Aang, ready to put your peace making skills to the test?<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(looking to the ground in doubt)</i> I... don't know. A fight over chores is one thing. These people have been feuding for 100 years.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(walking forward and raising her voice to be heard by all)</i> Everyone, listen up! <i>(Pointing backward at Aang, a fierce look on her face) </i>This is the Avatar! And if you give him a chance, I'm sure he can come up with a compromise that will make everyone happy.<br><br><i>(The two tribes look to Aang for a moment in silence. Cut to Aang, who after a moment offers an obvious solution.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Uh...you could share the earthbender and travel together?<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: Absolutely not! We'd rather be taken by the Fire Nation <i>(he points accusingly o.c. at the Zhang)</i> than travel with those stinking thieves.<br><br><i>(Camera zooms left to the Zhang Leader, who, in turn, points an accusing finger at the Gan Jin Leader.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: We wouldn't travel with you pompous fools anyway!<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: <i>(pompously)</i> I am not pompous!<br><br><i>(General pandemonium breaks out as the tribes begin to yell at each other. This continues for a moment or two before Aang intervenes. The camera shows a close up of Aang's face as he yells.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(Angry) </i>Alright! Here's the deal! <i>(Cut to a slowly panning wide shot) </i>We're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across. Does that seem fair?<br><br><i>(The two leaders nod their grudging approval. Cut to Aang in the foreground with a small smile on his face, Katara and Sokka in the background looking happy as well. Fade to a shot of the open sky which pans down to show Appa and his saddle now full of elderly and sick Gan Jin and Zhang. The two groups eye each other suspiciously in the saddle. They sit as far away as possible from each other. Cut to a wide shot of Aang petting Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sorry Appa. You'll have to do this on your own. <i>(Appa grunts.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: This feuding tribe stuff is serious business. Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?<br><b>Aang</b>: To tell the truth, I'm not sure. <i>(Smiling widely)</i> But when have I ever been?<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(Putting a hand on Aang's shoulder)</i> He's the Avatar, Sokka. Making peace between people is his job.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(slumping in despair)</i> His job's gonna make us cross this whole thing on foot, isn't it?<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead wide shot of the two tribes and the others.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Okay, now comes the bad news. <i>(Cut to a frontal shot of the Guide)</i> No food allowed in the canyon. It attracts <i>(he makes motions with his hands to illustrate the skittery monsters that might lurk in the canyon) </i>dangerous predators.<br><br><i>(The tribes dissatisfied cacophony rises again at the interdiction against food.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: No food! This is ridiculous.<br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Aww, you babies can go a day without food. Would you rather be hungry...or dead?<br><br><i>(At this, the Guide raises a pillar of stone underneath him. He now towers ten feet or more over the rest. He continues, cupping his hands to his mouth to amplify his voice.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Now, we're headin' down in 10 minutes. All food better be in your gut, or in the garbage!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the Zhang who whip various bits of food out of their tunics and begin to eat sloppily. Cut to the Gan Jin, who eat little bits of food with chopsticks. The dainty music plays again in the background. When the Gan Jin man in the foreground is done, he dabs his lips with a white napkin. Cut to Aang addressing the people in Appa's saddle.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Appas's gonna take good care of you until we get there. <i>(He drops down to the ground and addresses Appa)</i> See ya on the other side, buddy. Yip, yip!<br><br><i>(Appa grunts and flies off. Cut to a wide shot of Appa making a bee-line with his passengers for the other side of the canyon. Fade to a far and wide shot of the canyon wall underneath the canyon path entrance. The Canyon Guide's outpost is still visible at the top of the screen on the canyon rim. Underneath, the tribes are walking down a steep, switch-back path.<br><br>The shot pans down, revealing more of the path in front of them. Cut to a close up shot of Aang and the Canyon Guide leading the procession. The Guide puts a hand in front of Aang to stop him as the camera pans down again to reveal a break in the path in front of them. The drop is hundreds of feet down. The Guide whirls around and makes a motion with his outstretched arm and fist. With a grunt of effort, the camera switches to wide that shows blocks of stone pushes outward from the canyon wall face to repair the path in front of them.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Nice bending!<br><br><i>(They begin to move forward again.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: The job's much more than bending, kid. Folks want information. <br><br><i>(They stop and the Canyon Guide turns to address the crowd. He continues in a slightly bored voice while the camera shows various shots of the canyon system.) </i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Many of you are probably wondering how canyons are formed. Experts tell us this canyon was most likely carved into the ground by Earth Spirits who were angry at local farmers for not offering them a proper sacrifice.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Sokka who look at each other, then gasp and look up at the sound of rumbling from o.c. Cut to a rock slide beginning above them. The rocks come down on the group, but are bent away by the Canyon Guide into the canyon below.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: <i>(laughing)</i> Guess the spirits are still angry! Hope you all brought sacrifices.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the canyon floor and the canyon wall on the right side of the screen. The view pans slowly rightward, then cut to a closer, overhead shot of the group now at the bottom of the switchback trail. They have just entered the canyon floor. The Guide stands in front of the two tribes and the kids.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Okay...everyone stand clear of the wall.<br><br><i>(The Canyon Guide earthbends a nearby rock outcropping and throws it at the bridge he created earlier. The bridge is destroyed.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Why'd you do that?<br><br><i>(The debris from the bridge lands behind them, raising a cloud of dust that obscures everything in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: These people are fleeing the Fire Nation, aren't they? I gotta make sure we can't be followed. We'll be safe now.<br><br><i>(A massive, insect shaped silhouette appears in the dust behind the Guide. A pincer emerges from the dust and picks up the Guide, who yelps in surprise. Cut to Aang, who airbends the dust away with a yell. The monster is revealed. It is a huge, black insect like creature with four legs, red eyes, and a long thin mouth with teeth. The Canyon Guide is in the creature's mouth, screaming. Cut to Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We gotta help him!<br><br><i>(He throws his boomerang. It flashes through the air and strikes the beast on the head. It drops the Guide and rushes Sokka. The guide lands with a thump in the underbrush. Cut to the advancing monster. It slavers with its tongue hanging out. Cut to Sokka, running for his life, the creature close behind.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Okay...now you gotta help me!<br><br><i>(Sokka runs over a rock outcropping. The creature follows over the outcropping as Sokka doubles back. Katara arrives, opens her water bottle and whips it with the water. It smacks the creature, but has little effect. It tries to bite her, but she lunges o.c. as Aang drops into the frame and shoots a blast of at the monster. It gets blown backward, but charges again. With enough lead time before the creature reaches him, Aang is able to create a tornado with his staff. He catches the creature in the tornado and throws far up the cliff. Able to walk on the walls, the creature quickly hides in one of the canyon walls many crevices. Cut back to Aang who turns to the others, a look of concern on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: What was that?<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara kneeling over the distressed Guide who is laid out flat on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Canyon crawler. <i>(In pain) </i>Oh, ugh! And there's sure to be more.<br><b>Katara</b>: Your arms...they're broken.<br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: Without my arms, I got no bending. In other words...<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Aang, the two tribes on either side of him. The shot zooms closer to Aang, without changing the perceived distance of the tribes behind him. This creates a distorting effect that accentuates the horror behind Aang's next pronouncement.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: ...we're trapped in this canyon.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the group at the base of the canyon, then fade to black for commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(Return from break to a shot of the canyon rim. The shot pans back down to group at the base. Cut to a shot of Katara finishing a set of bandages on the Guide's arms. Aang, Sokka and the Gan Jin are visible in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(camera zooms in on him) </i>I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like... canyon crawlers...<br><b>Gan Jin Leader:</b> It's the Zhangs! They took food down here, even after the guide told them not to!<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: <i>(approaching the Gan Jin Leader with an accusatory finger pointed at him) </i>What! If there's anyone who can't go without food for a day, it's you pampered Gan Jins! <br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: I hope you're happy. <i>(Cut to Aang, Katara and the Guide behind him. He looks displeased at the resumption of the bickering) </i>We're stuck in the canyon with no way out.<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Why don't you thank yourself, food hider! <br><b>Aang</b>: Look. Sticking together is the only way to...<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: <i>(rudely interrupting the Avatar and again pointing at the Gan Jin Leader) </i>I'm not walkin' another step with the likes of them.<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: <i>(folding his arms across his chest)</i> Now, there's something we can agree on.<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(turning to look back o.c. at Katara and the Guide)</i> Any ideas?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close shot of the Guide. The camera slowly zooms in on the Guide as he speaks, his eyes wide and getting wider as hysteria grips his mind.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: No bending. We need to get out of this canyon. I won't die down here! I won't become part of the food chain!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang, the Gan Jin Leader behind him, who speaks o.c. to his Zhang counterpart.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: See? We're going to become part of the food chain because of YOU!<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Sure. Unjustly blame the Zhangs like you ALWAYS do!<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: Gladly!<br><br><i>(A blast of wind tears across the screen, surprising everyone.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: ENOUGH! <i>(Cut to Aang, angry)</i> I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not going to happen. <br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot where Aang airbends himself to the top of a small bluff. The bluff is the beginning of what amounts to a stone baulk between two canyons on either side.) </i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: We should split up. Gan Jins on this side...and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from the canyon bottom where the two leaders look up at Aang, then at each other, then nod. They and their following begin to take their separate paths, Zhang on the left, Gan Jin on the right. Aang hops down as Sokka and Katara approach him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sokka, you go with the Zhangs. And Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can figure out why they hate each other so much.<br><br><i>(Sokka and Katara split up to follow their assigned tribes. Cut to a wide shot of the two tribes following their separate paths. The screen pans up to the sky. It fades from midday to dusk, then pans back down to Aang standing atop another bluff, surveying the two groups setting up their camps below. Cut to Sokka coming up behind the Zhang leader. He puts his hand to his chin as he observes.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: What for? It's the dry season.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(releasing suppressed exasperation)</i> Exactly!<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: <i>(turning to Sokka, smiling)</i> Besides, we like to use the tarp as a blanket.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Finally, someone gets it.<br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot of the Gan Jin camp. Their tents are pristine white and erected perfectly. The dainty music plays as we see two Gan Jin set up a tarp over one of their tents. The camera zooms back to reveal Katara speaking with the Gan Jin leader.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: You really think it'll rain?<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: No, but you can never be too careful, right?<br><br><i>(Katara smiles at the Gan Jin Leader, pleased at his response. Fade to a night scene. Crickets chirp as a shot of the moon pans down to the Gan Jin camp. The Gan Jin sit in a circle around the campfire. The camera pans across the group to Katara and the Gan Jin leader. After a moment, the Gan Jin leader looks around and then produces some bread from underneath his robe. Katara gasps. Soon all the Gan Jin are eating food with their chopsticks, it is clear they all violated the ban.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: <i>(offering Katara some bread) </i>Would you care for some bread, Katara?<br><b>Katara</b>: So it was you guys who had food!<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: Oh come now. You really think that tribe of thieves isn't smuggling food? Why should MY people go hungry when the sneaky Zhangs are stuffing their faces? <br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(hesitating, then taking the bread)</i> Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it. <i>(She eats a few bites, then turns back to the Gan Jin Leader) </i>So, why does your tribe hate the Zhang so much?<br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: You seem like a smart girl, Katara. I bet you would enjoy hearing some history.<br><br><i>(As the Leader speaks, the camera pans away to stars of the night sky. As he concludes, the camera pans down to the horizon as dawn approaches. Noble music plays in the background. The scene is of a path coming out of the mountains, the sun rising in the east behind them. The path runs through a Chinese paifang or perhaps a Japanese torii gate in the foreground. Cut to a vision of a well built, well dressed, noble looking Gan Jin warrior, his hair flowing in the wind. The style of animation is now very idealized. The Gan Jin Leader narrates the succeeding tale from o.c.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty; transporting our sacred orb from the Great Eastern Gate to the Great Western Gate.<br><br><i>(During this explanation, cut to a shot of someone holding a pink, translucent, crystal ball out to someone else, the sun and the gate visible in the background. Another pair of hands takes the offered orb. The camera rises to show the sun perfectly framed by the circular, doughnut like ornament on top of the gate. Cut to a profile shot of Jin Wei and the gate. He kneels, holding the orb out before him. It catches the rays of the sun through the gate and glows brightly.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sunï¿½s rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual...<br><br><i>(Jin We runs through several different landscapes before cutting to a dusk scene on a forest path. Another paifang or torii gate arches over the path here, presumably the Great Western Gate. In the distance, Jin Wei approaches at a run, his cape flowing behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: ...but as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang!<br><br><i>(Jin Wei gets knocked off the path by a grubby looking newcomer, the orb flying into the air. The orb is caught by the ruffian, which glows with power as its new possessor grins sardonically with greed at his plunder.)</i><br><br><b>Gan Jin Leader</b>: A vermin, named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward, Wei Jin, knocked Jin Wei to the ground and stole our sacred orb. <i>(Fade back to Gan Jin leader's face, his eyes closed in remembrance) </i>Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang. <br><br><i>(Cut to Katara, who looks o.c. towards the Zhang camp, an expression of hardness and suspicion spreading over her face.<br><br>The screen pans left to reveal the Zhang camp in the distance, then cut to Sokka sitting next to the Zhang leader. She produces a leg of meat from a bag and offers it to Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Care for some meat?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Would I!?<br><br><i>(Sokka grabs the leg and begins to eat hungrily.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: I know what you must be thinking. We're horrible for endangering everybody by bringing food down here.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(munching, barely paying attention)</i> Mm hmm!<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: The Gan Jin think so badly of us they probably assumed we brought food in and decided to bring food in themselves. That's why we brought food in.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(still munching)</i> Mmmm!<br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years...<br><br><i>(The camera again pans to the stars as the Zhang Leader narrates her story from o.c. The scene reforms around a very cartoonish portrayal of another gate. Tribal music plays in the background. The animation here is very rustic.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Our forefather, Wei Jin, was leaving the western gate of our village...<br><br><i>(A figure, Wei Jin, runs east through the gate, cut to a close up of Wei Jin, who looks almost as bad as he did in the Gan Jin version.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: ...when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground.<br><br><i>(Wei Jin stops in mid stride in surprise. Cut to a shot of a man crawling in the distance. It is Jin Wei, crawling on the ground, obviously in distress. The camera pans back slightly to reveal Wei Jin standing above him.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. <i>(Wei Jin bends to help, but Jin Wei points ahead. The camera zooms out to show the orb.)</i> Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds, but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, <i>(Jin Wei makes dramatic gestures of self sacrifice at this pronouncement)</i> and asked him to take it back to his tribe. <i>(Wei Jin grabs the orb and begins to run) </i>Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory he was arrested!<br><br><i>(As Wei Jin runs through another gate, his path is blocked by three thuggish Gan Jin warriors with drawn swords. He is smacked down and he drops the orb. Cut to the inside of a jail cell, the door of which opens and Wei Jin is thrown inside.)</i><br><br><b>Zhang Leader</b>: Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison. <i>(Cut back to Zhang Leader who continues bitterly)</i> We Zhang's will never forget that injustice.<br><br><i>(Cut to wider shot of her and Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: That's just terrible. <i>(Pointing to her leg of meat)</i> You gonna finish that?<br><br><i>(She takes a bite in response. Sokka looks depressed and slumps a bit.<br><br>Cut to Aang and Momo looking down at the camps below with longing, backs to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sure would be nice to be around one of those campfires, telling stories and laughing. <i>(Momo chitters as the screen cuts to a frontal shot of Aang and his lemur.)</i> It's okay, Momo, we'll be out of here soon enough and then we can eat our weight in leechy nuts!<br><br><i>(Momo hears a flying bug, catches it and offers it to Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Nah, I'll wait for the leechy nuts.<br><br><i>(Momo begins chomping.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: <i>(from o.c. as Aang turns to the voice)</i> It's lonely, isn't it? <i>(Cut to the Guide walking up to him.)</i> Being impartial.<br><b>Aang</b>: I wish I could help these people get along, but it just seems impossible. Anyhow, I guess our biggest problem is getting out of here.<br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: <i>(lying down next to Aang)</i> I'm not so sure the two problems are unrelated. <br><br><i>(The Guide nods off to sleep, then cut to Aang who looks away sadly. <br><br>Fade to a morning shot of the sky. The camera pans down to reveal the Guide and Aang atop the baulk, the two tribes continuing their trek on either side.)</i><br><br><b>Canyon Guide</b>: All clear! <i>(Pointing to somewhere below)</i> We're almost to the other side.<br><br><i>(A few shots of the tribes walking reveal that the baulk, or rock separator of the canyons that the tribes have been using for travel, is coming to an end. The tribes are now in site of each other, Aang and the Canyon Guide between them. Okay! I get it! Now I need your help. Let's get everyone together at the base of the canyon wall.<br><br><i>(Aang then opens his glider and flies off.
