Cut back to the temple and then to Sokka, a happy expression on his, still sucking on the frog in his mouth.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!<br><br><i>(It thaws out and begins moving around and croaking. Sokka realize what it is and spits it out in disgust. Cut to Katara, her frog has also thawed. She cries out and it hops out of her mouth. Both Katara and Sokka begin spitting and coughing. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>The Fortuneteller</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=71">Aaron Ehasz</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=80">John O'Bryan</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=75">Dave Filoni</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=84">Miyuki Hoshikawa</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=85">Justin Ridge</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=86">Ian Graham</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> JM Animation Co, Ltd<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Acastus<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(Scene opens with a lake view. Camera pans up to reveal Sokka, Aang, Katara and Momo sitting around a camp on the lakeshore. A large blue tent occupies the left hand portion of the screen. When the camera stops a large green fish jumps into view and falls back into the lake. Katara gets up and points at it.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Look!<br><br><i>(Sokka gets up and assumes a gunslinger stance. Cut to a close up of Sokka's face, with Katara visible over his right shoulder. Cut to another fish in mid-air, it drops back off the screen in slow motion. It appears to be some sort of green catfish. Cut to Sokka and Katara again.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> He is taunting us. <i>(Cut to long shot of the group.)</i> You are so gonna be dinner! <i>(Sokka runs back to the tent and grabs his fishing pole which standing up outside of it, runs back to the lake edge and casts the pole a few times without effect.)</i> Hey! Where's the fishing line?<br><b>Aang</b>: Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka. <i>(Holds up a necklace.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: Aahh, it's all tangled!<br><b>Aang</b>: Not tangled – woven. <i>(Airbending himself to a standing position and turning to Katara.)</i> I made you a necklace, Katara. <i>(Looking from side to side in an embarrassed fashion)</i> I thought since you lost your other one...<br><br><i>(Aang holds up the necklace and sheepish smile marked by a sound effect spreads across his face, cut to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(smiles, walks over to Aang and takes necklace)</i>: Thanks, Aang. I love it.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(again at the water's edge and looking back at Aang)</i>: Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world you can go into the jewelry making business.<br><b>Aang</b>: I don't see why I can't do both. <i>(Katara puts necklace on in the background.)</i><br><br><i>(Sokka turns his back to the camera to see the fish leaping again from the lake. He throws his pole like a spear and it disappears into the water.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Stop taunting me! <br><br><i>(A visual effect denoting anger flashes briefly near Sokka's head as he says this. He draws his knife from behind his back and enters the water in a bandy-legged way. He lunges into the water with the knife trying to catch the fish. Aang appears in the foreground, watching Sokka's antics.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(from o.c.)</i>: So, how do I look?<br><br><i>(Aang turns to face Katara as she begins to speak. By the end of her question Aang's eyes have almost popped out of his skull. He is dumfounded. Cut to a view of Katara's lower body with the camera immediately beginning to pan up. Around Katara, the world has become beautiful, with the rocks and trees bathed in a romantic dark pink or purple hue, every object reflecting light as if studded with diamonds. The music has changed abruptly to reflect Aang's feelings for Katara. The pan ends with a view of Katara's upper body, her hand at her new necklace and small patches of red under her eyes, indicated some embarrassment. Cut to Aang, who is using his left forefinger to loosen his collar while staring at Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: You mean all of you or just your neck? I mean, uh, both look great.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(who has just emerged from the lake, holding a fish as if about to give it a kiss)</i>: Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love. <i>(The fish flips is his hands, knocking him back into the lake.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(rubbing his head in an embarrassed gesture)</i>: I...well...<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(looking in annoyance o.c. towards her brother)</i>: Stop teasing him, Sokka. <i>(Momo hops up onto Aang's shoulder.)</i> Aang's just a good friend. <i>(She rubs Aang's head)</i> A sweet little guy – just like Momo. <i>(She rubs Momo's head just as she had Aang's a moment before.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(clearly put down)</i>: Thanks.<br><br><i>(Sokka approaches them, sopping wet, empty handed and with a dark look on his face. An ominous noise off screen prompts Momo to fly toward it and off screen. Cut to a large rock that Momo is sitting on, looking off screen. He is joined a moment later by Aang who has clearly airbent himself into the air and onto the rock. He points towards the source of the noise.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear!<br><br><i>(Cut to see a huge bear like creature with red eyes and the bill of a platypus. It bares its teeth and rears itself up on its hind legs. Cut to a view from right behind the bear's left shoulder. The bear is threatening a man in blue who smiles calmly at the advancing monster. Cut to long shot of the bear as it advances, swinging at the man, who dodges the blows by causally stepping backwards, hands behind his back. Cut to a view from behind the man's right shoulder. The bears swings a few more time while Aang jumps up onto a rock behind the bear. Cut to the a frontal shot of the man, a smile still plastered on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Calm Man</b> <i>(to Aang)</i>: Well, hello there. <i>(Bears swings at him from o.c., the man dodges.)</i> Nice day, isn't it?<br><b>Aang</b>: Make noise, it'll run off!<br><br><i>(Screen expands and pans right as Sokka and Katara run up behind Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: No, play dead, he'll lose interest!<br><br><i>(Cut to wide shot of bear and calm man. The bears swings and misses again.)</i><br><br><b>Calm Man</b>: Whoa! Close one. Haha!<br><b>Katara</b>: Run down hill, then climb a tree!<br><b>Sokka</b>: No, punch him in the bill!<br><b>Aang</b>: And then run in zigzags!<br><b>Calm Man</b>: No need. It's going to be fine.<br><br><i>(The bear swings again, swiping a large chunk of wood out of a nearby tree as the calm man ducks just in time. Aang shoots into the air from off his nearby rock up over the head of the bear. He lands, putting himself between the calm man and the bear, and airbends up a wall of air that momentarily pushes the beast backwards.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Whoa there!<br><br><i>(The bears rears up and roars, only to have Appa rear up behind him and roar. Cut to a side shot of the bear with Appa behind him. The bear drops an egg out his behind and runs into the river and swims away. Cut to Sokka's arms picking up the large egg.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Mmm! Lunch! <i>(He sniffs egg, then looks at calm man o.c. with a haughty look.)</i> Lucky for you we came along.<br><b>Calm Man</b>: Thanks, but everything was already under control. Not to worry, Aunt Wu predicted I'd have a safe journey. <i>(He puts his hands in a position of prayer and bows slightly at this.)</i><br><b>Aang</b>: Aunt who?<br><b>Calm Man</b>: No, Aunt Wu. She's the fortuneteller from my village. Awful nice knowing your future.<br><b>Katara</b>: Wow, it must be. That explains why you were so calm.<br><b>Sokka</b>: But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey, you were almost killed!<br><b>Calm Man</b>: But I wasn't. All right, have a good one! <i>(He gestures in farewell and begins to walk away, but turns back again.)</i> Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this. <i>(He hands Aang a long, thin wrapped object and walks away.)</i><br><b>Katara</b>: Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh come on, fortunetelling is nonsense.<br><br><i>(While Sokka is speaking, Aang shreds the objects wrapping to reveal an umbrella. When Sokka finishes speaking, the umbrella opens in Aang's hand.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: What do ya know, an umbrella!<br><br><i>(The sky darkens instantly and thunder is heard as it begins to pour rain. Katara smiles and waterbends the rain in a sparkling arc away from her head.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: That proves it. <i>(She runs under the umbrella with Aang.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(holding the egg above his head to try and deflect the rain)</i>: No it doesn't – you can't really tell the future.<br><b>Katara</b>: I guess you're not really getting wet then.<br><br><i>(The egg slips out of Sokka's hands and in his attempts to grab it again it flies up into the air and lands back on his head. Cut to the three walking down a road. It is still pouring rain. Aang and Katara are under the umbrella. Sokka is getting soaked.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Of course she predicted it was gonna rain. The sky's been gray all day.<br><b>Katara</b>: Just admit you might be wrong and you can come under the umbrella.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Look, I'm going to predict the future now <i>(making funny motions and in an exaggerated voice)</i> – “It's going to keep drizzling.” <i>(He folds his arms across his chest and assumes an expression of defiance.)</i> See!<br><br><i>(The rain instantly stops and the sun comes out.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Not everyone has the gift, Sokka.<br><br><i>(Cut to side view of the group walking with Appa bringing up the rear. As Appa passes Sokka he shakes off his wet fur, drenching Sokka once again.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(as he gets soaked)</i>: Yahhh!<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of a single snow capped mountain, its peak partially obscured in clouds. Camera pans down to reveal a village and its main gate. They walk through the gate and come to the village square. In front of the circular door of one of the buildings, some sort of herald dressed in black greets them.)</i><br><br><b>Herald</b>: Aunt Wu is expecting you.<br><b>Katara</b>: Really?<br><br><i>(The three walk forward as Sokka makes a sound of disgust. Cut to the three in a room with three sitting pillows and an open door to the left. They have passes through the circular door mentioned above and which is now on the right side of the screen. The herald closes this door behind them as they walk in. A young girl in a pink kimono and huge hair braids that stick straight out from the sides of her head enters from the opening on the left.)</i><br><br><b>Meng</b>: My name is Meng and I'm Aunt Wu's assistant.<br><br><i>(Her eyes go wide. Cut to a view of Aang's lower body that pans upwards to his face and upper body. The music and background parallel Aang's romanticized view of Katara seen earlier. The effect is somewhat spoiled, however, by Aang's unenthusiastic facial expression and slightly hunched over posture.)</i><br><br><b>Meng</b> <i>(to Aang)</i>: Well hello there.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(rubbing his nose)</i>: Hello.<br><b>Meng</b> <i>(as Aang and Katara sit on the pillows)</i>: Can I get you some tea, or some of Aunt Wu's special bean curd puffs?<br><b>Sokka</b>: I'll try a curd puff.<br><b>Meng</b> <i>(giving Sokka the heisman)</i>: Just a second. <i>(Bending down to address Aang)</i> So what's your name?<br><b>Aang</b>: Aang.<br><b>Meng</b>: That rhymes with Meng! And you've got some pretty big ears, don't you?<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(confused)</i>: I... guess...<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh, don't be modest. They're huge! <br><br><i>(Sokka spreads his arms wide to demonstrate just how huge they are, as Aang looks angrily at Sokka. He puts his hands over his ears as if to smash them down to an acceptable size.)</i><br><br><b>Meng</b>: Well Aang, it is very nice to meet you. Very nice.<br><b>Aang</b>: Likewise.<br><br><i>(Meng exits, looking back slyly out of the corner of her eye, presumably at Aang. Cut to shot of the three seated on the pillows.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.<br><b>Katara</b>: Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future?<br><b>Sokka</b>: It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs. <br><br><i>(Katara looks annoyed at this. Cut to overhead shot of the hallway adjacent to the reception room the three are sitting in. The hallway shows another door leading farther into the building. From the right, Meng appears with a tray of refreshments. A moment later the inner door opens to reveal a young woman in a green kimono. She rushes over to Meng.)</i><br><br><b>Woman in Green</b>: Oh Meng! Aunt Wu says I'm going to meet my true love! He's going to give me a rare panda lilly.<br><b>Meng</b> <i>(with Aang visible over her right shoulder)</i>: That's so romantic. <i>(Looks dreamily over at Aang)</i> I wonder if my true love will give me a rare flower.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(earnestly)</i>: Good luck with that!<br><b>Woman in Green</b> <i>(amused)</i>: Is that the big eared guy who Aunt Wu predicted you'd marry?<br><br><i>(Meng shoves the young woman o.c. and brings the tray over to the three, but her eyes are fixed on Aang. She trips and almost dumps the food on Aang, but he helps steady her grip on the tray. His hands now hold hers as they together hold the tray. They share a moment looking into each other's eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Meng</b> <i>(embarrassed)</i>: Enjoy your snack. <i>(She exits with a short fairy dust sound effect.)</i><br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(from o.c. at first)</i>: Welcome young travelers. <i>(Cut to torso shot of Aunt Wu in a yellow or gold kimono looking serene.)</i> Now, who's next? Don't be shy.<br><br><i>(Both boys look uninterested. Screen pans left to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I guess that's me.<br><br><i>(Katara runs o.c. to follow Aunt Wu. Cut to Aang and Sokka, the latter of which is chomping on curd puffs.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Not bad. Not bad. Mmmm! <i>(Offers puffs to Aang.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(pushing puffs away)</i>: I'm good on puffs. So...what do you think they're talking about back there?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Boring stuff, I'm sure. Love. Who she's going to marry. How many babies she's gonna have.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(growing more alarmed at each of Sokka's pronouncements)</i>: Yeh... dumb stuff like that... <i>(bites his fingernails, eyes wide)</i> well, I've gotta find a bathroom!<br><br><i>(Aang runs o.c. as Sokka stretches out over the pillows and eats another puff. Momo grabs the bowl of puffs and runs off. Cut to Aang walking down the hall near the inner door, obviously trying to be quiet so he can eavesdrop. All between Katara and Aunt Wu from o.c., camera on Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Your palms are so smooth – do you use moisturizer?<br><b>Katara</b>: Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I could get you some if you want. <i>(Aang sticks his tongue out, his face clearly expressing his disdain for discussions around moisturizer)</i> So, do you see anything interesting in my love line? <i>(Aang's eyes bug out instantly and he leans in close to hear.)</i><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: I feel great romance for you. The man you're going to marry...<br><b>Katara</b>: Tell me more!<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: I can see that he is a very powerful bender. <br><br><i>(The sound of an egg timer going off is heard, and Aang's expression flips from wide eyed to smug in an instant. Happy music plays. Cut to long shot of him in the hallway as he launches himself into the air, ecstatic over this news. Clearly there is no doubt in his mind as to what this prediction means. Cut to Sokka picking his teeth. Aang walks back into the reception room looking like the cat who ate the canary.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, when I was in there...<br><b>Sokka</b>: I don't even wanna know!<br><br><i>(Aunt Wu and Katara enter.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Who's next?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(standing)</i>: Okay, let's get this over with.<br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(looking unhappily at Sokka)</i>: Your future is full of struggle and anguish, most of it self-inflicted.<br><b>Sokka</b>: But, you didn't read my palms or anything!<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: I don't need to – it's written all over your face. <i>(Cut to Sokka, who looks displeased. To Aang)</i> You then, come with me. <br><br><i>(Aang follows her out, Sokka sits down and pouts. Cut to Aang and Aunt Wu entering her inner chamber. It is a simple room with the four red pillars rising to the roof. The square made by the pillars is depressed into the floor by a small amount so that you have to step down into the area where Aunt Wu and the guests sit and discuss the future. In the center of the square is a small fire. Four pillows lie at the four corners of the square. On the left is a small urn filled to the brim with bones. Aunt Wu and Aang go over to the urn.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie. <i>(Motioning to the urn with bones.)</i> Go on, pick one. <i>(Aang picks one and they sit down.)</i> Now throw it on the fire. <i>(He obeys.)</i> The heat makes cracks in the bones and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of the fire. The camera zooms in on the bones. A huge crack appears and the music turns threatening.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Wow, that's a big crack. <i>(The bone cracks again, almost disintegrating.)</i><br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(surprised)</i>: I've never seen this before. <i>(Bone explodes, sending flame to the ceiling.)</i> Oh my!<br><br><i>(Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(When the show returns, the camera focuses on the fire, bits of bone surrounding it. Cut to Aunt Wu, as dramatic music plays in the background, signaling the importance of what has transpired.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: This is incredible! You will be involved in a great battle; an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil, a battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(dramatic music and the sound of fire suddenly dies away)</i>: Yeh, yeh, I knew that already, but did it say anything about a girl?<br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(confused)</i>: A girl? You want to know about love?<br><b>Aang</b>: Yes!<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: I'm sorry, but I didn't see anything. <i>(Aang looks downcast at this, and Aunt Wu looks on compassionately.)</i> Oh look! <i>(She slaps the side of her face with her hand, in a gesture of mea culpa)</i> I must have missed something. <i>(She picks up a sliver of bone, holds it over her head and examines its underside)</i> Right here – it says, “trust your heart and you will be with the one you love.”<br><b>Aang</b>: Really!? <i>(He stands and clasps his hands in a gesture of thanks)</i> Thank you, Aunt Wu! <br><br><i>(Aang runs out, happy. Aunt Wu shakes her head at the exiting airbender. Cut to exterior of Aunt Wu's building. Aang has just exited and the door closes quickly behind him. Appa, Katara and Sokka await him, and once together they all move further into the main square together. Appa's massive footsteps echo through the ensuing conversation.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Well, now you got to see for yourselves that fortunetelling is just a big, stupid hoax.<br><b>Katara</b>: You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(exploding)</i>: That woman is crazy! My life will be calm, and happy and joyful!<br><br><i>(Sokka gets more upset with each of his successive pronouncements. He ends by kicking a small stone off the ground which ricochets off a nearby sign and hits him the head, knocking him on his behind.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Ow! <i>(From o.c.)</i> That doesn't prove anything!<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(cut to Katara and Aang)</i>: Well, I liked my predictions. Certain things are going to turn out very well. <i>(She holds her hands together in a gesture of hope.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(knowingly)</i>: They sure are.<br><b>Katara</b>: Why, what did she tell you?<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(smiling)</i>: Some stuff. You'll find out.<br><br><i>(Cut to overhead shot of the village square. A large crowd has gathered at its center where a covered stage resides. Aang and his friends approach the crowd from the rear. Cut a view of the rear of the crowd as Aang et al enter. Most of the people standing around are looking up in silence. The Calm Man from before is one of these onlookers.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b> <i>(also looking up)</i>: What's with the sky?<br><b>Calm Man</b>: We are waiting for Aunt Wu to come and read the clouds to predict the fate of the whole village. <i>(Camera pans left to Aang.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(pointing up)</i>: That cloud looks like a fluffy bunny.<br><b>Calm Man</b> <i>(shot widens to show more of the crowd)</i>: You better hope that's not a bunny – the fluffy bunny cloud forecasts doom and destruction.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Do you even hear yourself? <br><br><i>(Calm Man looks annoyed at Sokka. Cut to another crowd member in front of the group.)</i><br><br><b>Woman</b>: The cloud reading will tell us if Mount Makapu will remain dormant for another year or if it will erupt.<br><b>Calmn Man</b>: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves, but ever since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago we have a tradition of not doing that.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(incensed)</i>: I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy old woman's superstition.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(putting a hand on Sokka's shoulder)</i>: Shhhh!! She's coming! <br><br><i>(Cut to shot between Katara and Sokka's heads which zooms to show an ever larger view of the approach of Aunt Wu and her herald. Cut to an overhead shot of the village square that shows the large staircase that Aunt Wu has just ascended. The crowd has parted to allow Aunt Wu access to the little stage. Cut to Aang and Katara, Aang with Momo perched on his head. The crowd begins to clap and cheer. Meng shows up suddenly next to Aang.</i><br><br><b>Meng</b> <i>(pointing to the sky and looking at Aang)</i>: Hey Aang, doesn't that cloud look like a flower?<br><b>Aang</b>: Sure, I guess. <i>(Camera pans left as Aang simultaneously pushes her off the screen.)</i> Hey Katara, don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?<br><b>Katara</b>: Shh!!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aunt Wu, now on the stage. She bows, draws breath and holds up her hands to the sky. Cut to a shot of an arrow shaped cloud. Cut to Aunt Wu examining an open book in her hands.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Bending arrow cloud... good crops this year, nice big harvest! <i>(Happy music plays)</i><br><b>Old Man</b>: Arg! Good news! <i>(Hugs old woman.)</i><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Wavy moon shape cloud... let's see... gonna be a great year for twins.<br><b>Twins in Green</b> <i>(they give each other a high five)</i>: Yes!<br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(dramatic music begins)</i>: And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it... the village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year! <br><br><i>(Crowd goes wild. Cut to Aang and Katara at the rear of the crowd, backs to the camera looking at Aunt Wu on the stage.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal. <br><br><i>(Cut to front view of the two, where Katara is clearly paying no attention to Aang. She is looking with rapt attention at the stage with Aunt Wu o.c. and at this point she runs o.c. up towards the stage leaving Aang alone. Aang looks crushed. Momo, perched on Aang's head, also drops his ears in sadness.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Never mind.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Aunt Wu's house that pans slowly down. Cut to a view of Katara knocking on Aunt Wu's door. Cut to wider shot as Aunt Wu opens the door.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hi, Aunt Wu. Sorry to bother you.<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Anytime.<br><b>Katara</b>: About this man I'm supposed to marry <i>(her cheeks flush momentarily in embarrassment)</i>...is he gonna be handsome? <i>(She clasps her hands together in a gesture of hope.)</i> Oh, I hope he's tall!<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Ahh, you want another reading.<br><b>Katara</b>: Yes, please!<br><br><i>(She follows Aunt Wu into her reading room and the door closes behind them. Cut to a shot of the upper half of Sokka's head as he walks through the village square. He is clearly in a bad mood.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I can't believe all these saps. <i>(Cut to side view where it is apparent that Aang follows behind him.)</i> Someone really needs to scream some sense at them.<br><b>Aang</b>: They seem happy, Sokka.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Not for long. I'm gonna prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense. <i>(Turns and grabs nearby man.)</i> Hey, you. I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she?<br><b>Red Shoed Man</b>: Yeh, she said I'd be wearing red shoes when I met my true love.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Uh-huh. And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?<br><b>Red Shoed Man</b>: Everyday.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(swirling red fire appears behind him, demonstrating his anger and frustration)</i>: THEN OF COURSE IT'S GOING TO COME TRUE!<br><b>Red Shoed Man</b>: Really? You think so? I'm so excited!<br><br><i>(Sokka kicks a stone on the ground, it hits a duck o.c., which soon flys up onto Sokka's shoulders and starts to annoy him. He crawls away with the duck expressing its displeasure loudly. Cut to wide shot of Aunt Wu's reading room, where she and Katara are seated. The camera zooms in to them.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: ...and then you'll have your third great grandchild before quietly passing away in your sleep. Is that enough information for you?<br><b>Katara</b>: Wow, thanks Aunt Wu. <i>(Gets up, turns to leave, but turns back.)</i> Oh, wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?<br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(flabbergasted)</i>: You want me to do a reading for that? <br><br><i>(Cut to Katara with a huge and slightly scary grin on her face – she nods enthusiastically. Cut to Sokka and Aang, with Sokka clearly out of his mind.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I don't care what Aunt Wu told you, you have to take a bath sometime!<br><br><i>(Cut to a filthy old man, who smiles, grunts his acknowledgement of Sokka's shouting, and turns and walks away in a Pig-Pen like cloud of dirt and dust.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(smugly)</i>: Some stuff? You've come to the right place. <i>(Puts his arm around Aang's shoulders and points at his chest in a conspiratorial gesture.)</i> What can I do you for?<br><b>Aang</b>: Well, there's this girl...<i>(cut to shot of Aang in the foreground, with Meng hiding behind a barrel at the far end of the square, stalking Aang. She laughs.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: I think I know who you mean.<br><b>Aang</b>: You do? And you're ok with it?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(clearly thinking of Meng rather than Katara)</i>: Of course I am. And, to tell you the truth, I've been picking up the subtle vibe that she likes you too. <i>(Meng visible in the background, waving her arms trying to get Aang's attention.)</i><br><b>Aang</b>: She does!?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh yeh, she's crazy about ya. All ya have to do now is not mess it up.<br><b>Aang</b>: Well, how do I do that?<br><b>Sokka</b>: The number one mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(to a sound effect)</i>: You can be too nice?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Yup. If you want to keep her interested you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(screen pans left to show Meng sidling up to Aang)</i>: Well...ok.<br><b>Meng</b>: Hey Aang, I was wondering...<br><b>Aang</b>: See ya later.<br><br><i>(Aang quickly walks away, leaving a disappointed Meng, who makes a sad noise.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(rubbing his chin in admiration)</i>: Wow, that kid is good.<br><br><i>(Cut to the door of Aunt Wu's house. Bye bye now.<br><b>Katara</b>: Okay, okay, but, one more thing.<br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(exasperated)</i>: All right, what is it?<br><b>Katara</b>: Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow?<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Papaya! <i>(She slams the door shut.)</i><br><b>Katara</b>: Ohhh, I hate papaya.<br><br><i>(She gives the dirt at her feet a petulant kick. I didn't see you there.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(walking away)</i>: Hey Aang.<br><b>Aang</b> <i>(shouting after her)</i>: That's ok, I'm busy with my own stuff.<br><br><i>(Aang stands there for a moment looking abashed. A duck flys near him. They look at each other and the duck quacks at him. Cut to Katara at a papaya stand.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Ugh. Papaya please.<br><br><i>(Cut to view from the papaya stand looking at Katara. The shopkeeper's hand enters the frame, handing Katara a fruit. Behind Katara, a woman in green and a man in white and pink are talking to each other in the square. The shot expands to reveal Aang entering from Katara's right.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(trying to sound cool)</i>: So...papaya.<br><b>Katara</b>: Uh-huh. See you later.<br><br><i>(She turns and walks out of view while Aang takes a bite of the fruit. He chokes and spits it back up, clearly hating the taste.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Maybe aloof isn't my style.<br><br><i>(In the background, the man in white and pink has just given something to the woman in green.)</i><br><br><b>Woman in Green</b>: Oh! A panda lilly! <i>(She and the man hug.)</i><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(to Momo, perched on his shoulder)</i>: Did you see that?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close of the panda lilly and the shot rapidly expands to show to couple hugging happily. The dreamy music is rudely interrupted as Aang appears in between the happy – physically forcing them apart. They are both surprised, and he leans over them to point at the flower the woman's hand.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Excuse me. Where can a guy find one of those things?<br><br><i>(Cut to a view of a path leading towards the mountain. Then cut to a shot of Aang hopping up rocks on the side of the mountain.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(from o.c.)</i>: I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.<br><b>Aang</b>: Not just any flower – a panda lilly. I've seen it in action and boy does it work.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(climbing into frame from below)</i>: Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.<br><b>Aang</b>: But my heart is telling me to get this flower, and Aunt Wu said if I trusted my heart I would be with the one I love.<br><b>Sokka</b>: What? Why should she be wrong about love? <i>(Pointing up.)</i> There, on the rim!<br><br><i>(Cut to shot of Aang on the rim of the volcano. The panda lilies dot the rim. A fiery glow emanates from the caldera below. He picks up a flower and sniffs it. His eyes pop open though when he looks down into the volcano. The caldera is full of lava.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Oh no! Aunt Wu was wrong.<br><br><i>(He drops the flower into the lava. It burns instantly. Cut to break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act III</b></u><br><br><i>(When the show returns, both Sokka and Aang are on the rim looking down in alarm.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Those people all think they're safe. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.<br><b>Katara</b>: Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my min –<br><br><i>(She is cut off by the sound of the mountain erupting to life. That volcano is gonna blow any second. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes.<br><b>Calm Man</b>: Well I heard Aunt Wu's prediction with my own ears.<br><br><i>(Aang airbends himself up onto the roof of Aunt Wu's house.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here. You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction. You have to take fate into your own hands.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(another explosion occurs)</i>: Look! <i>(Pointing to the mountain.)</i> Can your fortunetelling explain that?<br><b>Man in Crowd</b>: Can your science explain why it rains?<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(annoyed)</i>: Yes! Yes, it can!<br><br><i>(The crowd is not convinced. Cut to overhead shot showing the crowd dispersing back to their homes.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: They just won't listen to reason. <i>(Aang flies back down to them.)</i><br><b>Aang</b>: But they will listen to Aunt Wu.<br><b>Sokka</b>: I know, that's the problem.<br><b>Aang</b>: Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own ha(who has just emerged from the lake, holding a fish as if about to give it a kiss) Oh look! nds. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Aunt Wu's door. Katara and Sokka stand guard with guilty expressions on their faces. Momo makes a few chittering noises.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(whispering)</i>: Shh... we don't want anyone to hear us.<br><br><i>(The polished metal gong in front of Aang now shows Meng's reflection, an expression of surprise on her face. I guess.<br><br><i>(Cut to shot of Appa flying through the clouds with Aang and Katara on his back.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Clouds are made of water and air so between the two of us we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(reading Aunt Wu's book)</i>: I found it. Lava engulfs it and it begins to burn away. The world has taken on the eerie red tinge of the lava, which now passes through the cemetery, consuming headstones as it flows downhill. The lava reaches the trench and begins to fill rapidly, its progress temporarily halted. Cut to the group on the safe side of the trench.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!<br><br><i>(Another explosion rocks the village. Burning ejecta begins to rain down in addition to the ash. Katara and Sokka begin to run, but turn to see Aang hasn't moved. A huge boulder falls out of the sky and lands in the trench, exploding. Cut to Aang rushing forward with a furious warcry. He launches himself into the air and begins to airbend. As the lava begins to overflow, Aang blows the lava straight up, rather than allowing to advance on the village. Finally, he draws in a mighty intake of breath and expels it, airbending it as it exits, cooling all the lava to stone. Aang relaxes and assumes a meditation pose, calming himself after the massive exertion. Cut to Katara and Sokka watching in awe, the mountain still visibly erupting, but no longer threatening the village.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Man, sometimes I forget what powerful bender <i>(Katara's expression instantly changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words)</i> that kid is.<br><b>Katara</b>: Wait, what did you just say?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara's and Sokka's view of Aang. His figure is wreathed in red glow of the lava still seething behind the stone shield Aang has created.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I suppose he is...<br><br><i>(Cut a day shot of the volcano, smoking, but no longer erupting. Clearly some time has passed between this scene and the last. Cut to a view of the square where Aunt Wu and the people, including the Calm Man, have assembled. Aang stands in front of Aunt Wu to address her, offering her back the cloud book he “borrowed.”)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b> <i>(sheepishly looking at the ground)</i>: By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: So you messed with the clouds did you! <br><br><i>(She grabs the book in anger and Aang cringes. In the background, Katara looks guilty, while Sokka smiles and points at her, indicating that she was in on the cloud manipulation too.)</i><br><br><b>Aunt Wu</b> <i>(begins to laugh)</i>: Very clever!<br><b>Sokka:</b> No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortunetelling.<br><b>Calm Man</b>: But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed, and it wasn't. She was right, after all.<br><b>Sokka</b> <i>(getting right in the Calm Man's face)</i>: I hate you.<br><b>Katara</b> <i>(taking Sokka by the shoulders)</i>: It's ok, Sokka. Everything's gonna be all right.<br><br><i>(Cut to Aunt Wu and Aang, who were watching Sokka and the Calm Man. Aang turns to Aunt Wu.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Can I ask you something?<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: Of course, honey.<br><b>Aang</b>: You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.<br><b>Aunt Wu</b>: I'll tell you a little secret, young Airbender. Just as you reshaped those clouds, you have the power to reshape your own destiny.<br><br><i>(Aang smiles. Cut to shot of Appa and the crowd. Katara is at Appa's reigns. Take care, Meng.<br><b>Meng</b> <i>(waving goodbye)</i>: Take care! <i>(Appa turns away, cut to Meng's face, whose smile disappears and is replaced by a frown.)</i> Floozy.<br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Dad was here.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Iroh's face. He is drinking tea. He drinks and then cut to a shot of he and Zuko sitting at a table in a cabin on Zuko's ship. Then the kids, Appa and Bato appear walking in through the main gate.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. I found them by my boat.<br><b>Superior </b> (<i>bowing</i>): Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.<br><b>Aang </b>(<i>bowing</i>): Thank you! It's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything –<br><b>Sokka </b> (<i>cutting Aang off</i>): What smells so good, Bato? (<i>He sniffs the air.</i>)<br><b>Bato</b>: The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Perfume? Maybe we could dump some on Appa? Because he stinks so much! Am I right?<br><br><i>(Cut to Bato and Katara, who are not amused.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: You have your father's wit.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wooden door opening to reveal Bato and the two kids.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Bato! It looks like home!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Everything's here, even the pelts!<br><br><i>(The pair examine the comforts of the room. Cut to Aang holding Momo, looking a little disconcerted.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, nothing's more comforting than dead animal skins.<br><br><i>(Momo hops down and examine the head of a bear skin rug. The mouth of the bear closes suddenly, scaring Momo into climbing back up to Aang's shoulder. Cut to a pot over the fire in the center of the room. Katara's hand opens the pot and then the camera zooms back to show her looking at Sokka to her left, with Baton sitting down on the opposite side of the fire.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: No way! Stewed sea prunes?<br><b>Bato</b>: Help yourself.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things.<br><br><i>(Katara puts some in bowl, then cut to Aang with a bowl in his hands. He sniffs it and makes a sound of disgust. Cut to a wider shot of the room. Aang sits back from the group having put the untouched bowl of stew beside him. As the conversation continues, Momo tastes the stew, spits it back out and runs away.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Bato, is it true you and Dad lassoed an arctic hippo?<br><b>Bato</b>: It was your father's idea. He just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging.<br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, I ride animals too! One time there was this giant eel –<br><b>Sokka </b> (<i>cutting Aang off</i>): So who was it that came up with the great blubber fiasco?<br><b>Bato </b> (<i>laughing</i>): You knew about that?<br><b>Katara</b>: Everyone does.<br><b>Aang</b>: What's that story?<br><b>Sokka</b>: It's a long one, Aang, some other time.<br><br><i>(Aang looks sad in the background. The others don't notice.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.<br><b>Bato</b>: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny with hindsight. <i>(Then to o.c.) </i>Aang, put that down <i>(cut to Aang wearing some kind of animal skin headdress)</i>, it's ceremonial and very fragile.<br><br><i>(Aang puts it back on the wall and walks off dejected while the others continue from o.c. He sits down, back to the wall, near the door. Momo joins him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?<br><b>Bato</b>: Your dad wore the octopus, but <i>(in a sinister tone) </i>I did the spooky voice.<br><br><i>(Cut to a scene that same night of the exterior of a squat, three story building with many windows. As the camera pans in, it is clear that the building is packed with people. Cut to a view of the front door where Junee's shirshu can be seen to its right. A few other patrons of the establishment can be seen. Suddenly someone gets thrown through the wall above the door, landing in the foreground and crying out painfully upon impact. Cut to a close of the tattoo of a curled red snake on June's right shoulder, then pan the camera zooms backward to reveal June arm-wrestling a beefy man. They are in a tavern that is filled to capacity with revelers. The beefy man is sweating in his attempt to best the beautiful bounty hunter. She does not even appear to be trying. Suddenly, Zuko appears, forcing his way through the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Out of my way! Step aside, filth!<br><br><i>(Iroh appears in Zuko's wake with a smile, addressing the people his nephew has just thrust aside.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: He means no offense! I'm sure you bathe regularly.<br><br><i>(Zuko and Iroh at the table where June is arm-wrestling. During the conversation the beefy man continues to grunt and struggle against June's grip.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: I need to talk to you.<br><b>June</b>: Well, if it isn't my new friends, Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.<br><br><i>(Iroh laughs heartily for a moment before June ends the contest with one swift movement. The crowd erupts and a lot of money changes hands, much of it ending up in a big pile in front of June.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back.<br>June (raking in the pile of coins): Aww, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money. (<i>To the crowd</i>) Drinks on me!<br><b>All </b>: YEHHH!!!!<br><b>Zuko </b> (<i>grabbing her hand as she raises her cup to her lips</i>): Money isn't what I had in mind.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of one of the lamps outside the front door of the tavern. Moths fly around it. Cut to a view of Zuko holding Katara's necklace.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko </b>(<i>from o.c.): </i>I need you to find someone.<br><b>June</b>: What happened? Your girlfriend run off on you?<br><b>Zuko</b>: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.<br><b>June</b>: Whatever you say.<br><b>Zuko</b>: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.<br><b>June</b>: Heh! Forget it.<br><br><i>(She turns and begins to climb into her saddle.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Plus we'll pay your weight in gold.<br><br><i>(She smiles, gets down and walks over to Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>June</b>: Make it your weight and we got a deal.<br><b>Iroh </b>(<i>laughing</i>): You got it!<br><b>June </b>(<i>grabbing the necklace from Zuko's hand</i>): Get on.<br><br><i>(June walks over to the shirshu and lets it smell the necklace. Cut to p.o.v. of shirshu. The necklace reeks with a purple stench. It scans the area and finds Katara's trail. Cut back to a view of the shirshu's slobbering mouth full of teeth, then camera cuts to June jumping into the saddle in front of Zuko and Iroh. They take off. Cut to a long, exterior shot of the abbey still that same night. Bato begins to speak o.c., then cut back to his room as the conversation continues. Aang is still slumped against the wall away from the others. His eyes are closed.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father. <br><b>Katara</b>: Really?<br><b>Sokka</b>: When?<br><b>Bato</b>: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait here until the message arrives you can come with me and see your father again.<br><br><i>(Aang has straightened up at this and looks over at his friends, clearly worried that he might lose them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad! That would be so incredible. Katara?<br><b>Katara</b>: I do really miss him. It would be great to see Dad.<br><br><i>(The Avatar looks downcast at this, loneliness and worry on his face. He walks out of the room and shuts the door behind him and walks down the road away from the abbey. Cut back to the others.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: It's been far too long, hasn't it? I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does...<br><b>Sokka </b>(<i>less exuberantly</i>): It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.<br><b>Katara</b>: Even if we had time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.<br><b>Bato</b>: I'm sure your father would understand and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.<br><br><i>(Cut to a moonlit shot of the beach, where Aang sits huddled on the prow of Bato's boat.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I can't believe they would leave me.<br><br><i>(He looks up at the sound of a messenger approaching on some kind of bipedal lizard.)</i><br><br><b>Messenger</b>: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.<br><b>Aang</b>: Uh, I know Bato.<br><b>Messenger </b>(<i>giving Aang a scroll</i>): Make sure he gets this.<br><br><i>(Messenger rides off. Aang, with Momo peering over his shoulder, opens the scroll to reveal a map.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's Dad!<br><br><i>(He crumples it in anger, stuffs it into his left sleeve, and crouches back down. Cut to wider shot of him on the boat then fade to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns with a long shot of the abbey's exterior. Cut to a shot of the door to Bato's room opening. Camera zooms back to reveal Aang entering in the background, Sokka, Katara and Bato in the foreground, still sitting around the fire.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.<br><b>Katara</b>: Hey Aang, I didn't notice you left.<br><b>Aang </b>(<i>with exaggerated happiness</i>): Yup, but now I'm back. Cut to Katara and Bato looking at him strangely, with Sokka's head entering the screen from the right, a similar expression on his face. Cut to a daytime view of the deserted town on the hillside seen in “The Blue Spirit.” At the base of the hill in the old, decrepit town square, the Herbalist is crouched near the ground harvesting some plants. Near her is her cat, Miyuki, who tenses and hisses at the sound of the shirshu approaching. The Herbalist rises and the shot cuts wide to show the old woman looking at the three atop the shirshu.)</i><br><br><b>Herbalist </b>(<i>unafraid</i>): Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?<br><b>Zuko</b>: We're looking for someone.<br><b>Herbalist</b>: I hope it's not Miyuki. (<i>Looking down at her cat</i>) Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation again?<br><br><i>(The cat meows and backs away.)</i><br><br><b>June</b>: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.<br><br><i>(She cracks her whip and the shirshu takes off. Cut to a shot of the abbey's exterior, and then to a shot of Appa lying down munching on hay. Near a huge pile of hay, Aang airbends another load of hay in front of Appa, who takes a huge bite. The map falls out of Aang's sleeve. Cut to close up of the crumpled map as a hand picks it up.)</i><br><br><b>Sister </b>(<i>from o.c.): </i>Ha! I caught you! I'll take care of this. <br><br><i>(He bows nervously and the sister walks off. He stuffs the map back under his hood. Cut to a panning shot of the woods that ends back on the beach. Bato and the kids are approaching his boat.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.<br><br><i>(Aang looks down and sees the tracks of the messenger's beast. He airbends the entire trail away, then turns back to the others, whistling guiltily.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Is this the boat he took you ice-dodging in?<br><b>Bato</b>: Yeh, it's got the scar to prove it. Huh. How about you, Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice-dodging?<br><b>Katara</b>: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.<br><b>Bato</b>: Oh, I forgot, you were too young.<br><b>Aang</b>: What's ice-dodging?<br><b>Bato</b>: It's a rite of passage for young water tribe members. When you turn fourteen your Dad takes you... you know what (<i>putting a hand on Sokka's shoulder, who looks downcast</i>), you're about to find out.<br><br><i>(Sokka smiles. Cut to a shot of Aunt Wu's village from “The Fortuneteller.” The mighty lava floes, hardened to stone by Aang's airbending, surround the village, ominous, but harmless. Cut to a view of the main square from one of the alleys. People run into it screaming, fleeing the shirshu and its riders who soon enter the frame. Cut to Aunt Wu, looking serene, if not entirely pleased. Cut to a wider shot of Aunt Wu standing to the left of the closed circular door to her building. The shirshu and its riders enter the frame.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Why are we stopping?<br><b>June</b>: Because the girl must of spent a lot of time here.<br><b>Zuko </b>(<i>grabbing the necklace from June's hand</i>): We have no time for this!<br><br><i>(He gets down and shows the shirshu the necklace again. In our village it was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.<br><b>Sokka</b>: How are we supposed to ice-dodge without ice?<br><b>Bato</b>: You will be dodging...those.<br><br><i>(Bato points ahead. Helm to lee! Helm to lee!<br><b>Aang</b>: What does that even mean!?<br><br><i>(All three struggle against their loads, cut to the ship narrowly missing a huge pile of rock.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Great job!<br><br><i>(Cut to overhead shot of the ship entering a cul de sac, ringed by jagged rocks, at high speed. (<i>Cut to zooming close up of Sokka's determined face</i>.) Now!<br><br><i>(Aang and Katara jump to it. Aang starts pushing wave after wave of air into the sail, while Katara raises the ship up on an accelerating wave of water. The wave carries the speeding ship safely over the ring of jagged rocks. For Sokka, the mark of the wise, the same mark your father earned.<br><br><i>(He marks Sokka's head with dot and a half circle mark above it.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: For Katara, the mark of the brave. You are now an honorary member of the water tribe.<br><br><i>(He marks Aang's forehead with a half circle mark.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I can't.<br><b>Katara</b>: Of course you can!<br><b>Aang </b>(<i>rubbing off the mark</i>): No, you can't trust me. <br><br><i>(He backs away, his head hung low. How could you? (<i>Aang shrivels up</i>.) Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own! I'm going to find Dad.<br><br><i>(Cut to wide shot with Sokka stalking away angrily.)</i><br><br><b>Bato</b>: Now Sokka, I think you should – <br><b>Sokka</b>: Katara, are you with me?<br><b>Katara </b><i>(looking at Aang, then lowering her eyes</i>): I'm with you, Sokka.<br><br><i>(She turns away, then cut to the three water tribe members leaving Aang alone on the beach. It's how I felt when the water tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.<br><br><i>(Close up of Sokka's face. He is sad. A flashback begins of him on the South Pole once again, this time watching his father's fleet depart into the mist. And I know he's proud of you.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Thanks, Bato.<br><b>Bato</b>: I know where to go from here. (<i>He gives Sokka the map</i>). Take this in case you want to find us. (<i>Eyes suddenly going wide</i>) Huh! Katara!<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the abbey in the distance. The screen pans down, following the road to were Sokka and Katara walk directly below. Cut to a frontal shot of the pair, where Sokka motions for his sister to stop as a galloping sound from o.c. is heard. The shirshu jumps into the frame behind them and they run, the monster and its riders in pursuit. Switch to the monster's p.o.v., where it can see Katara's scent all over the place. It focuses on her and it sees her completely colored the purple of her own scent. Cut back to a view of the shirshu and its riders.)</i><br><br><b>June</b>: So this is your girlfriend. <i>(Zuko hops down and approaches her.) </i>No wonder she left. (<i>Grabbing Katara by the arm</i>) Run!<br><br><i>(They run, but the shirshu paralyzes them both with its tongue before they get very far.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: What are we supposed to do now?<br><b>June</b>: It's seeking a different scent – perhaps something that the Avatar held.<br><br><i>(The shirshu moves forward and starts sniffing the paralyzed pair.
