Appa is ejected deep into the swamp, knocking down much in his path as witnessed by the dust and dirt cloud that erupts over the swamp canopy. Cut to a shot inside the swamp as Katara and Sokka drop from the sky into the muddy water. It is dark in here, even though it is still daytime. The swamp canopy screens out most of the  sunlight. A second later Aang drops into the frame using his airbending to cushion his fall. Cut to a shot of a Sokka shaped shadow in the water. Sokka gets up, rubbing his head and making pained sounds. The three get up and look about them.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Where's Appa and Momo?<br><br><i>(Aang airbends himself through the trees and emerges at the top of the tree canopy. He scans around, but sees nothing.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(calling fruitlessly)</i> Appa! Momo!<br><br><i>(Cut back to an overhead shot of Sokka and Katara walking through the swamp. Cut to a shot of a crocodile like monster sits in the water some distance away, then cut back to Katara who points at Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Sokka! You've got an elbow leech!<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(freaking out)</i> Where! Where!<br><br><i>(After he stops moving, it is clear the leech is hanging from his elbow. Katara crosses her arms and looks coolly at her brother.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Where do you think?<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(angrily ripping off the leech and throwing it near Katara) </i>Why do things keep attaching to me!<br><br><i>(Katara looks angrily at her brother for a moment before cut to a wide shot of Aang swinging on a vine back towards them.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: You couldn't find them?<br><b>Aang</b>: No... and the tornado... it just disappeared.<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Katara and Sokka, who turn around to look behind them into the dark depths of the swamp. The camera zooms in on the blackness, then fades to a shot of Appa hanging from the swamp canopy by a net of vines. Appa strains to free himself, but the vines hold him immobilized. Momo chitters and begins to chew threw vine after vine. Finally, Appa's weight is too much for the remaining vines and they fall to into the muddy water below.</i><br><br><i>Appa shakes as much water off him as he can, then takes off again. He flies right into another net of vines and is once again held fast. Appa groans in frustration again, as Momo begins the process once more.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of some vines and weeds. A machete cuts through them to reveal Sokka and the others behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We better speed things up!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(concerned)</i> Maybe... we should be a little nicer to the swamp.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(continuing to chop through the vines)</i> Aang, these are just plants! Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(also concerned)</i> Maybe you should listen to Aang. <i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the dark swamp)</i> Something about this place feels... alive.<br><br><i>(Cut back to a closer shot of Sokka addressing Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(slightly annoyed and gesturing with his machete)</i> I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here, and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.<br><br><i>(Sokka begins cutting a path with his machete once again. Cut to the p.o.v. of someone looking at the kids through the vines some distance away. </i><br><br><i>Cut to Appa making footprints in the swamp floor. Momo sits atop his saddle as Appa plods on. A frontal shot of Appa reveals a large fallen tree in their way. Appa groans in frustration, then cut to a wider overhead shot. Appa collapses in a heap, refusing to move any farther, then cut to Momo blowing the bison whistle in the saddle. Appa cringes and tries to cover his ears. Appa groans, but Momo bows it again. Cut to a wider shot as Appa swats Momo in the saddle using the flat of his tail like a fly-swatter. Momo chitters and falls backwards, clearly knocked silly.</i><br><br><i>Fade to a long shot of the kids walking through the swamp. They are walking up a large fallen tree, the water beneath them. It is hard to tell, but it looks like night has fallen.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(calling out)</i> Appa! Momo!<br><br><b>Sokka</b>: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.<br><br><i>(Sokka is suddenly surrounded by about a dozen swamp flies which he flails at with his arms and machete. They go away just as a huge bubble of swamp gas burps from the muddy water beneath them. The gas rises up to them.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: What was that! <br><b>Sokka</b>: Nothing. Just swamp gas. <i>(The gas begins to swirl about them)</i> Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.<br><b>All</b>: <i>(As the gas reaches there noses)</i> Ugh!<br><br><i>(Their disgust in interrupted by a terrifying scream. The stop in mid retch and grab each other with bugged out eyes. The camera zooms backward to reveal a white bird in the foreground with a huge mouth. This is the source of the scream. It screams once more and flies off. Cut back to the terrified kids still gripping each other.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I think we should build a fire...<br><br><i>(Sokka runs over to some nearby tree or vine roots and starts hacking them with his machete. Aang and Katara enter the frame from the left, their backs to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Sokka, the longer we're here the more I think you shouldn't be doing that.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(slightly sarcastically)</i> No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine. <i>(He turns to address a nearby root)</i> Right, swamp? <i>(he grabs the root and begins to shake as he fakes a reply in a funny voice)</i> "No problem, Sokka!"<br><br><i>(He then chops the top of the root off with his machete. Cut to a frontal shot of Aang, displeased and Katara disconcerted.</i><br><br><i>Switch to a long shot of the kids on a ledge created by the root system of a large tree. They have built their camp on it and sit around a small fire. It is sometime later that night.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Katara looking around out of the camp. She turns back to address the others, a slightly creeped out look on her face.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?<br><br><i>(The camera pans right across Aang to stop on Sokka, who responds in annoyed tone. A few flies continue to buzz around him, but not the others.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Please, we're all alone out here.<br><br><i>(He starts swatting at the fly with his machete and misses. Cut to a wider shot of the group as the fly turns into a ball of incandescent light. They shield their eyes from the light, then cut to a closer profile view of the three kids. Behind them in the swamp, many glowing eyes look down up them. The three turn their heads to look at the sinister eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: ...except for them.<br><br><i>(They turn back to the camera with frightened faces and the eyes disappear behind them. They grab each other in a group hug.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(terrified)</i> Right, except for them.<br><br><i>(Fade to a view of the swamp. It is still night. The screen pans up to show Appa lying down on the lowest branch of a huge tree. Cut to a closer shot of Appa, Momo perched atop him. The sounds of the swamp are all around them, and Momo scurries around, listening, and frightened at the cacophony. Cut to a close up of Appa, who opens an eye, lift his head and roars. The swamp falls silent. Momo curls up on Appa and tries to sleep.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the kids' fire. It is dying. The camera zooms back to reveal the three, backs to each other, fast asleep.</i><br><br><i>Shift again to the p.o.v. of the stalker from earlier in the story. Through a bunch of vines the stalker observes the kids from afar. Cut to a vine snaking its way across the ground. The camera pans up to reveal its target - Sokka - whose left leg sticks out. The vine winds around it and then around his whole body. Cut to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to an overhead shot of the three, each tied up by three or four vines that snake out of the frame. Cut to a close up profile shot of the three. For a moment they are still asleep, but awake screaming as the vines simultaneously yank them all out off the screen and away from each other.<br><br>Cut to Sokka. He plants his machete in the ground as he is dragged away, halting his movement. Both Katara and Aang are dragged off into the mist. Sokka gets up and starts hacking the vines with his machete. He frees himself and runs back down the tree root, pursued by more vines.<br><br>Cut to Katara, struggling to free herself from the vines. Using a water whip she cuts through her bonds and runs off into the mist.<br><br>Cut to Aang, who frees himself by creating an air bubble around him and expanding it. His bonds loosened, he collapses the bubble and hops into the surrounding trees, closely pursued by more vines. He escapes a vine that pulls him to the ground using his airbending to propel himself far away and soon finds himself alone in the swamp. Cut to a wide shot of Aang looking around for his friends.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Guys?<br><br><i>(Fade to a shot of Appa's footprint, filled with swamp water. Cut to two barely clothed figures who are looking down at the footprint. Due is tall and skinny, and Tho is short and fat. Both wear small, animal skin loincloths. Each has a single, large leaf on his head that serves as a hat. It is once again hard to tell, but it seems to be daytime. Tho carries a stick.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?<br><b>Tho</b>: Don't know, Due. <i>(Points stick at footprint)</i> Something with six legs. <i>(Cut to footprint as Tho's stick enters frame from o.c.)</i> Pretty big'uns too.<br><br><i>(The camera pans up to reveal Appa's tracks in the mud.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.<br><b>Tho</b>: You know what's at the end of that trail?<br><br><i>(Due shakes his head in the negative. Cut to a close up of Tho's smiling face.)</i><br><br><b>Tho</b>: Dinner.<br><br><i>(Cut to Appa swimming in the marsh water, then cut to a close up of Momo. His eyes dart from side to side as he chitters. A fly is buzzing around his head. It flies off and Momo flies after it. He lands on a nearby tree root, still trying to trap the fly. He hops from root to root. He catches the fly on the last root, but releases it when the root turns out to be the back of a catfish crocodile. Momo jumps into the air as the creature roars and snaps its mighty jaws at Momo. The monster pursues Momo as he flies back to Appa. The camera pans left as the chase continues. When they reach Appa, the bison's mouth is open to receive the pursuing crocodile. Appa spits him back out. Momo and the monster hiss at each other for a moment, then the crocodile swims off. Cut back to Appa, who shakes his head slightly and groans.<br><br>Cut to another swamp view. The camera pans down to reveal Katara walking through an area where the tree roots are covered in white flowers.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(calling out)</i> Aang? <i>(Cut to a closer shot)</i> Sokka?<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara's p.o.v. Ahead of her is another water tribe woman, back to the camera. She wears the same robe as Katara and has the same hair style. Katara begins walking toward the figure.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hello? Hello? Can you help me? <i>(She squints, then cut to again to water tribe woman's back)</i> Mom? <i>(More loudly and running towards the figure)</i> Mom!<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of Katara as she runs, her eyes streaming tears of joy. She reaches the figure and places a hand on her shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: I can't believe...<br><br><i>(The smile drops from her face as the scene begins to lighten. Cut to a wider shot. Katara stands in front of a tree stump. The figure was an illusion. Katara gasps at the realization, then falls to her knees and begins to cry. Cut to an overhead shot of the devastated water tribe girl, then fade to shot of Sokka's hand holding his machete high. The rest of Sokka appears.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Aang! <i>(He is cutting a path in the vines before him with his weapon)</i> Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara! <i>(Turning to another vine in his way)</i> You think you're so tough, huh?<br><br><i>(He swings, misses, gets caught up in some vines, and falls flat on his face in the mind. He looks up and sees a ghostly figure hovering some distance away from him. Floating in a shaft of light, it is the spirit form of Princess Yue.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Hello? <i>(Sokka walks forward)</i> Yue? <i>(Sokka grabs the side of his head and looks away)</i> This is just a trick of the light... swamp gas... <i>(he turns around, his back to the ghost)</i> I... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy.<br><br><i>(He turns around, still frightened. He walks over to her.)</i><br><br><b>Princess Yue</b>: <i>(her voice sounds as if from far away, echoing)</i> You didn't protect me.<br><br><i>(Sokka rubs his eyes and suddenly the shaft of light is empty. He turns to walk away and Yue is behind him. He yells and falls backwards into the water. He looks around once more, and she's gone. He stands, draws his machete, and walks off, a frown on his face.<br><br>Fade to an overhead shot of Aang walking through the swamp.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(calling out)</i> Katara! Appa!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from behind Aang's back. Above him on a stone or earthen mound are two figures in white.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hello?<br><br><i>(Cut to a closer shot of the two. The one on the left is a pig with wings. The one on the right is a girl in a white robe.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(from o.c.)</i> Who are you?<br><br><i>(The girl covers her mouth with her hands and laughs. The pig flaps its wings and raises itself into the air. The pig flies off and the girl runs down the opposite side of the mound. Cut back to Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Hey, come back!<br><br><i>(Aang pursues the girl through the swamp through several shots. She seems to be many places at once, able to move at lightning speed, or both. Aang cannot reach her.<br><br>Fade to a shot of a chicken possum hanging from a tree branch, then pan down to Appa swimming down one of the swamp's many rivers. <br><br>In front of Appa the mist clears to reveal three river boats. The point boat is manned by Tho and Due. The two parties survey each other. Momo chitters atop Appa. Sitting in the driver's seat, it looks as if Momo is Appa's master. Cut to a close up of Tho, who licks his tongue over his thick lower lip. Momo chitters again, then cut back to Tho and Due.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: Look at that, Tho. Is that little hairy fellow ridin' that thing?<br><b>Tho</b>: Naw, that's what they call a "lemoo," saw one at a travelin' show once. Real smart they say.<br><b>Due</b>: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.<br><b>Tho</b>: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.<br><b>Due</b>: <i>(leaning forward and talking to Appa and Momo)</i> C'mon now, fellas. Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.<br><br><i>(Appa roars, turns and bounds away. Cut back to Due and Tho, the waves from Appa's wake buffeted them.)</i><br><br><b>Tho</b>: <i>(angry)</i> What'd ya say that fer?<br><b>Due</b>: Well, we are!<br><b>Tho</b>: But you don't have to tell'em that!<br><b>Due</b>: <i>(confused)</i> Well how'd I know they'd understand me!<br><b>Tho</b>: <i>(exasperated, but wanting to stop arguing and get after Appa and Momo)</i> Come on!<br><br><i>(Due stands up and begins making paddling motions with his hands. Within a few seconds the boat speeds off, with Due waterbending to propel the canoe. The other boats follow, a waterbender in each of those as well.<br><br>Cut to Appa running over the surface of the river, his feet splashing as he goes. The boats follow close behind.<br><br>Shift back to Aang still in pursuit of the laughing girl. After a few more shots, he spies her on top of another mound.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Who are you?<br><br><i>(He runs up the mound and charges her. She turns, but it is not the girl in white, it is Katara. Cut back to Aang, who realizes too late that it is Katara. He runs right into her and knocks her off the mound. She cries out as they go down. Cut to Sokka walking along, then drawing his sword as he hears something approach. The other two appear rolling into the frame and knock him down as well. The land in a pile at the bottom of another tree root. Sokka gets up, angry.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What do you guys think you're doing! I've been looking all over for you!<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(displeased with Sokka's attitude)</i> Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(airbending himself to his feet)</i> I was chasing some girl.<br><b>Katara</b>: What girl?<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(helping Katara to her feet)</i> I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(sarcastically)</i> Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(after a pause and looking down)</i> I thought I saw Mom.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(again after a pause and looking down)</i> Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.<br><b>Katara</b>: You saw something too?<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(turning away)</i> I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. <i>(Turning back to the others)</i> Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.<br><b>Aang</b>: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here. <br><br><i>(Aang begins scanning around as if looking for something.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Okay... so where's here? <i>(Gesturing in front of them)</i> The middle of the swamp?<br><b>Aang</b>: Yeh, the center...<br><br><i>(As Aang speaks, cut to a wide shot of the swamp that zooms backwards to reveal that they are standing at the base of the largest tree imaginable.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(from o.c.)</i> It's the heart of the swamp, </i>(cut back to Aang, the others behind him)</i> it's been calling us here, <i>(smiles)</i> I knew it.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(frustrated)</i> It's just a tree. It can't call anyone! For the last time, there's nothing after us <i>(cut to a wide shot of the three standing on the tree root, Aang on the left, Sokka on the right, Katara in the middle)</i> and there's nothing magical happening here.<br><br><i>(At that moment a huge swamp monster, seemingly made of vines bursts from the water behind the log. Cut to a close up of the three hugging each other and screaming their heads off. An animated effect appears behind them to accentuate the terror. Cut to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to an overhead shot of the three standing on the tree root looking up in terror at the camera. Cut to a close up of the monster which has a very simple, carved wooden mask on its face. The camera zooms back as the vine monster swings at Aang. The three break up and run out of the frame in different directions.<br><br>The monster grabs Sokka as he runs away and begins flailing him around. Aang turns and knocks Sokka out of the monster's grip with a blast of air. Sokka falls into the water with a yell. The monster then knocks Aang way back with a sweep of its arm. Cut back to Sokka cutting vines around him with his machete. To his right, the vines start rising out of the water. The camera pans up to reveal the vines attaching itself to the monster and rebuilding the right arm that Aang had damaged with his blast of air when he released Sokka. The monster swings at Sokka and grabs him again. <br><br>Cut to Katara who skates across the water in a graceful curve and fires a jet of water through the creatures left shoulder. The creature drops Sokka, a large hole in its left shoulder. Katara squares off against the creature as it fills the hole with more vines. Cut to a close shot of Katara who looks on in alarm. Katara skirts around the monster as it swings a few times and misses. She sprays some water at it and then concentrates, building a large wave and washing the creature backwards. Sokka screams, as he is once again in the monster's clutches.<br><br>Katara then parts the water between her and the monster. She runs down the dry earth in front of her, but the creature knocks her backward with vines that grow right out from its body.<br><br>Cut to Aang running back to the fight. Katara sails the other way in the background, yelling as she goes. Aang turns back just in time to get smacked backwards by another vine appendage. Cut back to the monster which has Sokka in its grip. It places Sokka on its and begins to suck him in. Sokka struggles, but is slowly drawn in.<br><br>Switch to a long shot of Appa running through the swamp, pursued by the waterbender boats. Cut to a close up of Tho and then Due, still performing his waterbending moves. He is hit in the face by something and is disoriented momentarily. Cut to Momo, who is atop Appa and looking for things to throw at their pursuers. Cut back to a profile shot of Tho, one of the other boats in the background. A blue shirt whaps one of the other boatmen in the background in the face. He struggles to get it off.)</i><br><br><b>Tho</b>: Now what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?<br><br><i>(The other boat with the blinded crewman capsizes. Cut back to Appa running over the swamp surface. Appa bends low and runs under a tree root or fallen tree that blocks his path. Appa makes it, but knocks Momo off his back. Cut to Tho, ready to catch Momo with an open sack. Momo flies right into it, Tho closes the sack, ties it and drops it beside him. The chase continues.<br><br>Cut to a swamp shot that pans down to reveal the monster flailing about, then cut to Sokka still struggling in the monster's chest. Shift to Aang approaching rapidly across the water, seated on an air ball. Aang rides the air ball up the monsters torso and back as the monster swings at him and misses. Aang lands atop its head and begins to make a whirlwind around the monster. The whirlwind twists the vines that compose the monster into a huge coil.<br><br>Switch to Katara who makes a few waterbending motions then blows a breath out that freezes the water vapor in front of her. Cut to a view from Katara's back. Her breath has frozen the vines around Sokka. She raises a column of water behind her that propels her and Sokka through the chest of the monster and into the water behind. The monster repairs the hole in its chest and begins to advance on the pair.<br><br>Cut to Aang jumping through the air and landing on the monster's back. Aang jumps back onto the ground and the monster blasts him out of the frame again. Aang goes flying through the air and lands back in the water.<br><br>Katara turns back to the monster, an expression of determination on her face. The camera zooms back as she begins to rapid fire loops of water at the monster as it approaches. Cut to a profile shot of Katara and the monster. The loops get larger the farther they get from Katara. As they strike the monster, the sound of a cutting knife is heard. A few close ups show the water slicing the vines apart. One of the close ups reveals that there is a man inside the monster dressed like Due and Tho. Katara continues to rapid fire and the monster begins to disintegrate, revealing a few more glimpses of the man inside. Cut to Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!<br><br><i>(Cut back to Katara who twirls around in a bending move and slices the mask and the head of the monster with a mighty lash of the water whip. The head and mask fall into the water as a bunch of vines grab Katara. Sokka watches as Aang flies back into the picture and with a single blast of air blows away the rest of the monster to reveal a fat, leaf clad man.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(angry)</i> Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us?<br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(dropping the rest of the vines around him)</i> Wait! I didn't call you here.<br><b>Aang</b>: We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.<br><b>Sokka</b>: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us - a lot.<br><b>Hue</b>: The Avatar! Come with me.<br><br><i>(The kids drop their combat stances and then fade to a view of the swamp from above the canopy. It is daylight. The kids and Hue are climbing the exposed roots of the great tree at the center of the swamp.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: So, who are you then?<br><br><i>(Cut to a closer view of the group. Hue bends a vine out of their way.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it. <i>(He lets Aang and Katara pass, and then to Sokka as he in turn passes)</i> Like this fellow with his big knife.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(to his friends)</i> See? Completely reasonable. Not a monster <i>(he sheathes his machete as he follows Aang and Katara who have now exited the frame)</i>, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.<br><br><i>(Cut again to the wider shot of them ascending the tree root.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(voice over)</i> Oh, the swamp is a mystical place, all right. It's sacred.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a space between the roots of the tree at its base. The group enters the frame.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: I reached enlightenment right here under the banion grove tree. <i>(He sits)</i> I hear it callin' me, just like you did.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Sure ya did. It seems real chatty.<br><b>Hue</b>: See, this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles...<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out and fades to show several shots of the tree, finally ending with a shot of tree and the whole swamp.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: Branches spread and sink and take root and then spread some more - one big living organism, just like the entire world.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Hue's p.o.v. looking at the kids.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: I get how the tree is one big thing, but, the whole world?<br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(cut to Hue's face)</i> Sure. You think you're any different from me? Or your friends? Or this tree? <i>(The camera cuts to different shots of the swamp as Hue speaks)</i> If you listen hard enough you can hear every living thing breathing together, you can feel everything growing. We're all livin' together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots, and we are all branches of the same tree.<br><br><i>(Camera pans up form the last shot to show a long shot of the group sitting on the tree root.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: But what did our visions mean?<br><b>Hue</b>: In the swamp we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved...<br><br><i>(The screen flashes white as we enter a flashback. The flashback pans right to show the spirit of Yue, and the back of Sokka and Katara's mom.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(continuing from voice over)</i> ...folks we think are gone. But the swamp tells us they're not.<br><br><i>(The screen flashes white and the flashback ends. When the screen returns, Hue is seated where he was and continues to speak.)</i><br><br><b>Hue</b>: We're still connected to'em. Time is an illusion, and so is death.<br><b>Aang</b>: But what about my vision It was someone I had never met.<br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(smiling)</i> You're the Avatar. You tell me.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of Aang, who tries to puzzle this out.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(to himself)</i> Time is an illusion... so, it's... <i>(looks up at Hue, realization spreading across his face)</i> someone I will meet?<br><br><i>(Cut back to Hue, smiling, who winks at Aang to a subtle sound effect. Then cut to a wider shot of the group. Sokka stands up and addresses the group)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to Appa and Momo.<br><b>Aang</b>: I think I know how to find them. <i>(Aang leans forward and places his hand on the tree root. He closes his eyes and begins to concentrate.)</i> Everything is connected.<br><br><i>(The arrow tattoo on Aang's hand begins to glow. Lighting or some other energy suddenly surges from his hand and into the tree root. The energy follows a zigzag path down the tree root and then through the swamp. The screen flashes to show Aang's head superimposed on vines rushing by in the background.<br><br>The screen flashes white, and then a fish eye view of Appa getting netted by the boatmen appears. Appa roars and struggles, but is clearly on his way to being subdued. The flashback ends and Aang stands up.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Come on! We've got to hurry!<br><br><i>(Cut to a hand strumming the side of a boat.)</i><br><br><b>Tho</b>: <i>(singing)</i> Set my lines by the river bed! <i>(Cut to a wider shot of Tho, Momo struggling in the bag in front of him, Appa caught in a net being towed behind him.)</i> Caught ten fish and I killed'em dead! <i>(Cut to a wider shot of the two boats slowing being waterbended forward.)</i> Cut'em and gut'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them cat gators dead. <br><br><i>(Suddenly a jet of water erupts beyond the boats and destroys the one farther one that does not contain Due and Tho. Cut to an overhead shot of the captured Appa from the p.o.v. of a tree branch. Aang appears on the tree branch.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Appa!<br><br><i>(Aang unleashes a blast of air that knocks Tho off the boat. He drops the bag with Momo as he flies off and Momo gets out and flies away.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: We're under attack!<br><br><i>(Due waterbends a wall of water up at Aang and Katara, who has joined Aang on the tree branch, which they bend away from them. Cut to Katara, who bends back and forth as she manipulates the water.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!<br><br><i>(Cut to Due.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: <i>(smiling)</i> You too? That means we're kin!<br><br><i>(Cut back to Katara, who looks vaguely horrified. Cut to a wider shot as the water wall collapses between them. Sokka and Hue run up the tree branch to Aang and Katara. They look down, then cut to Due.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: <i>(Putting his hands on his hips and smiling)</i> Hey, Hue! How you been?<br><b>Hue</b>: <i>(smiling sheepishly)</i> You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.<br><br><i>(The camera pans to the kids looking with various expressions of surprise over at Hue.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Hue?<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead long shot of a campfire with the kids and the swamp men around it. Appa is with them, freed. Cut to a closer shot. They are eating meat off shish-kabobs.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: How you like that possum chicken?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from between Hue and Tho, looking at Katara and Sokka across the campfire. A catfish crocodile sits just behind Hue and Tho in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(examining his kabob)</i> Tastes just like arctic hen. <i>(Looking up at them)</i> So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa? <i>(Points at the catfish crocodile)</i> You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.<br><b>Due</b>: <i>(incredulously)</i> You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!<br><br><i>(Due takes a fish off his kabob and tosses it at Slim, who eats it in one bite.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Nice Slim!<br><br><i>(Sokka throws a piece of roasted insect at Slim, but it bounces off his mouth. Slim turns and growls at Sokka, who recoils in terror.)</i><br><br><b>Due</b>: <i>(laughing)</i> Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.<br><b>Tho</b>: Where d'you say you're from?<br><b>Katara</b>: The South Pole.<br><b>Tho</b>: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?<br><b>Katara</b>: No, it' all ice and snow.<br><br><i>(Tho and Due look surprised.)</i><br><br><b>Tho</b>: Hmm. No wonder you left.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(To his sister in a slightly sanctimonious tone)</i> Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here. Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.<br><b>Katara</b>: What about the visions?<br><b>Sokka</b>: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug! <br><br><i>(Sokka lifts up what appears to be a huge fruit fly, fully the size of a grown cat, and takes a huge bite out of it and swallows. The camera pans over to Aang, seated in front of Appa with Momo in his lap. Hue is seated next to him, eating.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?<br><b>Sokka</b>: That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count. <i>(To Hue)</i> The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.<br><b>Hue</b>: I can't do anything like that. I just bender the water in the plants.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(trying to sweep the issue under the carpet)</i> Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.<br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot of the camp from across some open water. A tree branch is in the foreground. One of the screaming white birds lands on the branch and screams. A nearby vine rises up and bats the bird into the camera, which goes dark.<br><br>When the image returns, it is of a full moon back in the Earth Kingdom village where we last saw Iroh and Zuko. The camera pans down to reveal the Broadsword Man walking down a street alone. He hears something behind him, turns and draws his blades. Cut to a frontal shot of him, there was nothing behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Broadsword Man</b>: Who's there?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up shot of his hands, which are grabbed each in turn by another man's hands. He is disarmed and thrown against some nearby boxes, his swords useless on the ground. His assailant's feet are seen to approach the sword. He picks them up, as the camera in turn pans upward to reveal that the assailant is no less than the Blue Spirit himself. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>Avatar Day</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=80">John O'Bryan</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=77">Lauren Macmullan</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=77">Lauren Macmullan</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=102">Chris Graham</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=103">Kenji Ono</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=154">Dean Kelly</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=160">Oh Saung Hyun</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> DR Movie<br><b>Transcribers:</b> Acastus, Pandora<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens with an early morning scene that begins with a wide shot of a shoreline. The shore is largely composed of cliffs that drop shear into the sea. The tops of the cliffs in the foreground are forested, those in the background are grass covered. The shot tilts down to reveal Appa, Katara and Sokka asleep. The water tribe siblings each sleep atop a large tree stump.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a view from inside Sokka's mouth. Sokka breathes heavily with his mouth wide open. A spider has built a web in his open mouth and sits patiently at its center. A moment later, Momo's face appears. His ears stand straight up on his head and he chitters as he sees the spider. He blinks. Shift to a quick profile view of Momo standing up on his hind legs, beginning to lean forward toward Sokka, who is drooling out of the side of his mouth. Cut to Momo's p.o.v.; the camera closes in on the web as a fly enters the frame and lands on the web. The spider moves to get the fly.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the profile shot of Momo and Sokka, where Momo cocks back his hand, and the shoves it into Sokka's mouth. Sokka's eyes bug out. Cut to a shot from Sokka's chest looking forward. Sokka lifts his head, chucking Momo over his face and at the camera. He disappears from the frame, leaving an irate Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(spitting and startled)</i> What are you doing in my mouth!<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of Sokka, Momo eating the bugs, lying upside down on his chest.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.<br><br><i>(As Sokka speaks, Momo hears something that isn't Sokka. He flips upright, chitters and jumps on Sokka's face and then out of the frame. Cut to a brief wide shot of the camp, then a shot of Aang sleeping on Appa. A galloping sounds is heard from o.c. as Aang awakes. He looks off screen in horror. The camera pans right at very high speed creating a rushing effect. It stops on a patch of open ground nearby. A Fire Nation war rhinoceros jumps into the screen and lands with a ponderous "thud." Atop the beast a Fire Nation soldier rides. Cut to Katara, halfway out of her sleeping bag. She gasps, then cut to another rhino emerging from the brush. Cut to a muscular, cruel looking soldier atop one of the rhinos. He wears a nose ring and a short sleeve uniform.)</i><br><br><b>Colonel Mongke</b>: Give up! You're completely surrounded!<br><br><i>(As he speaks, cut to a wide, overhead shot of the camp. The camera zooms back at high speed to reveal four rhinos circling Appa and the kids. Cut to a shot of a long haired Fire Nation archer with three flaming arrows on his bow. He fires them. Cut to Sokka, still in his sleeping bag, moving in earthworm type fashion. The three arrows pin the end of the sleeping bag to ground. Sokka frees himself and runs out of the frame. Cut to a shot from above Aang who sits in Appa's drivers seat. In front of him, Sokka and Katara run into the frame towards Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Come on, come on, come on!<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Katara running towards the camera. Her eyes widen and she stops. She turns to look at the tree stump behind her as a rhino passes by in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: My scrolls!<br><br><i>(The rhino stops at the stump and its rider twirls a halberd and then plants it into the stump. Cut to Aang, who leans forward with a look of alarm on his face, as Sokka crawls up onto Appa in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: My staff!<br><br><i>(His face twisting in anger, Aang jumps airbends himself off Appa and out of the frame.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a frontal shot of a determined Katara running at the camera as it zooms backwards, keeping her in the frame. She opens her water skin as she runs and bends a jet of water o.c. Cut to a shot of the tree stump. The water enters the frame and hardens to ice around the soldier's halberd. Tilt up to reveal the surprised Fire Nation soldier, then cut a shot from the soldier's p.o.v. looking down as Katara scoops up the box of scrolls on the stump and runs out of the frame. Cut to a wider shot as Katara runs o.c. with the box hugged to her chest. In the background, the soldier breaks the ice and retrieves his weapon.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot from the top of a tree trunk high off the ground. A Fire Nation cavalryman at the bottom launches a chain with weights at its end up to the camera. The chain, anchored by the weights, wraps around the tree trunk. Cut to a shot from near the cavalryman, who directs his rhino to move away from the tree. The chain goes taught and the tree is brought down with a huge crash.</i><br><br><i>Shift to Aang running to his staff. The tree falls in his way, but he airbends lightly over it. Cut to a masked Fire Nation soldier for a second, then to a close up of his hand and belt. He snaps his fingers, removing a cap from a dynamite like stick, one of many, on his belt. Removing the cap seemingly lights a wick. He throws the device. Cut to Aang arriving at his staff as the bomb drops into the frame next to him. He sees it, and with a grimace and twirl of his staff his bats it deeper into the forest. He airbends out of the frame and it explodes in the background. <br><br>Cut to a wide shot of Appa surrounded by the four rhinos once more. In the foreground on a rock, close to the camera's p.o.v, Colonel Mongke's rhino sits looking down at the battle. Aang lands atop Appa.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Yip, yip!<br><br><i>(With a flap of his tail, Appa takes off. Cut to Colonel Mongke, who fires a blast of flame at Appa's retreating figure. Cut to Katara, Sokka and Momo in Appa's saddle. They duck as the fireball passes overhead.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka and Katara</b>: Ahhh!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Wait, my boomerang!<br><br><i>(Cut to a spinning, zooming backward shot of Sokka's boomerang still on the ground below.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: There's no time!<br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh, I see. There's time to get <i>your</i> scrolls and time to get <i>your</i> staff, but no time for <i>my</i> boomerang? <br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(cheerfully)</i> That's correct!<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(resigned)</i> Oh.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from near Colonel Mongke's shoulder. He looks out over the scene below and Appa flying away in the distance. He turns and looks off camera with an angry expression.</i><br><br><i>Screen fades to a pan right shot of a daytime scene. A walled town lies nearby. A trail leads to it out of the forest on the right of the screen. On the other side the town abuts a cliff that looks over the ocean. In the foreground, Appa has landed in a forest clearing near the trail that leads to town. A small building is also nearby.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(initially from o.c.)</i> Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka.<br><br><i>(As Aang speaks, cut to the kids inside the town. Katara is talking to a vendor in a stall behind Aang and Sokka, who is sitting on the ground, mourning the loss of his boomerang. Aang wear's a coolie hat to hide his tattoo.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I feel like I've lost part of my identity. Imagine if you lost your arrow, or if Katara lost her... <i>(cut to Katara, looking confused)</i> ... hair loopies.<br><br><i>(Sokka walks over to the stall, where Katara hugs him. The merchant puts a basket of food on the counter.)</i><br><br><b>Merchant</b>: Here's your produce, ponytail guy.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(picks up basket, then, dejected)</i> I used to be boomerang guy...<br><br><i>(Katara pays the nice merchant.)</i><br><br><b>Merchant</b>: <i>(surprised)</i> Hey, Water Tribe money.<br><b>Katara</b>: I hope that's okay.<br><b>Merchant</b>: So long as it's money. <i>(closes shop and begins to walk away)</i> Have a nice Avatar Day!<br><b>Aang</b>: Avatar Day?<br><b>Merchant</b>: <i>(turning around)</i> You guys are going to the festival, right?<br><br><i>(Aang, Katara and Sokka look at each other. Sokka, who has been crying over his boomerang still looks distraught, but Katara and Aang smile.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a wide, overhead shot of the sky. Tilt down to reveal the walled town. Festival music plays in the background. Cut to a shot of the three kids in a crowd on a street. Green banners fly suspended on strings across the streets. They look around in wonder, Sokka carrying Momo in his arms.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew?<br><br><i>(Behind them a hug float of Avatar Kyoshi rolls by. They turn to see it.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float.<br><br><i>(The kids run to the main square.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: And here comes Avatar Roku.<br><b>Aang</b>: Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated.<br><b>Sokka</b>: And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food.<br><br><i>(Sokka takes a huge chomp out of a cake he is holding.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Aang, look!<br><br><i>(A huge Aang float passes next.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(smiling)</i> That's the biggest me I've ever seen.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of the three Avatars now abreast of each other in the main square. Pan right to reveal a muscular and scantily clad young man running into the square with a lit torch.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Now a torch; that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous... <i>(inhales deeply)</i>... smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off.<br><b>Katara</b>: Hey, what's that guy doing?<br><br><i>(The torch man jumps through the bottom of the Kyoshi statue and lights it on fire.)</i><br><br><b>Torch Man</b>: Yaaaah!<br><br><i>(He lights Roku on fire as well.)</i><br><br><b>Crowd</b>: <i>(chanting in unison)</i> Down with the Avatar! Down with the Avatar! Down with the Avatar!<br><br><i>(Cut to a zoom in shot of the kids. Sokka's mouth drops open in surprise and food starts falling out.</i><br><br><i>Shift scenes to another town that rests on top of a hill, then cut to a man and woman walking down a deserted street. He is carrying two baskets suspended by a pole across his back. A shadow passes in front of the camera, then the Blue Spirit appears in front of the couple, swords drawn. He cuts the baskets away from the terrified man, scoops them up and runs.</i><br><br><i>Cut again to a forest shot. A fly or other insect is snapped up by the lengthy tongue of a nearby tree chameleon. Shot tilts down to show the Blue Spirit climbing over a log with his baskets of loot. A green clad arm places the mask in the hollow a tree. Zuko looks out from around the tree, then cut to a shot of a cave.</i><br><br><i>Iroh sits cross legged within the cave. Zuko throws the baskets from o.c. which land in front of him.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Where did you get these?<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(walking away)</i> What does it matter where they came from?<br><b>Iroh</b>: <i>(seriously)</i> Hmm... <i>(eats food and smiles as pink goo drips from his mouth)</i> Mmmm!<br><br><i>(Return to a profile shot of the burning Avatar floats.)</i><br><br><b>Crowd</b>: <i>(chanting in unison)</i> Down with the Avatar! Down with the Avatar!<br><br><i>(The Mayor gives the torch man a signal, who throws his torch at the Aang float. It lands on his right eye and begins to burn. Cut to a shot of Aang with a distraught face amidst the crowd, the cut to Katara running across the plaza. She jumps forward and waterbends the water from two nearby water caskets, putting out the burning floats.)</i><br><br><b>Spectator 1</b>: <i>(angrily)</i> Hey! That party-pooper's ruining Avatar Day!<br><br><i>(Aang airbends himself to the left shoulder of his own float.)</i><i></i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: That party-pooper's my friend! <br><br><i>(He takes off his hat and throws it o.c. An animation effect shows a blinding shine from his perfectly bare head.)</i><br><br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: <i>(surprised)</i> It's the Avatar himself!<br><b>Spectator 1</b>: <i>(panicking)</i> It's going to kill us with its awesome Avatar powers!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(calmly, raising his hand in a non-threatening way)</i> No, I'm not, I...<br><br><i>(Guy runs around completely scared and hurls himself into the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Majoy Tong</b>: <i>(snootily)</i> I suggest you leave. You're not welcome here, Avatar.<br><b>Katara</b>: Why not? Aang helps people.<br><b>Aang</b>: It's true. <i>(airbending himself down to where Katara and the Mayor stand)</i> I'm on your side.<br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: <i>(accusingly)</i> I find that hard to swallow considering what you did to us in your past life. It was Avatar Kyoshi; she murdered our glorious leader, Chin the Great.<br><b>Aang</b>: You think that I... murdered someone... <br><br><i>(Cut to an old, hideous man.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: <i>(slurring)</i> We used to be a great society before you killed our leader. <i>(pointing to himself)</i> Now look at us!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(cringing in revulsion)</i> Huh!<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(defensively)</i> Aang would never do something like that. No Avatar would. <i>(pointing an accusing finger at the crowd)</i> And it's not fair for you all to question his honor!<br><b>Spectator</b>: <i>(to the crowd)</i> Let's tell her what we think of the Avatar's "honor." <i>(blows a raspberry and sticks his butt out at her.)</i><br><br><i>(Crowd voices its agreement noisily.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(to everyone)</i> Give me a chance to clear my name.<br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: The only way to prove your innocence is to stand trial.<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(confidently)</i> I'll gladly stand trial.<br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: You'll have to follow all our rules. That includes paying bail.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: No problem!<br><br><i>(As he finishes speaking, a stock closes around his neck. The camera zooms backwards to reveal Aang behind bars, heads and arms in a stock. Outside of his cell Katara has her face buried in his hands and Sokka leans sullenly against a wall, Momo beside him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: How was I supposed to know they wouldn't take Water Tribe money?<br><br><i>(Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Show returns a wide, overhead shot from the town looking out to sea. Tilt down to reveal that Aang's cell is in fact an open air courtyard with a grated observation window into the jail building where Sokka and Katara stand. Cut to a shot from behind the water tribe siblings looking at Aang as Sokka speaks.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: So some people don't like you. Big deal! There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you. Now let's bust you out of here.<br><b>Aang</b>: I can't.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(upbeat)</i> Sure you can! A little... swish, swish, swish! Airbending slice! ... and we're on our way.<br><br><i>(Sight gag: he flashes to the back of the room and uses his arms to cut the air and then back to the front to shove his face in the camera for "Airbending slice!")</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(disdainfully)</i> I think what "Master Swish" is trying to say is that you're supposed to be out saving the world. You can't do that locked up in here.<br><b>Aang</b>: I can't do that with people thinking I'm a murderer, either. I need you guys to help prove my innocence. <br><b>Sokka</b>: How're we gonna do that? The crime happened over three hundred years ago.<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(shrewdly)</i> That's okay, Sokka. For some reason, I thought you were an expert detective.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(self-importantly)</i> Well, I guess I <i>could</i> be classified as such.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(playing along)</i> Yeah! Back home he was famous for solving the mystery of the missing seal jerky.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(bragging)</i> Everyone wanted to blame it on a polar leopard, but I figured out that it was Old Man Jarco wearing polar leopard boots. See, a real eight hundred pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks. Okay, I guess I am <i>pretty</i> good.<br><br><i>(During Sokka's monologue, Katara's holds her hand to her head in a gesture of despair, while Aang makes gestures poking fun at him. Sokka fails to notice either.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: So you'll help me with my case?<br><b>Sokka</b>: Fine. But I'm gonna need some new props.<br><br><i>(An effect of instantly passing time and space stops to reveal Sokka a strange hat.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: I'm ready.<br><br><i>(He extends a magnifying glass out of hat that rests in from of his right eye. The contraption is reminiscent of the head gear used by Johnny Depp in "Sleepy Hollow." Katara giggles.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: What?<br><br><i>(Sokka turns to her and extends the magnifying glass out a bit more and he hunches over to see her better.</i><br><br><i>Cut to an armored wagon with a small trailer traveling through a forest scene. It is pulled by a horse ostrich.</i><br><br><i>Inside, a plump merchant looks at an open cash box with glee. He plays with the coins. The camera zooms backward to reveal the whole interior of the cab. Suddenly, the carriage jolts as it comes to a sudden stop. The merchant's hat falls off and he grabs his cash box protectively. He looks around in alarm and closes and locks the cash box. Cut to a close up as the merchant begins sweating.</i><br><br><i>After a few moments of nothing, he breathes a sigh of relief. Then a broadsword blade slices through the roof in front of the camera. It slices back and forth. Cut to a shot of the roof from the merchant's p.o.v. A fist appears as it smashes a hole through the damaged roof. Through the hole the Blue Spirit is seen atop the carriage. The merchant offers the box with his eyes closed and the Blue Spirit grabs it. The merchant looks up, but the Blue Spirit is gone. Cut to an overhead shot of the carriage as the camera zooms backward. The driver is knocked out beside the carriage and the ostrich horse is gone.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the city of Chin from the sea. On the sea side of the town, there is a small temple right on the cliff overlooking the water below. Cut again to a wide overhead shot of the temple that tilts toward the bottom of the frame. Behind the temple, between it and the city walls, the benches of an amphitheatre are cut into the hillside. Three figures walk from the city to the temple.)</i><br><br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: This is the crime scene.<br><br><i>(Cut to a closer shot of Aang and Katara as they approach the temple with the Mayor. Sokka looks at the camera through his magnifying glass for a moment, which makes his eye look huge. The Mayor stands right at the edge of the cliff and points to a small footprint at his feet.)</i><br><br><b>Mayor Tong</b>: This is the footprint of the killer, Kyoshi. It was at sunset three hundred and seventy years ago today that she emerged from the temple and struck down <i>(he indicates a statue of a stern Earth Kingdom warrior made of pink marble near the temple)</i> Chin the Great. After that tragic day, we built this statue to immortalize our great leader. Feel free to appreciate it.<br><br><i>(Mayor Tong exits the scene. Sokka walks around with many sounds effects and a few small animations exaggerating his "Sherlock Holmes" routine.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone. And we know that the statue was built after Chin died.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(getting worked up)</i> So if they were built at the same time, that means...<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(interrupting)</i> Shhh! I wanna solve it! That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple.<br><b>Katara</b>: That's a <i>big</i> hole in the mayor's story, but it's not enough to prove Aang's innocence.<br><b>Sokka</b>: You're right. <br><br><i>(He produces a water pipe out of nowhere, and proceeds to blow a few bubbles.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: We need to go to Kyoshi Island.<br><b>Katara</b>: Where'd you get that?<br><br><i>(Cut back to courtyard of the jail. An elephant rat peeks out from behind a few pots. It sniffs with its long trunk, moves forward, picks up an acorn. Aang looks at it, still in his stocks, from the background. The elephant rat jumps out of the frame with a few squeaks.)</i><br><br><b>Prisoner 1</b>: <i>(initially voice over)</i> You got a bald head... <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the other end of the courtyard from Aang's p.o.v. There is a partial roof overhanging that part of the courtyard, and the voice emanates from the dark area underneath.)</i><br><br><b>Prisoner 1</b>: ...some nice tattoos... <br><br><i>(He comes forward. The prisoner is a tall, muscular, bald man with tattoos of his own. Cut to a closer shot of Katara, the cookie drooping in her fingers.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(halfheartedly)</i> Happy Avatar Day, everyone.<br><br><i>(She eats it and the camera pans right to Aang, who has one hanging out of his mouth, then shows Sokka as well.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.<br><br><i>(They eat a few more cookies. Screen fades to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
