A few mountains rise in the distance. Cut to a street corner scene, then cut to a close up shot of a green bag with a shoulder strap.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> It's pricey, but I really do like it.<br><br><i>(Camera zooms backward to reveal the three kids in an open air shop. Sokka is looking at the bag. Katara, with Momo on her shoulder, looks at him with some concern. Aang sits on the floor, looking somewhat bored and unhappy.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Then you should get it. You deserve something nice.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(turns to her with a smile)</i> I do, don't I? <i>(turns back with an exaggerated gesture)</i> But no. It's too expensive, I shouldn't.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(slightly annoyed)</i> Alright, then don't.<br><br><i>(She turns and walks out of the frame. Aang gets up and follows her. Sokka goes last, looking wistfully back at the bag. The frame is empty for a moment before Sokka returns and stands behind the bag, his hands clasped in front of him. Sight Gag: Sokka's face goes slightly chibi as he smiles at the bag.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> You know what? I'm gonna get it.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of Katara and Aang standing in the street. A man nears with a paper in his hand turns around and speaks to them.)</i><br><br><b>Man:</b> Psst, psst. Hey, you kids like earthbending? You like throwing rocks? Then check out Master Yu's Earthbending Academy.<br><br><i>(He hands Aang a flyer with a smile and leaves. Cut to a close up of the flyer. Aang flips it over to reveal the other side.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Look, there's a coupon on the back. The first lesson is free.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot of the two.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Who knows? This Master Yu could be the earthbending teacher you've been looking for.<br><br><i>(Sokka enters the frame from the right, the green bag cradled in his arms.</i><br><br><i>Quick fade to the front gate of a dojo compound. The gate is a paifang with a large green sign with Chinese characters written across it.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot tilting up of Aang in a dark green earthbender training uniform and a round helmet. He looks confused. He picks his ear with his finger, then sniffs his finger. Cut to a zooming back shot of Aang from the p.o.v. of the end of the line of boys of which he is a member. The boys are younger and smaller than he is by a head. They stand resolute, looking forward. Aang stands up straight in imitation of them.</i><br><br><i>Shift to a wide shot of the compound. On the left is a line of four boys with a stone in front of them. On the right is a line of fours boys, including Aang without any stones. A man, Master Yu, enters the frame in the foreground, only his back visible to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Yu:</b> Take your stances.<br><br><i>(The students except Aang assume earthbending stances. He walks between the two lines then cut to a closer shot of him.)</i><br><br><b>Yu:</b> Now, strike as if you're punching through your opponents head!<br><br><i>(Master Yu strikes a pose as he says this, then cut to a wide shot of Yu and the two lines facing each other. The line on the lift their rocks and throws them at the line on the right.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a close up of Aang looking alarmed, then a split second close up of the boy across from Aang chucking the rock at him. The rock hits Aang square in the chest and knocks him backwards into a large ceramic pot behind him. The pot explodes in a cloud of dust and fragments.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Aang's p.o.v. amidst the wreckage. Master Yu approaches him with a smile.)</i><br><br><b>Yu:</b> So, are you ready to commit to more lessons? <i>(Cut to a closer shot of Yu)</i> If you pay for the whole year in advance, I'll bump you up to the next belt.<br><br><i>(Shift back to Aang, buried in the rubble. His face is covered as more debris slides down over him. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a wide shot of Aang excited the dojo through the paifang gate. Sokka and Katara sit just outside.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(disappointed)</i> He's not the one.<br><br><i>(Aang leans over and pats one side of his head, ejecting bits of dirt from his ear. The last two boys exit the gate and their conversation is heard.)</i><br><br><b>Student 1:</b> I think The Boulder is gonna win back the belt at Earth Rumble 6.<br><b>Student 2:</b> He's gonna <i>(cut to a close up of Aang's face)</i> have to fight his way through the best earthbenders in the world to even get a shot at the champ.<br><b>Aang:</b> Excuse me, <i>(runs over to the boys, cut to wider shot of the three)</i> but where is this earthbending tournament exactly? <br><b>Student 1:</b> It's on the Island of Noneoya - none o' ya business! <br><br><i>(Both laugh and walk away. Cut back to Aang, Sokka and Katara visible behind him. Sokka begins to laugh as he and his sister walk up behind Aang. Katara looks peeved at the boys' treatment of Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Ha, ha! Oh, I got to remember that one.<br><br><i>(Katara smiles and puts her hands on Aang's shoulder and left arm.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(in a comforting tone)</i> I'll take care of this.<br><br><i>(Cut to a view down the street and the right turn into a side street where the two boys disappeared into. Katara runs into the frame, waving her right hand in the air.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Hey strong guys, wait up!<br><br><i>(Katara disappears around the corner. Cut to Aang and Sokka, who holds out his new bag in disdain.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> What was I thinking? I don't need a new bag. Why'd you let me buy this? <br><br><i>(Sokka drops the bag and folds his arms crossly. Momo, perched on Sokka's shoulder, looks down at the bag. He jumps down into the bag. Cut to a close shot of Momo settling in for some sleep, chittering happily. Cut back to a wider shot as Katara runs back into the frame.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You ready to find an earthbending teacher? Because we're going to Earth Rumble 6!<br><b>Aang:</b> How did you get them to tell you?<br><b>Katara:</b> Oh, <i>(looks over her shoulder coyly)</i> a girl has her ways.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the two boys looking down at the camera. They are frozen from the neck down. Shift to a wider shot. Their feet are frozen to the walls of the buildings that line each side of the street. Their heads touch each other and together they form a gate or archway over the street.</i><br><br><i>Fade to a night scene in the mountains. In the distance at the bottom of the frame is the brightly lit entrance to a cave. People are lined up to enter.</i><br><br><i>Cut to an underground stadium with a wide shot of the rectangular earthbending arena. The center of the arena is dominated by a large stone circle with a square punched out of its center. In the background on the lift is a tower atop which the master of the games announces the matches. Around the rest of the arena are the stands. There is an empty space all around the arena between it and the stands.</i><br><br><i>Shift to a closer shot of the stands. They are empty in the immediate vicinity as the three kids enter the frame from the left.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Hey, front row seats! I wonder why no one else is sitting here.<br><br><i>(They sit down. A moment later the camera zooms backward as a massive boulder slams into the seats to their right, showering them with dust and debris.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I guess that's why.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from just behind the three kids looking at the arena. A man earthbends a mighty explosion of rock and dirt at its center. A huge column of earth begins to raise the man upwards. It stops rising. The man motions and the column collapses back to floor level. Cut to a close of the man's face. It is strong, cruel, and mostly obscured by long, luxurious black hair.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> Welcome to Earth Rumble 6! <i>(cut to wide, panning right shot of the arena, Xin Fu continues in voice over)</i> I am your host, Xin Fu!<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of the kids. Aang, Sokka and Momo look at the arena, while Katara has turned sideways and adopted a bored pose.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> This is just gonna be a bunch of guys chuckin' rocks at each other, isn't it?<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(hopefully)</i> That's what I paid for.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Xin Fu.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> The rules are simple. Just knock the other guy out of the ring and you win. <br><br><i>(He earthbends himself back to the announcer's tower and continues in voice over. Cut to a muscular earthbender with a tattoo on his back. He raises his arms in a salute to the crowd and grins confidently.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> Round one! The Boulder <i>(cut to a long shot of The Boulder as a huge foot crashes onto the floor in the foreground. Cut to a frontal shot of a huge fat man)</i> versus The Big Bad Hippo! <i>(cut to a close up of the Hippo, who opens his mouth to reveal four hippo like teeth as he roars.)</i><br><b>Boulder:</b> <i>(in exaggerated, WWF type voice)</i> Listen up, Hippo. You may be big, but you ain't bad! <i>(grinning insanely)</i> The Boulder's gonna win this in a landslide.<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of the Hippo, who raises his arms high in the air.)</i><br><br><b>Hippo:</b> Hippo mad!<br><br><i>(The Boulder earthbends a boulder at the Hippo, who catches part of it in his mouth, crushes it and spits it out. The Hippo then begins to jump up and down. His enormous bulk actually causes the arena to shake around. The Boulder wobbles backwards on the verge of losing his balance.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> Unbelievable, ladies and gentlemen! The Hippo is rocking The Boulder! <br><br><i>(As The Boulder reaches the edge of the arena, he earthbends a sheet of rock out of the side of the arena and throws it at his opponent. It hits the Hippo's back and he turns around to face the Boulder once more. The Boulder, with a tremendous effort, then earthbends the Hippo off the floor and throws him over the side of the arena.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> The Boulder wins!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot from behind the three kids. The Boulder raises his arms in victory. Cut to an off angle shot of Aang and Katara. She turns to him questioningly.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> How about The Boulder? He's got some good moves.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(hesitantly)</i> I don't know. Bumi said I need a teacher who listens to the earth. He's just listening to his big muscles. What do you think, Sokka?<br><br><i>(Shot widens to show Sokka in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(excitedly)</i> Ha ha! Whoo!<br><br><i>(Cut to a long shot from the arena looking up at Xin Fu atop the tower.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> Next, The Boulder versus <i>(cut to a shot of Fire Nation Man waving the Fire Nation flag and smiling, Xin Fu continues in voice over)</i> Fire Nation Man!<br><br><i>(The crowd boos audibly as Fire Nation Man walks across a stone bridge to the arena floor waving his flag. The bridge crumbles behind him. Cut back to Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(giving thumbs down)</i> Boo! Boo!<br><br><i>(Cut back to wide shot of Fire Nation Man holding the flag upright and addressing the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Man:</b> Please to rise for Fire Nation national anthem. <i>(singing)</i> Fire Lord, my flame <i>(drops to his knees)</i> burns for thee!<br><br><i>(Crowd boos and throws small stones at him. Cut to Sokka with a stone cocked back in his hand, ready to throw.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Go back to the Fire Nation!<br><br><i>(He throws the stone, which hits Fire Nation Man on the head. His anger is cut short as he is twisted violently around and sinks into the earthen floor of the arena. In a flash he is buried up to shoulders in the arena floor. Cut to a shot from behind Fire Nation Man's buried figure. He stares ahead at The Boulder, who raises himself up on a huge column of earth. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot looking down at Fire Nation Man, who looks petrified.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Man:</b> No. No please!<br><br><i>(Cut to the Boulder atop of the column, who grins and jumps off. He sails downward with his legs bent at the knees so he can hold his feet with his hands. He hits the ground in front of Fire Nation Man, who is hurled high into the air and out of the arena on impact. Cut to a shot of the kids and the rock that hit near them earlier. A second later Fire Nation Man flies into the picture and slams into the rock.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(looking at Fire Nation Man's impact point)</i> Yeah! Whoo! The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt! <i>(cut to a close up of Sokka looking insane and making taunting faces)</i> Yeah! Whoo!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a guy driving a badger mole across the arena. The badger mole uses his claws and earthbending powers to act as a zamboni, clearing up the arena for the next fight. Carnival type music plays in the background. Cut to a quick shot of an attractive woman in a white, sleeveless dress waltz across the screen bearing a placard for the crowd to see.</i><br><br><i>Several matches now pass by in rapid succession. The Boulder defeats every contestant he faces. The first is a gopher type guy who tunnels under the ground and bursts out in quick attacks. The next is a thin guy in a green mask who goes shirtless. The third is a guy with a painted face. Each is depicted in defeat with a stylized still that looks like a frame from a comic book. After the last is defeated, switch to a long shot of the announcer's tower.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> Now, the moment you've all been waiting for. The Boulder <i>(cut to a shot of short person with black hair mostly obscured by a green prize belt)</i> versus your champion...<br><br><i>(The views tilts down, the looks up to reveal a young girl with milk white eyes. She wears a green cape and a simple, but attractive green and white earthbending uniform. On her head she has a black and green headband. Above her head show holds the green prize belt.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> The Blind Bandit!<br><br><i>(The crowd chants "bandit" as the screen expands to reveal two young women next to the Bandit who remove her cape and take the belt. Cut to a shot of Aang and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> She can't really be blind. <i>(cut to a close up of the Bandit's eyes that pans right)</i> It's just part of her character, right? <br><br><i>(Cut back to Aang and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I think she is.<br><br><i>(Screen expands to show Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I think she is... <i>(yells)</i> going down!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the Bandit. The camera rapidly zooms backward to a wide shot. The Boulder's foot crashes down in the foreground, then cut to a front shot of The Boulder.)</i><br><br><b>Boulder:</b> The Boulder feels conflicted about fighting a young, blind girl.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(pointing at the Boulder and in a mocking tone)</i> Sounds to me like you're scared, Boulder.<br><b>Boulder:</b> <i>(after a pause where he looks stung)</i> The Boulder's over his conflicted feelings, and now he's ready to bury you <i>(screen expands instantly and the Boulder makes a dramatic, crushing gesture)</i> in a rock-a-lanche!<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(points again at her opponent)</i> Whenever you're ready...The Pebble. <i>(throws her head back)</i> Ha ha ha!<br><br><i>(Cut back to a close up of Aang, then to a flashback from "The Swamp" where he saw the girl in white and the flying boar. He remembers her laugh. It is the same as the Bandit's. The flashback shows a closer shot of the girl in the fancy dress. The camera closes in and turns around the girl to reveal her face. It is the Bandit's. The flashback ends in a flash of white to reveal Aang's stunned face.)</i><br><br><b>Boulder:</b> It's on!<br><br><i>(Cut back to a shot from behind The Boulder who faces the Bandit, then shift to a tilting down shot of The Boulder's head. Despite his bravado, he is sweating profusely.</i><br><br><i>Switch to a frontal shot of the Bandit. The camera whirls around her head and ends with a close up shot of her ear.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to The Boulder, who yells and takes a step forward. As his heel hits the ground, the frame freezes and goes to black and white. Shock waves in white move out from his heel where it is has struck the floor of the arena. Cut to an overhead shot of The Boulder showing the shock wave emanating away from his heel in neat concentric circles. Cut again to the Bandit standing perfectly still. The shock wave reaches her and travels up her body.</i><br><br><i>Return to a frontal shot of the Bandit in full color. She moves forward and opens her arms as soon as she registers the shock wave indicating the movement of her opponent. Cut to a shot of her feet as she moves forward to finish the set up for her attack. The Boulder moves forward at a slow frame rate. He is bellowing a battle cry, but it is slurred due to the slow frame rate. Cut to a wider shot of The Boulder. As his foot strikes the ground again, the screen flashes black and white again as another shock wave is shown moving out from him. Cut back to a frontal shot of the Bandit who has begin to swing her right foot in an arc towards the ground in font of her. As she strikes the ground, the view cuts to a wide shot from behind and above her right shoulder. The frame rate speeds up to normal. Her strike creates a shock waves in the arena floor that churns up the ground and heads toward the Boulder in a straight line as if a gopher were tunneling toward him at great speed.</i><br><br><i>We see a quick shot of Aang staring incredulously at the camera, his face turning to follow the Bandit's shock wave travel o.c. in front of him.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to a frontal shot of the Boulder whose foot meets the shock wave just as he puts it back on the ground. The shock wave makes him drop down onto the ground in a perfect split. Cut to briefly to Momo and Sokka. Momo squeaks and Sokka's look of adulation and excitement turns to a look of pain. Cut back to a close shot from above The Boulder. He looks up into the camera with a look of excruciating pain on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Boulder:</b> <i>(in pain)</i> Ooh!<br><br><i>(Cut back to the Bandit who makes a chopping motion with her right hand. Three stalagmites erupt from the ground near The Boulder and eject him from the ring. He slams into the wall beneath the stands and slides down into the crevice between the arena and the stands.</i><br><br><i>Shift to a close up of the Bandit's face, which softens into a crafty and satisfied smile as Xin Fu speaks.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Your winner, <i>(cut to wider shot of the Bandit, who raises her right fist in victory)</i> and still the champion, The Blind Bandit!<br><br><i>(Cut back to Aang and Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(crying)</i> No!<br><br><i>(Camera zooms back to show Katara as well. Sokka slumps in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(incredulously)</i> How did she do that?<br><br>(Cut to a close up of Aang.)<br><br><b>Aang:</b> She waited, <i>(turns to Katara)</i> and listened.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the announcer's tower as Xin Fu jumps from it to the arena floor. He holds a green bag in his left hand.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> To make things a little more interesting, I'm offering up this sack of gold pieces to anyone who can defeat <i>(he motions toward the champion)</i> The Blind Bandit! What No one dares to face her?<br><b>Aang:</b> I will!<br><br><i>(Xin Fu looks worried for a moment, before a cut to Aang onto the arena. The crowd murmurs its approval. Shift to a long, wide shot of Aang closing the distance between he and the Bandit. Xin Fu jumps out of the screen. Cut to Sokka and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(cupping his hands to his mouth)</i> Go Aang! Avenge The Boulder!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from behind Aang. The Bandit is in front of him.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Do people really want to see two little girls fighting out here?<br><br><i>(The crowd goes "ooooh" at this bit of taunting. Aang puts his hands up in a conciliatory gesture.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I don't really want to fight you. I want to talk to you.<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka and Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Boo! No talking!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(smacking her brother)</i> Don't boo at him!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang's feet. He takes a step, then cut back to the Bandit, who smiles as soon as his foot hits the ground. She stomps the ground with the side of her left foot. A shock wave travels across the ground and causing a large rock to grow out of the ground underneath Aang, who is launched into the air. He lands softly on the ground behind her. She turns around with an upset expression on her face.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Somebody's a little light on his feet. What's your fighting name, <i>(cut to Aang, the Bandit continues in voice over)</i> The Fancy Dancer?<br><br><i>(Aang smiles and shrugs his shoulders. Another rock erupts from the ground and launches Aang into the air. He somersaults through the air.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Where'd you go?<br><br><i>(Aang lands behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Please, wait!<br><b>Toph:</b> There you are!<br><br><i>(She turns quickly, raises a boulder and throws at him in a straight line, like a bullet. The crowd cheers. Cut to Aang's p.o.v. as the rock approaches him rapidly. He jumps into the air, turns and airbends the rock backwards. Cut to a shot from behind the bandit. She and the rock are blown backward and off the arena. Quick shots of Xin Fu, The Boulder, and the Water Tribe siblings confirm their collective shock. Cut back to Aang, who looks around in surprise as the crowd cheers.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the Bandit walking away from the base of the arena. In the background is a set of stairs. Aang is at the top of the stairs and he calls after the former champion.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Please listen! I need an earthbending teacher, and I think it's supposed to be you.<br><b>Toph:</b> Whoever you are, just leave me alone.<br><br><i>(She opens a door in the wall with a stomp of her foot. She enters, turns and closes the door with a motion of her hands.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Wait!<br><br><i>(Aang reaches the wall too late. He turns and looks sad. Cut to Xin Fu holding the belt and the bag of gold, the crowd cheering behind them. Katara and Sokka enter the frame from the right. Sokka hugs Xin Fu and takes the money and the belt. He puts his arm around Aang's shoulder, but the Avatar is still morose.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Way to go, champ!<br><br><i>(Aang's head droops in sadness, then cut to black for commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to a brief shot of the village nestled amongst the mountains before cutting to the kids walking down a street. Cut to a frontal shot of Sokka, who is wearing both his new bag and the tournament belt.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I gotta admit, now I'm really glad I bought this bag. It matches the belt perfectly.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> That is a big relief.<br><b>Aang:</b> If we want to find The Blind Bandit, the Earthbending Academy is a good place to start.<br><br><i>(They enter the gate of Master Yu's academy once again. Cut to a few shots of the two boys Katara froze punching dirt contained in two huge pots. They look up as the kids enter.) </i><br><br><b>Student 1:</b> Oh great, you again.<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of the kids. Katara, between Sokka and Aang, looks forward and looks mean. The two students flinch backwards in fright.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Yeah, I didn't think so.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Nicely done.<br><b>Student 2:</b> Hey, <i>(walking towards Aang)</i> you're the kid who beat The Blind Bandit.<br><b>Aang:</b> We need to talk to her. Do you guys know where she lives?<br><b>Student 1:</b> The Blind Bandit's a mystery. She shows up to fight, then disappears.<br><br><i>(Aang looks disappointed. Katara notices and puts a hand on his shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Let me handle this. <i>(pointing at student #2 and saying angrily)</i> You're not telling us everything!<br><b>Student 2:</b> <i>(hands up)</i> No no, I swear it's true! No one knows where she goes, or who she really is.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(almost lost in thought)</i> That's because we're asking about the wrong person. In my vision, I saw a girl in a white dress with a pet flying boar. Know anybody like that?<br><br><i>(Cut back to a frontal shot of the two students. Student # 2 now hides behind student #1.)</i><br><br><b>Student 1:</b> Well, a flying boar is the symbol of the Bei Fong family. They're the richest people in town, probably the whole world.<br><b>Student 2:</b> Yeah, but they don't have a daughter.<br><b>Aang:</b> Flying boar is good enough for me. <i>(to his friends)</i> Let's check it out.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of the faces of the two students. They try to look tough.)</i><br><br><b>Student 1:</b> <i>(quietly)</i> Yeah, you better leave.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara turning as she exits the compound. From now on, you will be cared for and guarded 24 hours a day.<br><b>Toph:</b> But dad!<br><b>Mrs. Bei Fong:</b> We are doing this for your own good, Toph.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from the back of the reception room from behind Aang, Sokka and Katara. Lao stands to give instructions to the guards.)</i><br><br><b>Lao:</b> Please escort the Avatar and his friends out. <i>(he points his right o.c.)</i> They are no longer welcome here.<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang being marched out. He turns his head around.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I'm sorry, Toph.<br><b>Toph:</b> I'm sorry, too. Goodbye, Aang.<br><br><i>(A close up of Toph's face reveals a tear streaking down and dripping off her chin.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a wide, over head night shot of Appa and the kids. Appa grunts. Aang and Katara walk over to the lip of a small cliff in front of them.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Don't worry. We'll find you a teacher. <i>(cut to a profile shot of the two, the air blows Katara's braids)</i> There are plenty of amazing earthbenders out there.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wider shot from behind them. The full moon shines in the distance.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Not like her.<br><br><i>(Shift to a close up of Sokka wearing Toph's tournament belt. He cleans it and it makes squeaking noises as he does so. Cut back to Katara and Aang walking over to Appa. They walk on his tail and Appa lifts them up to his back.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the bushes behind them. Toph runs through them, breathing heavily. Aang's turns to see her with a look of wonder.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Toph! What are you doing here? <br><b>Toph:</b> My dad changed his mind. He said I was free to travel the world.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(he and Katara look at each quickly)</i> Well, we'd better get out of here - before your dad changes his mind again.<br><b>Toph:</b> Good idea.<br><b>Aang:</b> You're gonna be a great teacher, Toph.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(slyly)</i> Speaking of which, I want to show you something.<br><b>Aang:</b> Okay.<br><br><i>(Aang airbends himself out of Appa's driver's seat. As he lands in front of Toph, she taps the ground with her foot and a rock erupts from the ground, throwing Aang out of the frame. Cut to a shot from the branches of a nearby tree. Aang hangs from one of them by his feet.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Now we're even. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from Sokka's p.o.v. looking down at Toph. She extends her hand up towards him.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Um, I'll take the belt back.<br><br><i>(Sokka unhooks the belt and drops it on her. It hits on the head with a sound effect and lays her out flat in a heap.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Ow!     <br><b>Sokka:</b> Sorry.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot Appa and Toph still laid out flat. In the foreground Aang falls out of tree and lands in a heap himself.<br><br>Shift scenes to Lao's house. Xin Fu and Yu stand next to each other facing the camera.)</i> <br><br><b>Lao:</b> I know you two are very different...<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot behind Xin Fu and Yu. Lao enters the frame and puts a box he is carrying on the table in front of them.) </i><br><br><b>Lao:</b> ...but I believe you have a common interest. <br><br><i>(He opens the box to reveal gold coins. Xin Fu looks at them with great, Master Yu with astonishment. A shot of the right half of Xin Fu's face shows his eye sliding over to Yu. A shot of the left half of Yu's face shows the same. Cut to Lao on his seat.)</i> <br><br><b>Lao:</b> The Avatar has kidnapped my daughter. I want you to do whatever it takes to bring her back home.<br><br><i>(Both bow, then fade to Toph in Appa's saddle looking back from where they had come. She looks content and closes her eyes. Cut to a wide shot as Appa grunts and flies away from the camera. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>Zuko Alone</b><br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=74">Elizabeth Welch Ehasz</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=77">Lauren Macmullan</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=77">Lauren Macmullan</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=102">Chris Graham</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=103">Kenji Ono</a>, <a href="http://atla.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=154">Dean Kelly</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> JM Animation Co, Ltd<br><b>Transcribers:</b> Acastus, Psycho Silver<br><br><br><br><i>["Previously on Avatar" sequence, including clips from "The Storm", "Avatar Day", "The Siege of the North, Part 2", and "The Avatar State".]</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(The episode opens with a shot of a partly cloudy sky. A dead tree dominates the right side of the screen. The camera tilts down to show a figure in the distance riding an ostrich horse. He wears a round, coolie type hat. Cut to a close up of the figure. It is Zuko. He looks sullen. </i><br><br><i>He rides the ostrich horse over a rope suspension bridge. The ostrich horse puts a foot through one of the planks and almost loses its balance. Zuko acts quickly to right the animal and continue crossing the bridge.</i><br><br><i>Later, Zuko stops his mount mid stride as he smells something. He looks o.c. Cut to a zoom in shot of two people in Earth Kingdom clothing around a campfire. Zuko sees food cooking and clutches his stomach. Cut to a close up of his hand holding his middle. He moves his hand to the hilt of his two broadswords, then cut to a closer shot of the two people by the campfire. A man approaches his pregnant wife who reclines against a tree. He rubs her belly and smiles at her. </i><br><br><i>Cut back to the close up shot of Zuko's hand on his swords. He releases his grip as the camera tilts up to show his face. He lowers eyes in resignation and moves forward on his mount.</i><br><br><i>Shift to a profile shot of Zuko riding across a field. He is almost asleep in the saddle. Cut to a closer shot as he tries to take a drink from a water skin. It is empty. Cut to a shot from behind the banished Prince as he rides to the horizon. The landscape is a grassy field strewn with huge, circular shaped stones with squares cut from the middle. Many are embedded in the earth.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a profile close up of Zuko's eyes. They have grown heavy and he fights back asleep. Cut to a shot from his p.o.v. His eyesight is blurry. He fights back asleep, jerking himself awake a few times. He has a momentary vision of a beautiful woman with dark hair wearing barely visible Fire Nation clothing, but he wakes with a start. </i><br><br><i>Shift to a shot of the sun. The camera tilts down to show Zuko on his mount looking at a village in the distance, then cut to an overhead shot of the village and some of its busy streets. Shift again to several Earth Kingdom soldiers, backs to the camera, playing some type of game. One of the soldier's is shaking a pair of dice to throw in front of them.)</i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: Come on, spider snake eyes...<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of the soldiers. Three squat on the ground at around camera level. Another, Gow, stands behind them wearing a slightly different uniform than the others. The soldier in the middle is shaking the dice. He throws them and rolls two fives. The man with the different uniform scowls, as the roller puts his hands over his head in triumph.) </i><br><br><b>Soldier</b>: Yeah!<br><br><i>(His two compatriots squatting next to him begin to hit him.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Zuko entering the village on his mount. He rides up to a stall near the men. Cut to a shot of the soldier standing up; his eyes follow the sound of the arriving ostrich horse and he turns slightly towards the camera to look at the newcomer o.c.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of frontal shot of Zuko offering a merchant in the stall a few coins.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Could I get some water, a bag of feed, and something hot to eat?<br><b>Merchant</b>: Not enough here for a hot meal. I can get you two bags of feed.<br><br><i>(Zuko looks down in despair, the gambling soldiers looking at him from the background. The soldiers turn back to their game as Zuko looks to the side o.c. at the sound of some laughter. A few kids peek from around the corner of the stall.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a wider shot of Zuko standing in front of the stall. At the side, a kids hands his friend an egg, who throws it at the gambling soldiers. It hits a soldier on the head and the kids run off. The soldiers get up and look over and see Zuko's back to them. The street is otherwise empty.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: Hey! <i>(he and his friends approach Zuko from behind)</i> You throwing eggs at us, stranger?<br><b>Zuko</b>: No.<br><b>Gow</b>: You see who did throw it?<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(turning around and putting his hand on his sword hilt)</i> No.<br><b>Soldier</b>: That's your favorite word, no?<br><b>Gow</b>: Egg had to come from somewhere.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(turning back to the merchant)</i> Maybe a chicken flew over.<br><br><i>(One of the soldiers starts laughing, but a look from Gow silences him. Cut to a profile shot of Zuko at the merchant's counter. The merchant appears and drops two bags of feed on the counter. Gow swoops in and grabs them and throws to one of his men.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: Thanks for your contribution. The army appreciates your support. You better leave town. Penalty for staying is a lot steeper than you can afford, stranger. <br><br><i>(Cut to a side shot of Gow from the chest down as he taps the war hammer hanging from his belt.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: Trust me.<br><br><i>(Gow and his men walk away, then cut back to Zuko, the merchant standing behind him at his stall.)</i><br><br><b>Merchant</b>: Those soldiers are supposed to protect us from the fire nation, but they're just a bunch of thugs.<br><br><i>(Zuko walks back over to his mount. A bright eyed boy appears on the other side of the ostrich horse as he is about to hop up.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: Thanks for not ratting me out.<br><br><i>(Zuko gets on and starts riding away. The boy looks non-plussed, then a smile spreads on his face and he follows. Cut to Zuko riding, then the camera zooms backward instantly to show Lee holding the ostrich horse's bridle.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: I'll take you to my house and feed your ostrich horse for you. Come on, I owe you.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot as Lee lead's the banished Prince away. As the leave, Zuko grabs his grumbling tummy.</i><br><br><i>Shift to a wide shot of the road leading up to a farm. A variety of pigs oink and make noise all around them. The noise picks up as the pass the animals.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: No one can ever sneak up on us.<br><b>Zuko</b>: No kidding.<br><br><i>(Lee leads the ostrich horse o.c. and Zuko looks to his right. A rooster sheep stops atop a fence pole to his left. It crows at him. A man enters the frame, only his back is visible at first.)</i><br><br><b>Gansu</b>: You a friend of <i>(cut to a shot of Gansu's face)</i> Lee's?<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot. At this question Lee runs out of the barn near them and addresses his father in an excited tone.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: This guy just stood up to the soldiers! By the end, he practically had them running away.<br><br><i>(A woman enters from the right of the frame. She is dressed in simple green, as are her husband and son.)</i><br><br><b>Sela</b>: <i>(in a friendly manner)</i> Does this guy have a name?<br><b>Zuko</b>: I'm, uh...<br><b>Gansu</b>: He doesn't have to say who he is if he doesn't want to, Sela. Anyone who can hold his own against those bully 'soldiers' is welcome here. <i>(cut to a shot of Gansu with his arms around his wife and son)</i> Those men should be ashamed to wear Kingdom uniforms.<br><b>Sela</b>: The real soldiers are off fighting the war, like Lee's big brother Sen Su. Supper's going to be ready soon. Would you like to stay?<br><b>Zuko</b>: I can't. I should be moving on.<br><b>Sela</b>: Gansu could use some help on the barn. Why don't you two work for a while, and then we'll eat.<br><br><i>(Zuko nods his assent at Sela's suggestion, then fade to a shot sometime later that pans left across the farm, then cut to Zuko and Gansu atop the barn. They are nailing roof shingles to the frame. Near them Lee stands at the top of the ladder used to access the barn's roof. He watches his father and the nameless stranger working. This is followed by a frontal shot of Zuko on his knees using both hands to hammer in a nail. Lee's upper body is visible behind him poking up over the edge of the roof.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: You don't seem like you're from around here.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Uh-uh.<br><b>Lee</b>: Where are you from then?<br><b>Zuko</b>: Far away.<br><b>Lee</b>: Oh. Where're you going?<br><b>Gansu</b>: Lee, give it a rest. Stop asking the man personal questions, got it?<br><b>Lee</b>: <i>(sighs dejectedly)</i> Yes. <i>(then brightly)</i> So, how did you get that scar?<br><br><i>(Zuko slams the hammer into his thumb at this and stifles a cry of pain through gritted teeth.)</i><br><br><b>Gansu</b>: It's not nice to bother people about things they might not want to talk about. A man's past is his business.<br><br><i>(Cut to Zuko, who looks up, lost in a memory. He begins to hammer once again, a look of fierce determination on his face. As he drops the hammer for the third time, a white flash fills the screen, and a flashback begins. The flashback is hazy and the colors in the animation are somewhat washed out so that the characters and the scenery look slightly faded.</i><br><br><i>The flashback begins with a pool of water. A hand with long fingernails enters the frame and touches the surface of the pool. A Fire Nation red robe adorns the arm to which it is attached. The person pulls her hand out of the water and opens her palm to reveal some small bits of food. A baby turtle duck enters the frame and squawks. It is fuzzy except where it is covered by its shell. It eats the offered food.</i><br><br><i>Cut briefly to a wide, long shot of the garden in which the pool is located. It is a sheltered compound and very beautiful two figures sit by the pool, though their features are difficult to see at this distance. One is a woman, the other a little boy of perhaps eight or ten.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a profile shot of the boy, a young Prince Zuko, and his mother, Ursa. In front of them in the pond hover four baby turtle ducks, hoping for more food. Zuko holds a stone in his hand.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Hey mom, want to see how Azula feeds turtle ducks?<br><br><i>(He throws the rocks at one of the baby turtle ducks, which disappears beneath the surface of the pool.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(shocked)</i> Zuko! <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Zuko, Ursa continues o.c.)</i> Why would you do that?<br><br><i>(Cut back to the surface of the pond. The baby turtle duck bobs back up to the surface unhurt; his shell protected him from the rock. The baby blinks and shakes his head as its mother swims into the frame to make sure the baby is okay. Once sure of this, she swerves and attacks Zuko loudly. She jumps out of the pond and bites Zuko's foot. The young Prince yells in pain. Ursa removes the angry turtle duck and drops her back into the pond. She swims away with one final squawk of protest, her babies in tow.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Stupid turtle duck, why'd she do that?<br><br><i>(Zuko hugs his knees and looks sullen. His mother sits next to him.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: Zuko, that's what moms are like. <i>(putting her arms around her son)</i> If you mess with their babies, <i>(she makes a biting sound for effect)</i> they'll bite you back.<br><br><i>(She hugs Zuko and he laughs.</i><br><br><i>Fade to an overhead shot of another courtyard in the palace. This is quickly replaced by a shot of a young Azula and Ty Lee. Azula sets up for a cartwheel. She makes several successful flips but falls at the end. Ty Lee executes the move flawlessly and with incredible grace. She lands on her feet, but Azula knocks her over and laughs, pointing at the fallen girl.)</i><br><br><b>Ty Lee</b>: <i>(sans malice)</i> Azula!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a young Mai sitting with her back to a tree. She looks to her left to see Zuko and his mother walking down the path across the courtyard. She looks away, her cheeks blushing red and a small smile stealing across her face. Azula notices.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(whispers to Ty Lee)</i> Watch this. <br><br><i>(She runs over to catch her mother and brother as Ty Lee laughs quietly.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: Mom, can you make Zuko play with us? We need equal teams to play a game.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(emphatically)</i> I am not cart wheeling.<br><b>Azula</b>: You won't have to. Cart wheeling's not a game, <i>(under her breath)</i> dumb dumb.<br><b>Zuko</b>: I don't care. I don't want to play with you.<br><b>Azula</b>: We are brother and sister. <i>(her voice becoming sickly sweet)</i> It's important for us to spend time together. Don't you think so, mom?<br><b>Ursa</b>: Yes darling, <i>(to Zuko) </i>I think it's a good idea to play with your sister. Go on now, <i>(she fluffs Zuko's head a few times)</i> just for a little while.<br><br><i>(Ursa walks off, leaving Zuko. Cut to a shot of an apple hanging from a tree. Azula's hands picks it as she begins to speak in voice over.) </i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(voice over)</i> Here's the way it goes. <br><br><i>(Cut back to Azula and the others. Mai's back is to the camera in the foreground, Zuko and Ty Lee visible behind. Azula places the apple on Mai's head.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: Now what you do is try to knock the apple off the other person's head. Like this.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of the apple atop Mai's head. The camera tilts down to show Mai's face. She looks unhappy. Azula fires a blast at the apple, whose stem catches on fire. Mai looks surprised, then cut to Zuko, Azula and Ty Lee. Zuko instantly springs to action to save the girl he thinks is in danger. Azula looks on smugly.</i><br><br><i>Zuko stampedes over to Mai. He jumps her, knocking the burning apple off her head, but also knocking them both into the pool.) </i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(to Ty Lee)</i> See, I told you it would work.<br><b>Ty</b> <b>Lee</b>: Aw, they're so cute together.<br><b>Mai</b>: <i>(getting up as Zuko walks off) </i>You two are such... ugh!<br><br><i>(Cut to Ursa coming out of one of the buildings. Zuko enters the screen, dripping water, as she begins to speak.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: I was just coming to get you. Uncle Iroh sent us a letter from the war front. <i>(to Zuko)</i> You're soaking wet.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(with a gesture of frustration)</i> Girls are crazy!<br><br><i>(The screen flashes white again. When the image returns the scene has changed to a night shot of an enormous stone wall. It has been breached and smoke rises from the piles of rubble. The shot pans down to reveal rows of Fire Nation soldiers at the base of the breached wall. On a stone parapet below is Iroh's headquarter tent. He begins to narrate the letter from o.c.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: <i>(voice over)</i> If the city is as magnificent as its wall, Ba Sing Se must be something to behold. <i>(cut to a younger Iroh sitting at a desk, flanked by two guards, writing the letter)</i> I hope you all may see it someday, if we don't burn it to the ground first.<br><br><i>(He laughs at this, then cut back to a frontal shot of Ursa, the letter scroll spread open in the foreground, with Zuko and Azula on either side. They laugh with Iroh at this comment.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(reading the letter)</i> "Until then, enjoy these gifts. Note the inscription <i>(Zuko unsheathes the dagger)</i> and the superior craftsmanship."<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(reading the inscription)</i> "Never give up without a fight."<br><br><i>(The shot pans right to show Azula standing in front of another servant. He offers her something on a tray.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: "And for Azula, a new friend. She wears the latest fashion for Earth Kingdom girls."<br><br><i>(As Ursa speaks, Azula picks up a doll wearing Earth Kingdom green. The Princess makes a face of disgust.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: If Uncle doesn't make it back from war, then dad would be next in line to be Fire Lord, wouldn't he?<br><br><i>(In the background, Zuko runs around practicing with his new dagger.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(disappointed)</i> Azula, we don't speak that way. It would be awful if Uncle Iroh didn't return. And besides, Fire Lord Azulon is a picture of health.<br><b>Zuko</b>: How would you like it if cousin Lu Ten wanted dad to die?<br><b>Azula</b>: I still think our dad would make a much better Fire Lord than <i>(looking at the doll with disdain)</i> his royal tea loving kookiness.<br><br><i>(She holds out the doll and makes its head burst into flame. The screen flashes white and the flashback ends. </i><br><br><i>When the image returns, Zuko is asleep on some hay in the barn. It is night. The barn door opens and Lee enters. He sneaks in trying to be quiet and takes Zuko's broadswords. Zuko detects this and awakens.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Lee practicing with the swords in a field. He used to show me stuff like this all the time.<br><br><i>(Fade to a day shot of the farm and some of the animals. Shift to a wide shot of Zuko getting on his mount. The family is there to see him off. Sela offers him a package.)</i><br><br><b>Sela</b>: Here. This ought to get you through a few meals.<br><br><i>(A sound is heard in the distance. They look up to see dust rising down the road. Cut to a frontal shot of Gow and his men riding hard toward them.)</i><br><br><b>Gansu</b>: What do you think they want?<br><b>Zuko</b>: Trouble.<br><br><i>(Cut to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to show Zuko and the family looking ahead o.c., then a quick shot follows of Gow and his men riding hard. The sheep pigs begin to make noise as the approach. The stop just in front of Zuko and the family.)</i><br><br><b>Gansu</b>: What do you want, Gow?<br><b>Gow</b>: Just thought someone ought to tell you, your son's battalion got captured. <i>(cut to Gansu, whose expression turns to horror)</i> You boys hear what the Fire Nation did with their last group of Earth Kingdom prisoners?<br><b>Soldier</b>: Dressed them up in Fire Nation uniforms and put them on the frontline unarmed, way I heard it. <i>(he spits)</i> Then they just watched.<br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Gansu who points at the camera, his wife and son visible behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Gansu</b>: You watch your mouth!<br><br><i>(Gow moves his ostrich horse forward, but Zuko rides forward and blocks him.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: Why bother rooting around in the mud with these pigs?<br><br><i>(Gow and his men turn and go. Another flashback begins as the dust swirls from the departure of the bullies.</i><br><br><i>It is a scene in the garden of the Fire Nation palace once again. Zuko approaches her.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: Iroh has lost his son. Your cousin Lu Ten did not survive the battle.<br><br><i>(The screen flashes back to the present. I'm going to find Sen Su and bring him back.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the farm as Gansu and Sela walk back to their home.</i><br><br><i> Lee begins to cry and runs to Zuko.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: When my dad goes, will you stay?<br><b>Zuko</b>: No. I need to move on. Here. <i>(offers him his dagger)</i> I want you to have this. Read the inscription.<br><br><i>(Lee takes the dagger and unsheathes it.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: "Made in the Earth Kingdom."<br><b>Zuko</b>: The other one.<br><b>Lee</b>: "Never give up without a fight."<br><br><i>(The sound of heavy footsteps are heard o.c. as Zuko puts his ostrich horse into a gallop. Cut to a shot from behind Zuko as he recedes into the distance. Lee runs after him for a few steps, a pig in tow.</i><br><br><i>The screen flashes white and we return to another of Zuko's memories. He is in a room in the palace, wielding the knife he has just given away. You're not even good.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(getting up, his cheeks flaming) </i>Put an apple on your head and we'll find out how good I am!<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(getting up and walking over to him)</i> By the way, Uncle's coming home.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Does that mean we won the war?<br><b>Azula</b>: No. It mean's Uncle's a quitter <i>and</i> a loser.<br><b>Zuko</b>: What are you talking about? Uncle's not a quitter.<br><b>Azula</b>: Oh yes, he is. He found out his son died and he just fell apart. <i>(leaning against a nearby pillar)</i> A real general would stay and burn Ba Sing Se to the ground, not lose the battle and come home crying.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(angry)</i> How do you know what he should do? <i>(looking down, sadly)</i> He's probably just sad his only kid is gone... forever.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot. A shadow approaches the entrance to the chamber the kids were playing in. It is their mother.)</i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: Your father has requested an audience with Fire Lord Azulon. Best clothes, hurry up.<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(mocking)</i> Fire Lord Azulon. Can't you just call him "Grandfather"? He's not exactly the powerful Fire Lord he used to be. Someone will probably end up talking his place soon.<br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(crossly)</i> Young lady! Not, another, word. <i>(Azula runs past)</i> What is wrong with that child?<br><br><i>(Quick fade to a long, wide shot of the Fire Lord's throne room. The chamber is filled with dark, ornate pillars holding up the roof. The center aisle leading up to the dais is clear. The Fire Lord sits on his thrown up the dais, which is separated from the rest of the hall by a trench of fire.</i><br><br><i>A quick shot of Fire Lord Azulon is replaced by a profile shot of the kids and Ursa seated on the floor. Between Ursa and Zuko sits Ozai, though his face cannot be seen.)</i><br><br><b>Ozai</b>: And how was it Great Grandfather Sozin managed to win the battle of Han Tui?<br><b>Zuko</b>: Great Grandfather won, because... <i>(struggling)</i><br><b>Azula</b>: Because even though his army was outnumbered, he cleverly calculated his advantages. The enemy was downwind and there was a drought. Their defenses burned to a crisp in minutes.<br><b>Ozai</b>: Correct my dear. Now, won't you show Grandfather the new moves you demonstrated to me?<br><br><i>(Azula stands and performs a series of firebending moves. A shot of Ozai's lower face shows his stony countenance turn to a slight smile at his daughter's performance. Zuko looks on, an uncertain expression on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Ozai</b>: She's a true prodigy. Just like her Grandfather for whom she's named.<br><br><i>(Azula sits back down next to Zuko.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(whispering to Zuko)</i> You'll never catch up.<br><br><i>(Stung, Zuko gets up and addresses the Fire Lord.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: I'd like to demonstrate what I've been learning. <br><br><i>(Cut back to Ozai's face, which turns rapidly to a frown. Zuko tries to run through some of the same moves as Azula but with evidently less skill. After a few moments, he chokes on the routine and falls on his backside. He recovers and finishes the routine as his mother looks on in concern. Azula looks on her brother's failure with glee. Ursa rushes over to him.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(dejected)</i> I failed.<br><b>Ursa</b>: No, I loved watching you. That's who you are Zuko. <i>(cut to Zuko looking up at his mother with wide eyes)</i> Someone who keeps fighting even though it's hard.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from behind Azulon's head looking out over his son and his family.)</i><br><br><b>Azulon</b>: <i>(frustrated and angry)</i> Prince Ozai, why are you wasting my time with this pomp? Just tell me what you want. <i>(with a dismissive wave of him hand)</i> Everyone else go.<br><br><i>(As they are about to exit the chamber, Azula grabs Zuko by the hand and takes him behind some curtains.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: What are you...?<br><b>Azula</b>: Shh!<br><br><i>(They run behind the curtains and then peak out near where Ozai now addresses his father o.c.)</i><br><br><b>Ozai</b>: Father, you must have realized, as I have, that with Lu Ten gone Iroh's bloodline has ended. After his son's death, my brother abandoned the siege at Ba Sing Se, and who knows when he will return home? But I am here, father, and my children are alive.<br><b>Azulon</b>: Say what it is you want.<br><b>Ozai</b>: Father, revoke Iroh's birthright. I am your humble servant, here to serve you and our nation. Use me. <br><b>Azulon</b>: <i>(leaning forward and pointing a finger at Ozai, who now kneels before him)</i> You dare suggest I betray Iroh? My first born? <i>(the fire in the trenches rises up into the frame from below, mirroring the Fire Lord's anger)</i> Directly after the demise of his only beloved son? I think Iroh has suffered enough. But you, your punishment has scarcely begun!<br><br><i>(Cut back to the kids spying from behind the curtain. Scared, Zuko breaks and runs away. Azula turns back to the spectacle, a cruel smile on her face.</i><br><br><i>Shift to Zuko asleep in his bed. The door opens and Zuko awakes. Azula leans against the doorway.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(in a sing-song voice)</i> Dad's going to kill you. <i>(normal voice)</i> Really, <i>(turning to look at him with a leer)</i> he is.<br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(sarcastically)</i> Ha-ha, Azula. Nice try.<br><b>Azula</b>: Fine, don't believe me, but I heard everything. Grandfather said dad's punishment should fit his crime. <i>(imitating Azulon)</i> "You must know the pain of losing a first born son, by sacrificing your own!"<br><b>Zuko</b>: Liar!<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(coming and sitting on his bed)</i> I'm only telling you for your own good. I know, maybe you could find a nice Earth Kingdom family to adopt you.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Stop it, you're lying! <i>(holding his blanket for security)</i> Dad would never do that to me.<br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(voice over)</i> Your father would never do what to you? <i>(cut to Ursa entering the room)</i> What is going on here?<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(innocently)</i> I don't know.<br><b>Ursa</b>: <i>(grabbing Azula)</i> It's time for a talk. <br><br><i>(Ursa leads her out of the room.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(almost chanting)</i> Azula always lies... Azula always lies...<br><br><i>(The flashback ends once again. In the present, Zuko is asleep on the ground, but chants along with his younger self just seen in the flashback.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Azula always lies...<br><br><i>(Zuko awakes at the sound of a wagon approaching. It is Sela. She is distraught.)</i><br><br><b>Sela</b>: You have to help. It's Lee. <i>(getting off the wagon and approaching Zuko)</i> The thugs from town came back as soon as Gansu left. When they ordered us to give them food, Lee pulled a knife on them. I don't even know where he got a knife! Then they took him away. They told me if he's old enough to fight, he's old enough to join the army. I know we barely know you, but...<br><br><i>(She begins to cry. The screen zooms back in an instant to reveal that Zuko is now standing.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: I'll get your son back.<br><br><i>(Cut to a slow pan right shot of Zuko's face. Cut to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to a shot of Zuko riding into the village. The sun is setting and it casts a golden hue over the scene. He rides under a tall paifang gate that looks like it could be straight from a western.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Lee tied to a post. His head snaps up at the sound of Zuko's approach. He smiles.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: Hey! There he is! I told you he'd come.<br><br><i>(Gow and his men emerge from the shadows. Still silhouetted by the light from the sunset, Zuko dismounts and takes off his hat. Zuko and Gow face off, the latter backed by his men.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(in a threatening tone)</i> Let the kid go.<br><b>Gow</b>: <i>(laughing, then in an equally threatening tone)</i> Who do you think you are? Telling us what to do?<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the face off, panning down. Zuko and his mount cast a long shadow due to the angle of the sun.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: It doesn't matter who I am, but I know who you are. You're not soldiers. <i>(cut to a shot of Zuko's face)</i> You're bullies. Freeloaders, abusing your power. Mostly over women and kids. You don't want Lee in your army. You're sick cowards messing with a family who's already lost one son to the war.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide, profile shot of Zuko and his antagonists.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: <i>(to his men after a pause)</i> Are you going to let this stranger stand there and insult you like this?<br><br><i>(The soldier to Gow's left brandishes his spear and walks forward. Zuko pulls back as the soldier lunges, then draws the handle of his swords right into the stomach of the charging thug. The soldier is knocked backwards, gets up and runs off. </i><br><br><i>Another solider runs at Zuko with his spear, but Zuko blocks and then brings him to the ground with a palm blow to the forehead. This thug gets up and runs away as well.</i><br><br><i>The last pawn charges Zuko with his spear, but Zuko breaks it in half with a blow. The thug drops the remains and runs. Cut to Lee, who laughs with delight. Cut to a shot of the crowd that has gathered, Sela is among them. She is amazed at what she has seen.</i><br><br><i>Gow, made of sterner stuff than his men, draws his two war hammers and adopts a bending stance. Zuko in turns draws his broadswords. Gow slams the ground with one hammer, raises a rock and hits it with the other hammer. It flies at Zuko, who shatters it with his blades. Gow repeats the move twice in rapid succession. Zuko destroys one rock, but is hit in the gut by the other. He recovers at runs at Gow with his blades.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: Give him a left! A left!<br><b>Old Woman</b>: It's not a fist fight.<br><b>Old Man</b>: He's got a left sword, don't he?<br><br><i>(Zuko continues rushing his opponents. He chops several more rock, but is again thrown backwards by one that gets through. He staggers.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: Look out!<br><b>Lee</b>: Behind you!<br><br><i>(Switch back to Zuko who is being steadily driven back by Gow. The thug leader alternates hammers as he smacks the ground, each time raising rocks and hurling them at the banished prince. Finally, with a mighty blow to the ground, Gow raises up a shock wave of earth and rock that travels along the ground between him and his opponent. A huge rock erupts from the ground as the shock wave nears Zuko, striking him in the chest and throwing him to the ground. The crowd gasps as Zuko falls in the dust, an expression of pain on his face. </i><br><br><i>The screen flashes white as the flashback resumes. Young Zuko is again asleep in his bed.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(sleepily)</i> Mom?<br><br><i>(Cut to Zuko sitting up, his mother silhouetted in the dark near him.) </i><br><br><b>Ursa</b>: Zuko, please, my love, listen to me. Everything I've done, <i>(she hugs him)</i> I've done to protect you. Remember this, Zuko. No matter how things may seem to change, never forget who you are.<br><br><i>(She lets him go and walks down the dark hall out of his room.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the present with a quick shot of his face, then a wide overhead shot that show's Zuko laid out flat on the ground. The dust from his fall is still settling. Gow approaches. Cut to Lee, still tied up.)</i><br><br><b>Lee</b>: <i>(whispers desperately)</i> Get up.<br><br><i>(Switch to a close shot of Zuko. He opens his eyes and screams in fury. He spins as he gets up, firebending a circle of fire around him. Gow draws back, dropping his hammers. Zuko fires a blast at Gow that hits him full in the stomach. The thug is shot back and falls to the ground.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Zuko who finishes getting up. He is wreathed in fire and his expression is angry. Lee looks in surprise.</i><br><br><i>Gow recovers and gets back up. He assumes a bending stance. Zuko charges him, sending many bolts of fire from his blade in Gow's direction. One hits and the thyg is thrown back into the wall of a nearby building. Part of it collapses on him after he impacts.)</i><br><br><b>Gow</b>: <i>(weakly)</i> Who, who are you?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from Gow's p.o.v., looking up at the wrathful Fire Prince.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(with confidence)</i> My name is Zuko. Son of Ursa and Fire Lord Ozai. <i>(sheathing his swords)</i> Prince of the Fire Nation and heir to the throne.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide, overhead shot as the crowds begins to chatter, then cut to Lee, who's shocked expression remains. Switch back to the crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man</b>: <i>(pointing)</i> Liar! I heard of you. You're not a prince, you're an outcast! His own father burned and disowned him.<br><br><i>(Zuko turns away from the old man, ignoring the comment. Instead, he walks over to Gow, who cowers at the Fire Prince's approach. He bends down and takes the dagger back that the thug had apparently taken from Lee. He walks over to where Sela is untying Lee. After this is done, she moves in front of Lee as Zuko approaches, shielding him.)</i><br><br><b>Sela</b>: Not a step closer.<br><br><i>(Kneeling down and offering the dagger to Lee, who looks out from behind his mother.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: It's yours. You should have it.<br><b>Lee</b>: No, I hate you!<br><br><i>(He turns and walks away with his mother. Zuko kneels behind them, still silhouetted by the sun. The crowd stands still behind him.</i><br><br><i>The screen flashes white and the flashback begins anew.</i><br><br><i>Young Zuko get's up out of bed and runs down the hall as he calls for his mother.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Mom? Mom, mom! <br><br><i>(Cut to young Azula who leans against a pillar somewhere in the palace, playing with Zuko's knife. She steps out from behind the pillar as Zuko passes.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(slightly panicked)</i> Where's mom?<br><b>Azula</b>: No one knows. Oh, and last night, Grandpa passed away.<br><b>Zuko</b>: Not funny, Azula. You're sick. And I want my knife back, now.<br><br><i>(He grabs for the knife, but she dodges and holds the knife out in front of her, taunting him.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: Who's going to make me? Mom?<br><br><i>(He grabs the knife and runs out of the room. He runs into the garden where Ozai looks out over the pond.)</i> <br><br><b>Zuko</b>: Where is she?<br><br><i>(His father does not reply. Zuko looks down in despair.</i><br><br><i>Fade to a shot of larger pool. The screen tilts up to reveal a ceremonial plaza somewhere in the palace. It is packed with people. As the Fire Sage speaks, the camera shows various shots of the funeral audience. On the dais stands the gold sarcophagus and the Fire Sage presiding over the ceremony. Around the sarcophagus stand members of the royal family, including Ozai, Azula and Zuko, all dressed in white.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Sage</b>: <i>(voice over at first)</i> Azulon, Fire Lord to our nation for 23 years. You were our fearless <i>(cut to a shot tilting up showing the Fire Sage with Azulon's gold sarcophagus behind him)</i> leader in the battle of Gar Sai. Our matchless conqueror of the Hu Sin provinces. You were father of Iroh. Father of Ozai. Husband of Ila, now passed. Grandfather of Lu Ten, now passed. Grandfather of Zuko and Azula. <br><br><i>(The Fire Sage turns and approached the sarcophagus. He reaches in and takes the Fire Lord's diadem. In the foreground, Ozai walks forward, his back to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Sage</b>: We lay you to rest. <br><br><i>(The Fire Sage holds the diadem above his head as two firebenders on the left and right light fire to the sarcophagus. With the fire of the funeral pyre burning behind him, the Fire Sage crowns the new Fire Lord.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Sage</b>: As was your dying wish, you are now succeeded by your second son. <i>(he puts the diadem on Ozai's head, whose face is still not shown, and exits the frame to the right)</i> Hail Fire Lord Ozai!<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide, long shot of the dais from down below where the audience stands. As Ozai stands up from being crowned, the audience bows low. Switch to a shot from behind Ozai looking out over the enormous field below, filled with his subjects. Cut to a profile shot of Azula and Zuko, wearing white, bowing to their father. Azula has her customary cruel grin. Zuko looks over at his sister in fear, then looks ahead.</i><br><br><i>The flashback ends. Returning to the present we see a close up of Zuko. He is riding away from the village on his ostrich horse, his round hat back on his head. Cut to a wide shot of Zuko riding out of the village with either side of the street lined with villagers. An Earth Kingdom flag flies in the breeze on the left of the frame. Switch to a shot of some villagers, including Lee, as Zuko leaves. They look upon him with dull hatred.</i><br><br><i>Zuko rides into the sunset. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

The camera tilts down to show Appa and the gang, now including Toph, sitting in what looks like a dried up section the creek. There is a bunch of white fur around Appa's feet. Cut to a shot of Appa from his right side at an angle so his back is closest and his head is furthest. Aang sits in the basket and is passing a sleeping bag down to Sokka. Katara walks around Appa's head to the same side. Toph appears from the left and is closest to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: Hey, you guys picked a great campsite. <i>(cut to a shot of Toph's feet in the pile of white fur)</i> The grass is so soft.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot that shows the full of Appa from his right side showing all four of them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: That's not grass. Appa's shedding.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(Lifting her right foot out of the fur and balancing on her left)</i> Oh, gross!<br><b>Aang</b>: That's not gross; it's just a part of spring. <br><br><i>(Shot cuts to Aang atop Appa as a light melodious tone plays softly. A blue bird lands gracefully on his head and a yellow butterfly flutters by his right ear which Momo jumps up in an attempt to snatch.) </i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: You know, rebirth, flowers blooming, and Appa gets a new coat!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Appa's head, Katara stands to its left.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Ah, the beauty of spring. <i>(Appa, who sticks his tongue out to reveal it's covered in fur, sneezes, blowing fur everywhere.)</i> Stop, Appa, stop! <br><br><i>(She coughs, and waves her arms to stop Appa from covering her in hair even more. Shot pans over to Sokka who is kneeling and rubbing fur on his head.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: It's not that bad, Katara. <i>(He stands to reveal he has piled the fur on his head to form a tall pillar of hair in a very Marge Simpson like fashion.)</i> It makes a great wig!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(Dropping into the shot from atop Appa, he has arranged the fur on his face to form a large mustache and beard.)</i> And a great beard!<br><br><i>(Sokka and Aang point and laugh at each other. Shot changes to Katara who is not smiling and begins to whip the fur off her sleeve.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(unamused)</i> I'm just glad we finally have another girl in the group because you two are disgusting.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Aang and Sokka who are both slightly hunched with one arm over the other's shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: Excuse me, <i>(She walks in between the two breaking them apar.) </i>does anyone have a razor... <i>(She lifts both arms to reveal a mass of white fur emerging out of both of her sleeves, under her arms)</i> ...because I've got some hairy pits!<br><br><i>(All three of them laugh until Aang gives one of his powerful airbending sneezes, thrusting him backwards into Appa's leg and then falling face down on the ground. He lifts his head to reveal his beard and mustache are gone but he now has a large mass of fur sticking jaggedly up on his back. All three begin laughing again. Cut to Katara who at first looks disgusted, but quickly joins in the laughter.</i><br><br><i>Fade into a shot of the same setting at night where Aang, Sokka, and Katara are setting up camp. Sokka is carrying some firewood, Aang, with a blast of air, sets up the tent, and Katara is swirling some water in a large pot. They all eventually stop and look o.c. Shot cuts to show Toph laying lazily against a rock with her legs crossed, arms behind her head, and a piece of straw casually hanging from her mouth. Cut back to a close up of Katara at her pot who looks slightly annoyed and stands up. Shot changes to a view from behind Toph's head. Katara enters the shot in front of Toph.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: So, Toph, usually when setting up camp we try to divide up the work.<br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(Cut to her lying down) </i>Hey, don't worry about me, I'm good to go.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(Cut back to her, Aang and Sokka can be seen working again in the background)</i> Well, actually, what I'm trying to say is, uh, some of us might fetch water while someone else might set up the fire pit or put up the tent. <i>(Momo flies down dropping nuts into Katara's hand and flutters by her head.)</i> Even Momo does his fair share.<br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(Cut back to her as she takes the straw from her mouth)</i> Katara, I'm fine. I can carry my own weight. I don't need a fire, I've already collected my own food, and look, <i>(Now sitting upright, she uses her earthbending to create a stone tent.)</i> my tent's all set up.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(Cut back to her, as she becomes steadily more annoyed)</i> Well, that's great for you, but we still need to finish...<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the both of them from the side, Toph sitting just outside her stone tent.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(Irritated) I</i> don't understand. What's the problem here?<br><b>Katara</b>: Never mind.<br><br><i>(She walks away as Toph earthbends herself back into her tent. Fade in to Sokka and Aang setting up camp apparently a little time later. Aang stands on Appa's head while Sokka stands on the ground. Using airbending, Aang lifts Appa's basket off his back and attempts to lower it down to Sokka, but accidentally drops it on top of him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Aaaah!<br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(Leaping down to lift the basket off him.)</i> Sorry!<br><br><i>(Shot cuts to Katara who places down her pot of water and looks over to Toph by her stone tent. Cut to Katara's face who smiles slightly before the shot changes to Toph eating something in front of her tent while Katara walks over to her.) </i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Hey Toph, I wanted to apologize for earlier. I think we're all just a little tired and getting on each others' nerves.<br><b>Toph</b>: Yeah, you do seem pretty tired.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara's aggravated face.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(angrily)</i> I meant all of us.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot from insider Toph's tent showing her back and Katara standing outside it.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: Well, goodnight. <br><br><i>(She turns around and lays done on her chest inside.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(half-heartedly)</i> Goodnight.<br><br><i>(She walks away o.c.. Fade to a night scene. Aang is sleeping on Appa's front right arm, Momo is curled up on Appa's head, Sokka and Katara are sleeping inside their tent, and Toph is across the camp asleep in her tent. Cut to a shot of Toph asleep in her tent. Quite suddenly she awakes and gasps, rising to her knees and feeling the ground with her hand. Cut to a shot of her hand as she feels, then cut to her right ear as she listens carefully. Shot cuts back to her inside the tent as she rises, turns, and runs out.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: There's something coming toward us!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Appa and the tent. Aang wakes and looks up, Momo does the same. Katara and Sokka emerge from their tent.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: What is it?<br><br><i>(Cut to Toph standing in the middle of the camp, she kneels to the ground again to feel it.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: It feels like an avalanche... <i>(Aang, Katara, and Sokka all enter the shot and stand behind her)</i> But also not like an avalanche.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Your powers of perception are frightening.<br><b>Katara</b>: Should we leave?<br><b>Aang</b>: Better safe than sorry.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the tree line where, just beyond it, something is moving rapidly in their direction across an open area of ground, kicking up a large cloud of dust in its wake. Appa flies up into the shot from below. Cut to a shot of Aang sitting on Appa's head. He turns around and squints his eyes to see their pursuer. Cut to a shot of the saddle where Sokka Katara and Toph are riding. We see all four of them looking back beyond.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: What is that thing?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the thing chasing them. It's a large train-like tank with smoke pouring out of it's smokestack. It has two large compartments connected to it, trailing behind. All have large treads. The machine is moving very quickly for its size.</i><br><br><i>Cut to shot of the moon in the cloudy sky, partially blocked by them. Appa flies into the shot from the left and flies through. It is later that night. Shot cuts to Aang holding Appa's reigns. He now has bags under his eyes and yawns deeply. Cut to Sokka who is using his right arm to support his head. Cut to the back end of the saddle, we see Toph holding the side of it while Katara sits in the middle. They both are trying to stay awake. Cut back to Appa flying through the sky over a range of hills below.</i><br><br><i>Fade to Appa descending onto one of the hills a little bit later. Once all six paws are on the ground, Toph jumps out of the saddle and lays flat on the ground. The other three climb out as well.)</i><br><br><b>Toph</b>: Ahh, land, sweet land! <i>(Using earthbending to propel herself to her feet and slinging her bag over her shoulder.)</i> See you guys in the morning!<br><b>Katara</b>: Actually, can you help us unload?<br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(Cut to her looking back.)</i> Really? You need me to help unload Sokka's funky-smelling sleeping bag?<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Sokka standing beside Appa. Aang, of screen, hands down Sokka's sleeping bag to him. I'm carrying my own weight. <br><br><i>(Toph walks left off screen.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(Hand on her hips.)</i> That's not the point. <br><br><i>(The camera cuts to and follows Katara from her right as she walks from left to right approaching Toph. When she reaches her it stops at a side view of both of them.)</i> <br><br><b>Katara</b>: Ever since joining us you've been nothing but selfish and unhelpful.<br><b>Toph</b>: <i>What?</i> <i>(Doing a half turn and pointing at Katara again.)</i> Look here, sugar queen, <i>(Drops arm and continues, Katara makes a gesture like she wants to interject.)</i> I gave up everything I had so that I could teach Aang earthbending, so don't you talk to me about being selfish!<br><br><i>(Camera backs away slightly to show Toph sitting quickly and making another stone tent around herself.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>Sugar Queen!</i> <i>(Toph closes off her rock tent by brining a slab of earth up to cover the opening to Katara.)</i> D-Did you just slam the door in my face!  <br><br><i>(Shot cuts to show the tent from the front farther away with Katara moving erratically about it grumbling.
