Suddenly, a massive black form passes near Momo, sending him leaping back to Toph, to cower dripping wet on her shoulder.</i><br><br><i>The enormous bulk of the creature passes over the bubble, and is dimly seen from within.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> What is that thing? <br><br><i>(As Ying and her family huddle in fear, something huge crashes through the walls of the bubble, breaking Katara's concentration and threatening to drown them all. Reacting quickly, Toph bends up a  column of rock that rushes everyone to the surface. Toph hands back Aang's staff back just as the others notice a long spiny dorsal fin circling their sanctuary. Everyone watches it with growing dread, until the head of a colossal monster explodes from the lake. It is a gigantic jade Sea Serpent, whiskered head resembling a seahorse's, long tongue lashing whip like from its maw. The monster roars deafeningly as it rears back its long neck to menace our heroes.) </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(pointing upward)</i> I think I just figured out why they call it the Serpent's Pass. <br><br><i>(A final close-up of the Serpent's gaping toothy jaws, from which issues a shrill scream of rage. Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Scene opens back to the titanic Serpent arching menacingly over our circle of heroes)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Suki, you know about giant sea monsters. Make it go away!<br><b>Suki:</b> <i>(angrily)</i> Just because I live near the Unagi doesn't mean I'm an expert! <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(beseechingly holds up Momo)</i> Oh great and powerful sea serpent, please accept this humble and tasty offering. Thank you. <br><b>Katara: </b> <i>(outraged)</i> Sokka!<br><br><i>(The Serpent lunges toward them, but Aang sweeps an arc of wind at its head, punching it backwards.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b>I'll distract him. Katara, get everyone across. <br><br><i>(Aang opens his flyer and swoops off as the serpent recovers and snakes after him. Katara begins casting a path made of ice across the lake surface, running forward to connect it to the far shore. Urging the others past her, Katara watches Aang elude the serpent in the distance. She hops onto the water, forms a pontoon of ice around her feet, and propels herself toward the fight.  </i><br><br><i>When Aang races past her, the enraged Serpent close behind, she begins to freeze ice around the passing monster's midsection. With a twist of its body the Serpent bursts free, turning back to chase Katara the opposite direction. Cut to Sokka rushing on shore behind the others, then turning to see that Toph is still stranded atop of the<br>rock pillar.) </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(calling out)</i> Toph, come on. It's just ice. <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(puts a foot out onto ice, shrinks back)</i> Actually, I'm gonna stay on my little island where I can see. <i>(A huge coil of the Sea Serpent crashes down behind her, sending her out onto the ice with a cry of fright.) </i> Ok, I'm coming! <i>(begins inching sideways across the ice span)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(shouting encouragement)</i> You're doing great! Just follow the sound of my voice! <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(acidly)</i> It's hard to ignore. <br><b>Sokka:</b> You're almost there. <i>(the serpents tail crashes through the bridge, shattering its entire length and sending Toph plunging into the lake)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(screams and thrashes helplessly)</i> Help! I can't swim! <br><b>Sokka: </b>I'm coming Toph! <br><br><i>(As Sokka struggles to remove a boot, Suki dives into the water towards Toph. Standing amazed, Sokka watches her swim furiously to the rescue as Toph slips beneath the waves. Reaching the place where she disappeared, Suki dives down and brings her gasping to the surface.) </i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(dramatically)</i> Oh Sokka, you saved me. <i>(plants a big kiss on Suki's cheek)</i><br><b>Suki:</b> Actually, it's me.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(fatally embarrassed)</i> Oh...well...heheh. <i>(limply)</i> You can go ahead and let me drown now. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the Serpent's head thrashing in the distance. Cutting closer, Aang and Katara are shown circling the Serpent at tremendous speed, stirring up a irresistible whirlpool that holds it helpless. The spinning monster's neck cracks like a whip against the cliff-side, and it slinks off into the depths. Walking up a rise, the others cheer as Aang flies by with Katara.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a view of the far shore, then another showing the weary travelers descending down the last rise of the pass.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka: </b><i>(pointing excitedly)</i> There's the wall! <i>(view pans past rocky barrens toward a vast wall that fills the distant horizon)</i> Now it's nothing but smooth sailing to Ba Sing Se.<br><b>Ying:</b> <i>(gasps)</i> Oh no! <i>(doubles over, clutching her belly)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(apprehensively)</i> What's wrong? <br><b>Ying:</b> The baby's coming! <i>(the refugee family ease Ying to the ground</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(in rising panic)</i> What! Now! Can't you hold it in or something?<br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka, Calm down. I helped Gran-Gran deliver lots of babies back home. <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(completely panicking)</i> This isn't the same as delivering an arctic seal! This is a real... human.... thing!<br><b>Katara: </b>It's called a baby, and I helped todeliver plenty of those too. <i>(speaking with authority)</i> Aang, get some rags. Sokka, water. Toph, I need you to make an earth tent. A big one. <i>(Toph creates a tent of stone slabs around the refugees)</i> Suki, come with me. <i>(both enter the tent)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to the ferry, making progress through the early morning mist. Zuko stands at the prow looking toward the nearing shoreline. Jet approaches him from behind.) </i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You know, as soon as I saw your scar, I knew exactly who you were. <i>(Zuko glances warily at Jet who now stands next to him)</i> You're an outcast, like me. And us outcasts have to stick together. We have to watch each other's backs, because no one else will. <br><b>Zuko: </b><i>(grimly)</i> I've realized lately, that being on your own isn't always the best path. <br><br><i>(The rocky cliffs of the opposite shore come into full view, and behind them a looming wall. </i><br><br><i>Cut to the darkened interior of the stone tent, where Than and the girl hold each of Ying's hands. Ying herself is laboring  heavily, gasping for breath and sweating profusely. Katara is seated between her blanket-covered legs, back to the tent's entrance.) </i><br><br><b>Katara: </b>You're doing great Ying. <i>(calling back)</i> Sokka! Where's that water? Get ready to push. <i>(Sokka enters behind her)</i> One, two, three...PUSH! <br><br><i>(As Ying cries out in effort, Sokka, watching over his sister's back, slumps unconscious to the ground.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the tent's exterior. Momo is perched overhead on a tree branch, while Aang, Toph and Sokka wait outside the tent entrance. Aang is huddled despondently to one side. Toph leans on the other side of the entrance. Sokka sits next to her, mopping his face with a cloth.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(from inside)</i> It's a girl!<br><b>Toph: </b> <i>(leaning over to Sokka)</i> So, you want to go see the baby? Or are you going to  faint like an old lady again? <br><b>Sokka:</b> No no, I'm good this time. <i>(Sokka stands and follows Toph into the tent. Moments later Katara appears at the entrance.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Aang, you have to come see this. <i>(steps back inside)</i><br><br><i>(Aang rises and walks morosely to the tent entrance, raises his head and looks inside. Everyone is gathered around Ying, who sits propped up on a bedroll. All attention is on the small bundle cradled in her arms.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> She sounds healthy. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(awed)</i> She's beautiful.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(dubiously)</i> It's so...squishy looking. <br><br><i>(Camera draws close to the sleeping newborn, then back to Aang, as his expression melts into a bittersweet smile. Than is kneeling next to his wife, as both serenely watch their sleeping daughter.)</i><br><br><b>Than:</b> What should we name her?<br><b>Ying:</b> <i>(turning to Than)</i> I want our daughter's name to be unique. <i>(looks down at her)</i> I want it to mean something. <br><br><i>(Aang is still smiling as tears well up in his eyes, streaming down his cheeks before he wipes them away with his arm. He finally enters into the center of the tent.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(softly)</i> I've been going through a really hard time lately. But you've made me... hopeful again.<br><b>Ying:</b> I know what I want to name our baby now. Hope.<br><b>Than:</b> That's a perfect name. Hope.<br><br><i>(Cut to the outside, where Aang and Katara stand beneath a tree, away from the others.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> (thoughtfully) I thought I was trying to be strong, but really I was just running away from my feelings. Seeing this family together, so full of happiness and love, it reminded me of how I feel about Appa.....and how I feel about you.<br><br><i>(Katara wipes a streaming tear from her eye as Aang finishes speaking. Both step forward and embrace lovingly, tears welling up in Katara's closed eyes. They disengage as Suki, Sokka and Toph step toward them. Katara straightens Aang's collar before backing away.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I promise I'll find Appa as fast as I can. I just really need to do this. <i>(Tophhands him his staff)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> See ya in the big city.<br><b>Toph:</b> Say hi to that big fuzzball for me. <i>(slugs Aang's arm, who winces and rubs it painfully)</i><br><b>Katara: </b> <i>(gently)</i> You'll find him Aang. <br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(softly)</i> I know. Thank you Katara. <br><br><i>(As Aang snaps open his glider and prepares for takeoff, Momo stands next to him and spreads his wings in imitation. Toph, Sokka, Katara and Suki all stand back a few paces.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b><i>(glancing over)</i> You ready Momo? <br><br><i>(Momo chitters his assent. They both crouch, then hurtle into the sky as everyone waves farewell. </i><br><br><i>We see a shot of Aang and Momo soaring over the barrens toward the far-off walls of Ba Sing Se. </i><br><br><i>Cut to Sokka kneeling over his pack, as Suki walks up to him.)</i><br><br><b>Suki:</b> Sokka, It's been really great to see you again. <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(standing)</i> Whoa, hold on. Why does it sound like you're saying goodbye?<br><b>Suki: </b>I came along because I wanted to make sure you got through the Serpent's Pass safely. But now I need to get back to the other Kyoshi warriors. <i>(gestures back)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> (<i>stunned) </i>So you came along to protect <i>me</i>? <br><b>Suki:</b> <i>(blushing)</i> Listen, I'm really sorry about last night. <i>(looks askance)</i> We were talking, and saying things, <i>(closes eyes)</i> I just got carried away and before I knew it I... <i>(Sokka surprises her with a tender kiss, draws back)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(gazing into her eyes)</i> You talk too much.<br><br><i>(Both begin kissing passionately. Suki slips her arms around Sokka's neck. The camera pans upward past the rocky cliffs and into blue sky.</i><br><br><i>Fade into a shot of Aang and Momo swooping over an open desert towards the outer wall, nearly disappearing into the distance. Cut to a shot of them soaring up the vertical face of the wall, giving an impression of the walls awesome height as they pass through low clouds. Finally reaching the wall's summit, they perform a backwards loop and glide in for a landing. Aang, with Momo riding on his shoulder, looks serenely out over the wall. Turning to look back, the Avatar's expression changes to shock and dismay.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a ground level shot of the wall's base. As the camera pans away and out to the open desert, we see a formation of approaching vehicles kicking up a huge dust cloud. Various shots show us two groups of Fire nation tanks, dwarfed by the monolithic drilling machine they flank.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(looks sadly to his lemur friend)</i> Sorry Momo, Appa's gonna have to wait.<br><br><i>(Final shot of the towering wall over the back of the approaching drilling machine, fade to white.) </i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

The tanks flanking it appear as little more than insignificant toys by comparison. In another shot we are shown large segments of the drill's body pushing forward under steam power, punching steam driven spikes into the ground, then contracting again to gain forward movement. Nothing can stop us.<br><b>Ty Lee:</b> (<i>looking away from a periscope)</i> Hmm. What about those muscle-y guys down there? <br><br><i>(She looks back into periscope, then cut to a view through the periscope, where Earth kingdom benders are seen dropping into trenches. I have the situation under control. I assure you the Fire Nation cannot penetrate this wall. To stop it, I've sent an elite platoon of earthbenders called the Terra Team.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(thoughtfully)</i> That's a good group name, very catchy.<br><br><i>(Cut to a scene of the Terra Team launching their assault on the Fire nation forces. Panning down, we see that ahead in its path Toph, Aang, Momo, Katara and Sokka are crouched down in one of the Terra Team's abandoned trenches.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(gesturing back towards the Drill)</i> Once I whip up some cover, you're not gonna be able to see, so stay close to me. <br><br><i>(Leaping from the trench, Toph begins a strenuous earthbending gesture that ends with a powerful foot stomp, sending a mighty blast of dust and broken stone rocketing along the ground toward the drill.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Run!<br><br><i>(Racing closely behind Toph, the team plunges into the swirling white dust cloud. I'm sure it's nothing. <i>(Azula looks to Ching doubtfully)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to Toph and the rest running through the thick dust to emerge near the front of the drill. Standing in the drill's shadow, she bends open a pit in the ground.) </i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Everyone into the hole! <br><br><i>(Toph hops down into the hole after the others, and the surface immediately swirls shut above them. The camera pans  down below ground and into utter blackness)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> It's so dark down here, I can't see a thing. <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(feigning horror)</i> Oh no, what a nightmare. <br><b>Sokka:</b> Sorry.<br><br><i>(Cut to the surface, underneath the drill, where the ground bulges upwards and opens up. Toph emerges, followed by the others. They stand underneath the Drill itself, a vast, gloomy region framed by long rows of tracked wheels, with the Drill's body as its ceiling.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(pointing ahead and upwards)</i> There! <br><br><i>(An opening in the Drill's belly is seen, with a narrow length of pipe extending out of it horizontally. Aang leaps up to  catch it and hangs upside down from it by his legs. He catches Katara and then Sokka by the hands, boosting them up into the Drill. There is a pause  and we realize that Toph is not following.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(peeking out upside down from the opening)</i> Toph, Come on! <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(looking resigned)</i> No way am I going in that metal monster. I can't bend in there. I'll try to slow it down out here. <br><b>Sokka:</b> Okay, good luck. <i>(both he and Aang disappear up into the Drill)</i><br><br><i>(Outside, Toph tries unsuccessfully to stop the forward movement of the Drill by bending up an outcropping of stone, but both Toph and the brace are pushed along by the unstoppable force of the Drill's progress.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the Drill's inner corridors, where Sokka leads the others through a red-lit area of pipes and valves.</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(studying the pipes)</i> I need a plan of this machine. Some schematics that show what the inside looks like. Then we can find it's weak points. <br><b>Aang:</b> Where are we gonna get something like that <i>(Sokka abruptly draws his machete and chops off asteam valve)</i> What are you doing! Someone's gonna hear us! <br><br><i>(Aang</i> <i>looks about worriedly as the room begins to fill with steam.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(confidently)</i> That's the point. I figure a machine this big needs engineers to run it, and when something breaks...<br><b>Katara:</b> They come to fix it. <br><br><i>(Aang and Katara exchange pleased smiles. Moments later, a large Fire Nation engineer in a filter mask appears through the steam holding a large wrench and a rolled up document.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(appearing behind him)</i> Hi.<br><br><i>(Katara bends the steam, condensing it into an icy shell that entraps the engineer.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(runs up and takes plans)</i> This'll work, thanks! <br><br><i>(He runs off, leaving the engineer standing helplessly, eventually dropping the wrench in his other hand.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Sokka leading the others up metal stairs, stopping to unroll the plans across a large pipe.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(studying cross-diagram of Drill)</i> It looks like the Drill is made up of two main structures. There's the inner mechanism, where we are now, and the outer shell. <i>(traces his finger along diagram while speaking)</i> The inner part and the outer part are connected by these braces. If we cut through them, the entire thing will collapse.<br><br><i>(Both Aang and Katara nod in agreement and they all race off-screen.</i><br><br><i>Cut to debarkation point for Ba Sing Se, which resembles a large stone train station. People are milling about in groups, and the scene shifts to Zuko and Iroh, who are seated with arms crossed at a waiting area. Jet casually sits down next to Zuko.</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> So, you guys got plans once you're inside the city? <br><b>Tea Peddler:</b> Get your hot tea here! Finest tea in Ba Sing Se!<br><br><i>(All three look up to see a tea merchant pushing a concession cart in front of them.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(waving an arm)</i> Oh! Jasmine, please. <i>(the peddler pours tea into Iroh's bowl, who delightedly takes a sip. His eyes widen in shock and he spits it out in disgust)</i> Blaugh! Ugh. <i>Coldest</i> tea in Ba Sing Se is more like it. What a disgrace!<br><b>Jet:</b> Hey, can I talk to you for a second? <i><br><br>(Jet gestures for Zuko, who seems to be ignoring the tea episode, to follow him. Zuko rises reluctantly and sighs.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(walking away from where Iroh sits)</i> You and I have a much better chance of making it in the city if we stick together. You want to join the Freedom Fighters? <b></b><br><b>Zuko:</b> Thanks, but I don't think you want me in your gang.<br><b>Jet:</b> Come on, we made a great team looting that Captain's food. Think of all the good we could do for these refugees.<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(turning and walking back towards Iroh)</i> I said no.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(mildly surprised)</i> Have it your way.<br><br><i>(Jet focuses in on the seated Iroh, who is carefully enjoying the tea now steaming vigorously in his cup. Jet suddenly bristles and his eyes open wide in shock, realizing what he is seeing. Reaching Iroh, Zuko looks back toward Jet, who now wears a look of hostile suspicion on his face. Jet turns and walks off.</i><br><br><i>Watching Jet leave, Zuko abruptly turns and dashes the cup of tea from his uncle's hand.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(surprised)</i> Hey!<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(whispering through gritted teeth)</i> What are you doing firebending your tea?! For a wise old man, that was a pretty stupid move.<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(mournfully)</i> I know you're not supposed to cry over spilled tea, but... <i>(Iroh sniffles and the cup is shown overturned in a puddle) </i> that's so sad. <br><br><i>(Cut to another aerial view of the approaching Drill and its tank escort. Scene changes to the interior of Drill, with Sokka leading the others out a doorway and onto a massive steel beam.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(studying plans) </i>Wow, it looks a lot thicker in person than it does in the plans. We're going to have to work pretty hard to cut through that. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(crossing arms)</i> What's this <i>we</i> stuff? Aang and I are going to have to do all the work.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(turns and gestures to self)</i> Look, I'm the plan guy, You two <i>(makes rapid chop-chop gestures)</i> are the "cut stuff up with waterbending" guys. <i>(strikes a heroic pose)</i> Together, we're Team Avatar! <br><br><i>(Aang and Katara exchange mortified looks. Katara is then shown bending the water out of her flask, sending it to ring against the edge of a vertical beam before being caught by Aang, who bends it back towards her along the same path. As the water zings back in forth, a cut begins to form in the side of the thick beam. Wearing looks of strenuous concentration, Aang and Katara again and again send the water scything back through the diagonal cut. Moving forward to a point where the cut has reached the midway point through the beam, Katara and Aang are shown bent over and gasping with exhaustion.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(pumping arms in the air)</i> C'mon team, don't quit now, we're... <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(explodes with frustration)</i> Grrrrrr! <i>(shoots a menacing glare back at Sokka, who stands  wide-eyed, arms still in air)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> I mean, <i>(recovers and points reassuringly)</i> you're almost there. <br><br><i>(The two of them resume slicing away at the girder little by little. Sokka watches on, an eager look of anticipation growing on his face. Finally the beam is cut completely in two, and the upper section grinds down the angled cut a few inches before screeching to a halt.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(clearlyexhausted)</i> At this rate, we won't do enough damage before the drill reaches the wall. <br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(sitting down to rest)</i> I don't know how many more of those I have in me. <br><br><i>(An ominous shudder and low moan passes down the length of the Drill.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Do you hear that We took it down. We better get out of here fast! <br><br><i>(As they race away, they pause at a doorway as a voice comes down from overhead speaking tubes.)</i><br><br><b>War Minister Qin:</b> Congratulations crew, the Dill has made contact with the wall of Ba Sing Se. <br><br><i>(Cut to view of Qin in the command center)</i> Start the countdown to victory!<br><br><i>Azula is shown with an unreadable expression on her face, Followed by the Drill's titanic bit penetrating into the surface of the outer wall.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The scene opens with a high aerial view of the Drill as it starts to bore into the outer wall. A different view shows the  rubble from the wall being saturated with moisture as it is conveyed backwards through the Drill. The camera follows the slurry back through a thick pipe to where Sokka is shown struggling futilely against the severed girder.) </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(grimacing)</i> C'mon brace, budge!<br><br><i>(Camera pans back to show everyone else resting on the large horizontal beam, while Sokka makes several efforts to push the severed one.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> This is bad, really bad.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Were putting everything we've got into busting these braces, but it's taking too long!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(suddenly inspired)</i> Maybe we don't need to cut all the way through. Toph has been teaching me that you shouldn't give 100% of your energy into any one strike. <i>(levitates to hisfeet)</i> Sokka, take a fighting stance.You've gotta be quick and accurate. <i>(hooks a foot around one of Sokka's ankles, pulling him off balance)</i> Hit a series of points, and break your opponent's stance.<i>(hits Sokka with a series of pretend blows)</i> And when he's reeling back, you deliver the final blow. <i>(bonks him lightly on the head)</i> His own weight becomes his downfall. Literally. <i>(A he finishes speaking, Sokka collapses</i> <i<br>>forward comically.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> So we just need to weaken the braces, instead of cut all the way through.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(pointing upward)</i> Then I'll go to the top of this thing, and deliver the final blow. <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(raising arms)</i> And boom, it all comes crashing down! <i>(sweeps arms down)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(passionately)</i> Everyone inside that wall, the whole world, is counting on us. <br><b>Sokka:</b> The whole world, minus the Fire Nation that is. <br><br><i>(Sokka grins, while others look on exasperated.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the underside of the Drill, where Toph still struggles mightily to slow its advance with a stone brace, which merely results in a pile of loose earth growing behind her feet as both she and the brace are drug along.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(straining)</i> C'mon twinkle toes, hurry up!<br><br><i>(Back inside the Drill's superstructure, we are shown scenes of Katara and Aang inflicting cuts into various support beams.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> That's enough, we need to get to the next one!<br><br><i>(Cut to the outside, as earthbender's push wave after wave of boulders from the top of the outer wall. They ring harmlessly off of its hull and drop to the side. Cut to the Drill command center, where Azula , War Minister Qin and the rest of the crew listen to messages coming from the various speaking tubes.)</i><br><br><b>Speaking Tube 1:</b> <i>(alarmed)</i> War Minister, an engineer was ambushed! His schematics were stolen! <i>(The War Minister looks shocked, while Azulas eyes narrow in suspicion.)</i><br><b>Speaking Tube 2:</b> <i>(alarmed)</i> War Minister, a brace on the starboard side has been cut clean through! It's sabotage sir! <i>(The War Minister is frozen in terror, watching Azula from the corners of his eyes.) </i><br><b>Azula: </b><i>(turning from Qin to Mai and Ty Lee)</i> Let's go ladies.<br><br><i>(Cut to the Drill's superstructure, where Aang and Katara continue their sabotage.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(Encouragingly)</i> Good work Team Avatar. Now Aang just needs to... <i>(glances up)</i> DUCK! <br><br><i>(He ducks and covers just in time to avoid a blast of blue flame. Azula, Mai and Ty Lee run out onto another massive girder well above Aang and friends.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(narrowly avoiding a second blast)</i> Whoa!<br><b>Ty Lee:</b> Wow Azula, you were right, it is the Avatar! <i>(smiles seductively)</i> ... and friends. <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(smiles vacantly and waves)</i> Hey. <br><br><i>(Katara marches past and yanks him off camera. As her allies rush off camera to pursue, Ty Lee drops to the bottom edge of the girder and swings out towards Aang, who throws her backwards with a gust of wind. Aang and his friends are shown fleeing down corridors, when Aang comes to a halt at a T intersection.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Guys get out of here, I know what I need to do. <i>(heads other direction with Momo)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Wait! You need this water more than I do! <br><br><i>(As Aang turns, she draws out her flask of bending water and throws it to him. Sokka and Katara rush down a corridor, while Aang and Momo head the opposite direction.)</i><br><br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(reaching intersection)</i> Follow them, the Avatar is mine. <i>(Azula races off after Aang, while Mai and Tai Lee pursue the others)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Sokka reaching a dead end, with a large hatch marked by a sign written in Chinese.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(as Sokka struggles with hatch)</i> Slurry pipeline What does that mean? <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(finally opening hatch, peering into it with Katara)</i> It's rock and water mixed together, it means our way out. <br><br><i>(As Katara begins to lower herself into the slurry pipe, Mai and Ty Lee suddenly arrive on the scene. Katara lets go and plunges in followed by Sokka, just as Mai's throwing knives ricochet off the open slurry hatch. Both splash into the slurry neck-deep and are quickly swept away by the current. Cut back to Mai looking down into the slurry flow.)</i><br><br><b>Mai:</b> <i>(completely revolted)</i> Ughh, disgusting!<br><b>Ty  Lee:</b> <i>(peering down)</i> Come on, you heard Azula.We <i>have</i> to follow them.<br><b>Mai:</b> She can shoot all the lightning she wants at me, I am not going in that wall sludge juice. <br><br><i>(Mai shudders. Ty Lee hops down into the slurry flow, sending up a great spash that narrowly misses Mai. With a final expression of disgust Mai slams closed the slurry hatch. </i><br><br><i>Cut to scene of Aang racing through the Drill's engineering section with airbending speed, past engineers who barely detect him through their respirator masks. Aang finally races up a long ladder toward the Drill's surface.</i><br><br><i>Cut to an overview of the Drill showing a large pool of slurry starting to form at its rear. Screaming with fear, Sokka and Katara ride the cascade of slurry out the rear spout of the Drill, sliding to a halt in the grayish ooze. <br><br>Sokka tries to wipe the revolting stuff off of his tongue, pounds his fists into the slurry in disgust. Ty Lee emerges from pipe exhaust, riding waist deep in  the slurry flow with a look of wicked anticipation on her face. Just as she is about to reach the ground, Katara bends back the rush of slurry, pinning Ty Lee at the terminus of the pipe.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(fiercely)</i> Why don't you try blocking my chi now circus freak! <i>(stands resolutely with one hand upraised)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> Katara, keep that up. The pressure will build up in the drill, then when Aang delivers the final blow, it will be ready to pop!<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang and Momo emerging from an opening onto the Drill's upper hull. The pair start racing towards the front of the Drill, which has already penetrated deep into the wall.)  </i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(pausing)</i> This looks like a good spot Momo. <i>(glances up, and barely avoids the large boulder that bounces off where he was standing)</i> Aggh! <br><br><i>(dodges a second and third boulder as they continue to rain down from above)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(shouting upward)</i> General Sung, tell your soldiers to stop shooting rocks down here!<br><b>General Sung:</b> <i>(looking down from a great height, he apparently doesn't hear)</i> Soldiers, whatever you do, don't stop shooting rocks down there! <br><br><i>(Sung draws his hands up to his face in distress, while the row of benders next to him release another volley of boulders.</i><br><br><i>Below, Aang vaults past this new wave of stones, and as he lands, begins rapidly scything the surface of the drill with the water Katara gave to him. The camera pans the entire length of the Drill. At its rear, Katara continues to block the pipe's exhaust with a slurry ball containing Ty Lee.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(in lecturing tone)</i> Good technique little sister! Keep it up! Don't forget to breathe!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(losing temper) </i>You know, I am just about sick and tired of you telling me what to do all day. You're like a chattering Hog-Monkey!<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(screaming)</i> Just bend the slurry woman!!<br><br><i>(Katara bends up a rush of slurry with her free hand, launching him up to plunge back down into the foul muck.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(emerging from beneath the Drill)</i> You guys need some help? <br><b>Katara:</b> Toph, help me plug up this drain!<br><br><i>(Bracing her muddy legs she coordinates with Katara, driving the slurry-plug even further up the pipe. Switching to an internal view of the Drill, we see the slurry pipe system begin to buckle and swell under the pressure.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the front of the Drill, where fountains of slurry begin to jet where the Drill meets the wall. Nearby Aang  continues to rapidly cut away at the outer hull in an X pattern.) </i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(winded)</i> What I'd give to be a metal bender. <br><br><i>(Momo, perched on Aang's shoulder, turns and give out a warning cry, allowing Aang to turn and deflect a deadly blast of blue fire. Momo narrowly avoids the flame.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Momo, get out of here! <br><br><i>(Momo flies off as Aang assumes a stance.</i><br><br><i>The camera follows Azula's shadow to Azula herself, as she readies a stance with a look of steady confidence, then back to Aang who looks nowhere near as sure of himself. It pulls back to show the two benders facing off about a dozen yards apart atop the Drill. Azula begins by launching a ball of fire at Aang, who ducks and simultaneously sends an arc of wind towards her. Leaping over the windblast, Azula once again attacks, but is forced to counter a rapid series of water-whips that keep slapping away her attack gestures. Leaping into the air, Azula delivers a pair of flying firebending kicks that completely vaporize the water Aang was bending sending him spinning back. She is prevented from pressing the attack however, as another barrage of boulders from above force both of them to dodge. Aang catches one of the boulders with bending, sending it hurtling at Azula who falls into a split to avoid it, rises, and launches another fire blast. Aang earthbends pieces of debris into a protective wall, then punches chunks of it toward Azula. Kicking them out of the air, she launches a sweeping counter blast which barely misses Aang's head, who responds by punching an even larger chunk towards her. Vaulting into the air, Azula executes an incredible forward spinning double-kick fire blast, obliterating his defensive wall and hurtling him backwards to slam against the outer wall. </i><br><br><i>Readying another attack, Azula pauses as she sees the Avatar drop to his knees and slump forward unconscious. Aang is seen from above sprawled against the Drill's hull. Azula is jarred by the forward advance of the drill, and the massive bit is shown bursting through the other side of the outer wall. Cuts to an overview showing the great Drill piercing completely through the wall, then back to a shot of Aang being slowly pulled underneath the walls exterior by the forward progress of the Drill. Azula grabs him by the back of his collar and presses him upright against the wall. Aang slowly begins to rouse, and the camera switches to Aang's point of view as we see a blurry Azula preparing to deliver the final blow. Closeup of Aang's eye snapping open in alarm, then his right hand cracking open the surface of the wall and surrounding itself with a mitt of broken rock. He catches Azula's fire punch in the rock mitt and shoves her far back with it, her steel shod boots sparking against the Drill's hull. Aang strikes a defiant earthbending stance as Azula charges towards him, both hands ablaze.</i><br><br><i>The battle is suddenly interrupted by a blast of slurry that erupts at the point where the Drill meets the wall, throwing Aang from his feet before surging out to crash against the onrushing Azula. Aang flails about trying to regain his feet, and just manages to make it to his knees before Azula, arms windmilling, skates helplessly through the slop to send them both careening into the wall. Knocked momentarily senseless, they both slide face-first through the slurry and away from the wall, diverging to slip down opposite sides of the Drill. Recovering, Azula tries to stop her descent using her hands and feet, her steel-toed boots sparking. She manages to stop herself midway down the side of the Drill, clutching at it precariously. Aang meanwhile slides down his back, his rock mitt breaking apart as he tries to stop himself with it. He is rescued by Momo, swooping down, catching the back of his collar and pulling him upright so that he can use his swift-running technique to regain the top of the Drill. Aang leaps back onto the back of the Drill, and Momo settles on his shoulder.) </i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(scratchingMomo's head)</i> Thanks Momo, I owe you one.<br><br><i>(Aang walks along the Drill's back, through the slurry mess, to stop at the X cut into the plating.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Now all I need is a... <i>(boulder crashes down startling him)</i> Actually, that is what I needed for once. <br><br><i>(Bending the boulder around to the incision, he begins a series of sweeping earthbending moves, each one slicing away a large chunk of the boulder. Eventually he is left with a large stone spike pointed down into the breach. Aang drops back, falls into a sprinter's stance and starts running toward the wall. Nearing it he bends up a ball of air and leaps atop it, riding up the sheer face of the outer wall. As he rockets up the wall the ball dissipates, and Aang begins to run up the vertical face. As his momentum falls away, he turns and we see that Aang has nearly reached the top of the outer wall, the Drill far below him.</i><br><br><i>With a powerful shout Aang completes his turn and wind-sprints downward at a fantastic speed. Meanwhile, Azula having  finally crawled back up to the top of the Drill,  spots Aang streaking down face of the wall. With a shout, Aang leaps free of the wall and plunges downward, as we cut to Azula preparing a potent blast to intercept him. Her attack passes just over Aang's head as he strikes the spike with incredible force. The explosive shockwave hurls a screaming Azula through the air as it travels the length of the Drill. Cut to the superstructure of the Drill, where we see weakened beams begin to shear in half as torrents of slurry rush past. Cut to an exterior view of the entire Drill, as a chain of slurry eruptions begin at the front segment and work their way towards the rear. Cut to Toph and Katara, still in bending stances, with Sokka standing behind them.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Here it comes! <i>(begins raising the three of them up on a pillar of rock)</i><br><br><i>(As the rock pillar rises from the lake of slurry, a great rush of it issues from the exhaust spout. Ty Lee is washed up against the pillar, slammed against it and held there by the powerful current. Safe atop the pillar, Toph and the Water siblings watch as one by one the segments of the Drill slump to a stop, great clouds of steam rising from them. On the other side of the wall we see the massive bit slowly stop rotating. Cut to a high aerial view showing the remains of the steaming drill nearly submerged in slurry. Cut back to a mud-covered Aang standing atop of the stone spike, as the sun sets in the background.</i><br><br><i>Wiping the mud from his face, he reveals an enormous grin. Momo lands on his muddy shoulder and starts licking the slurry from his forehead. Cut to a view through the mud-covered windshield of the Drill command center. As the mud slides away it reveals War Minister Qin, standing with an expression of horror and amazement. In another shot we follow a long streak of mud that had exploded up the face of the wall. General Sung stands there completely covered in mud, as it drips away to reveal the pathetic expression on his face.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Ty Lee sitting up from the slurry pool, wiping clear her face, and spitting out a mouthful of mud in disgust. Azula slides down the back of the Drill, dropping down next to her and splashing her with a fresh layer of mud. Azula looks back to see a steaming hatch open in the rear of the drill, revealing a somber Mai.)</i><br><br><b>Mai:</b> We lost. <br><br><i>(Cut to the Train Station where an ornate stone train has arrived to pick up passengers.)</i><br><br><b>Conductor:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Last call for Ba Sing se!<br><br><i>(Cut to Jet striding angrily toward the train, flanked by Smellerbee and Longshot.)</i><br><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> Jet, relax! So the old guy had some hot tea. Big deal. <br><b>Jet:</b> He heated it himself! <i>(close-up of furious Jet)</i> Those guys are firebenders. <br><br><i>(Cut to a scene of the train, showing Iron and Zuko boarding a car in the background, pulling back to show Jet, Smellerbee and Longshot watching them. Jet raises his collar and Longshot pulls down his hat as they attempt to look inconspicuous as they board a few cars down.</i><br><br><i>Cut to train car interior as Zuko and Iroh enter, where we see Than and family already seated. Zuko sits down with his arms crossed, still obviously angry. Iroh, sitting down between Zuko and Ying, glances at his nephew before leaning over and smiling at Ying. She is cradling a sleeping Hope in her lap while a grinning Than has his arm draped over her shoulders.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> What a handsome baby. <i>(tickles her blanket with his finger)</i><br><b>Ying:</b> Thank you. <br><br><i>(The camera closes in on Hope's peacefully sleeping face while her mother beams over her.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the rear of the train, as two earthbenders begin to scoot it forward with a grinding noise. We follow the train out of the station. The scene cuts back to show the train traveling on a raised track over sunset lit fields.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Toph, Aang, Momo, Sokka and Katara watching the sun set over the barrens from atop the outer wall.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(enthusiastically)</i> I just want to say, good effort out there today Team Avatar. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(slightly annoyed)</i> Enough with the Team Avatar stuff. No matter how many times you say it, it's not gonna catch on. <br><b>Sokka:</b> How about... <i>(whips out boomerang, startling Momo)</i> the "Boomerang Squad!", see it's good cause it's got "Aang" in it. <i>(puts hand on Aang's head </i> Boomer-Aang.<br><b>Aang:</b> I kinda like that one.<br><b>Katara:</b> Let's talk about this on our way into the city. <br><br><i>(She and the others start walking away.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> The "Aang Gang"?  <br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka.<br><b>Sokka: </b>The "Fearsome Foursome"?<br><b>Toph:</b> You're crazy.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(now alone)</i> Why? We're fearsome! <br><br><i>(Sokka races after them. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

They look up at the monorail tracks above as a car slides past, pushed by two earthbenders. Cut to inside the car, where Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph and Momo are awaiting their arrival at Ba Sing Se. Katara looks out the window and spots the inner wall of the capital drawing closer.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Look, the inner wall. Cut to a close shot of the bear gorging. He pulls his head away as Toph, Katara and Long Feng walk into the hall.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> It's beautiful, isn't it? By the way, I'm Long Feng. I'm a cultural minister to the king.<br><b>Katara:</b> I'm Kwa mai, and this is Dung. <i>(Toph frowns and tugs at a string hanging from Katara's headdress.)</i> Ow!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> Now where is your family? I'd love to meet them. <br><b>Katara:</b> Um... I don't see 'em right now. But I'm sure we'll find them soon. Thanks for all your help.<br><br><i>(Katara and Toph walk away from Long Feng. A moment later, Long Feng mysteriously appears in front of the two girls.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> Don't worry, as your escort it would be dishonorable to abandon you ladies without finding your families first. We'll keep looking.<br><br><i>(Long Feng turns around and begins leading Toph and Katara.</i><br><br><i>Cut to outside the palace. Two guards are stationed at the gates. The camera zooms out and Aang peeks around the pedestal of a statue of a lion. Cut to a shot of Aang and Sokka peeking around both sides of the pedestal.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Where are they? <br><br><i>(Aang and Sokka duck back behind the pedestal. Momo is there with them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Look, I came up with a backup plan. <i>(picks Momo up by the armpits </i> We dress Momo like a ghost, OK? <i>(begins waving Momo through the air)</i> He flies by the guards creating a distraction, then we blast a hole in the wall... <i>(Aang stands up and peers over the pedestal)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> Or, we could go in with these guys. Toph said we might pass as busboys.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a carriage parked in front of the gate. Sokka peeks over the pedestal and the camera zooms in on a few busboys unloading supplies from the back of it and bringing them inside. Cut to a shot of Sokka and Aang. Momo is clinging to Sokka's head.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> OK, but remember that Momo ghost plan. I think it's a winner. <br><br><i>(Sokka and Aang sink back behind the pedestal.</i><br><br><i>Shift scenes to outside the tea shop. Zuko bursts through the door and tumbles into the street. Jet runs after him and does a few spins before striking at Zuko with both swords. Zuko manages to block the strike and both combatants lock swords.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You must be getting tired of using those swords. Why don't you go ahead and firebend at me. <br><br><i>(They both struggle to gain control and walk off to the side. Iroh is standing in the doorway and watching, worried. Off screen, the sound of swords clanging and the fighters grunting is heard.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> Please son, you're confused. You don't know what you're doing! <br><br><i>(Cut back to Zuko and Jet. Zuko swings at Jet, but Jet catches Zuko's broad sword with the ends of his hook swords, spins around and deflects it to the side. Zuko spins with it and tries to counter attack, but Jet hooks the ends of his swords together and begins them at Zuko in large circular motions. Zuko retreats back a few steps to avoid the bladed hilt.)</i><br><br><b>Jet: </b>Bet you wish he'd help you out with a little fire blast right now. <br><br><i>(As Jet swings at Zuko's feet, Zuko stabs one of his broad swords through the hilt, pinning it to the ground. Jet looks at it with annoyance before focusing back on Zuko.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> You're the one who needs help. <br><br><i>(Both fighters are down to one sword each. Jet lets go of his pinned hook sword and retreats a step. He turns in a circle and tries to swipe at Zuko, but Zuko quickly advances and swings his sword at Jet in a horizontal motion. Jet pulls his attack just in time to bend backward and avoid Zuko's blade. The scene goes into slow motion as Zuko's broad sword passes over Jet, cutting the wheat straw sticking out of Jet's mouth in half. The scene replays, only this time the shot is a close up of the wheat straw.</i><br><br><i>The scene goes back to normal speed as Jet regains balance and jumps backward on to the edge of a well. By now several people are in the street watching the fight.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You see that? The Fire Nation is trying to silence me. It'll never happen. <br><br><i>(Jet hooks his sword on to a wooden beam above the well and swings forward at Zuko, attacking him with a flying kick.</i><br><br><i>Shift scenes back to inside the palace. Aang and Sokka are dressed as busboys and are serving guests. Aang is pouring a drink and Sokka is serving food on a plate. Both of them stand back to back. Momo's tail is sticking out from under Aang's hat.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Where are Toph and Katara? <br><b>Sokka:</b> Forget about them, just keep an eye out for the King. <br><br><i>(Momo's tail rises up to Sokka's face and begins wagging back and forth.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I don't know what he looks like. <br><b>Sokka:</b> You know, "royal", flowing robe, fancy jewelry. <br><br><i>(Sokka grabs Momo's tail forcibly, causing the hair on it to stand up on end. Cut to a panning right shot of the crowd of guests, who all fit Sokka's description.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> That could be anyone.<br><br><i>(The camera cuts back to Aang, then quickly pans right to show Toph standing right next to him.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Another crab puff please.<br><b>Aang:</b> You found us. <br><b>Toph:</b> I'd know your little footsteps anywhere Twinkletoes.<br><br><i>(Sokka smiles and presents his tray to Toph, who grabs a crab puff and begins to nibble on it. Katara joins the group. Aang blushes when he sees her.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Thanks for letting us in.<br><b>Katara:</b> Sorry, but the guy who escorted us in, won't let us out of his sight. <br><br><i>(Sokka peers behind Katara, trying to spot the escort.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> What guy?<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the group. Long Feng is nowhere in sight. Joo Dee approaches the group from off screen. Her normally cheerful demeanor is replaced with anxiety.)</i><br><br><b>Joo Dee:</b> What are you doing here? You have to leave immediately, or we'll all be in terrible trouble.<br><br><i>(Joo Dee tries to push Sokka out of the way, but he blocks her with his tray.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Not until we see the King.<br><b>Joo Dee:</b> You don't understand. You must go. <br><br><i>(Joo Dee shoves Sokka into Aang, causing him to spill the contents of the pitcher he is holding on to a guest.)</i><br><br><b>Female Guest:</b> Aarrhhh! Oh!<br><b>Aang:</b> Sorry! No, don't shout. <br><br><i>(Aang uses his hands and foot to airbend a gust at the guest. His hat is blown off, along with Momo. It dries her off, but also turns her hair, clothes and makeup into a mess. Aang smiles sheepishly. The guest is briefly shocked, but smiles in amazement.)</i><br><br><b>Female Guest:</b> <i>(inawe) </i> The Avatar. Ooh, I didn't known the <i>Avatar</i> would be here.<br><br><i>(All the guests' attention is now focused on Aang. Joo Dee's large, happy smile quickly turns sour and is replaced by a frown and a look of pure dread. Aang looks around at the guests as Momo hides back under the hat on the floor and slinks away. Aang blushes and waves at the crowd, laughing nervously. Sokka leans in towards Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(whispering)</i>You keep their attention while I look for the King. <br><b>Aang:</b> Watch this everybody!<br><br><i>(Aang leap out of his busboy clothes and on to the long dining table as Sokka walks off into the crowd. Aang swings his arms over the guests' drinks, waterbending the liquid out of the cups. He jumps onto a pitcher and balances on top of it. Aang brings the liquid above his head and creates a swirling multicolored ball. The crowd 'oohs' at the spectacle. The king's bear growls with delight at Aang's antics.</i><br><br><i>Cut to outside the tea shop. Zuko growls as he swings his broadsword at Jet. Jet parries the attack and steps to Zuko's side and the two end up back to back. The camera orbits around Zuko and Jet as they attempt to strike at the opponent behind them, but neither can get past the other's defense. Cut to a shot of two Dai Li walking through the crowd and towards the swordfight.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Lee Guard 1</b>: Drop your weapons!<br><br><i>(Zuko and Jet step away and face each other. Zuko lowers his sword and Jet points at Zuko and Iroh.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> Arrest them. They're Firebenders. <br><b>Iroh:</b> This poor boy is confused. We're just simple refugees. <br><b>Tea shop owner:</b> <i>(pointing at Jet) </i>This young man wrecked my tea shop, and assaulted my employees. <br><b>Officer:</b> It's true sir. We saw the whole thing. This crazy kid attacked the finest tea maker in the city. <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(blushing) </i> Oh ho ho. That's very sweet. <br><br><i>(The two Dai Li walk up behind Jet, who looks at them angrily.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Lee Guard 2:</b> Come with us son.<br><br><i>(Jet swings his hook sword at the Dai Li guard, but he catches the sword with his hand covered in stones. The guard then disarms Jet and both guards pull the boy's arms behind his back, binding his wrists together using the stones on the palms of their gloves. They drag Jet away towards a wagon designed for holding captured criminals.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You don't understand! They're Fire Nation! You have to believe me! <br><br><i>(Zuko and Iroh watch as Jet is being put into the wagon. The crowd begins to disperse. On his knees, Jet looks up as the doors slam shut. The people left in the street watch the wagon roll away. Longshot and Smellerbee look on, hidden within the crowd, and silently walk out of sight.</i><br><br><i>Shift scenes to the palace. Two lines of guards walk into the hall. Eight of them are carrying a curtained platform. The Earth King sits quietly on the platform, and though the curtain veils him from view, a close up reveals his appearance. He has a young, pointed face and narrow eyes. A pair of round spectacles rests on his nose, and he dresses in traditional Earth Kingdom colors and patterns. Cut to a shot of the crowd as they marvel in the presence of their host and ruler. The camera pans left as Sokka sneaks through the crowd and attempts to get a better view of the king. Cut to the line of guards as they place the platform down and face the guests. Sokka looks over at Aang and points at the earth King.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Aang, the Earth King. <br><br><i>(The camera quickly shifts to Aang, who is entertaining the king's bear with some waterbending. Noticing him, Aang bends an air scooter and whisks down the table.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Greetings your majesty. <br><br><i>(Three guests pull their food and drinks off the table before Aang can run over them with his air scooter. Cut back to the procession of guards and the Earth King. The platform is carried off while a line of guards walk up to the long dining table. Sokka exits the crowd and tries to follow the king, but two Dai Li guards grab him and begin leading him away, pulling his arms behind his back.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, let me go.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a pillar in the hall. A Dai Li steps out from behind it and throws his hands out, causing the stones covering his hands to fly forward. Cut to Katara and Toph. While Katara is looking away, the stone gloves of the Dai Li grab Toph and pull her backward, covering her mouth to keep her silent. A second later, another pair of stone gloves grabs Katara and pulls her back. Cut to a Dai Li guard standing watch. The camera shifts down to show Momo still hiding under the busboy hat and trying to sneak past, his ear and tail sticking out from under. The Dai Li reaches down and pulls the hat off. Momo looks up with surprise.</i><br><br><i>Shift back to Aang who has reached the other end of the dining table on his air scooter, knocking over several dishes. He dismounts the scooter and holds his arms up in triumph. Long Feng walks up to Aang from behind the line of guards and addresses him.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> Avatar, it is a great honor to meet you. I am Long Feng, Grand Secretary of Ba Sing Se and head of the Dai Li. I'd like to talk to you. Your friends will be waiting for us in the library.<br><br><i>(Long Feng gestures for Aang to follow him and heads toward the library. Aang hesitates for a moment before hopping off the table and following. Cut to a shot of the library's large double doors shutting. The camera zooms out to show Aang and his friends facing Long Feng, who is sitting in front of a hearth that illuminates the area with a green flame.</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Why won't you let us talk to the King? We have information that could defeat the Fire Nation!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> The Earth King has no time to get involved with political squabbles and the day to day minutia of military activities.<br><b>Aang:</b> This could be the most important thing he has ever heard.<br><br><i>(The camera shifts behind Aang's party and pans slowly to the right. Long Feng is always visible seated in front of them as the camera passes by each member.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> What's most important to his royal majesty is maintaining the cultural heritage of Ba Sing Se. All his duties relate to issuing decrees on such matters. It's <i>my</i> job to oversea the rest of the city's resources, including the military.<br><b>Katara:</b> So the King is just a figurehead.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(furious)</i> He's your puppet!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> Oh, no, no! His majesty is an icon, a god to his people. He can't sully his hands with the hourly change of an endless war.<br><b>Sokka:</b> But we found out about a solar eclipse that will leave the Fire Nation defenseless. You could lead an invasion...<br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(stands up suddenly, cutting Sokka off)</i> Enough, I don't want to hear your ridiculous plan! <i>(there is a brief shot of Sokka with a confused and hurt expression)</i> It is the strict policy of Ba Sing Se that the war not be mentioned within the walls. Constant news of an escalating war will throw the citizens of Ba Sing Se into a state of panic.<br><br><i>(The scene fades to white and shifts to a dark, stone room. A ray a light shines through under a door. The door slides open and two of the Dai Li drag Jet inside, sitting him in a stone chair at the other side. They bind his arms down using square stones similar to the stones that make up the Dai Li's gloves.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> You have to believe me, they're firebenders! They won't stop until they win the war. <br><br><i>(Several square stones circle Jet's head and clamp down on his skull, holding it in place.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Li Agent:</b> Calm down, you're safe now.<br><br><i>(The Dai Li agent stands in front of Jet, surrounded by a metal track. From behind him appears a small orange lantern attached to the track. It travels around the track and passes the camera, causing a white flash that cuts back to Long Feng.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> Our economy would be ruined. Our peaceful way of life, our traditions would disappear.<br><br><i>(There is another white flash and the scene shifts back to the lamp circling the Dai Li agent.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Li:</b> There's no war in Ba Sing Se.<br><b>Jet:</b> What are you talking about? Where do you think all the refugees come from? You can't hide it.<br><br><i>(Jet can only watch as the lamp passes by his face. The screen flashes white and cuts back to Long Feng.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> In silencing talk of conflict, Ba Sing Se remains a peaceful, orderly utopia. The last one on Earth.<br><br><i>(Aang and his friends can only stare at Long Feng with a mix of shock and horror at this revelation. The screen flashes white again. Cut to a close up of Jet. A circle of stones covers his mouth, muffling his protests. The lamp passes by his eyes again. Cut to a shot of the Dai Li agent standing within the circular track as the lamp revolves.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Li:</b> There is no war within the walls. Here we are safe. Here we are free.<br><br><i>(Jet's eyes widen and his protests become silent as the hypnosis begins to affect him. The screen flashes, then cut to Aang and his friends.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You can't keep the truth from all these people. They have to know.<br><br><i>(Aang steps forward and points a finger at Long Feng.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(defiantly)</i> I'll tell them. I'll make sure everyone knows!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> Until now, you've been treated as our honored guest. <i>(steps forward and bends down to look Aang in the eye. Aang stares back at Long Feng with loathing)</i> But from now on, you will be watched every moment by Dai Li agents. If you mention the war to anyone, you will be expelled from the city. <i>(turns around and walks over to the hearth with the green fire)</i> I understand you've been looking for your bison. It would be quite a shame if you were not able to complete your quest. <i>(Aang appears frightened for a moment, but his expression changes to that of silent anger)</i> Now Joo Dee will show you home.<br><br><i>(Long Feng sits back down as the library doors open and Joo Dee walks in. Cut to a shot from behind Joo Dee as she faces Aang's party. Her hair is a different style than before. The group looks at her with surprise. They do not recognize this woman.)</i><br><br><b>Joo Dee 2:</b> Come with me, please.<br><b>Katara:</b> What happened to Joo Dee?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Joo Dee 2's face. She is clearly not the same Joo Dee that showed Aang around Ba Sing Se.)</i><br><br><b>Joo Dee 2:</b> I'm Joo Dee. I'll be your host as long as you're in our wonderful city.<br><br><i>(Joo Dee 2 smiles cheerfully at the group in the same artificial way as her predecessor. The screen fades to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

It then cuts to a shot of Aang's head in a mirror covered with shaving cream as he shaves it off with a razor blade. Shot pans left to Sokka's head in the mirror to show he has a few hairs growing above his lip which he cuts off with the end of his machete. He then clicks his tongue and points at his reflection. Camera pans left again to show Katara in the mirror as she fixes together her hair loops. Once they are placed, she smiles and the camera cuts back to show the whole room, with them all staring at the mirror, and Momo off to the side on a stool giving himself to bath like a cat. Shot cuts to a dark room where, Toph, her hair a horrible mess, lays face-down on her bed, her blanket sloppily laying over her. A sliver of light cuts through the darkness as the door opens. Katara enters the room and gasps at the sight.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Huh! Toph, aren't you gonna to get ready for the day?<br><br><i>(Toph whips her head up causing her wild bed-head-hair to fly about. She quickly spits a large loogy into a nearby spittoon which spins upon impact. Cut to Katara's face as she looks shocked, then cut back to Toph as she gets to her feet and brushes a large amount of dust off her sleeping shirt.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I'm ready.<br><b>Katara:</b> You're not gonna wash up? You've got a little dirt on your... everywhere actually.<br><b>Toph:</b> You call it dirt. I call it a healthy coating of earth.<br><b>Katara:</b> Hmmm. You know what we need? A girl's day out!<br><b>Toph:</b> Do I <i>have</i> to?<br><b>Katara:</b> It'll be fun.<br><br><i>(Cut to outside of a large building that is decorated with pictures of flowers and plants, Toph and Katara stand near the entrance. Fancily dressed woman in beautiful robes walk out and smile at each other.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> The Fancy Lady Day Spa? Sounds like my kinda place.<br><b>Katara:</b> Are you ready for some serious pampering?<br><b>Toph:</b> Sure Katara, whatever you say. As long as they don't touch my feet.<br><br><i>(They walk in, Toph with her head hung low. Cut to an interior shot where Katara sits happily having her feet scrubbed. Shot cuts again to a close-up of Toph's foot as the attendants, who have to hold the girl down, are hard at work trying to scrape the massive amounts of dirt off her feet. A close up of Toph's angry face show she isn't pleased with this.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Arrrr! Rrrrr! Errrr!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of an empty hallway within the spa as suddenly an explosion of dust erupts from one of the doorways as the frame is crumpled and an attendant flies out and hits the opposite wall, Toph having just performed some earthbending apparently out of annoyance. The shot cuts to Toph and Katara each taking mud baths, with mud covering their faces in a mask, cucumber slices over their eyes, and their heads rapped in towels. An attendant with arms full of fresh towels walks over to Toph. Cut to Toph's face as she breaths in then exhales which it apparently some form of earthbending as the mud on her face begins to move strangely and creating a scary appearance. The attendant, having seen this, screams and runs off. Katara and Toph laugh, as the mud around Toph's mouth forms a large goofy smile.)</i><br><br><b>Toph and Katara:</b> Hahaha!<br><br><i>(Shot fades into a pile of rocks in the sauna that Toph and Katara now occupy. Toph kicks the ground once causing a rock from the cold pile to fly onto the pile of hot rocks. Katara, using waterbending, slashes the hot rocks with some water creating steam. They both sigh.<br><br>Fade into Toph walking down the streets of Ba Sing Se with the front of her hair, which usually hangs to cover her forehead, now combed back behind her ears and her face now with lots of make-up.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Well, that wasn't so bad. I'm not usually into that stuff, but I actually feel... <i>girly</i>.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(Cut back to show them both walking together, Katara's face has make-up as well.)</i> I'm glad, it's about time we did something fun together.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the two crossing a stone bridge over a creek. As they do, they pass three girls going the other direction. They wear fancy dresses and robes, one sporting a fashionable umbrella.)</i><br><br><b>1st Mean Girl:</b> Wow, great makeup. <br><b>Toph:</b> Thanks.<br><b>1st Mean Girl:</b> For a clown!<br><br><i>(Toph's face drops into a frown as the stop walking.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Don't listen to them, let's just keep walking.<br><b>Star:</b> I think she looks cute. Like that time we put that sweater on your pet poodle monkey.<br><b>3rd Mean Girl:</b> Good one, Star!<br><b>Katara:</b> Let's go Toph.<br><b>Toph:</b> No, no. That <i>was</i> a good one! "Like your poodle-monkey"... Ha ha! You know what else is a good one?<br><br><i>(Toph pounds the ground once causing dust to rumble up as her earthbending shoots across the bridge to where the girls stand. A hole opens up in the stone bridge where Toph's earthbending reaches them and all three fall through into the creek.)</i><br><br><b>Girls:</b> Ahhh!<br><b>Katara:</b> Now <i>that</i> was funny.<br><br><i>(With one move of her arm, Katara waterbends a huge wave that sweeps the girls away and down stream as they scream. Cut to a shot of Toph walking away from the bridge as Katara jogs to catch up.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Those girls don't know what they're talking about.<br><b>Toph:</b> It's ok. One of the good things about being blind is I don't have to waste my time worrying about appearances. <i>(Cut to her frowning face.)</i> I don't care what I look like. I'm not looking for anyone's approval. I know who I am. <i>(They stop walking, shot cuts back to show the both of them.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> That's what I really admire about you, Toph. You're so strong and confident and self assured. And I know it doesn't matter, but... you're really pretty.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(Smiling)</i> I am?<br><b>Katara:</b> Yeah. You are.<br><br><i>(Shot cuts to show them walking away together from behind.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I'd return the compliment, but I have no idea what you look like.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(Laughs)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> Thank you, Katara. <i>(She punches her in the shoulder in a friendly way.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Ow!<br><br><br><br><b><u>The Tale of Iroh</u></b><br>Written by: Andrew Huebner<br><br><i>(Title card for this tale fades into a shot of a marketplace in Ba Sing Se from overhead. Cut to a shot of the street that shows Iroh walking pleasantly down the lane and stopping to examine a basket being sold by a merchant.)</i><br><br><b>Merchant:</b> If this is for a romantic picnic, may I suggest this lavender one?<br><b>Iroh:</b> No, it is not a romantic picnic, but it is a special occasion. (<i>He hands the merchant a few coins and picks up the basket. Iroh turns to leave the market stall when a closed flower in a vase catches his eye. He slides the vase out of the sunlight and into the shade</i>) The moonflower likes partial shade.<br><br><i>(Iroh bows to the merchant and walks away. Shot fades into Iroh examining another merchant's stall which sells 'liuqins', which are a type of Asian lute which is a stringed instrument. The sound of a crying child catches Iroh's attention and he turns around to see a boy sobbing the middle of the street and his mother trying to console him.)</i><br><br><b>Child:</b> <i>(crying)</i> Wahh!<br><b>Woman:</b> Shhh. Appa hovers underneath these and Momo is seen perched upon the buffalo's head. Momo flies up and begins eating some fruit and tosses some down to Appa who chews them passively. As Momo continues to chew on one of the fruits, Appa suddenly gives a very great roar.<br><br>The screen flashes white and the shot cuts to Momo asleep on the windowsill of the Avatar's house. Startled by the thunder that woke him from his dream, Momo leaps up into Sokka's green Earth Kingdom bag that is hanging nearby. After a bit, he pokes his head up and realizes he has a bunch of white fur lying on his head that does not belong to him. After sniffing it a bit, the screen flashes white into a shot of Appa and Momo flying to indicate this is what Momo is thinking of at that second. With another roar of Appa's, the screen flashes white again and back to the real world as Momo chatters as he registers whom the fur belongs to.<br><br>The camera then pulls back to a shot from the lawn of the Avatar's house with Momo visible through the window. A shadow crosses the ground that looks very similar to Appa's shadow. Cut back to Momo as he wraps the wad of fur around one of his front legs and takes flight. He soars out the window of the house and into the yard to investigate if this shadow does indeed belong to his lost friend. But, alas, as he emerges from a tree he flew up into, he realizes that the shadow is merely being cast by a cloud. He holds his arm up and looks at the fur tied to it sadly, but then chatters a bit as he notices something new. Off in the distance, just on the other side of a roof, is what appears to be the top of the flying bison he is looking for. But when Momo flies closer, he finds out it was only a tree with white leaves and branches sticking out that looked similar to Appa's horns. Momo lands on one of these branches and his ears drop low in disappointment that he has once again failed to find his friend.<br><br>Fade into a shot of a street in the city as Momo soars down into it. He lands on a water barrel that has no lid and begins to drink from it. As he does, his wagging tail accidentally knocks over a stick sitting nearby. It falls to the ground with a loud thud that alerts three pygmy panthers who were rummaging in the garbage nearby. The panthers growl at Momo and suddenly pounce on him. Momo manages to dodge this in time and run into a box with an opening big enough for him but not enough for the panthers. The three predators surround the box and growl, two of them clawing in the openings to try and catch the lemur. Momo manages to slip out of an open crack in the back of the box and soar away. The panthers, however, are in hot pursuit. Chasing him by running on rooftops, one of them manages to swat him clean out of the air. After hitting the ground, Momo gets to his feet and runs on foot into a ground of people. The panthers do not follow their pray into the crowd.<br><br>Momo is then picked up by a man within this crowd and has a green little hat stringed to his head. He's tossed into an opening in the circle of the people where two monkeys are already dancing to the beat of a drummer in the background. After standing for a moment, Momo dances along too in a very strange and silly dance as a faster, livelier version of his theme music plays. The crowd all cheer and clap for the dance, but the panthers are stalking just outside the perimeter of people, looking in between the legs at their prey. One of the monkeys jumps onto Momo's head and balances with its hand, the other then doing the same on his head, and Momo struggles to keep balance.<br><br>The panthers growl and finally make their move, all of them leaping into the circle with a roar. Momo flees again, but this time as he tries to fly away, one of them grabs him round the middle and is taken for the ride, which slows him down in the flight. The other two panthers jump on and all four creatures crash into the ground. When the dust clears, Momo is seen pinned to the ground by one of his pursuers while the other two stand ready to strike their catch. However, before they can, a net flies in, captures all four of them, and drags them off.<br><br>A new shot shows an animal catcher placing Momo into a cage and locking it by placing a peg in to prevent the doors from opening. As the cart begins to move away, Momo rubs the clump of Appa fur still tied to his arm against his face possibly fearing he'll never see his friend again. Fade into a scene at what appears to be some sort of butcher, the cart as been pulled up next to the building. A view from Momo's perspective in the cage shows the animal catcher and the butcher arguing, though since this is from Momo's standpoint, the dialog is herd as gibberish. Another shot shows that occupying the cage next to him are the three pygmy panther scratching at their cage and crying out. Momo utilizes his opposable thumbs by reaching through the bars and removing the peg that holds his cage shut. As he pushes the cage open and begins to run away, he stops and looks back. The pygmy panthers are all staring at him sadly from their cage, realizing their fate rests with him. Momo leaps back onto the cart and begins to remove the peg to free them, just as the two men begin to approach. But when the men reach the cart, they find both cages deserted as right behind them, Momo and the panthers make their escape on the rooftops.<br><br>Fade into a scene on the roofs of the city, as Momo and his three new friends sit and watch the clouds. One of the panthers is rubbing up against Momo in a loving fashion; all three apparently very aware and very grateful for what Momo just did for them. Suddenly, one of the panthers uses its mouth to remove the wad of Appa's fur from Momo's arm. The panther with the fur then runs off and Momo, chattering loudly, follows as well as the other two panthers. The panthers lead Momo through the streets of Ba Sing Se till finally one of them places the wad of fur down inside a hole in the ground. Momo lands in the hole as the panther runs off. He looks at this strange hole and realizes immediately that it is actually a footprint made by none other than the Appa, the very bison Momo has been desperately trying to find. Chattering softly, Momo lays down on the ground holding the wad of fur. The camera pulls back to show the panthers sitting nearby watching as the rain begins to fall on Momo, lying in the only signature of his long lost friend. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

In a closer shot, we see Toph struggling to prevent the tower from submerging entirely.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(straining)</i> No, stop sinking!<br><br><i>(Cuts to Appa, surrounded by sandbenders who have him ensnared with a number of ropes. The cowled desert nomads are desperately holding on to the ropes in an attempt to control a snarling Appa. Two more of the Sandbenders narrowly avoid being crushed by the bison's powerful tail slap. Appa sends yet another nomad flying overhead, and strains mightily against the ropes of the remaining attackers. The view pans over to show Toph , hands pressed against the tower in an attempt to halt its descent with earthbending.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Don't make me put this down! <br><br><i>(Turning from the tower, she tries to launch an earthbending attack at the sandbenders, but it misses them harmlessly. Behind her, the building containing her friends begins to sink rapidly, and Toph quickly turns and braces against it, straining her powers to slow its descent. Behind her, the sandbenders continue struggling with the sky-bison.)</i> <br><br><b>Gashuin:</b> Put a muzzle on him!<br><br><i>(One of the raiders loops a rope around Appa's jaws, which he promptly snaps. Appa lunges forward at him, and he falls backward to avoid the bison's massive jaws. Another rope, weighted with a pouch of sand, loops over Appa's right horn, and all of the raiders pull downward in an attempt to subdue him. A powerful head butt sends one of the sandbenders hurtling into the air, and Appa launches himself skyward. Yet another nomad snares one of the sky-bison's legs, and he uses sandbending to anchor himself into the sand. Even as this bender is drug forward, a further rope is looped around another leg, until Appa, hovering above the heads of the anchored nomads, is finally brought crashing down to the ground. From above we see eight of the sandbenders holding a splayed Appa against the ground with ropes, while a sand-skiff glides close. Two of the vessels, propelled by sandbenders, begin dragging the subdued bison away from the library tower. We cut to a shot of Toph, still holding the tower.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I'm sorry Appa. <i>(she is grief-stricken, and closes her eyes sorrowfully)</i><br><br><i>(Behind her, we see Appa growing distant, and cut to a shot of him closing wearing a look of mournful resignation. Cut to a shot of the sun shining above the desert sands, as the sand-skiffs slide by, hauling Appa behind them. The young leader of the sandbender lowers his facemask, and signals for the three skiffs to come to a halt in an open stretch of desert.)</i><br><br><b>Gashuin:</b> <i>(dropping to the ground)</i> Ransack his saddle. Who knows what treasures are stashed in there? <i>(two nomads rush towards the bound Appa)</i><br><br><i>(Appa roars menacingly, and the two nomads stop short of him looking back to their leader)</i><br><br><b>Gashuin:</b> He's tied up good, he can't hurt you.<br><br><i>(The two sandbenders leap up onto Appa's saddle, kicking up a cloud of dust in his face that causes him to snuffle and let loose a tremendous sneeze.</i><br><br><i>The blast of air impacts against the center skiff, sending it rocketing through the air to wreck against a sand dune.)</i><br><br><b>Sandbender:</b> <i>(turning to Gashuin)</i> What's your father going to do when he finds out we lost a sand sailor?<br><b>Gashuin:</b> Nothing. <i>(thumbs back to the wreck)</i> It's the one we stole from the Hammi tribe. <i>(turns back to Appa)</i> Did you empty the saddle? <i>(walks up to the pile of gear)</i> That's it! Nothing but garbage! <i>(Frustrated, he kicks away a pair of items)</i> Ahh! It doesn't matter. We'll still make a profit from selling him to those beetle-headed merchants! <i>(his companion picks up a parasol and opens it up, shading himself)</i><br><br><i>(The scene fades into a shot of the remaining two skiffs dragging Appa to a trio of large tents grouped out in the open desert. He is drug into the camp past a group of three well dressed men. Once the skiffs stop, the men walk around to the front of Appa stopping to his head to appraise him.)</i><br><br><b>First Beetle Merchant</b>: How's his temper?<br><b>Gashuin:</b> Uhhhh, pretty good.<br><br><i>(Appa abruptly roars ferociously, causing the merchants to jump back in fear, then falls silent again)</i><br><br><b>Gashuin:</b> <i>(sheepishly)</i> Uh, most of the time.<br><b>Second Beetle Merchant:</b> <i>(turning to the first merchant)</i> I bet someone will pay a fortune for him in Ba Sing Se.<br><b>First Beetle Merchant:</b> All right. You've got a deal.<br><br>(<i>Gashuin, flanked by two of his fellows, accepts a small ornate chest. He opens it and looks into it smiling before closing it and walking away. Six wooden arms lever over from the sides of the sled, caging the bison. Appa! <br><br><i>(A close-up of Aang's angry face, as he begins to blow furiously on the bison whistle. We cut to a shot of Appa's face as his eyes snap open upon hearing the ultrasonic note.
