Ha ha ha! <i>(the two skiffs slide away into the distance)</i><br><b>Second Beetle Merchant:</b> What!?<br><br><i>(He and a fellow merchant turn back to the sled, which is now rocking side to side dangerously. Appa's tail breaks the rope holding it down, and with a powerful tail slap he launches himself, sled and all, into the air and over the stag beetle. He fillips over the beetle, and begins dragging it through the camp, destroying a tent in the process.)</i><br><br><b>First Beetle Merchant:</b> <i> (shouting)</i> We need the shirshu spit darts!<br><b>Second Beetle Merchant:</b> <i>(whips out a blowgun)</i> Got'em! Ok big fella, you're gonna take a nice little snoozle. <i>(he loads the blowgun and brings it to his lips as he says this)</i><br><br><i>(He fires the blowgun up at Appa, piercing his foot with three small blowgun needles. Instantly, Appa's eyes begin to droop, and he comes to a sliding crash back onto the desert floor.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Aang, swooping down to a landing upon a sand dune.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b> <i>(yelling) </i>Appa! <i>(he looks out over a seemingly endless expanse of empty desert, lowers his face sadly)</i> No... NOOOO!<br><br><i>(With this final cry of outrage, Aang leaps forward and sends an incredible blast of air down into the desert sand. Viewed from afar, we see a towering mushroom cloud of sand and dust explode into the sky. Switching again to Appa's point-of-view, we can see the cloud far, far in the distance. The two merchants step into view as the groaning bison's vision begins to blur and darken.)</i><br><br><b>First Beetle Merchant:</b> We've gotta get rid of this one! He's too much trouble.<br><b>Second Beetle Merchant:</b> We could sell him for parts.<br><br><i>(Fade to black. After a moment, we begin to hear a new voice in the darkness. I understand you've had a rather hard time lately. That's too bad. You probably felt you had no choice but to behave outrageously. Like a wild animal. <i>(walks up and strokes Appa's forehead through the bars)</i> But don't worry, you won't anymore. <i> (in a sinister voice)</i> Because I am going to break you.<br><br><i>(From above, we see that Appa is enclosed in a circus wagon, and a number of other creatures lie in cages nearby. From the outside, pennants wave in the wind on the enormous red tent of the Fire nation circus.</i><br><br><i>Returning to the inside of the animal tent, we see the Trainer pushing a cart of cabbages past a reclining platypus-bear. He tosses one of the cabbages back to the bear, who catches it in his bill and munches on it. He pushes it past Appa's cage, and the bison rises slowly, his attention on the cart. As he gains his feet, he finds that he has been chained and manacled. Rumbling with displeasure, he begins gnawing at the manacle on his forepaw. The Trainer walks past to the cage containing a vulture-griffon, who cries out in anticipation. As he feeds the beast, he turns to address Appa, who is watching him and drooling.</i><br><br><b>Circus Trainers:</b> Hungry? Don't worry, I'm going to feed you too. <i>(holds cabbage out to Appa)</i> But not yet. As he steps away, Appa uses his air bending skills and sucks in a stream of air that pulls the cart full of cabbages closer to him. He successfully lifts one from the pile and devours it. Appa rears back and groans and roars in distress. The Trainer approaches his cage, heedless of the flames between them.)</i><br><br><b>Circus Trainer:</b> It's obvious that whoever your previous owner was, he had no idea how to handle you properly. <i> (Appa ,cowed by the flames, glares at the Trainer)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to the outside of the Main Circus Tent. Lit against the nighttime sky, a large crowd has gathered outside the entrance. Circus style music can be heard playing. We cut to a fire nation boy about Aang's age, who walks past an open tent flap. He quickly reappears, eyes wide in amazement. He sees the caged Appa inside the tent, trying to pull a bale of hay towards himself with his wind breath. His attempts to bring it to him come to nothing. Turning, Appa exchanges looks with the amazed lad, and makes a licking gesture with his tongue. The boy smiles, and seem ready to enter, when a hulking adult shows up behind him abruptly.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Man:</b> I am gonna get a bag of sizzle-crisps. <i>(points commandingly)</i> Stay here and stay away from that monster. Behave yourself, or you'll regret it.<br><br><i>(The boy watches him walk off with a meek look, then turns back to the tent opening. I want the Wind Buffalo to perform <i>tonight</i>. <i>(he stalks off-scene)</i><br><b>Circus Trainer:</b> <i>(turns to glare at Appa)</i> If you don't behave yourself, you'll regret it. <br><br><i>(Stepping forward, he creates a large torch of flame before Appa's face, who shrinks back in his cage and growls in fear and anger. Appa soars away into the night, the lights of the circus fading away below him.) </i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The scene opens to Appa soaring above the desert in the early dawn, as he comes upon the crater left by the disappearing Library. We flash back to his remembrance of the tower, and he lands in the crater and starts pawing at the sand. With a great bellow of despair he collapses onto his belly in the center of the crater. Cuts again to the shackled bison flying above the desert floor, his stomachs rumbling with hunger. Spying a large egg lying on the desert floor, Appa lands heavily next to it. But just before he can lap up the egg with his tongue a small bipedal lizard rushes up, snatches it and flees into the rocks with the egg held high. Appa spots a Jackelope standing next to a small cactus in the distance, and swoops over, frightening off the small creature. He bites off the entire cactus, then spits it out, roaring in pain and wagging his hurt tongue. We cut again to a tired looking Appa flying low over the midday desert, and he suddenly begins sniffing the air with interest.</i><br><br><i>He flies toward a large stone mesa, and descends into one of the many openings in the gigantic mud hive built atop it. Moments later, Appa zooms back out, hotly pursued by an angry swarm of buzzard-wasps. Wheeling about in the air, he sends them crashing to the desert floor with a great wind-gust sweep of his tail. Stunned, the buzzard-wasps rise and fly slowly back to their hive. Gasping and panting, Appa lands dripping of honey. Rolling onto his side, he hungrily laps the honey from his fur, collapsing with a satisfied, exhausted sigh. Cut to sunset, as Appa flies over greener, less desolate lands. Looking tired and bedraggled, he flies in to land on a farm, entering a large domed barn. He devours a pile of hay, then flops down and immediately lapses into a deep slumber. </i><br><br><i> A Sepia-tone dream sequence shows us the Eastern Air Temple built high upon three mist shrouded peaks. We see an adorable Air bison calf swoop into view, joined by four others and an adult bison. The cooing calves fly in a circle around the adult, then pause to nuzzle it before flying downward, the adult in tow. Below, a group of small boys in airbender garb, take apples from a large bowl held by an airbender nun. We see that one of them is a young Aang, at age 6 or so.)</i><br><br><b>Air Nomad Woman:</b> Chose well. A sky bison is a companion for life.<br><br><i>(The bison land on the terrace in front of the boys, and Aang approaches what is certainly a young Appa. I guess this mean we'll always be together. <i>(he laughs as the calf begins licking him again)</i><br><br><i>(The scene changes to the night camp upon the Serpent's Pass, where a dreaming Aang mimics the scene we just observed laughing as the dream calf licks him. Aang rolls to his side upon his bedroll with a blissful look on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(smiling in his sleep)</i> Always.<br><br>(<i>Cut back to Appa, slumbering inside the barn. He is roused by a human cry of terror.)</i><br><br><b>Farmer:</b> AAhhh! It's some kind of monster! <br><br><i>(From Appa's point of view we see a wide-eyed Earth peasant waving a pitchfork in his face. Appa rises angrily to his feet, his manacles rattling, and growls a warning to the farmer. The farmer's wife comes to the barn entrance, carrying a bright torch. Seeing the blazing torch, Appa rears onto his hind legs in panic, sending the couple running and screaming. In a full panic Appa crashes up through the roof of the barn, sending up a rush of wind that extinguishes the torch carried by the couple, who lie sprawled in the dirt.</i><br><br><i> Cut to a scene of Appa flying over the Serpent's Pass, passing in the pre-dawn air over an Earth Kingdom vessel. From the deck, a shocked Iroh watches the forlorn bison pass overhead and away.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> Huh!<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(roused from sleep)</i> Uncle? What are you looking at? Is there something out there?<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(nervously)</i> Uh, it's nothing. Go back to sleep. <i>(he sighs in relief as Zuko falls asleep again)</i><br><br><i>(Appa descends towards forested bluffs, and crashes groggily near a tree-capped mine entrance. He begins to nibble some grass, before being roused by a loud squealing echoing from the mine entrance. He turns just as an enraged porcupine-boar charges out of the mine, crashing into him and sending them both rolling down the hillside. Both of them crash to a halt below, and we see that Appa already has a number of large quills sticking out from his side. Appa and his opponent both roar a challenge, and they begin to circle one another. Suddenly the porcupine-boar charges Appa's flank, plowing the bison into a tree that snaps in two from the impact. Seizing the tree in his mouth, Appa tosses it at the boar driving him backwards into a line of trees. Squealing in rage, the porcupine boar leaps over the tree, charging headlong towards the sky-bison.</i><br><br><i>Rearing onto his hind legs, Appa catches the charging boar and hurls him deep into the forest, where the beast finally loses heart and flees into the night. Panting heavily from exertion, Appa plucks one of the quills from his hide with his teeth, the ground trembling from his roar of agony. He half flies half stumbles up the hill to the mine entrance, and collapses inside, utterly spent.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the following morning, where Appa lies unconscious inside the mine. The day passes again into night, as it begins to rains steadily outside.</i><br><br><i>Another morning, and we see the Kyoshi warriors gathering red berries from a group of bushes. One of the warriors notices clumps of white fur hanging from the branches of a bush.)</i><br><br><b>Kyoshi Warrior:</b> <i>(plucking a mass of fur)</i> Must have been some fight.<br><b>Suki:</b> Wait. Let me see that. <i>(takes the clump of fur)</i> No. It couldn't be.<br><br><i>(We follow her gaze up the side of the hill, a devastated scene of broken trees and stripped earth. She follows the path of destruction, climbing up the bluff and finally pulling herself up to the top. She discovers the ragged bison lying in the shadow of the mine entrance.)</i><br><br><b>Suki:</b> Huh? Appa? Oh no.<br><br><i>(Roused by her voice, Appa cowers back into the mine growling. As Suki approaches, she sees his chains as well as the various injuries he has sustained. Kneeling near the entrance she lays down a double handful of berries and fruit.)</i><br><br><b>Suki: </b> <i>(reassuringly)</i> It's gonna be ok Appa. I have to leave, but I am gonna be back soon with help. <br><br><i>(She turns and hurries back down the bluff. Appa emerges and cautiously sniffs at the fruit. Later we see Suki leading the other Kyoshi warriors carefully up the side of the bluff, as Appa lies back inside the mine entrance.)</i><br><br><b>Suki:</b> <i>(addressing the others)</i> No sudden movements. He's been lost for awhile, and he looks like he's hurt. He's shy around people and scared. Stay low, and stay quiet.<br><b>Kyoshi Warrior:</b> I can't believe you found the Avatar's bison. Didn't you just see the Avatar a few days ago?<br><b>Suki:</b> Yes, so he can't be too far from here. It's our responsibility to get Appa back to him safely. This could be our most important mission yet. <br><br><i>(Turning, she leads the other girls up the rest of the way, pausing at the top of the hill. Appa notices them, and rises to his feet roaring an angry warning.)</i><br><br><b>Suki:</b> Give him some space! <i>(they back up apace, as Suki edges closer)</i> Appa, it's me, Suki. I'm a friend. <i>(walks toward Appa,who moans warily)</i> I want to help you. You're hurt. We can help you feel better. And we can help you find Aang. <i>(she cautiously places her hand on his nose, and he lays down and closes his eyes in acceptance)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to a scene showing the manacles and quills lying in the grass, while further off, a better-better looking Appa sits among the girl warriors licking the face of one with his great tongue. Suddenly his ears twitch to approaching danger, and as he turns about, a bolt of blue lightning fells a nearby tree. Azula, Mai and Ty Lee ride out of the hills on the backs of mongoose dragons, reigning to a halt before the Kyoshi warriors.)</i><br><br><b>Azula: </b> <i>(holding out a clump of white fur)</i> My, my, you're easy to find. <i>(tosses it aside)</i> It's really astounding my brother hasn't captured you yet. <br><br>(<i>The Kyoshi warriors stand ready around Appa, as the three regard them from the saddles of their mounts. Scene goes to black.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(We return to the preceding scene, as Appa rears and growls threateningly. The warriors drop as one into combat stances, unfurling war fans and collapsible shields.)</i><br><br><b>Suki:</b> What do you want with us?<br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(mockingly)</i> Who are you, the Avatar's fan girls?<br><b>Ty Lee:</b> <i>(thinks for a moment, then brightens) </i>Oh, I get it! I get it. Good one, Azula!<br><b>Suki:</b> If you are looking for the Avatar, you're out of luck.<br><b>Mai:</b> <i>(sighs despondently)</i> I knew this was a waste of time.<br><b>Azula:</b> No Avatar huh? <i>(shrugs)</i> Well that's ok, any friend of the Avatar, is an enemy of mine.<br><br><i>(As she finishes saying this, Azula does a spinning aleap from her saddle, sending a blast of blue fire towards the warriors. They leap to form a shield wall in front of Appa, deflecting the fire blast. Mai and Ty Lee flip forward out of their saddles to engage the warriors in combat. Mai, landing on her feet, produces a brace of throwing knives from her sleeve. With a sweeping throw, she pins a startled warrior to a tree by her clothing.)</i><br><br><b>Mai:</b> You're so colorful, it's making me nauseous.<br><br><i>(Mai spins and throws a barrage of throwing-arrows at a second warrior, who draws a katana and cuts them from the air. She takes a couple of swings at Ty Lee, who nimbly evades her slashes before felling her with a flurry of pressure-point strikes.) </i><br><br><b>Ty Lee:</b> <i>(hands on hips)</i> You're <i>not</i> prettier than we are!<br><br><i>(Suki continues to stand between Azula and Appa, blocking her fire blasts with her shield. Azula's second more powerful blast ricochets off Suki's shield, setting fire to the tree she had felled initially. As it catches on fire, Appa cowers back from the leaping flames.)</i><br><br><b>Azula:</b> Afraid of fire I see. That's good, you should be!<br><b>Suki:</b> <i>(drawing her sword)</i> Go Appa! Fly away from here! Get out of here.<br><br><i>(As Appa rises to the sky, Suki charges Azula. The Fire princess performs an amazing horizontal mid-air spin, simultaneously avoiding her thrust and sending her sword flying from her hands to imbed in a tree. Suki blocks another fire blast, then Azula counters her kick and trips Suki to the ground. Pausing at the sight of Suki in danger, Appa turns and flies back to help. Ready to finish Suki, Azula dodges beneath a pair of hurled war-fans hurled at her back, and turns to launch a retaliatory attack. Suki rises to her feet, rushing to wave off the approaching sky-bison)</i> <br><br><b>Suki: </b><i>(waving a burning branch)</i> Get out of here! You have to find Aang! We'll be ok!<br><br><i>(Clearly torn, Appa finally shies away and flies off into the sky. Smiling in relief, Suki barely reacts in time to block a blast of blue fire with her shield. Staggered backwards, she falls into a battle-stance, unfolding her war fan.)</i><br><br><b>Azula: </b><i>(contemptuously)</i> Don't you know that fans just make flames stronger?<br><br><i>(The two charge one another, and as they clash the scene action freezes and the scene closes. Cut to Appa above the forest, then flying along a river among a flock of white birds. We see Appa flying through dark skies in a torrential downpour, passing above a pair of Southern Water tribe ships sailing through the rains. On the deck of one of the vessels, we see Hakoda staring up at the sky-bison in wonder. Cut again to Appa flying steadily over misty peaks, until in the distance we recognize the ruins of the Eastern Air Temple Appa enters the broken, weedy ruins of the Sky-Bison stables, and in flashback we see it restored, with young bison calves frolicking through its warm hay covered halls. </i><br><br><i>Resuming his journey through the stables, Appa comes across a round metal framework, and once more in flashback we see bison calves teething at it the bars. Back in the present, Appa chomps on the ring, but the dust causes him to cough and he leaves it unsatisfied. Crossing one of the spans between the peaks Appa passes through and steps out onto a terrace. Framed against the rising sun is a bald figure sitting cross-legged at the end of the terrace. Mistaking him for Aang, he bounds forward and knocks the figure on his back, licking his face with gusto. We see that it is not Aang, however, but a bald, brown skinned old man with a long snowy beard and bushy eyebrows. The old man blinks in surprise at the sky-bison standing over him, before recovering to speak in a thick East Indian accent.)</i><br><br><b>Guru:</b> Hello. I am Guru Pathik. <br><br><i>(realizing it's not Aang, Appa jumps away and turns to stare him down)</i><br><br><b>Guru:</b> <i>(leaning up)</i> I know I am not the person you expected. And I didn't expect to be licked by a giant tongue just now. The world is full of surprises.<br><br><i>(Appa gives him a long menacing growl, and the old man calmly lies back down on his back closing his eyes. Later in the day, the guru raises his head to look at the waiting bison, who growls at him, causing him to lower his head and close his eyes again. Still later peeks open an eye to peer at Appa, who again issues a low growl. Once again the guru calmly closes his eyes. Night falls, and we see Appa lying on his side, snoring loudly. Opening his eyes, the lean old man nimbly rolls backwards to his feet, stands and dusts his hands in satisfaction. Rubbing his hands together he walks up to the chest of the slumbering Appa. He touches Appa's neck with two fingers, then places his hand on the bison's leathery chest plate.)</i><br><br><b>Guru:</b> Oh, dear. You've been through so much recently. Hurt and betrayed, so twisted up inside. <i>(he runs two fingers along Appa's underside, then places a hand on his belly)</i> You're still full of love. <i>(sighs)</i> But fear has moved in where trust should be. <i>(we pan upward to show the temple, as continues in voice-over)</i> I've been expecting you and the young Avatar for quite a long time. I had a vision many years ago of helping him. That's why I came to the Eastern Air Temple <i>(standing near the restless Appa's head)</i> Ahh. Your emotions are so turbulent. Like swirling storm clouds..<i> (places a hand on Appa's brow)</i> Let the clouds in your mind be gentle, peaceful ones. <i>(as he says this Appa calms into a deep pleasant sleep)</i><br><br><i>(Appa's eyes snap open, revealing another night has passed, and he rises looking around surprised. He notices a small pile of fruit before him, and eagerly snaps it up. Turning he notices another piece of fruit, and still another, until he is eating his way back into the temple behind him. We cut to a peak reached by a stair curving around its side. The Eastern Air Temple is framed just behind it. On its top is centered a stone dais, surrounded by a rock garden and a copse of trees. Appa follows the stairs up to the base of the platform. We see Guru, sitting in a meditative pose with a bird perched on his head, surrounded by birds and small woodland creatures. he holds out a handful of seeds, and another bird lands on it.)</i><br><br><b>Guru</b>: Someone looks very well-rested, judging by your bed head. <i>(Appa lows at him in greeting, and shakes his fur back into place)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to a full moon-lit sky, and pans to the stone dais, where Guru sits in deep meditation, while Appa paces behind him, before finally lying next to him. The Guru then opens his eyes and turns to pat Appa's belly, gathering up a rolled and tied parchment and rising to his feet.)</i><br><br><b>Guru:</b> I have prepared a message for Aang. May I attach it to your horn? <i>(Appa seems to assent, and secures the message to a horn, then, standing before Appa) </i>You and the Avatar's energies are mixed. You have an unbreakable bond. By reading your energy, <i>(touches Appa's forehead)</i> I can sense where Aang is. <i>(Appa licks his face with his great tongue)</i> Funny, what invisible strings connect us all.<br><br><i>(Placing his hand on Appa's brow, he closes his eyes and both seem to focus. intently. From a distance we see a pale light emit from them both, and a path of light snakes away down the side of the peak). </i><br><br><b>Guru:</b> <i>(speaking in voice-over, as the light focuses on Appa's head)</i> I will see you again, great beast.<br><br><i>(Cut to Appa soaring down toward the city of Ba Sing Se. Silhouetted by the full moon, he passes over the inner wall, over the rooftops below. He is watched from the peak of a roof by a pair of Dai Li agents, who slide down after he passes. Appa hovers over the city, looking about for signs of Aang. Suddenly his eyes snap wide in excitement as he hears the familiar sound of the bison whistle. He descends rapidly, landing in an open square in the city's lower circle and bounding down a street. </i><br><br><i>Cut to show the bison whistle, lying unused next to a sleeping Aang and Momo. Somewhere in the city, a figure stands in the shadows blowing another whistle. As Appa turns a corner he man steps out into the light, revealing himself as Long Feng. He walks forward, lowering the whistle. Appa retreats back, leaving the footprint in the mud that is seen in the previous episode. With an earthbending gesture, Long Feng causes the entire street section to revolve like a trap door, dropping Appa into a passage beneath the city. </i><br><br><i>As the dust settles and the camera fades back, we are left with a final view of the footprint, the last trace of Appa to be seen.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

I'm here to help. <br><br><i>(Holding out his hook-swords, he drops them to the ground as Katara draws closer. She stops, not sure what to think. He reaches behind his back for something, and Katara pins him with a flurry of ice blades. Sokka, Toph and Aang come rushing up behind her.) </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Katara, what is it?<br><b>Katara:</b> Jet's back.<br><br><i>(A long close-up of Jet's face, then fade to black.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The scene then re-opens in the alleyway.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(resolutely)</i> We can't trust anything Jet says.<br><b>Sokka:</b> But we don't even know why he's here.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(with a hostile tone)</i> I don't care why he's here. Whatever the reason is, it can't be good.<br><b>Jet:</b> I'm here to help you find Appa. <br><br><i>(Still pinned to the wall, Jet opens his hand to let a leaflet unroll.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(turning from the leaflet back to Katara)</i> Katara, we have to give him a chance.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(earnestly)</i> I swear, I've changed. I was a troubled person, and I let my anger get out of control. But I don't even have the gang now. I've put all that behind me.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(bitterly)</i> You're lying! <br><br><i>(Toph pushes past Katara, and places her palm on the wall close to Jet.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> He's not lying. <br><b>Sokka:</b> How can you tell?<br><b>Toph:</b> I can feel his breathing and heart beat. When people lie, there is a physical reaction. He's telling the truth. <i>(Toph, Aang and Sokka turn to Katara)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(beseechingly)</i> Katara, we don't have any leads. If Jet says he can take us to Appa, we have to check it out. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(shoulders sagging in resignation)</i> Alright... <i>(suddenly stabbing a finger at Jet)</i> but we're not letting you out of out sight! <br><br><i>(She stabs her finger at Jet once more for emphasis, eyes narrowed.</i><br><br><i>We cut to Jet entering a dimly lit warehouse, which sits empty except for a few sacks and a pile of canvas and rope.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> This is the place I heard about. <i>(everyone begins looking around)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> There's nothing here.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(angrily)</i> If this is a trap...! <i>(she readies an attack)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> I told you, I work nearby! Two guys were talking about some giant furry creature they had. I figured it must be Appa. <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(offscreen)</i> He was here! <br><br><i>(Toph has discovered a handful of white fur, and the other rush to her side.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(stroking the clump of fur sadly)</i> We missed him.<br><br><i>(An old white haired man with a push-broom crosses behind the slumping Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Janitor:</b> They took that big thing yesterday. <i>(Aang straightens with a shocked look)</i> Shipped him out to some island. About time, I've been cleaning up fur and various, uh leavings all day. <i>(begins walking off again)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(frantically catching up with him)</i> What island?! Where's Appa?!<br><b>Janitor:</b> <i>(wearily)</i> Foreman said some rich royal type on Whaletail Island bought him up, guess for a zoo or such, though could be the meat would be good.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(anxiously)</i> We've gotta get to Whaletail Island. <i>(turns to the others, where Sokka is reading a map)</i> Where's Whaletail Island?<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(glumly)</i> Far. Very far. <i>(lays the map of the world on the floor, pointing)</i> Here it is. It's near the South Pole almost all the way back home.  <i>(Everyone kneels around the map.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Aang, It'll take us weeks just to get to the tip of the Earth Kingdom. And then we'll need to find a boat to get to the island.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(standing)</i> I don't care. We have a chance to find Appa. We have to try.<br><b>Janitor:</b> <i>(passing in the background)</i> Must be nice to visit an island. I haven't had a vacation for years. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(crossly)</i> Don't you have some more hair to clean up?<br><b>Janitor:</b> <i>(dismally)</i> Shuffle on, I get ya. No more need for "old sweepy."<br><b>Katara:</b> You're right Aang. <i>(places hand on his shoulder)</i> Right now, our first concern has to be finding Appa. We can come back when we have him.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(setting off)</i> All right, let's get moving.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(steppingtowards them)</i> I'll come with you.<br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(firmly)</i> We don't need you help. <br><b>Jet:</b> Why won't you trust me? <i>(walks after Sokka and Aang)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(arms crossed)</i> Gee, I wonder? <i>(turns and raises her head in a huff)</i> <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(standing beside her)</i> Was this guy your boyfriend or something?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(startled)</i> What? No! <i>(turns her head the other direction)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(teasingly)</i> I can tell you're lyyyyying. <br><br><i>(Katara stomps off blushing. We cut to the streets of Ba Sing Se, where Jet walks beside the four heroes.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> We can take the train out to the wall, but then we'll have to walk.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(cheerfully)</i> Don't worry, on the way back, we'll be flying!<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(with exaggerated relief)</i> We're finally leaving Ba Sing Se. <i>(thows her arms wide) </i>Worst city ever!<br><br><i>(As Toph starts to catch up with the others, we see Smellerbee and Longshot emerge from a side-street in the distance. Both seem astonished to see Jet in the street.)</i><br><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> <i>(shouting)</i> Jet!<br><br><i>(Katara turns in surprise, as Jet continues walking indifferently. She looks to Jet angrily.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(accusingly)</i> I thought you said you didn't have your gang anymore?<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(turns with a bewildered look)</i> I don't. <br><br><i>(Smellerbee throws herself against Jet, wrapping her arms around him with a look of utter relief)</i><br><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> We were so worried. How did you get away from the Dai Li?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(aghast)</i> The Dai Li?!<br><b>Jet:</b> I don't know what she's talking about? <i>(everyone stops and draws closer to Jet and Smellerbee)</i><br><b>Smellerbee:</b> He got arrested by the Dai Li a couple weeks ago. We saw them drag him away.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(baffled)</i> Why would I be arrested? I've been living peacefully in the city.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(kneeling down, with a palm on the street between them)</i> This doesn't make any sense. They're <i>both</i> telling the truth.<br><b>Katara:</b> That's impossible.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(thoughtfully)</i> No, it's not. Toph can't tell who's lying because they <i>both</i> think they're telling the truth. Jet's been brainwashed. <i>(points at Jet accusingly)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(distressed)</i> That's crazy! It can't be. <i>(starts looking around in a panic)</i> Stay away from me.<br><br><i>(Everyone encircles Jet, and they begin to close in around him. </i><br><br><i>Cut to the night sky, lit by the full moon. A lone Dai Li agent walks down the street past the entrance to an alley. Charging up the street behind him is the masked figure of the Blue Spirit.)</i><br><br><b>Blue Spirit:</b> Out of my way, skinny. <br><br><i>(He knocks the Dai Li to his knees, and continues rushing past him. The agent readies his stone-glove attack, but the Blue Spirit turns and disappears down a side street. Rising to his feet, the agent rushes in pursuit. Rounding the corner, he sees the Blue Spirit waiting in the darkness, and launches his stone gloves at him, one after the other. The second stone fist removes the Blue Spirit's head, which we now see is a straw-filled dummy. The dummy collapses to the ground. )</i><br><br><b>Dai Li Agent:</b> <i>(perplexed)</i> Huh?<br><br><i>(There is the whisper of a drawn blade behind him, and the Blue Spirit appears at his back, placing a sword at his throat.)</i><br><br><b>Blue Spirit:</b> <i>(menacingly)</i> If you don't want to end up like him. You'll do what I say.<br><br><i>(Cut to the outside of an apartment, where Momo suspends by his tail from a clothesline. Inside, from Jet's point of view, we see the Heroes and the Freedom fighters crowded together, regarding him suspiciously.) </i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> The Dai Li must have sent Jet to mislead us, and that janitor was part of their plot too.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(looking to her)</i> I bet they have Appa here in the city. Maybe he's in the same place they took Jet. <i>(turns back to Jet)</i> Where did they take you? <i>(Jet is seen sitting on a stool, his head hanging low)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(befuddled)</i> Nowhere. <i>(raises his head)</i> I, I don't know what you're talking about. <br><b>Aang:</b> We need to find a way to jog his real memories. <br><b>Sokka:</b> <i> (provokingly)</i> Maybe Katara could kiss him. That should bring something back. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(annoyed)</i> Maybe you should kiss him, Sokka.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(slyly)</i> Hey, just an idea.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(peeved)</i> A bad one.<br><b>Sokka: </b> Oo, wait. I got it. <i>(Sokka plucks a straw from his mattress, pokes it into Jet's mouth in trademark fashion, then regards him thoughtfully)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> I don't think its working. Puh! <i>(spits it onto the floor)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> Try to think of something from your past that triggers your emotions. <br><b>Smellerbee</b>: The Fire Nation, remember what they did to your family.<br><b>Katara:</b> Close your eyes. Picture it.<br><br><i>(Jet closes his eyes, and sweat beads on his forehead. They suddenly snap wide as a light seems to flash inside his head, and we are transported back to the scene of his burning village. A screaming woman flees the blaze, as a young Jet stands transfixed at the dreadful scene. Surrounded by flames, the leader of the Rough Riders turns slowly to glare at him. Young Jet stands there helplessly, tears streaming down his face as the bright embers waft about him. We return to a close-up of Jet's horror-struck eyes, then he droops for a while, exhausted.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(shaken)</i> No! It's too painful.<br><b>Katara:</b> Maybe this will help.<br><br><i>(Katara steps behind him, drawing out a portion of her bending water. She places moves the water and her hands to the sides of his head, and we see the glow of her healing powers. Jet stares down at the shadow cast on the floor before him by the light of her energies. As his eyes follow the floorboards, gaps appear, revealing blue waters. The far side of the room is replaced by the distant shore of a great lake, and Long Feng can be seen standing in the distance upon its surface. Long Feng regards Jet grimly, and suddenly Jet plunges down into the dark depths of the lake. He emerges inside a vast man-made subterranean chamber. The scene flashes to show him being subjected to the hypnotic light of an orbiting lantern by a pair of Dai Li agents. He shuts his eyes against the light, and the scene changes to the closed eyes of Jet inside the apartment.) </i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(tentatively)</i> They took me to a headquarters under the water, like a lake. <br><b>Sokka:</b> Wait! Remember what Joo Dee said?  She said she went on vacation to Lake Laogai.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(jumping to his feet)</i> That's it! Lake Laogai.<br><br><i>(The scene fades to black.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Scene opens to the aerial view of a vast lake, surrounded by rugged hills. In a shot from the shore, we see the Freedom Fighters and the Heroes lined up on the misty shore.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> So where's this secret headquarters?<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(scratching his head)</i> Under the lake I think. <br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(pointing to her right)</i> There's a tunnel right there near the shore. <br><br><i>(She walks that direction, whistling. Reaching the water's edge Toph jumps up in an earthbending move, and a stone pathway rises to the surface. Toph walks along it to a stone disc, which she bends aside. Everyone peers down into the dark shaft, and Momo flies away chittering nervously. From the depths of the shaft, we see a narrow ladder leads up to the tiny circle of light where the heroes stand, far above. The scene changes to a view of the underground base similar to the one in Jet's vision, a crosshatch of large passages lit by greenish firestone lanterns. A pair of Dai Li walk off into a side tunnel, and we pan back to see the assembled group cautiously descending a dark stairway to the main chamber.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(leading the group)</i> It's all starting to come back to me.<br><br><i>(Jet edges quietly to a partially opened door, then moves on, followed by the others. As they peer inside in turn, they see rows of identically dressed young women standing hypnotically before a Dai Li agent.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Li Agent:</b> I'm Joo Dee. Welcome to Ba Sing Se.<br><b>Joo Dees:</b> <i>(in perfect unison)</i> I'm Joo Dee. Welcome to Ba Sing Se. <br><b>Dai Li Agent:</b> We are so lucky to have our walls to create order.<br><b>Joo Dees:</b> <i>(in perfect unison)</i> We are so lucky to have our walls to create order.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(once more leading)</i> I think there might be a cell big enough to hold Appa up ahead. <i>(he stops before a sealed stone door)</i> I think it's through here. <br><br><i>(We see the stone door slide away from the other side, and light spills into a chamber. Inside Appa is chained to the floor, and the light from the doorway casts the shadow of a figure on him as the bison rises. Appa moans uncertainly.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko/Blue Spirit:</b> Expecting someone else? <i>(stepping into the chamber, he draws a sword, while Appa shifts nervously in his chains)</i><br><br><i>(An identical door slides open, revealing Jet, with the others behind him. Inside a massive shadowy cavern, the dark shapes of Dai Li can be barely seen suspended from the ceiling. Far below, the heroes cautiously enter, and the stone door abruptly slides shut behind them. They spin around in surprise, as the room is plunged into darkness, then green lanterns flare to life, illuminating the vast cave. Only now do they notice the Dai Li high above them, suspended from chains or clinging to the ceiling itself. Ahead, Long Feng waits with several more Dai Li.)  </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(as everyone stares up)</i> Now that's something different.<br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(grimly)</i> You have made yourselves enemies of the state. <i>(The camera pans across the determined faces of the heroes, as Longshot notches an arrow.)</i> Take them into custody.<br><br><i>(The Dai Li drop down to the floor, encircling the heroes. Two agents launch a stone fist attack, but Toph disintegrates them in mid-flight. As the dust clears, she launches them across the room with a pair of rock pillars. </i><br><br><i>Behind her, Jet turns and rushes another pair, cutting their stone fist projectiles from the air. Sliding along the ground past the first, he trips the second with his hook sword, slamming him hard to the ground.</i><br><br><i>Long Feng watches dispassionately as Aang deals with two more of his Dai Li with air and earthbending. Katara and Sokka manage to destroy two more of the glove projectiles before being seized by two more. Toph intervenes with a stone wall before they can be drug to the waiting Dai Li. They send a rush of stone towards Toph, but she rises high into the cavern on a pillar of rock, forcing them to pursue her the same way. </i><br><br><i>Two more Dai Li race up the walls to either side of her, to strike out at Toph with horizontal columns of stone. High in the cavern, Toph swats aside the first two agents, then leaps to avoid the two columns as they crash together beneath her. Landing atop them, she bends up a pair of stone blocks from the columns, using them to drive away both of the remaining agents simultaneously. A fist of stone grabs the back of her shirt, and she is hauled through the air toward a waiting Dai Li. Jet intervenes at the last moment. Leaping past he hooks her belt with his sword, pulling her to safety as the agent kicks a stone foot attack after them. Longshot covers them as they land, intercepting the missile with one of his arrows. Joined by two of his brethren, the Dai Li retaliate with three fist attacks at Longshot, but Jet cuts them from the air with a whirlwind of slashes.</i><br><br><i>Meanwhile Long Feng has seen enough. He flees from the room, sealing a stone door behind him. Back at the battle, Aang lands and blows two Dai Li aside with a burst of air.)  </i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Long Feng is escaping! <br><br><i>(Aang and Jet break free from the melee to pursue him. Aang blasts open the stone door, and they race down the passageway after the minister. They follow him as he turns into yet another chamber, a large room filled with pipe openings. As the enter, the door seals behind them, and Long Feng drops from the ceiling behind them.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(threateningly)</i> Alright Avatar, you've caused me enough problems. This is your last chance, ifyou want your bison back.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(outraged)</i> You <i>do</i> have Appa. Tell me where he is!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> Agree to exit the city now, and I'll waive all charges against you and allow you to leave with your lost pet. <br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(raising his swords)</i> You're in no position to bargain.<br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(haughtily)</i> Am I not? <br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(brandishing his staff)</i> You're definitely not!<br><b>Long Feng:</b> Jet, The Earth King has invited you to Lake Laogai.<br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(pupils dilating)</i> I am honored to except his invitation.<br><br><i>(Jet suddenly makes a brutal double slash at Aang's neck, which he nimbly avoids.</i><br><br><i>Leaping away from him, Aang reels backward in dismay as Jet charges him, snarling with anger.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Appa in his cell. He is growling and stamping his feet at the Blue Spirit, who stands just beyond his reach.) </i><br><br><b>Blue Spirit:</b> You're mine now. <br><br><i>(The door behind the Blue Spirit, and a shadow is seen in the light spilling inward. The Blue Spirit turns and readies both his swords to attack. Iroh enters the room, closing the door behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Blue Spirit: </b> <i>(taken aback)</i> Uncle?<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(feigning puzzlement)</i> So, the Blue Spirit. I wonder who could be behind that mask?<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(removing his mask) </i>What are you doing here?<br><b>Iroh:</b> I was just about to ask you the same thing. What do you plan to do now that you have found the Avatar's bison? Keep it locked in our new apartment? Should I go put on a pot of tea for him?<br><b>Zuko:</b> First I have to get it out of here.<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(incensed)</i>AND THEN WHAT?! You never think these things through! This is exactly what happened when you captured the Avatar at the North Pole! You had him, and then you had no where to go! <br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(heatedly)</i> I would have figured something out!<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(shouting angrily)</i> No!! If his friends hadn't found you, you would have frozen to death!<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(looking away in anguish)</i> I know my own destiny uncle.<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(forcefully)</i> Is it your own destiny? Or is it a destiny someone else has tried to force on you?<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(in torment)</i> Stop it Uncle. I have to do this. (turns away, toward Appa)<br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(pleading furiously)</i> I'm <i>begging</i> you Prince Zuko! It's time for you to look inward, and begin asking yourself the big questions. Who are you? And what do <i>you</i> want?<br><br><i>(With a cry of frustration, Zuko hurls both of his swords to the ground, followed by the Blue Spirit mask. The camera rises towards the opening in the distant ceiling. Appa is shown anchored by chains on each of his legs, as Zuko's shout continues to echo throughout the chamber.</i><br><br><i>We return to Jet and Aang, as Aang backpedals in a desperate attempt to avoid Jet's furious assault. He pleads with Jet as he continues to dodge his attacks.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(desperately)</i> Jet, it's me Aang! You don't have to do this.<br><b>Long Feng:</b> I'm afraid he no longer has a choice. <br><br><i>(Standing between them, a panting Jet, pauses to catch his breath. His eyes remain inky pools, and sweat runs down his face. With a shout, he renews his attack, showing evidence of tiring as Aang evades him. The Avatar propels him backwards with a blast of air. Jet slows himself with the hooks of his swords, which spark against the stone floor. Aang takes this opportunity to resume pleading with him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Jet, I'm your friend! Look inside your heart! <i>(Jet, gasping, seems conflicted)</i><br><b>Long Feng:</b> Do your duty Jet. <i>(Jet slowly approaches Aang, swords raised)</i><br><b>Aang: </b>He can't make you do this! You're a Freedom Fighter.<br><br><i>(At these final words, Jet straightens in shock. Everything goes white, and a tableau of images from his past flood his mind. We see Smellerbee, brandishing two swords in front of a tent, a dagger clenched in her teeth. The Duke and Pipsqueak are shown standing together. Scenes of him standing against a shy Katara. Cheers of the Freedom fighters as they feast in the tree fortress. Standing with Smellerbee and Longshot aboard the ferry. Sitting and speaking with Iroh and Zuko on the ferry deck. Handing food out to the passengers. Being dragged away by the Dai Li, and the brainwashing beneath the lake. Faces flash by rapidly, Iroh, Colonel Mongke, Long Feng, his own at various ages. Jet stands motionless, overcome by the thoughts racing through his brain. Behind him, Long Feng's voice cuts through his mental fog.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> Do it! Do it now!<br><br><i>(With a snarl of rage, Jet whirls and hurls one of his swords directly at Long Feng. It shrieks toward him, imbedding its pommel-spike in the stone wall as Long Feng avoids it. Long Feng simultaneously attacks with his earthbending, sending an out-thrust of stone rocketing towards Jet. When the dust clears, we see Jet is lying on the ground motionless, having taken the full brunt of the brutal attack. Momentarily stunned by the ferocious attack, the Avatar starts to rush Long Feng, who lifts himself to the entrance of a tunnel on a column of stone.)  </i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(contemptuously)</i> Foolish boy. You've chosen your own demise. <br><br><i>(He turns and vanished down the dark passage, as Aang moves over to where Jet lies.)</i><br><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(weakly)</i> I'm sorry, Aang.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(sitting at his side)</i> Don't be.<br><br><i>(Behind Aang, the doorway slides open, revealing the rest of his allies. They all rush forward to surround the stricken Jet, wearing sorrowful and shocked expressions. Katara draws forth her bending water, kneels beside him, and applies her healing powers to his chest.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(turning to the others) </i>This isn't good.<br><b>Smellerbee</b>: You guys go find Appa. We'll take care of Jet.<br><b>Katara:</b> We're not going to leave you.<br><b>Longshot:</b> <i>(speaking for the first time)</i> There's no time. Just go. We'll take care of him. He's our leader. <i>(The four heroes look at him with expressions of wonder.)</i><br><b>Jet:</b> <i>(tenderly)</i> Don't worry Katara, I'll be fine. <br><br><i>(Jet smiles weakly up at her, and she closes her eyes in grief before rising to her feet. The heroes file off somberly, leaving the Freedom Fighters behind. Toph and Sokka bring up the rear.</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(softly)</i> He's lying.<br><br><i>(Behind them, Smellerbee weeps over Jet. Longshot watches the heroes disappear down a passageway, before readying an arrow to cover the other entrance. Smellerbee gently strokes Jet's forehead as he prepares his final stand. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a stone door, which slides aside to reveal Toph, with the others close behind her. They step into a room where the six manacles lie empty within the prison.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Appa's gone. Long Feng beat us here. <br><b>Sokka:</b> If we keep moving, maybe we can catch up to him. <br><br><i>(An outcropping of rock bearing a circular stone plug arises at the edge of the lake. Cracks form on the plug, and it shoots off to shatter on the nearby cliff face. The four heroes emerge and start racing along the narrow shoreline. Glancing over his shoulder, Aang sees nine Dai Li emerge in pursuit from the hole behind them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(running beside Aang)</i> Do you think we can out run them?<br><b>Aang:</b> I don't think it's gonna matter.<br><br><i>(Ahead we see six more Dai Li flanking the waiting Long Feng. The six agents bend up a thirty foot wall of stone beneath Long Fengs feet, sealing the strip of land between the cliffside and the lake. The heroes draw to a stop, and behind them the Dai Li raise up another wall, boxing them in. They are enclosed and surrounded by eighteen Dai Li, who cling to the edges of the walls and the cliffside while Long Feng watches from atop the first wall. Momo, sweeps down out of the sky and lands on Aang's shoulder chattering excitedly.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> What is it Momo? <br><br><i>(Momo launches upward, past Long Feng, to disappear into the bright midday sun. Moments later Appa emerges from the dazzling light, hurtling downwards towards them. The four heroes look upwards with expressions of delight.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Appa!<br><br><i>(Appa swoops down and smashes through the first wall, continuing onward through the second. The Dai Li perched on the wall are knocked senseless by the bursting walls, and fall to the ground or spill into the water. Aang and Toph bend the cliff that the remaining agents are perched on, flinging them far out into the lake. Appa circles around to land heavily near the shaken Long Feng, as the remaining Dai Li flee. Turning from his fleeing men, Long Feng faces an enraged Appa.) </i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> I can handle you by myself. <br><br><i>(He launches a kick at Appa, who catches his leg in his teeth. With a mighty toss of his powerful neck, Appa sends him skipping far out across Lake Laogai, to disappear with a final splash. The sky-bison pauses momentarily before spitting out his shoe. Aang, Sokka, Katara and Momo throw themselves onto the shaggy bison, while Toph strokes his nose.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(hugging his leg) </i>Yeah! Appa!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(head pressed in his fur, crying)</i> I missed you, buddy.<br><br><i>(Appa's great brown eyes close in contentment. We cut to the heroes riding Appa over Lake Laogai. Katara stares down wistfully at the lake's surface, eyes brimming with tears. Aang puts a hand on her shoulder, and she turns back to them, wiping a tear. All four of the gather in an embrace, as Appa carries them off into the distance. Panning to the shore, we see Zuko and Iroh emerge from the passage originally uncovered by Toph.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> You did the right thing, nephew. <i>(Zuko pulls out the Blue Spirit mask, regarding its demonic visage as Iroh rests a hand on its shoulder)</i> Leave it behind.<br><br><i>(Zuko walks to the edge and drops the mask into the lake, where it slowly sinks into the depths.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

We're on a roll.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(critically)</i> One good hour after weeks of trouble isn't much of a roll.<br><b>Sokka:</b> We can build on it. If we want to invade the Fire Nation when the eclipse happens, we need the Earth King's support. <br><br><i>(Aang continues petting Appa in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> What makes you think we'll get it? I don't know if you've noticed, but things don't usually go that smoothly for our little gang. <br><b>Sokka:</b> I know, but I've got a good feeling about this. This time will be different.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(unconvinced)</i> Sokka, Long Feng is control of the city. His conspiracy with the Dai Li is too powerful. I've seen enough of Ba Sing Se, <i>(raises arms and opens eyes wide)</i> and I can't even see!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(leaping into the scene)</i> But now that we have Appa back, there is nothing stopping us from telling the Earth King the truth about the conspiracy and the war.<br><b>Sokka:</b> See, Aang's with me. <i>(puts arm over smiling Aang's shoulder, flashing a wide grin)</i> It's the whole reason we came here in the first place, we have to try. <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(thoughtfully)</i> Well, I guess if the Earth King knew the truth, things could change. <i>(both boys smile again)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(rising to feet)</i> I don't trust the new positive Sokka. (points accusingly) Long Feng brainwashed you, didn't he!<br><br><i>(Aang suddenly notices something off to his left. He rushes to the edge of the water, and we see that he has spied three Earth Kingdom ships off in the distance. Katara and Sokka rush up beside him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> That's probably the Dai Li searching for us. <i>(turns to Katara)</i> So?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(pauses, then decisively)</i> Let's fly!<br><br><i>(Cut to Appa, soaring toward the palace of Ba Sing Se. Riding bareback is terrifying! <i>(buries face in Appa's back)</i><br><br><i>(In another shot, we see Appa descending toward the distant palace, a massive complex at the center of the city, surrounded by a circular wall.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> There it is. That whole thing is the palace. The Earth King's chambers should be in the center. <i>(another shot of the palace, and the vast open plaza in front)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> We have to be careful. Long Feng's probably warned the King that we're coming.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Why would you assume that? If you ask me, I think we're just gonna sail right in....Ahhh! <br><br><i>(Appa evades a massive stone that streaks up and past them, leaving a billowing trail of dust behind it. Two earthbenders lift the Appa-sized stones from the ground, and two more rush forward to send one hurtling toward the heroes. Aang stares steadily ahead at the palace as the fly over the launch sites. One of the massive stones arcs directly at him, but he backhands it casually, shattering it without even glancing away. Appa emerges from the dust once more as more projectiles streak towards him. Aang splits a boulder with a strike of his staff, sending either half safely to the side.</i><br><br><i>Below, an earth kingdom commander, mounted upon an armored ostrich-horse, signals to the scores of earthbenders arrayed behind him on the central causeway. Striking the ground with the full force of his descent, Aang earthbends a cascading ring of rising stone blocks, which spread outward like a shockwave. The earthbender troops are flung into the air like rag-dolls, to drop insensible to the plaza surface. Appa lands directly in front of the mounted commander, and bringing his huge face close, knocks him off his mount with a mighty roar. Everyone dashes together toward the palace stairs along the block-paved causeway. Ahead, more earthbenders line either side of their path. Acting in unison, each bends up a head-sized block of stone, and punches it at the heroes. Aang swipes some of them from the air, while Toph pushes up projections of stone to block others. Twirling his staff around his body, the Avatar causes the large stone blocks of the causeway to rotate, shielding them from yet more of the attacks. Meanwhile, Katara is stunning the men with vicious cracks of her long water whip.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Sorry! <i>(winces at the soldiers cries of pain)</i><br><br><i>(Yet another group of earthbenders rush down the causeway toward them. She twirls in the air, imparting a spin to the long strand orbiting her. Landing gracefully, she slaps them into the moat, tumbles and lands in a defensive stance. It sits in a lake of slurry and is enclosed by a recently erected perimeter of stone wall. The Earth King wears a stunned expression. Now atop the great wall, the Earth King gazes down at the massive machine penetrating the outer defenses.)</i><br><br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(shaken)</i> I can't believe I never knew. <i>(he looks to his right as Long Feng arrives on a stone elevator, flanked by two of his agents)</i><br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(reasonably)</i> I can explain this, Your Majesty. <i>(approaches)</i> This is nothing more than... a construction project. <i>(gestures down at the Drill)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Really Then perhaps you can explain why there's a Fire Nation insignia on your construction project. <i>(gestures toward the drill, which bears the symbol clearly upon its back)</i><br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(lamely)</i> Well, it's imported of course. You know you can't trust domestic machinery. <i>(smiles weakly, everyone stares at him)</i> Surely you don't believe these children, instead of your most loyal attendant?!<br><br><i>(The Earth King, clearly in shock, looks first to the heroes then over to Long Feng, who wears an unreadable expression.)</i><br><br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(firmly)</i> Dai Li, arrest Long Feng. I want him to stand trial for crimes against the Earth Kingdom.<br><br><i>(Long Feng's expression changes to one of alarm. The heroes look surprised at this sudden victory. The two Dai Li agents exchange glances, and then snare Long Feng's wrists in their chain-manacles. They pull him backwards, securing his arms behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Long Feng:</b> <i>(outraged)</i> You can't arrest me. You all need me more than you know! <i>(is drug away by the agents)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> (<i>shouting after him mockingly) </i>Looks like Long Feng is "long gone"! Ha...Oh, yeah, I've been <i>waitin'</i> to use that one. <i>(rubs a tear from one of his eyes)</i><br><br><i>(Scene fades to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to a night-time view of the palace, then inside the Earth Kings throne room. The four heroes are lined before the base of the dais. The King is seated on his throne, his pet bear sitting at his feet.)</i><br><br><b>Earth King:</b> I want to thank you, young heroes for opening my eyes. All this time, what I thought was a great metropolis, was merely a city of fools, and that makes me the king fool. <i>(buries his face in one of his hands) </i>We're at war, with the <i>Fire</i> Nation.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(stepping forward)</i> That's why we came to Ba Sing Se, Your Highness. Because we think you can help us end the war. <i>(Momo perches on the King's shoulder)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(earnestly)</i> We don't have much time. There's a comet coming this summer. Its energy will give the fire benders unbelievable strength. They'll be unstoppable. <i>(Momo hops to sit atop Bosco, as the Earth King leans forward intently)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> But there is hope. Before the comet comes, we have a window of opportunity. A solar eclipse is coming. The sun will be entirely blocked out by the moon, and the fire benders will be helpless. <br><b>Earth King:</b> What are you suggesting, Sokka?<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(decisively)</i> That's the day we need to invade the Fire Nation. The Day of Black Sun.<br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(apprehensively)</i> I don't know. That would require moving troops out of Ba Sing Se. We'd be completely vulnerable.<br><b>Sokka:</b> You're <i>already</i> vulnerable. The Fire Nation won't stop until Ba Sing Se falls. You can either sit back and wait for that to happen, or take the offensive, and give yourself a fighting chance.  <i>(everyone waits anxiously as the King considers his options)</i><br><b>Earth King:</b> Very well. You have my support.<br><b>Gang:</b> <i>(drawing together)</i> Woo! Alright! Good work team! <i>(Sokka, Toph and Katara hug, as Aang circles them on an air scooter)</i><br><b>General How:</b> <i>(entering the throne room)</i> Your Majesty. I apologize for the interruption. <i>(he walks up next to the heroes, at the base of the dais, and drops to his hands and knees)</i><br><b>Earth King:</b> This is General How, he's the leader of The Council of Five. My highest- ranking generals. <br><b>General How:</b> <i>(lifting his forehead from the floor)</i> We searched Long Feng's office. I think we found something that will interest everybody. <i>(the heroes look to each other)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to show a guardsman carrying a small ornate chest. General How, the Earth King and the heroes are gathered around a desk in Long Feng's private study. The guardsman slides the box across the desk to the Earth King, then departs.)</i><br><br><b>General How:</b> There are secret files on everyone in Ba Sing Se. Including you kids. <i>(the King opens the chest)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> Secret files?<br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(reading the address on a rolled up scroll)</i> Toph Bei Fong. <i>(the scroll is handed across to Toph, who hands it to Katara)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(unrolling and reading)</i> It's a letter from your mom. You mom's here in the city, and she wants to see you. <i>(Toph's face lights up in surprise)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(disgusted)</i> Long Feng intercepted our letters from home? That's just sad.<br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(handing another to the Avatar)</i> Aang.<br><b>General How:</b> This scroll was attached to the horn of your bison when the Dai Li captured it.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(reading)</i> It's from the Eastern Air Temple.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(hopefully)</i> Is there a letter for me and Sokka by any chance?<br><b>Earth King:</b> I'm afraid not.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(both siblings exchange sorrowful looks)</i> Oh.<br><b>General How:</b> But there <i>is</i> an intelligence report that might interest you. <i>(hands another scroll to Katara)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(reading)</i> A small fleet of water tribe ships...<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(eagerly)</i> What? That could be Dad.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(in rising excitement)</i> Protecting the mouth of Chameleon Bay, led by Hakoda. It is Dad!<br><br><i>(Cut to the night-time exterior of the apartments. Inside, Iroh is pouring hot tea into a stoneware cup.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh:</b> You should know this is not a natural sickness. But that shouldn't stop you from enjoying tea. <i>(supports Zuko's head as he drinks)</i><br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(disorientated)</i> What? What's happening?<br><b>Iroh:</b> You're critical decision, what you did beneath that lake...it was in such conflict with your image of yourself, that you are now at war within your own mind and body. <i>(Zuko takes a second sip of the tea)</i><br><b>Zuko:</b> What's that mean <i>(collapses in a fit of coughing)</i><br><b>Iroh:</b> You're going through a metamorphosis, my nephew. It will not be a pleasant experience, but when you come out of it, you will be the beautiful Prince you were always meant to be. <i>(mops Zuko's forehead with the damp cloth, as the camera draws back from their window)</i><br><br><i>(Aang, Sokka, Toph and Katara sit in a circle on a rug inside Long Feng's office.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(reading his scroll)</i> I can't believe it. There's a man living at the Eastern Air Temple. He says he's a Guru. <i>(Momo seems to study the scroll beside him)</i><br><b>Sokka:</b> What's a Guru? Some kind of poisonous blowfish? <i>(scratches the back of his head)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(eagerly)</i> No, a spiritual expert. He wants to help me take the next step in the Avatar journey. He says he can teach me to control the Avatar State.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(happily)</i> And I can't believe we know where our Dad is now. <i>(holds the report)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(reassured)</i> I know what you mean. My Mom's in the city, and from her letter it sounds like she finally understands me.<br><b>Sokka:</b> This is all such big news. Where do we even start?<br><b>Katara:</b> I hate to say it, but...we have to split up.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(distraught)</i> Split up? We just found Appa and got the family back together. Now you want us to separate? <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(firmly)</i> You have to meet this Guru, Aang. If we're gonna invade the Fire Nation, you need to be ready.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(smiling)</i> Well, if I'm going to the Eastern Air Temple. Appa and I can drop you at Chameleon Bay to see your Dad.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(resigned)</i> Someone has to stay here with the Earth King and help him plan for the invasion. I guess that's me? (rises to his feet with a glum expression)<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(rises)</i> No Sokka, I know how badly you want to help Dad. You go to Chameleon Bay, I'll stay here with the king.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(tears welling in his eyes)</i> You are...the nicest... sister...ever. <i>(does a strange little happy dance, throws his arms around her and kisses her cheek)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(pushes him back)</i> Easy there, big brother. <i>(pleased)</i> Though you're right, I am.<br><br><i>(Cut to the next morning, the plaza at the foot of the palace. The Earth King is descending the great stair, to where the heroes are gathered around Appa. Katara is pressing affectionately against Appa's flank. Aang looks hesitant, then turns to speak to her.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(softly)</i> Katara, I need to tell you something. I've been wanting to say it for a long time. <i>(blushes and looks down)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(curiously)</i> What is it Aang?<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(hesitantly, still blushing)</i> Katara, I...<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(abruptly interrupts, throwing Aang in a headlock)</i> Alright! Who's ready to get going on our little men-only man trip <i>(gives Aang a head-noogie, as Katara wears a incredulous expression)</i><br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(approaching) </i>Aang and Sokka, I wish you good journey. (they wheel about, Aang still in the headlock) Ba Sing Se owes you its thanks, and we look forward to your return. <i>(Sokka releases him, and all three of them bow respectfully to the King)</i><br><b>Guard:</b> Your Majesty. There are three female warriors here to see you, they're from the island of Kyoshi.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(shocked)</i> That's Suki!! <i>(freezing while climbing Appa's side, he slips and falls to the stone plaza, sits up, and begins rubbing his sore back)</i><br><b>Earth King:</b> You know these warriors?<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>( rising, speaking confidently)</i> Oh yeah. The Kyoshi warriors are a skilled group of fighters, trust worthy too. They're good friends of ours.<br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(satisfied)</i> Then we shall welcome them as honored guests.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(turning to the departing Avatar)</i> Wait, Aang. <br><br><i>(She throws her arms around him, much to his surprise. She kisses his cheek, causing Aang to blush furiously.) </i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(quietly)</i> I'm really gonna miss you guys.<br><b>Katara:</b> Me too.<br><b>Aang:</b> Yeah.<br><br><i>(Katara and Aang throw their arms around her lovingly, while Sokka stands apart, arms folded. He peeks up just in as they swarm him around him, catching him in a group hug.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(embarrassed)</i>Ahhh! Great! That's enough! Ok, we love each other. <i>(pats Katara and Aang's head)</i>  Seriously.<br><br><i>(Appa soars away from the palace, bearing Sokka and Aang. We cut to show Zuko sleeping inside his apartment. Rising wearily, he leaves bed walking past the sleeping Iroh. He slides open a door into a small washroom, and splashes water from a basin over his face. He looks up into the mirror. The prince is startled to see his reflection mimics that of the Avatar. It is without his scar, completely bald, and bears the blue arrow tattoo. With a cry, he suddenly starts from his sleep.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> Ahhhh! <i>(sitting up in a jolt, he breathes heavily, eyes wide)</i><br><br><i>(Zuko places his fingers around his left eye. He closes them as he realizes his still bears his terribly scar.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the skies over the barrens, as Appa flies among the low clouds. Aang sits on his neck as Sokka reclines comfortably on Appa's back.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka<i>:</i></b><i> (smugly)</i> You see Aang, a little positive thinking works wonders. We got the King on our side, we got Long Feng arrested, and when we get back, Suki's waiting for me.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(love-struck)</i> Yeah, girls are waiting for us. Thanks "positive attitude".<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(cheerfully)</i> Everything's gonna work out perfectly, from now on and forever. <i>(Aang turns and shares his smile)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to the gloom of the Earth Kingdom prison, the walls and cell doors clad in steel. Inside one of the cells, Long Feng sits dejectedly. The face of a Dai Li agent appears at the barred window of the cell door, and a tray of food is slid through the gap beneath it.)</i><br><br><b>Dai Li Agent:</b> Dinner. <i>(in a low voice)</i> The Council of Five and the military are loyal to the Earth King, but the Dai Li remains loyal to you, Long Feng, sir. <i>(walks away)</i><br><br><i>(Long Feng looks up from his food to smile eagerly, then takes a satisfied bite from a large rice ball, his eyes brimming with cunning.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a beautiful house in the upper ring of Ba Sing Se. Toph hesitates at the front door, takes a deep breath and exhales nervously. Stepping up to the door, she raps lightly on it, and the unlocked door opens slightly. She steeps into the unlit room, which is bare of furnishings.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Hello? Mom? Anyone home? <br><br><i>(She walks into the center of the large empty room with a look of confusion, which is replaced by one of suspicion. She readies herself for trouble just as a large steel trap descends from the ceiling. She gives a shriek of surprise as it snaps her up, enclosing her in a metal box)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(frightened) </i>Hey! Who do you think you're dealing with?! <i>(outside, two figures drop down from above)</i><br><b>Xin Fu:</b> One loud mouth little brat who strayed too far from home.<i> (Xin Fu and Master Yu stride out of the shadows toward the trap)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to an exterior view of the Earth King's palace, panning down to show two lines of soldiers creating a path towards a platform. Three Kyoshi warriors walk  past the troops toward the Earth King. As they approach him he begins to address them.)</i><br><br><b>Earth King:</b> <i>(formally)</i> In our hour of need, it is with the highest honor that I welcome our esteemed allies, the Kyoshi warriors. <br><br><i>(All three drop to hands and knees, pressing their heads to the ground. When he finishes, they raise their heads, and we can see that "Suki" is none other than Azula in disguise. She is flanked by Ty Lee and Mai, similarly dressed in the garb of the Kyoshi warriors.)</i><br><br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(her voice is steady, her eyes cool and deadly) </i> We are the Earth King's humble servants.</i><br><br><i>(Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Sokka turns and looks out over the camp below, and lets out a resigned sigh before heading off for it. We see Sokka nervously walking into the encampment. Water Tribe warriors who were engaged in various activities turn to regard Sokka with a pleasant, surprised look. Sokka is intercepted in the middle of the camp by a tall warrior. The regard each other for a moment, then clasp arms in greeting, broad smiles on their faces. The other men gather around them, laughing with delight.)</i><br><br><b>Water Tribe Warrior</b>: Sokka, good to see you.<br><br><i>(Another of the tribesmen pushes on the top of Sokka's head in a friendly fashion, scrunching him down like a small boy. The smiling men stand aside to reveal the tent at the head of the encampment, which bears the symbol of the Northern Water Tribe. Sokka strides toward the command tent, his eyes filled with emotion. He parts the flaps of the tent to reveal a group of senior tribesmen sitting around a chart of the world. At the end of the tent his father Hakoda sits, pondering the map. As the flaps  close behind him, Sokka's tentative expression changes to a small smile. A warrior bearing burn scars on his arm and chest kneels next to Hakoda, returning Sokka's smile. Hakoda is preoccupied with the map, frowning in  concentration until the warrior nudges him with an elbow. He finally looks up, shocked then elated to see his son.)</i><br><br><b>Hakoda</b>: Sokka.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(voice thick with emotion)</i> Hi Dad.<br><br><i>(Hakoda rises and crosses the tent, and father and son embrace. Sokka rests his head on his father's shoulder with a blissful look of happiness.<br><br>Cut to the grandiose throne room of the Earth King. The King is seated on his golden throne. As we speak, the Council of Five is meeting to plan an invasion of The Fire Nation this summer. On the day of a solar eclipse. <br><br><i>(Azula's eyes widen slightly at these last words.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(feigning enthusiasm)</i> Really? Now that sounds like a fascinating and brilliant plan. <br><br><i>(The three girls exchange glances.<br><br>Cut to the military headquarters of Ba Sing Se. On the top floor, an enormous open chamber serves as the war room. The center of the ornate room is dominated by a map of the known world, perhaps sixty feet to a side. Katara kneels at the raised frame of the map, Momo perched on her shoulder. The Council of Five are seated at a long table overlooking it.)</i><br><br><b>General How</b>: General Fong's base will serve as the launching point of the attack. <i>(a closer view reveals colored stone markers representing military units)</i> In exactly two months, the Army and Navy will invade the Fire Nation on The Day of Black Sun. <br><br><i>(As he says this, he earthbends three earth unit markers across the sea to the fire nation capitol, where a red marker stands. Momo suddenly pounces on the fire nation maker, scattering the other pieces.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(amused)</i> Or we could send in Momo to do some damage. <br><br><i>(Momo continues to hop around the map, scattering more pieces) </i><br><br><b>Katara</b>:<i>(laughing)</i> Cause the...<i> (continues to laugh, then notices the grim expressions of the Council)</i>...sorry. <br><br><i>(With a gesture, General How snaps the pieces upright. A startled Momo shrieks and races off the map, to perch on Katara's shoulder once more.)</i><br><br><b>General How</b>: All we need is the Earth King's seal in order to execute the plan. <i>(places a scroll on a section of the map frame, which he bends across the map to Katara)</i><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(respectfully)</i> I'll get these scrolls to him right away. Thank you, General How. <br><br><i>(She picks up the scroll, rises and bows slightly, and turns to depart.<br><br>Cut to Appa, flying towards us from the direction of the setting sun, past mist shrouded mountain peaks. From his seat on Appa, Aang looks about in wonder, and perhaps nostalgia. Ahead we see the three mountain spires of the Eastern Air Temple, linked by bridges. Aang peers ahead as Appa soars closer to the temple, and we see the Guru Pathik seated in the lotus position upon a round dias. Momo settles in for a landing at its base. Sitting on Appa's large shaggy head, Aang looks up towards the Guru.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(uncertainly)</i> Um, hello? <i>(hops down, starts up stairs)</i> You're Guru Pathik, right? I was a spiritual brother of your people, and a personal friend of Monk Gyatso.<br><b>Aang</b>:<i>(sits facing the Guru)</i> In your note, you said you could teach me to gain control of the Avatar State. How?<br><b>Guru Pathik</b>: <i>(serenely)</i> You must gain balance within yourself before you can bring balance to the world. And the first step to gaining balance begins with this. <i>(holds up a wooden cup with a yellow liquid in it)</i> Drink up!<br><br><i>(Aang tentatively takes a swallow of the thick yellow stuff, and reacts with disgust, spitting it out to his left.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(appalled)</i> Ugh! It tastes like onion and banana juice!<br><b>Guru Pathik</b>: That's because it is. <i>(Pathik empties another bowl, and holds it over his head like a ridiculous hat) </i>Yum yum! <br><br><i>(Aang gapes at him in stunned disbelief.<br><br>Cut to a road in the rocky, forested lands of the Earth Kingdom. The Bei Fong Estate's this way.<br><b>Master Yu</b>: I'm quite certain you're mistaken. <i>(both turn to the sound of loud banging from the box)</i><br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(urgently shouting)</i> Hey! Can you two old ladies quit your bickering for a second? I gotta go to the bathroom! <i>(she is seen standing inside the dark box)</i><br><b>Master Yu</b>: <i>(hesitantly)</i> Oh. Okay, but make it quick. <br><br><i>(Yu takes out key and prepares to head to the back.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu</b>: <i>(grabbing Yu's arm)</i> What's wrong with you!<br><b>Master Yu</b>: Oh very sneaky Toph! Nice try, but you can't trick me. <i>(tosses key in his palm, resumes seat)</i><br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(furious)</i> Let me out of here, so I can kick both your butts! <i>(bangs on walls)</i><br><b>Xin Fu</b>: <i>(angrily) </i>Quit your banging. <i>(strikes the side of box) </i>You might think you're the greatest earthbender in the world, but even <i>you</i> can't bend metal. <br><br><i>(Xin Fu cracks the reins, starting the wagon off again. Azula paces the floor behind them.) </i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: We have been presented with an extraordinary opportunity, girls.<br><b>Ty Lee</b>: <i>(teasingly)</i> Mai finally gets to wear makeup that's not totally depressing?<br><b>Mai</b>: <i>(deadpan)</i> Ha. Ha. <i>(she has large, dark splotches of makeup beneath her eyes)</i><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(walking to a window)</i> I'm talking about conquering the <i>whole</i> Earth Kingdom. <i>(the two girls turn with shocked looks)</i> <br><b>Azula</b>:<i>(staring out the window)</i> For a hundred years the fire nation has hammered away at Ba Sing Se from the outside. But if we open the paths between the pools... <i>(clears some moss clogging the water with his stick. It deals with survival and is blocked by fear. <br><br><i>(We see inside Aang's mind, which shows a red-lit image of the Blue Spirit mask, then the Blue Spirit himself, holding swords to Aang's throat.)</i><br><br><b>Guru Pathik</b>: <i>(in voice-over)</i> What are you most afraid of? He cries out in terror, and closes his eyes once more.)</i><br><br><b>Guru Pathik</b>: <i>(voice-over)</i> Aang, your vision is not real. We see him leaving a note before fleeing the Northern Air Temple, a century ago.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>:<i>(voice-over)</i> I ran away. <br><br><i>(Aang is shown in the avatar state, riding a tornado of wind. In a rage, he lashes out at the soldiers in the Earth Kingdom fortress. We've been using these tangle mines to stop the fire nation ships from getting through.<br><b>Bato</b>: Your father invented tangle mines himself. <i>(pours liquid into the cap of the spherical mine)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: Destructive, buoyant, and <i>(takes a smell of the cap, recoils in disgust)</i> terrible smelling.<br><b>Hakoda</b>: Very perceptive. The mines are filled with skunk-fish and seaweed. <i>(affixes the plug onto the cap, and trims the sealant from the edges)</i> When a ship detonates the mine, the seaweed tangles up the propeller, and the foul smell forces people to abandon the ship. Good one Dad!<br><b>Bato</b>: <i>(rolling his eyes)</i> You are definitely your father's son.<br><b>Water Tribe Soldier</b>:<i>(urgently)</i> Hakoda, our scouts have spotted four fire nation ships. <i>(the other tribesmen gather round)</i><br><b>Hakoda</b>: Bato, get these mines loaded up. The rest of you men, prepare for battle! <i>(the warriors rush off, as Sokka sits and watches them leave)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(uncertain) </i>Uh, what should I do, Dad?<br><b>Hakoda</b>: Aren't you listening? I said the rest of you men get ready for battle.<br><br><i>(Sokka is shocked for a moment, then rises, grins and runs off to join the others. The Jasmine Dragon will be the best tea shop in the city.<br><b>Iroh</b>: No, I'm thankful because you decided to share this special day with me. <i>(puts a hand on Zuko's arm)</i> It means more than you know. <i>(Zuko gives him a warm hug, to his surprise)</i><br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(enthusiastically)</i> Now let's make these people some tea.<br><b>Iroh</b>: <i>(eagerly) </i>Yes! Let's make some tea!<br><br><i>(Cut to the fog shrouded peaks near the Easter Air Temple. The mists are lit by a golden light as the sun rises above the mountains. How's that a trick?<br><b>Toph</b>: It's not! It's the real deal! <br><br><i>(Both of the men turn to see Toph standing in the road behind them.
