Xin Fu is shown inside, with Master Yu tightly pressed in behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Xin Fu</b>: <i>(dolefully)</i> I'm going to be stuck in here forever with you, aren't I?<br><b>Master Yu</b>: <i>(pathetically) </i>I have to go to the bathroom. <br><br><i>(Xin Fu strikes his head against the metal wall in despair.<br><br>Nighttime at Chameleon Bay. Sokka sheathes his machete, and picks up his war club. His father approaches, as the warriors finish loading the ships.)</i><br><br><b>Hakoda</b>: Ready to go knock some Fire Nation heads?<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(earnestly)</i> You don't know how much this means to me dad. I'll make you proud, and I'll finally prove to you what a great warrior I am.<br><b>Hakoda</b>: <i>(reassuringly)</i> Sokka, you don't have to prove anything to me. <i>(places a hand on his shoulder)</i> I'm already proud of you, and I've always known you were a great warrior.<br><b>Sokka</b>: Really?<br><b>Hakoda</b>: Why do you think I trusted you to look after our tribe when I left?<br><br><i>(Sokka and Hakoda head off to the ships. Looking back, Sokka watches his father's ships head out of the bay toward open waters. From the deck of his flagship, Hakoda looks back and smiles toward his son.<br><br>Scene changes to the steel holding cells of Ba Sing Se. Azula is being escorted by a pair of Dai Li Agents, who hold her arms. She is brought into the cell holding Long Feng.)</i><br><br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(outraged)</i> What is this about? Your agents show up in the middle of the night and drag me down here? You will not treat a Kyoshi Warrior this way! <i>(struggles against her captors)</i><br><b>Long Feng</b>: <i>(in a sinister voice)</i> But you are not a Kyoshi Warrior, are you? <i>(rises from his bench)</i> Princess Azula of the Fire Nation!<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(stops struggling)</i> What do you want?<br><b>Long Feng</b>: I want to make a deal. It's time that I regain control of Ba Sing Se. And you have something I need. <br><b>Azula</b>: Oh? <br><b>Long Feng</b>: The Earth King's trust.<br><b>Azula</b>: <i>(warily)</i> Why should I help you?<br><b>Long Feng</b>: Because I can get <i>you</i> the Avatar.<br><b>Azula</b>: I'm listening. <i>(both smile wickedly)</i><br><br><i>(Inside the Jasmine Dragon, Zuko is sweeping up for the evening. As Iroh clears a table, a man enters and walks up to him.)</i><br><br><b>Messenger</b>: A message from the royal palace. <br><br><i>(He bows and hands a scroll to Iroh, who reads it with a look of worry. His eyes widen with astonishment.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: <i>(overcome)</i> I...I can't believe it. <br><b>Zuko</b>: <i>(walking over)</i> What is it Uncle?<br><b>Iroh</b>: <i>(elated)</i> Great news! We've been invited to serve tea to the Earth King! <br><br><i>(Iroh runs off excitedly towards the rear of the tea house. Zuko watches him go with a smile, then resumes sweeping, as the camera draws back out the entrance.<br><br>The door closes to Long Feng's cell, leaving him in shadow. Azula is led away by the Dai Li, head low. As she approaches closer, her eyes open, and she smiles cruelly. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

You were never even a player.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Zuko in their underground cell. I see <i>(turns away and places a hand to his scar)</i>.<br><b>Katara</b>:<i>(regretfully) </i>No, no, that's not what I meant.<br><b>Zuko</b>: It's ok. I used to think this scar marked me. The mark of the banished prince, cursed to chase the Avatar forever. It can't be healed.<br><br><i>(Katara reaches under her shirt and holds up the water from the spirit oasis at the North Pole, given to her by Master Pakku.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: This is water from the Spirit Oasis at the North Pole. It has special properties, so I have be saving it forsomething important. <i>(walks up to Zukoand faces him)</i> I don't know if it would work, but...<br><br><i>(Zuko stares at her for a moment before closing his eyes and silently accepting Katara's offer.<br><br>Katara places her hand on Zuko's scar and examines it. What are you doing with the Avatar!! <i>(points a finger at Aang)</i><br><b>Aang</b>: Saving you, that's what.<br><br><i>(Zuko snarls at Aang and tries to lunge at him, but Iroh grabs him, preventing him from causing a fight.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: Zuko, it's time we talked. <i>(turns to Aang and Katara)</i> Go help your other friends. We'll catch up with you.<br><br><i>(Aang clasps his hands and bows respectfully to Iroh before running back through the hole in the cave. Katara slowly follows after him. It's time for you to choose good! <br><br><i>(Zuko shuts his eyes, absorbing his uncle's words. Before he can process this wisdom, Zuko is startled by a violent quake. You will have your father's love. Zuko slings the fire around and continues his relentless attack.</i><br><br><i>Cut to Azula as she lands feet first on the floor, a puddle of water beneath her. She and Katara run towards each other. Hakoda returns the embrace.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(crying)</i>I understand why you left. I really do, and I know that you had to go, so why do I still feel this way? I was so sad and angry, and hurt.<br><b>Hakoda:</b> I love you more than anything. You and your brother are my entire world. I thought about you every day I was gone, and every night when I went to sleep. I would lay awake missing you so much, it would ache.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Hakoda. The camera tilts down to Katara, tears running down her cheeks, before the scene cuts to the Fire Lord's throne room. Zuko kneels on the floor before as he paces to the left.)</i><br><br><b>Ozai:</b> I am proud of you, Prince Zuko. I am proud because your sister conquered Ba Sing Se. I am proud because, when your loyalty was tested by your treacherous uncle, you did the right thing, and captured the traitor. And I am proudest of all of your most legendary acco mplishment. You slayed the Avatar.<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of Ozai as he walks around behind Zuko. The camera tilts down to Zuko as he raises his eyebrow in surprise.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> What did you hear?<br><b>Ozai:</b> Azula told me everything. She said she was amazed and impressed with your power and ferocity at the moment of truth.<br><br><i>(There is a brief close up of Zuko looking away before the scene cuts to a shot of Aang gliding barely a foot over the ocean. The wing of his glider dips into the water as Aang tries to keep control. Briefly cut to a close up of Aang before cutting to a panning right shot of a blockade of Fire Nation ships.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Blockade.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Aang as he takes a huge breath. Cut to an overhead shot of Aang as he collapses his glider and dives into the water. Aang torpedoes through the water and under the blockade, scaring away three green sealguanas. Cut to a shot of Aang popping out of the water on the other side. He catches his breath and is clearly exhausted. Aang spots a large peace of drift wood and swims over to it. Aang grabs on to it and smiles as an idea comes into his head. Cut to a quick zooming out shot of Aang windsurfing, using the driftwood as a board and his glider staff as a sail and bouncing over the waves. Fade to another shot of Aang wind surfing, but now it is raining heavily. Aang struggles to hang on as the board bounces high into the air. Aang hits the water, but wipes out. He disappears into the waves and the glider staff towards the camera just before cutting to a tilting up shot of the Fire Nation royal palace. Cut to a shot of Azula lying in her bed. The door opens and the light shines in, casting Zuko's shadow over Azula.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> Why'd you do it?<br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(eyes closed)</i> You're going to have to be a little more specific.<br><b>Zuko:</b> Why did you tell Father That I was the one who killed the Avatar?<br><b>Azula:</b> Can't this wait until morning?<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(sternly)</i> It can't<br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(Sighs, opens her eyes and sits up)</i> Fine. You seemed so worried about how father would treat you because you hadn't captured the Avatar. I figured, if I gave you the credit, you'd have nothing to worry about.<br><b>Zuko:</b> But why? <br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(gets out of bed) </i> Call it a generous gesture. I wanted to thank you for your help, and I was happy to share the glory. <br><b>Zuko:</b> You're lying.<br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(walks past Zuko) </i>If you say so. <br><b>Zuko:</b> You have another motive for doing this. I just haven't figure out what it is.<br><b>Azula:</b> Please, Zuko. What ulterior motive could I have? What could I possibly gain by letting you get all the glory for defeating the Avatar? Unless somehow, the Avatar was actually alive. All that glory would suddenly turn to shame and foolishness. But you said yourself that was impossible. Sleep well, Zuzu.<br><br><i>(Azula lays her head on her pillow and closes her eyes. Cut to a shot of Zuko walking out of the room and down the hall. The scene cuts to a lightning strike in the sky. Cut to Aang desperately trying to hang on to the drift wood and not be swept away. He reaches out to his glider as it floats further away. Aang yells as he is caught in a huge wave and is plunged beneath the water. Aang swims back up and grab a hold of the drift wood. Cut to a very close profile shot of Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I'm not gonna make it. I failed. <br><br><i>(There is another flash of lightning and the spirit of Avatar Roku appears before Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b>Roku?<br><b>Roku:</b> You haven't failed, Aang. <br><b>Aang:</b> But everyone thinks I am dead again. They think I've abandoned them, and I'm losing this war. I'm letting the whole world down. <br><b>Roku:</b> If anyone is to blame for the state of the world, it is me. I should've seen this war coming, and prevented it. You inherited my problems and my mistakes. But I also believe you are destined to redeem me, and save the world. <br><b>Aang:</b> I don't know.<br><br><i>(A beam of moonlight casts over Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Yue:</b> <i>(off screen) </i>You already saved the world. <br><br><i>(Aang looks up to the sky. The camera tilts up to show the moon shining through the clouds. The spirit of Yue appears in front of it.)</i><br><br><b>Yue:</b> And you'll save the world again. But you can't give up.<br><br><i>(Yue descends towards Aang. Cut to a shot of Aang staring in wonder. His expression quickly turns to determination.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> You're right. I won't give up.<br><br><i>(Aang waves his arm in a circle. The camera zooms out far as Aang bends a large wave of water behind him, pushing him forward. Cut to a shot of Aang climbing on top of the drift wood and riding it like a surfboard. He waves his hands to both sides and picks up speed. Cut to a shot behind the wave. The camera tilts up and zooms out to show Yue, her back to the camera, raising her arms, making the wave grow even higher. Cut to a shot of the wave rolling across the ocean. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Aang riding on top of it and towards the camera. Cut back to Yue as she ascends back to the moon. The scene fades to a shot of Crescent Moon Isle. Lava trails flow from the top of the volcano and down into the sea. The camera tilts up to one part of the shore where the lava has not touched. Cut to a shot of Aang lying unconscious on the rocky shore. The camera tilts up towards the top of the still active volcano. Fade to another shot of the isle, only now it is dawn. Cut to a profile shot of Aang still unconscious. Momo jumps onto Aang's chest from off screen and licks Aang's cheek, awakening him. Momo hops off Aang as he groans and sits up. Cut to a shot of Katara running to Aang. Sokka and Toph follow after. Katara drops to her knees and hugs Aang's head.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You're ok!<br><br><i>(Toph, Sokka, Momo and Appa all gather around and form a group hug. After a moment, Aang breaks away.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I have so much to do. <br><b>Katara:</b> I know, but you'll have our help.<br><b>Toph:</b> You didn't think you could get out of training just by coming to the Fire Nation, did you?<br><b>Aang:</b> What about the invasion?<br><b>Sokka</b>: We'll join up with my dad and the invasion force on the day of the eclipse. <br><b>Toph:</b> Hey, what's... <i>(grabs Aang's broken and burnt glider from out of the water)</i> Oh...it's your glider.<br><br><i>(Toph hands the glider to Aang as they all stand up.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> That's okay. If someone saw it, it would give away my identity. It's better for now that no one knows I'm alive.<br><br><i>(Aang turns around and jumps onto a mound that trickling out lava. Cut to a close up of Aang and zoom in as he looks down solemnly. Aang spins the glider above his head and slams it into the lava end first before jumping away. Cut to a shot of the glider sticking out of the mound and zoom out. It ignites and is consumed by the flames.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

It pans up to the crater wherein lies the royal city, and pauses.  Cut to the Fire Lord's palace. Cut to Zuko's bedroom. The prince is tossing and turning, unable to sleep. He rises from bed and dons a hooded cloak. Slipping by an unguarded path over the crater's rim, he makes his way to a prison tower embedded in the slope of another, nearby volcano. As he stands in the prison courtyard, looking upward, a guard spots him.) </i><br><br><b>Guard:</b> Who's there? <br><br><i>(Without a word, Zuko turns and leaves. Cut to the Fire Nation outer islands, daytime. A mysterious cloud is scudding rapidly over the water. As it lights on one of the islands, voices emanate from it.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I think I see a cave below.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Shhush... keep quiet! <i>(The cloud disperses with a blast of airbending to reveal the kids, riding Appa. Sokka dismounts and begins a furtive reconnaissance.)</i> Great job with the cloud camo, but next time, let's disguise ourselves as the kind of cloud who knows how to keep its mouth shut.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Yeah, we wouldn't want a bird to hear us chatting up there and turn us in.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey! We're in <i>enemy</i> territory. Those are <i>enemy</i> birds. <br><br><i>(He points upward to four of the enemy, perched on a rock just behind him. One hops down onto his head and squawks plaintively. The kids laugh. Sokka is unamused. They walk toward the cave, Sokka lurking behind. Of a sudden, he leaps over their heads to ward off some [entirely imaginary] threat. Peering suspiciously about, he dashes into the cave, followed by the rest of the gaang.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, this is it. This is how we'll be living until the invasion begins. Hiding in cave after cave...after cave...after cave... <i>(His head drops further to his chest with each repetition of the word.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka, we don't need to become cave people. What we need is some new clothes.<br><b>Aang:</b> Yeah, blending in is better than hiding out. If we get Fire Nation disguises, we'll be just as safe as we would be hiding in a cave.<br><b>Toph:</b> Plus...they have <i>real</i> food out there. Does anyone wanna sit in the dirt and eat cave-hoppers? <i>(She punches the cave wall and several hoppers hop out. Momo catches one and begins chowing down. The kids appear revolted.)</i><br><b>Sokka: </b><i>(to Momo)</i> Looks like we got out voted, sport. <i>(To the kids)</i> Let's get some new clothes.<br><br><i>(The scene shifts to a nearby Fire Nation laundry. Several items of clothing are hung on lines outdoors, suspended over steam vents.  The kids, hiding in some rocks close by, survey the scene.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I don't know about this. These clothes belong to somebody.<br><b>Katara:</b>I call the silk robe! <i>(She leaps from the rocks, runs to her prize and snatches it from the line.)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> But if it's essential to our survival...then I call the suit!<br><br><i>(Plunder ensues. The laundry's lone attendant, stealing a nap in the doorway, is oblivious.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a secluded beach nearby. The kids are trying on their new duds.  A shot of Aang from behind, tying the belt from his suit around his forehead to conceal his arrow. He turns around.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b><b>:</b> Ta-dah! Normal kid.<br><b>Toph:</b> Hmm...I should probably wear shoes, but then I won't be able to see as well. Sorry shoes! <i>(Sitting down, she brings her knee up to her chest, pulling on the shoe's upper and popping out the sole with her foot, which propels it into Sokka's face. She stands up and evaluates her new customized footwear.)</i> Finally, a stylish shoe for the blind earthbender.<br><b>Katara:</b><i>(partially visible in the right side of the screen, from behind)</i> How do I look?<br><br><i>(Cut to a full frontal shot of Katara, presumably from Aang's p.o.v. The camera slowly pans upward from toe to top to reveal a ravishing Fire Nation beauty... with one false note. Aang, smitten, blushes, and then suddenly realizes the problem.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Uh...your mom's necklace.<br><b>Katara</b><b>:</b> <i>(chagrined)</i> Oh...oh, yeah. I guess it's pretty obviously water tribe, isn't it?<br><br><i>(Relunctantly, she removes it.</i><br><br><i>The scene changes to the bazaar of a nearby town, where Katara buys some new, more fire-themed neckware. Cut to an alley, where she puts it on and Toph and Sokka try on their own new accessories - a new headband for Toph and a topknot clasp for Sokka. For his part, Aang smoothes down Momo's ears and tucks him beneath his coat.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I used to visit my friend Kuzon here a hundred years ago. Hotman. <i>Hotman</i>. Hotman. <i>Hotman</i>.<br><br><i>(Three imposing, official-looking figures approach him.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Officer:</b> It's over, we caught you.<br><b>Aang</b><b>:</b> Who me?<br><b>Fire Nation Officer:</b> It couldn't be more obvious that you don't belong here. <i>(Aang cringes, expecting the worst.)</i> Next time you play hooky, you might want to take off your school uniform.<br><b>Aang:</b> Heh, heh. Uh! <br><br><i>(He is seized by the collar and pulled towards the camera.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the exterior of the Fire Nation school, dominated by a large statue of Ozai. Cut to an interior classroom. The door opens and Aang is thrust in. He and his new classmates stare at each other in mutual astonishment.)</i><br><br><b>Teacher (Ms. Kwan):</b> Oh! Is this a new mind ready for molding?<br><b>Aang:</b> That's right. <i>(He knocks himself on the head to indicate its lack of contents.)</i> Let the molding begin.<br><br><i>(The truant officers turn to leave.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan</b>: Wait a minute. <i>(The officers stop and turn around.)</i> You're not from the Fire Nation! <i>(Suspenseful moment as Ms. Kwan approaches Aang with a critical eye.)</i> Clearly <i>you're</i> from the <i>colonies</i>.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(relieved)</i> Yeah, the colonies. Of course. The Fire Nation colonies in the Earth Kingdom.<br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> Your etiquette is terrible. In the homeland, we <i>bow</i> to our elders. Like so. <br><br><i>(She bows her head, making a fist with her right hand, holding her left hand open and pointed upward so that the palm is perpendicular to her body, and bringing the two hands together so that the proximal phalanx of her infolded right index finger just touches the base of her left palm, again perpendicularly. The effect is of a small, stylized flame.)</i><br> <br><b>Aang:</b> Sorry ma'am.<br><br><i>(Aang attempts the salute, but reverses hands and meets his right palm with his entire left fist, instead of just the index finger. Aang smiles, reverses hands, and lowers his fist.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> <i>(tapping his head with her ferrule)</i> And we don't wear head coverings indoors.<br><b>Aang</b>: Um, I have a scar. It's <i>really</i> embarrassing.<br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> Very well. What is your name? Or should we just call you, "Mannerless Colony Slob"?<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(chuckling)</i> Just "Slob" is fine. <i>(This doesn't go over well. He tries a different tack.)</i> Or, uh... Kuzon. <br><br><i>(He turns to face the class with a friendly smile.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of a bell ringing, signaling school's out. Kids stream out the doors. Aang walks toward the camera, pulling open his jacket and whispering to Momo.)</i><br> <br><b>Aang: </b>We made it through the day, Momo. My name's On Ji. I like your headband, by the way.<br><br><i>(Aang smiles, meditating a reply, when he is suddenly jostled from behind by a tall Fire Nation boy [Hide], who walks past him to stand by On Ji.)</i><br><br><b>Hide:</b> <i>(contemptuously)</i> On Ji, you don't have to baby-sit the new kid.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(amiably)</i>Wow. <i>(He bows, Fire Nation style.)</i> You must be one of those popular kids I've been hearing about.<br><b>Hide:</b> That's right. The kids are seated around a fire.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Where have you been? We've been worried sick!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(covered in burn marks)</i> I got invited to play with some kids after school.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(standing up, flummoxed)</i> After <i>what</i>?<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(happily)</i> I enrolled in a Fire Nation school, and I'm going back tomorrow.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Enrolled in <i>what</i>?!<br><br><i>(He keels over.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the prison tower. An interior shot of feet walking down a corridor.  The guard from the beginning of the episode hears the footsteps and spins around, leveling his spear. He recognizes the hooded figure.)</i><br><br><b>Guard:</b> You again? Stop where you are. <i>(The figure raises its head, revealing a well-known face with a telltale scar.)</i> Prince Zuko?! <i>(Zuko grabs him by the collar and slams him against the wall.)</i> Ugh!<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(in a tone of insolent menace)</i> I'm going in for a visit. You're gonna stand guard here, and <i>no one</i> is going to know about this.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of Iroh's cell. The cell is bisected by a wall of bars so that one half is accessible from the door and the other half serves as a cage. Iroh, unkempt and dressed in rags, is seated crosslegged on a mat, facing the wall to the right of the cell door as one enters it. Zuko walks in and up to the bars.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> Uncle. It's me.<br><br><i>(He removes his hood. Iroh turns away to face the back of his cell, scowling. Cut to commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Scene: the interior of the cave. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me. <i>(Iroh is silent.)</i> You're not gonna say <i>anything</i>? <i>(Enraged, he kicks a stool and bends a blast of fire at the wall.)</i> Argh! You're a crazy old man! You're crazy, and if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter!<br><br><i>(He leaves, slamming the door behind him. Iroh bows his head, closing his eyes.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the Fire Nation classroom. Ms. Kwan enters and the children rise.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> Good morning, class. Recite the Fire Nation oath.<br><br><i>(They turn to the larger-than-life portrait of Ozai that dominates the room's rear wall, bow Fire Nation style and begin reciting. Aang stands up awkwardly, a few beats behind everyone else, and does his best to follow along.)</i><br><br><b>Students:</b> My life, I give to my country. Ms. Kwan scowls. The kids turn back around and sit down.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> <i>(rising and striking the open book before her with her ferrule for emphasis)</i> Since it's obviously hilarious to mock our national oath, we'll begin with a pop quiz on our Great March of Civilization.<br><br><i>(The students groan and take pens and paper in hand.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> Question one: What year did Fire Lord Sozin battle the Air Nation Army? <i>(Aang raises his hand. She acknowledges him suspiciously.)</i> Kuzon?<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(rising)</i> Is that a trick question? The Air Nomads didn't <i>have</i> a formal military. Sozin defeated them by ambush.<br><br><i>(The entire class stares open mouthed at this brazen heresy.)</i><br><br><b>Ms. Kwan:</b> <i>(flustered)</i> Well, I don't know how <i>you</i> could possibly know more than our national history book. Unless you were <i>there</i> a hundred years ago.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(thinking better of it and sitting down)</i> I'll just write down my best guess.<br><br><i>(Cut to band practice, in a different classroom. The music teacher taps his stand and the amateur orchestra commences playing. Aang, armed with a Tsungi horn, pauses a few moments to draw in a deep breath and suddenly lets fly a boisterous blast of something resembling music, maniacally dancing in place as he does so. The rest of the class stops playing, dumbfounded.)</i><br><br><b>Music Teacher:</b> Kuzon? <br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(stops playing)</i> I know. I'm a terrible Tsungi hornist.<br><b>Music Teacher:</b> No, child. That hullabaloo going on with your feet. Is that a nervous disorder?<br><b>Aang:</b> I was just dancing. You do dances here in the homeland, right?<br><b>Shoji: </b><i>(sitting beside him)</i> Not really, no.<br><b>Music Teacher: </b><i>(walking to the window)</i> Dancing is not conducive to a proper learning environment. Young people must have rigid discipline and order.<br><b>Aang:</b> But what about expressing yourself?<br><b>Music Teacher:</b> <i>(walking back to his stand)</i> I know sometimes we're so moved by our love for our nation, that we can't control our own bodies. <i>(Overcome with emotion, he claps his hand to his face and reconsiders.)</i> If you must, you may march in place quietly next time the urge hits you.<br><br><i>(The orchestra recommences, Aang marching quietly as directed but clearly malcontent.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the school courtyard. It appears to be recess, or lunch, and kids are scattered about the yard. As Aang exits the school building and enters the yard, the kids spot him and begin whispering; clearly, he has caused a sensation.)</i><br><br><b>On Ji:</b> <i>(approaching him)</i> Oh, hi, Kuzon. I really liked that crazy dance you were doing.<br><b>Aang:</b> Thanks, On Ji. I could show it to you again, if you'd like.<br><br><i>(He starts and yells as a blast of fire hits him from off-screen. Cut to Hide, across the yard, who has thrown the blast.)</i><br><br><b>Hide:</b> What'd you say, colony trash? You're gonna show her something? <i>(He approaches them.)</i><br><b>Aang</b><b>:</b> Just some dance movements.<br><b>Hide:</b> Nobody shows my On Ji <i>anything</i>, <i>especially</i> movements.<br><br><i>(He lunges at Aang, who steps neatly out of the way. For the next several seconds, Hide tries to land a blow on Aang, who is too quick and agile to be caught. At last, Hide is propelled by his own momentum onto the ground.  At this unfavorable juncture, the School Headmaster enters the scene, and naturally assumes that Aang has been bullying Hide, rather than the other way around.)</i><br><br><b>School Headmaster:</b> Picking fights on your second day? We need to have a conference to discuss your punishment. Bring your parents to my office after school.<br><b>Aang</b><b>:</b> Parents? But...<br><b>School Headmaster:</b> Don't be late.<br><br><i>(He turns and leaves, followed by a smirking Hide. Aang is momentarily crestfallen - but suddenly appears to have an idea.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the Headmaster's office.  Pan down from the obligatory portrait of Ozai on the wall to the Headmaster, sitting directly beneath it.)</i><br><br><b>School Headmaster: </b>Thank you for coming, Mr. And Mrs... <br><br><i>(The camera cuts to Sokka, Aang, and Katara, in that order, seated facing the<br>Headmaster. Sokka is wearing a fake moustache and beard. Katara's hair is tied up in two buns on either side of her head, and her waist is padded to mimic pregnancy.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Fire! Wang Fire. This is my wife, Sapphire.<br><b>Katara:</b> Sapphire Fire, nice to meet you.<br><b>School Headmaster:</b> <i>(dubiously)</i> Mr. and Mrs...Fire, your son has been enrolled here for two days, and he's already causing problems. He's argued with his history teacher, disrupted music class, and roughed up my star pupil.<br><b>Katara:</b> My goodness! That doesn't sound like our Kuzon.<br><b>School Headmaster: </b><i>(indulgently)</i> That's what any mother would say, ma'am. Nonetheless, you're forewarned. If he acts up one more time, I'll have him sent to reform school...<i> (cut to a menacing close-up of the Headmaster's face)...</i> by which I mean the coal mines. Are we clear?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Don't you worry, Mr. Headmaster. I'll straighten this boy out somethin' fierce. <i>(He blusters in Aang's face.)</i> Young man, as soon as we get home, you're gonna get the punishment of a lifetime!<br><b>School Headmaster:</b> <i>(with an air of subdued sadism)</i> That's what I like to hear.<br><br><i>(The kids rise and leave, Sokka swaggering proudly...the role of overbearing father figure seems to suit him.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a sheltered little plateau on the rim of the royal volcano. Zuko and Mai are enjoying a sunset picnic and a chance to canoodle in private.)</i><br><br><b>Mai:</b> <i>(referring to the sunset)</i> Orange is such an awful color.<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(snickering)</i> You're so beautiful when you hate the world.<br><b>Mai:</b> I don't hate you.<br><b>Zuko:</b> I don't hate you, too. <i>(They kiss.)</i><br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Ahem! <i>(The two lovers look up at her in irritation.)</i> Zuko, could I have a word with you?<br><b>Zuko:</b> Can't you see we're busy? <i>(He and Mai resume their "business".)</i><br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(not to be put off)</i> Oh, Mai... Ty Lee needs your help untangling her braid.<br><b>Mai:</b> <i>(complaisantly)</i> Sounds pretty serious. <i>(She gets up and leaves. Walking past Azula, towards the camera, she shoots the princess a quick, poisonous glance behind her back.)</i><br><b>Azula:</b> So...I hear you've been to visit your Uncle Fatso in the<br>prison tower.<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(standing, incensed)</i> That guard told you. <br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(smugly)</i> No, you did. Just now.<br><b>Zuko:</b> <i>(sitting back down)</i> Okay, you caught me. What is it that you <i>want</i>, Azula?<br><b>Azula:</b> <i>(solicitiously)</i> Actually, nothing. Believe it or not, I'm looking out for you. If people find out you've been to see Uncle, they'll think you're plotting with him. Just be <i>careful</i>, dum-dum.<br><br><i>(Zuko looks up at her suspiciously.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the cave and a close-up of Sokka's face, still bearded, as he bends over Aang and rants at him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> That settles it. No more school for you young man!<br><br><i>(He straightens up and strokes his beard imperiously.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I'm not ready to leave. I'm having fun for once, just being a normal kid. You don't know what it's like, Sokka. You get to be normal all the time.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(mockingly)</i> Ha, ha.<br><br><i>(Sokka scowls.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Listen, guys, those kids at school are the future of the Fire Nation. If we wanna change this place for the better, we need to show them a little taste of freedom.<br><b>Sokka:</b> What could you possibly do for a country of depraved little fire monsters?<br><b>Aang:</b> I'm gonna throw them...<i>(he does a quick tap dance flourish</i> ...a secret dance party!<br><br><i>(The kids are stunned. Sokka is the first to recover.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka :</b> <i>(pointing)</i> Go to your room!<br><br><i>(Cut to commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Scene: the interior of the cave, later that same night. Toph earthbends a bandstand from the cave floor.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(arranging candles) </i>I can't believe we're having a dance party. It seems so... silly.<br><b>Aang:</b> Don't think of it as a dance party, but as a cultural event celebrating the art of fancy footwork.<br><br><i>(He demonstrates his fancy footwork as Katara bends beverage into an earthbended punchbowl in the background. Cut to a shot of Fire Nation kids approaching the cave. Cut back to the cave interior, where Toph has suddenly felt the vibrations of their feet.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> They're coming! Everyone stop bending!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(approaching Appa)</i> Sorry, buddy. You should probably wait out back. <i>(Appa grumbles and shuffles into a tunnel at the back of the cave.)</i> I know, you've got fancier feet than anybody...and six of 'em!<br><br><i>(Cut to a quick montage of Fire Nation kids playing various musical instruments on the bandstand. Cut to a wide shot of the entire band. Aang leaps in front of them exultantly and, facing them, spreads his arms wide.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Ladies and gentlemen, The Flamey-os! Yeah, this ought to get everybody moving.<br><br><i>(He turns around. It hasn't. The Fire Nation kids are standing, huddled together, uncertain.) </i><br><br><b>Shoji:</b> Now what do we do?<br><b>Aang:</b> This is when you start dancing.<br><b>Fire Nation Boy 1:</b> <i>(as his head disappears into his collar like a turtle's into its shell)</i> I don't think my parents want me dancing in a cave.<br><b>Fire Nation Boy 2:</b> Yeah, what if someone finds out? <i>(He looks around anxiously and scuttles off-screen.)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> Oh, boy. Listen, guys...dancing isn't something you think about. It's a form of self-expression that no one can ever take away from you.<br><b>Shoji:</b> Maybe it was different in the colonies, Kuzon. But we don't do that here.<br><b>Aang:</b> Sure you do. You have for generations. It just so happens that I know several classic fire nation dances. A hundred years ago, this was known as "The Phoenix Flight."<br><br><i>(He runs in a circle, squatting and kicking his legs in the fashion of Russian folk dance, his arms stretched straight out behind him in imitation of wings. The students ooh and aah.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> And this was the "Camelephant Strut".<br><br><i>(He hops on one foot toward the camera, alternating feet with each hop, passing his palms in front of his face as he does so.</i><br><br><i> He turns a somersault through the air and lands in front of two girls, who giggle, embarrassed. He somersaults backwards and lands expertly on one foot, bowing.  The students are amazed. Cut to Toph and Katara, sitting to the side, drinking beverage.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Who knew Twinkletoes could dance? <i><br><br>(Katara smiles.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the interior of Iroh's cell. Zuko kneels and passes a packet of food through the bars.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> I brought you some komodo-chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. <i>(Iroh, sitting down, is silent, his back to his nephew.)</i> I admit it. I have everything I always wanted, but it's not at all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice. <i>(He clenches the bars.)</i> I think the Avatar is still alive. I know he's out there. I'm losing my mind. <i>(desperately)</i> Please, Uncle, I'm so confused! I need your help. <i>(Iroh is motionless. Zuko stands, enraged.)</i> Forget it! I'll solve this myself! Waste away in here for all I care!<br><br><i>(He walks to the door and opens it, turning back for just a moment, and then quickly slams the door. Cut to a close-up side profile of Iroh's face. A single tear rolls down his cheek.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the cave. Aang, somersaulting through the air, lands in front of On Ji, who is looking away bashfully. A friend nudges her and she looks up at Aang, who extends his hand to her. She blushes as he leads her out to the dance floor.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> And this is how they do it in the ballrooms of Ba Sing Se.<br><br><i>(He passes his arms in an undulating motion across his chest, stepping from side to side as he does so. On Ji imitates him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Wow, they look pretty good together.<br><b>Katara</b><b>:</b> <i>(dismissively, looking away)</i> Eh, if that's what you like.<br><br><i>(She steals a jealous glance at the couple.</i><br><br><i>More of the kids join Aang and On Ji. The crowd is loosening up.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Yeah, that's it. That's the sound of happy feet. All right, go with that. Everybody freestyle!<br><br><i>(Cut to a lengthy shot of a Fire Nation boy doing an elaborate "freestyle" dance, reminiscent of juba dancing. Cut to a shot of the remaining crowd, who are slowly beginning to get their groove on. Cut to Katara, sitting alone at a table with her head in her hand. She looks up. Aang is standing in front of her, hand outstretched.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I don't know, Aang. These shoes aren't really right for dancing, and I'm not sure that I know how to...<br><b>Aang</b><b>:</b> <i>(masterfully)</i> Take my hand.<br><b>Katara:</b> Okay. <br><br><i>(He leads her out to the center of the floor and whispers in her ear. They stretch out their arms and touch wrists, circling around the axis thus formed.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Aang, everyone's watching.<br><b>Aang:</b> Don't worry about them. It's just you and me right now.<br><br><i>(She looks into his eyes, blushing, and then confident. They begin an elaborate dance that seems to be based off capoeira, cartwheeling through the air, crouching, and kicking over one another's heads. The crowd stops dancing and watches them, entranced.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the exterior of the cave, some distance away. The Headmaster, accompanied by three truant officers and Hide, sees the light and hears the music from the cave and scowls.)</i><br><br><b>School Headmaster:</b> It <i>is</i> a dancing party. You did the right thing by telling me, Hide.<br><b>Hide:</b> <i>(bowing)</i> Anytime, Headmaster, sir.<br><br><i>(Cut to the interior of the cave, where the party is in full swing.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Boy 1:</b> <i>(dancing)</i> This is incredible. It's like my inhibitions just disappeared. <i>(The Headmaster and his entourage enter the cave, and the dancing grinds to a halt. The boy's head shrinks back into his collar.)</i> Okay. They're...back again.<br><br><i>(Aang, oblivious, dances across the screen.)</i><br><br><b>Headmaster:</b> He's the one we want. <i>(Aang looks up, alarmed.)</i> The boy with the headband!<br><br><i>(He points and the truant officers make a beeline for Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Uh-oh.<br><br><i>(Aang dashes into the crowd, an officer following close behind. The crowd parts in front of the officer to reveal a lone figure with his back turned to the camera, wearing a headband.)</i><br><br><b>Officer:</b> Got ya!<br><br><i>(He grabs the figure by the shoulder and turns him around. It is Shoji, who has tied his belt around his head in imitation of Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Shoji:</b> <i>(smiling)</i> Looking for me?<br><b>School Headmaster:</b> That's not the one! He's here somewhere. Don't let him leave the cave!<br><br><i>(The officers dart through the crowd, the Headmaster joining them. Headbands are multiplying everywhere. One by one the officers snag them, only to discover one wide-eyed innocent face after another.)</i><br><br><b>On Ji:</b> Yes?<br><b>Fire Nation Boy 2:</b> Hi there. <br><b>Fire Nation Boy 1:</b> How we doing?<br><b>Fire Nation Boy 3:</b> Looking for someone?<br><br><i>(The officers, disoriented, back into a small knot in the middle of the cave as the students encircle them. By now the entire student body has morphed into replicas of Aang. The camera sweeps across them.)</i><br><br><b>Fire Nation Student:</b> Who are you looking for?<br><b>Shoji:</b> Do you need something?<br><b>Students:</b> Over here.<br><br><i>(Cut to the back of the cave. The gaang are escaping down the tunnel Appa disappeared into earlier. Aang, last out, stops and turns back for a moment. Shoji, at the edge of the crowd, turns and winks at him. Aang bows [Fire Nation style] and runs down the tunnel.  Two walls of rock abruptly slam across the tunnel's entrance, sealing it off. Shoji gapes as he realizes his new friend is a despised earthbender</i>.<br><br><i>Cut to the Headmaster, who is still standing, fuming, in the center of the cave, flanked by his officers. Two of them cannot restrain themselves and are discreetly swaying to the music [which miraculously is still playing]. The Headmaster admonishes them.)</i><br><br><b>Headmaster:</b> Stop that. Stop that! <br><br><i>(They quickly stand to attention.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the gaang, safely ensconced in Appa's saddle and flying away through the night sky.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: We're safe, Sokka. You can take off the moustache, now.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(smugly)</i> Oh, no, I can't. It's permanently glued to my skin. <i>(He strokes it, unaccountably pleased with himself.)</i><br><b>Toph:</b> Way to go, Dancypants. I think you really did help those kids. You taught them to be free.<br><b>Aang:</b> I don't know. It was just a dance party, that's all.<br><b>Katara:</b> Well, that was some dance party, Aang.<br><br><i>(She leans over and kisses him on the cheek. He blushes.  Cut to Sokka, sitting crosslegged near the pommel.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(rocking lazily back and forth and clapping his hands slowly like a tranced-out beatnik)</i> Flamey-o, sir. Flame-ee-o.<br><br><i>(Cut to a seedy industrial quarter somewhere in the Fire Nation. Smokestacks cloud the night sky. Pan downward to a small yard bisected by railroad tracks. Zuko, hooded, walks into the middle of the yard and removes his hood. A clanking noise is heard off-camera. Two large boots, one of them metal, stamp into view to frame the screen, Zuko visible between them, facing the wearer of the boots.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko:</b> You're sure you weren't followed? <i>(Cut to a side view. Zuko is speaking to an ominous looking figure twice his height.)</i> I've heard about you. They say you're good at what you do. And even better at keeping secrets. The Avatar's alive. I want you to find him. <i>(Cut to a close-up of Zuko's face.)</i> And end him.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of Combustion Man's face. Cue the scary music. Zoom inward to the inverted eye tattoo on his forehead. Fade to credits.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]

Aang and Momo are frolicking in the putrescent water.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(playing hide-and-go-seek)</i> Momo! <i>(He ducks underwater before Momo sees him, resurfacing nearby.)</i> Oh Momo! <i>(He ducks again, surfaces again, and the lemur finally spots him.)</i> Ah! Ha ha, you found me, buddy. <i>(It seems to finally dawn on Aang that he is swimming in toxic filth. He airbends himself up into the saddle.)</i> Hey guys, I think this river's polluted.<br><br><i>(He bends the residual goop off himself, sliming the rest of the gang in the process. Another blast of air and everyone's clean.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(fishing pole in hand)</i> Well, that explains why I can't catch a fish around here. Because normally my fishing skills are... off the hook! Get it? Like a fishing hook? <br><br><i>(The sound of chirping crickets is actually audible...or maybe that's birdsong. Either way, the joke is a flop.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Too bad your skills aren't <i>on</i> the hook. <i>(Toph's sally is more successful; the kids laugh, except Sokka, who scowls.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> It looks like we'll need to go somewhere else to get food. <i>(A long scroll of paper unrolls in front of her.)</i> Assuming that'll fit into Sokka's master schedule.<br><br><i>(The camera pans outward to reveal the end of the scroll in Sokka's hands. He is studying it intently.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hm...it's doable. But that means only two potty breaks today!<br><b>Aang:</b> Hey, maybe we can get food there.<br><br><i>(He points to the little village of Jang Hui, just visible down river.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a secluded spot in the nearby uplands, where Aang is covering Appa with a blanket of turf. Momo is already similarly concealed.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Now you look just like a little hill with horns. Bye buddy!<br><br><i>(Appa grumbles. The kids head out.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the kids standing on the cliffs that overlook the river, surveying the scene.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I don't feel anything. Where is this village? <br><b>Sokka:</b> It's in the middle of the river!<br><b>Dock:</b> Sure is! <i>(Pan down to reveal the village eccentric in his boat.)</i> My name's Dock. Mind if I ask who you are? <br><b>Katara:</b> We're, um, from the Earth Kingdom colonies.<br><b>Dock:</b> Wow... colonials! Hop on; I'll give you a ride into town.<br><br><i>(They hop, and Dock proceeds towards the village.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Why do you guys live on the river? <br><b>Dock:</b> Because we're a fishing town. At least that's how it was before the factory moved in. <i>(Cut to a shot of the ominous-looking Fire Army munitions factory, visible through a gap in the cliffs.)</i> Army makes their metal there. Moved in a few years ago and started gunking up our river. Now our little village is struggling to survive.<br><br><i>(They arrive in town and Aang waves goodbye as the kids head out to explore.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Thanks for the ride!<br><br><i>(A montage of village life, which is stricken with poverty and enforced idleness.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Look at this place. It's so sad. We have to do something to help.<br><b>Sokka: </b>No, we can't waste our time here! We have a bigger mission that we need to stay focused on. These people are on their own!<br><b>Katara:</b> These people are starving, but you turn your back on them?! How can you be so cold and heartless? <br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm not turning my back, I'm just being realistic! We can't go around helping every rinky-dink town we wander into. We'll be helping them all by taking out the Fire Lord!<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(slapping her hand over Sokka's mouth)</i> Hey, loudmouth! Maybe we should be a little quieter when we talk about <i>taking out the<br>Fire Lord</i>.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(a little quieter)</i> Come on, Katara, be reasonable about this. You know our mission has to come first.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(relunctantly)</i> I guess so.<br><b>Aang: </b>Let's just get what we need and go.<br><br><i>(They approach the counter of an outdoor market stall, staffed, to all appearances, by the same aged fisherman who gave them a lift into town.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, Dock. You work here too? <br><b>Dock:</b> I'm not Dock, I'm Xu. Dock's my brother.<br><br><i>(The kids are baffled.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> But we just saw you. You're even wearing the same clothes. The only difference is your hat.<br><b>Dock:</b> Dock works on the<br>docks, that's why they call him "Dock", and I work in the shop, that's why they call me "Xu".<br><b>Aang: </b>I don't get it.<br><b>Dock:</b> Me neither. <i>(He pulls out a crate filled with rancid grey seafood.)</i> What can I getcha? Hey, I'll give you a special deal. If you buy three fish, I'll throw in a clam for free.<br><br><i>(The kids are revolted by the foul haul...but they do need to eat.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> We'll just take the fish. Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore?<br><br><i>(Dock ducks beneath the counter; when he reappears, he is wearing his original headgear.)</i><br><br><b>Dock:</b> Hey, colonials. My brother says you need a lift.<br><br><i>(As they turn away to follow him, an urchin runs up to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Boy:</b> Can you spare some food? <br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(sadly, giving him a fish)</i> I wish I could spare more.<br><br><i>(The boy runs away and she watches him give the fish to a sick woman, presumably his mother.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the kids' campsite back up on the cliffs. While the benders of the group bend the pollution out of their cooking water, Sokka ponders his schedule.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Our detour into town today has completely thrown off our schedule. It's gonna take some serious finagling to get us back on track.<br><b>Toph: </b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Finagle away, O schedule master.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, for starters, it looks like we'll need to wake up forty-three minutes earlier every day.<br><b>Katara: </b>Forty-<i>three</i> minutes?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Look, we only have a few weeks to get to the Fire Lord in time for the invasion and the eclipse - which, by the way, only lasts for eight minutes. And we just lost a whole day. So if we want to make up the time and stay on schedule, we have to wake up early!<br><b>Toph: </b>Well,<i>I'm</i> not waking up early. <br><b>Sokka:</b> Or we could just cut out all of our eating breaks.<br><b>Aang:</b> What? <br><b>Katara:</b> No way.<br><b>Toph:</b> Forget it.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I got it, how's this From now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the <i>same time.</i><br><b>Gang:</b> Ew.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning.<br><br><i>(Close-up of Katara's face - she can't get the villagers' plight out of her mind.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the campsite, the following morning. Appa is lying on his side, groaning, while Katara ministers to him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> What's the matter, Katara? <br><b>Katara:</b> I think Appa's sick.<br><b>Sokka:</b> What, Appa's sick? That's awful!<br><b>Toph:</b> Wow, Sokka, I didn't realize you cared so much.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Of <i>course</i> I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now. <i>(The rest of the gang gives him the evil eye and he quickly changes his tune, rushing solicitously to Appa's side.)</i> <i>And</i> I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well.<br><b>Toph:</b> He must have gotten sick from being in the polluted water.<br><b>Aang:</b> He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy? <i>(He pulls Appa's tongue out.)</i> His tongue is purple! That <i>can't</i> be good. Katara, can you heal him? <br><b>Katara:</b> It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town.<br><br><i>(Cut to the village, which has experienced a renascence over night, bustling and prosperous.)</i><br><br><b>Toph: </b>Is it just me, or does this place seem different?<br><b>Aang:</b> Yeah, are the people...happier? <br><br><i>(The urchin from the previous day runs by, bouncing a ball, and Katara smiles to herself. The kids walk up to Dock's market stall, where, by his hat, he is currently inhabiting his "Xu" persona.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today? <br><b>Dock:</b> Ah, something amazing happened last night. Food was delivered to our village by a mysterious and wonderful person...the Painted Lady.<br><b>Katara:</b> The Painted who now?<br><b>Dock: </b>The Painted Lady. <i>(He plunks a statuette of the Lady down on the counter: she is a heavily draped damsel with elaborate eponymous face make-up and capped with a wide-brimmed conical hat.)</i> She's part of our town's lore. They say she's a river spirit who watches over our town in times of need. I always thought she was just a legend. Until now.<br><b>Sokka:</b> See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend.<br><b>Dock:</b> Medicine? Sorry, all the medicine we have goes to the factory. That's why there's so many sick people in our village.<br><b>Katara: </b>Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest.<br><b>Sokka: </b> <i>(exasperated)</i> I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell?<br><b>Dock: </b> <i>(a piscine monstrosity in each hand)</i> Would you like the<br>one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish? <br><b>Sokka: </b> <i>(mulling it over briefly)</i> Two-headed! <i>(The kids are revolted.)</i> What? You get more for your money that way.<br><br><i>(Cut to the village, late that night. A mysterious figure, resembling Dock's Painted Lady statuette, glides over the water on a carpet of fog and enters the village. She steps into a dwelling, presumably an infirmary, where several people are sleeping on the floor, and bends over each of them in turn, Healing them. Her last patient is the mother of the urchin seen earlier, her son sleeping at her side. He wakes as the Painted Lady turns to go and silently follows her out the door.)</i><br><br><b>Boy:</b> Thank you, Painted Lady.<br><br><i>(She stops, startled, acknowledges him with a nod, and glides away into the night.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The village, the next day. Dock is polishing his Lady figurine with a rag as Sokka steps up to the counter.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hi, Dock. Is Xu around? <br><b>Dock:</b> Let me check...<i>(He runs around the shop and ducks beneath the counter to switch hats.)</i> Hey there! Back again, are ya? <br><b>Toph:</b> We need more food. Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.<br><br><i>(Dock obligingly presents them with a platter of noxious clams.)</i><br><br><b>Dock:</b> Oh, well, that's too bad. Maybe if you guys are lucky, the Painted Lady will visit you in the night, and heal your friend.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(the eternal skeptic)</i> And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along.<br><b>Dock:</b> <i>(oblivious to sarcasm)</i> Yeah, may be! You know, last night she visited us again. Healed most of our sick folks.<br><b>Aang:</b> Is that why this place seems so festive?<br><br><i>(We see the villagers erecting a large statue of the Lady in the town square, to cheers and applause.)</i><br><br><b>Dock: </b>Yep, it's all because of the Painted Lady.<br><b>Katara:</b> Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady? I mean... spirit?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(indignantly)</i> Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Yeah, <i>now</i>, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory. <i>(He makes gestures to indicate explosive spirit magic.)</i> Oooooo... pow.<br><b>Aang:</b> Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like...<i>(He does an elaborate dance to one-up Sokka)</i> Woooooo....<br><br><i>(Katara stalks off angrily as the boys ham it up together.)</i><br><br><b>Aang and Sokka:</b> Wooooooo.....<br><br><i>(Cut to the campsite, that night. Katara slips out of her sleeping bag and stuffs dried grass into it to disguise her absence. She dons a makeshift Painted Lady costume, wrapping a ragged gown around her, painting her face in a bended ice mirror and finishing off with a wide conical hat similar to the Lady's, but with a diaphanous white veil covering her face. She glides away toward the village, but not quietly enough: she wakes Momo, and he wakes Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> What's the matter, buddy? <i>(He spots Katara just as she is slipping out of sight.)</i> It's her! <i>(He runs after her.) </i>Hello, Painted Lady spirit! <i>(Katara, shocked, begins running away, but she is only barely able to keep ahead of a determined airbender.)</i> Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule. Wait, but I'm the great bridge between your world and mine. I know Hei Bai, we're close personal friends. <i>(He chases her across the landscape, over the river and into the village. Running along a rooftop, he shouts to her...)</i> Heeeyy!!<br><br><i>(...but, distracted by the vocalization, he runs into a roofpole. Katara continues on through the village, across the river and onto the opposite riverbank. She stops to catch her breath, turns around...and there's Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b>My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.<br><b>Katara: </b> <i>(in a ridiculous fake voice, and attempting to hide her face)</i> Well, hello, Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy.<br><b>Aang:</b> Yeah, me too. I hate that. <i>(He takes a peek under her hat brim.)</i> You know, you're really pretty for a spirit. I don't get to meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet...not very attractive.<br><b>Katara: </b> <i>(chuckling nervously)</i> Thank you, but...<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(suspiciously)</i>You seem familiar, too.<br><b>Katara:</b> A lot of people say that.<br><b>Aang:</b> No...you <i>really</i> seem familiar.<br><b>Katara:</b> Look, I really should get going...<br><br><i>(She turns to leave, but Aang sends her hat flying with a blast of airbending. She frantically pulls it back onto her head but...)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Katara !<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(defeated)</i> Hi, Aang.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>You're</i> the Painted Lady ! But how?<br><b>Katara: </b>I wasn't at first, I was just trying to help the village. But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway...I guess I just kind of became her.<br><b>Aang:</b> So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait...is Appa even sick <br><b>Katara:</b> He...might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but, other than that, he's fine.<br><b>Aang:</b> I can't believe you lied to everyone so you could help these people.<br><b>Katara:</b> I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have.<br><b>Aang: </b>No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero.<br><b>Katara:</b> Well, if you want to help...there's one more thing I have to do.<br><br><i>(Cut to the factory. The two are standing beneath it staring up at its menacing expanse.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> You want to destroy this factory? <br><b>Katara: </b>Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently.<br><br><i>(They enter the factory and hard-core bending-assisted mayhem ensues. The carnage ends with a shot of explosions rocking the building and the kids running out. The sun is rising as they return to the campsite.)</i><br><br><b>Aang: </b><i>(triumphantly)</i> Ha ha! <i>(He imitates the sound of an explosion.)</i><br><b>Katara:</b> Shhh, we don't want to wake Sokka. <i>(It is a little late for this; Sokka and Toph are waiting for the pair as they walk into camp. Katara is all innocence.)</i> Hi! Sokka! We were just...out on a...morning walk!<br><b>Sokka:</b> Oh, really? A morning walk? <i>(He dumps the dry grass from her sleeping bag onto the ground.)</i> I know you're the Painted Lady. I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and feeding him purplizing tongue berries! <i>(Toph sticks out her now-purple tongue and holds up a bag of berries as evidence.)</i> Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now. <i>(He turns to Aang.)</i> And how long did <i>you</i> know about this?<br><b>Aang:</b> Hey, I just found out this morning.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the menacing General Mung emerging from the smoking ruins of the factory and looking vengefully towards the village.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the campsite, where the kids are packing. A strange sound fills the air and they look up to see a detachment of Fire Soldiers on jet skis racing down the river towards the village.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> What's going on? <br><b>Aang: </b>Fire Nation soldiers are heading to the village.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(to Katara, angrily)</i> What did you do?!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(guiltily)</i> I...kind of destroyed their factory.<br><b>Sokka: </b>You what?!<br><b>Katara: </b>It was your idea!<br><b>Sokka:</b> I was joking. I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises. Did you even think this through? The army's gonna blame the villagers. They're headed there right now to get revenge.<br><b>Katara:</b> Well, what was I supposed to do?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Leave! Do nothing!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(dramatic close-up)</i> No. I will never, <i>ever</i> turn my back on people who need me. <i>(She gets up to leave.)</i> I'm going down to the village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.<br><br><i>(Sokka, after a moment of soul-searching, gets up and follows her.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Wait. I'm coming too.<br><b>Katara:</b> I thought you didn't want to help.<br><b>Sokka: </b> You need <i>me</i>, and I will never turn my back on <i>you</i>.<br><b>Katara: </b>Sokka. You really <i>do</i> have a heart. <i>(They hug.)</i><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(overcome)</i> He really does have a heart, doesn't he?<br><br><i>(Wiping away tears, he turns to Toph for confirmation. The earthbender, however, has a low tolerance for this kind of girly twaddle and socks him in the chest, felling him to the ground. The act ends with a shot of Fire Army jet skis bearing down on the village.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(General Mung is addressing the gathered villagers.)</i><br><br><b>General Mung:</b> I thought we could live as neighbors, in peace. But I guess I was wrong. You steal our food, our medicine...and then you destroy our factory.<br><br><b>Dock: </b><i>(popping out of the crowd)</i> We didn't do any of that. <i>(popping out in a different place wearing his Xu hat)</i> Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.<br><b>General Mung:</b> Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too. This is a town of thieves and liars! <i>(He bends a fireblast, destroying a house.)</i> Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village. <i>(The Fire Soldiers begin demolishing the town. Two of them light a large flammable ball perched on a buoy in the river, but a mysterious gust of wind from nowhere blows the fire out, twice.)</i> Light it again! <br><br><i>(They do, and it is blown out again. Eerie flute music begins floating over the water.)</i><br><br><b>Female Fire Soldier:</b> Look at that! Where's it coming from? <i>(She refers to a heavy fog that is rapidly pouring in.)</i><br><b>Male Fire Soldier:</b> I don't know. Something strange is going on. <i>(An ominous growling noise echoes over the river.)</i><br><b>Boy:</b> It's the Painted Lady. <i>She's coming.</i><br><b>General Mung:</b> There is no Painted Lady!<br><b>Female Fire Soldier:</b> What is that <i>sound</i>?<br><br><i>(A repetitive thudding noise, as of giant footsteps, has begun. Pan over the river to the further bank where we see that the thudding is caused by Toph elevating and dropping a large boulder, Appa is doing the growling, and Sokka is manning the flute.)</i><br><br><b>Male Fire Soldier:</b> Maybe it <i>is</i> her.<br><br><i>(The fog parts dramatically to reveal Katara in full Painted Lady regalia. She pauses a moment for the theatrical effect and then rushes toward the Fire Soldiers in a burst of waterbending. She alights on the dock and slowly approaches them.)</i><br><br><b>General Mung:</b> Do something! <i>(He pushes his minions forward. As they timidly draw near, they are rattled by a blast of airbending. Aang is hiding beneath the dock.)</i> Stand your ground! <i>(Katara waterbends two jet skis into a nearby cliff. As she raises her hand to wreak further damage, the Fire Soldiers jump into the remaining jet skis and speed off, leaving Mung to hold the fort.)</i> I'll take care of you myself.<br><br><i>(He bends a arc of fire at Katara. Aang, still concealed beneath the dock, sends Katara flying into the sky on a column of air; the flame passes harmlessly beneath her. For good measure, Aang rends the dock in two with a blast of wind, sending Mung flying into the river. As he flounders, Katara rises out of the polluted water before him and raises her arms threateningly.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Leave this village and never come back.<br><br><i>(He swims desperately away from her. A stray jet ski passes by and he clambers into it; the ski buzzes off. Sokka and Toph row towards the village as the people applaud Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Boy:</b> I knew you'd come.<br><b>Dock:</b> Thank you!<br><b>Random Villager:</b> Painted Lady, you're the best!<br><b>Dock:</b> Me and my brothers really owe you a lot. <i>(Looking at her, he has a shock of recognition.)</i> Hey, wait a minute! I know you! You're not the Painted Lady, you're that colonial girl!<br><b>Boy:</b> Yeah, you're the lady that gave me a fish.<br><b>Dock:</b> You've been tricking us. You're a waterbender!<br><b>Random Villager:</b> She's a waterbender! How dare you act like our Painted Lady?<br><br><i>(The crowd surges forward in anger. Sokka runs forward to intervene.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her.<br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka, it's okay. <i>(to the villagers)</i> I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself.<br><b>Dock:</b> She's right, but what should we do? <br><br><i>(Toph, who has hidden in the crowd, pops out and makes a suggestion in a disguised voice.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Maybe we can clean the river.<br><b>Dock:</b> Yeah, we can clean the river! <i>(The crowd cheers this idea.)</i> Thank you. You know, you're not so bad for a waterbender.<br><b>Sokka:</b> You wouldn't mind keeping that a secret, by the way, would you?<br><b>Dock: </b>No problem. Keeping my mouth shut is a personal specialty. My brother Xu, on the other hand, hoo! He's a blabbermouth.<br><b>Katara:</b> So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?<br><b>Dock: </b>No, ma'am. I'm going to get my other brother, Bushi. He loves cleaning rivers. <i>(Dock brazenly switches hats right in front of them.)</i> Alright, I'm Bushi! Let's get some river cleaning done.<br><b>Aang:</b> Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner <i>and</i> the boat guy.<br><b>Dock:</b> Oh, you must be talking about my brothers, Dock and Xu.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(exasperated)</i> No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!<br><b>Dock:</b> Oh, you know who does that? My brother Dock. <i>(conspiratorial whisper)</i> He's crazy.<br><br><i>(Aang fumes. It's hopeless - Dock has been drinking industrial sewage for far too long.</i><br><br><i>The afternoon is spent cleaning the river, with extensive bending help from the kids. By sunset, the river is blue and pristine.</i><br><br><i>Nighttime, back at the campsite. Katara has gone down to the river as the others sleep. Suddenly an apparition appears before her...the Painted Lady is "real" after all.)</i><br><br><b>Painted Lady:</b> Thank you.<br><br><i>(She recedes into the fog and disappears. Katara smiles.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

The camera tilts down to the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: Wow, this is amazing to watch.      <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Aang and company lying on a makeshift roof covering Appa and staring up at the sky.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Kind of makes you realize how insignificant we are.    <br><b>Toph</b>: Eh, you've seen nothing once, you've seen it 1,000 times.   <br><br><i>(There is a sparkle in the sky as a large meteorite enters the atmosphere and falls toward the earth.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: Oh, man. You've never <i>not</i>seen anything like this. <br><br><i>(Sokka, Aang, Momo and Katara all sit up and stare at amazement at the meteorite, engulfed in blue fire. The camera follows the meteorite as it whistles through the air and passes over their heads. Sokka turns around and watches as the meteorite crashes in a huge, blue explosion off in the distance, causing him to shield his eyes. Toph stands up in surprise. The camera zooms out of a shot of the group all looking at the smoke rising from an orange glow. Aang, Katara, and Sokka look to each other nervously.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of a town nestled in the mountains. The camera zooms out to show Appa flying down towards a large, fire filled crater where the meteorite landed.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: The fire is gonna destroy that town.     <br><b>Aang</b>: Not if we can stop it. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Appa landing close to the fire. Aang, Toph, and Sokka jump off of Appa while Katara slides onto Appa's neck and takes his reigns.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water on to the fire. <i>(Katara whips Appa's reigns and flies off.)</i>         <br><b>Aang</b>: Toph, let's make a trench to keep the fire from coming any closer.  <br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(dejectedly)</i> What should I do?   <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Aang and Toph looking back. Momo flies past the screen and chirps.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Keep an eye on Momo <i>(Momo flies to Sokka and lands on his head.)</i><br><b>Sokka</b>: So what, I'm just a lemur-sitter <i>(petting Momo's head)</i> There, there. Feel better?<br><br><i>(Cut to Aang and Toph running toward the fire. They both swing their arms down and cut a fissure through the ground in front of the fire. Aang and Toph raise their hands, then fling their arms to both sides, bending the fissure into a trench and pushing the fire back. Cut to Sokka and Momo. Flaming embers fall around them. Sokka frantically stamps one out with his club while Momo stamps out the rest and jumps back on Sokka's shoulders. Sokka looks back to see all the other fires put one and gives Momo a sour expression. Cut to Katara and Appa flying over the nearby creek. Katara bends a huge orb of water out of the creek and high into the air. Cut to a close up of Katara bending the water behind her, stabilizing it. Cut to Sokka watching Appa fly over the fire while Katara sprays a shower of water from the orb, putting out most of the flames. Cut to Toph moving her hands from side to side, bending a large, rectangular slab of stone to roll over its edges and stomp out more flames. Cut to Sokka and Momo as they watch the stone slab pass by. Cut to a shot of Aang taking the orb of water from Katara with his waterbending as Appa flies past him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(bending the water around)</i> Sokka, stand clear.<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka and Momo.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(disappointedly)</i> Right, stand clear. Got it.<br><br><i>(Sokka stands up, picks up Momo, and begins to walk away. Cut to Aang. He bends the water behind him and takes a deep breath before pushes his arms forward, throwing the water the water at the fire and exhaling a gust of wind. Cut to Sokka carrying Momo. Momo quickly flies away before Sokka is caught by surprise by the torrent of water. Cut to an overhead shot of the flaming crater. A globe of water grows out from the center and explodes, spreading a light shower of snow all over the area, putting out all the fire. Cut to Aang as Appa and Katara land nearby and Toph walks up to him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: <i>(dusting his hands off)</i> Good work, everybody.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the snow covered crater. The camera zooms out before cutting to a shot of Sokka emerging from a pile of snow. Momo slides past him on the ice covered ground. <br><br>The scene cuts to a shot of the outside of the Fire Nation prison. Cut to the inside of a very dark cell. The door opens and light pours in over Iroh. He is leaning against the wall, eyes glazed over and drooling. Cut to a shot from floor level of Warden Poon walking up to the bars of the cell. The warden drops a bowl of mush on the floor in front of the cell and kicks it over to Iroh, spilling it. Iroh scrambles at the food, desperate and gasping. He falls face first into the mush and begins to slovenly shovel it into his mouth.)</i><br><br><b>Warden Poon</b>: <i>(descending)</i> Look at you. You're just a fat, disgusting old man. You do nothing, you say nothing. You just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig. You're a disgrace.<br><br><i>(Warden Poon spits on the floor before turning away and exiting the cell. Cut to a close up of Iroh. He smiles and flicks the stray strands of his hair back. Iroh picks up the bowl of mush and assumes a much more dignified, cross legged position and continues eating. <br><br>The scene cuts to a shot of the small Fire Nation town Shu Jing situated in the<br>mountains next to a cliff overlooking a river. Cut to Aang, Katara, and Toph seated at an outdoor table at a local restaurant, each with trays of food.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: These people have no idea how close they were to getting toasted last night. <br><b>Toph</b>: <i>(eating a dumpling)</i> Yeah, the worst thing about being in disguise is we don't get the hero worship anymore. I miss the love.<br><b>Sokka</b>: <i>(off screen, sarcastically)</i> Boo-hoo, poor heroes.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Sokka sitting at the edge of the floor by himself, a tray of steaming smoked sea slug next to him.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: What's your problem? You haven't even touched your smoked sea slug.     <br><b>Sokka</b>: It's just...all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around, and making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, ok <i>(sadly)</i> I can't do anything.   <br><b>Katara</b>: That's not true. No one can read a map like you.<br><b>Toph</b>: I can't read at all.   <br><b>Aang</b>: Yeah, and who keeps us laughing with sarcastic comments all the time I mean, look at Katara's hair, right <i>(grabs a lock of Katara's hair and gestures to it)</i> What's up with that? <br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(embarrassed)</i> What?
