The camera cuts to a close-up of the statue's face and pans down to the ground, so that we see Toph running out from a side street towards the statue. She reaches the base of the statue and turns around, only to be engulfed in a net flung from the direction of the camera. She falls to the ground, hogtied. As Fire Nation "domestic forces" approach her, she looks up accusingly.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara, standing over Toph with an angry glare.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.<br><br><i>(She folds her arms and turns her back on Toph. The helpless earthbender is dragged away.</i><br><br><i>Cut to an isolated area somewhere in the vicinity of Fire Fountain Village,<br>three days prior to the scene described above.  Toph and Katara face each other, apparently about to engage in combat. Aang stands up between them, tying his headband around his eyes for a blindfold.)</i><br><br><b>Aang</b>: Ok, I'm ready for some training!<br><br><i>(He assumes a fighting stance and stomps on the ground with one foot. Immediately the screen switches to Toph Vision and we see concentric circles radiating out from the impact of Aang's foot: Toph is instructing him in her ability to "see" via earthbending. She bends several columns of rock in his way and he dodges them with ease. Katara attacks with a water whip and Aang evades this as well, recoiling it back onto her and simultaneously hurling a boulder at Toph. Toph catches it on the end of her fist.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Good job, twinkle-toes. Visualize - then attack!<br><br><i>(She propels the boulder back towards Aang, who corkscrews into the ground to avoid it. The boulder, obeying Newton's first law, continues on its trajectory and collides with Katara's chest, bowling her over.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(angrily)</i> Maybe you should take your own advice, Toph.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(obnoxiously)</i> What's the matter? Can't handle some dirt, Madame Fussy Britches?<br><br><i>(Katara drenches Toph with a wave.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Oh, sorry, did I splash you, <i>mud slug</i>?<br><br><i>(Furious, they career towards each other on ramps of rock and ice, respectively, collide, and fall to the ground with shrieks of rage.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(still blindfolded)</i> Are we taking a break?<br><br><i>(Cut to Sokka, with an evil grin on his face. He rushes towards Aang from<br>behind, yelling.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Yaaaaaah, <i>sneak attack</i>!<br><br><i>(Aang bends a column of rock in his path, then removes the blindfold.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Sokka, sneak attacks don't work if you yell it out loud.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara and Toph, wrestling in a pool of mud.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Hungry for a mud pie?<br><br><i>(She kicks mud in Katara's face.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I'll give you a mud pie. <br><br><i>(She mudbends Toph to the ground. Toph springs back up and earthbends Katara into the air. They are about to go at it again when they are interrupted by Aang.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Uh, guys, I thought we were supposed to be training <i>me</i>.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(salvaging what dignity she can)</i> Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today.<br><br><i>(She walks away.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(derisively)</i> While Katara cleans up, let's go have some fun!<br><b>Sokka and Aang:</b> Yes! Yeah!<br><br><i>(Cut to Fire Fountain Village. Aang, Sokka, and Toph are strolling down the street. Messenger hawks are continually flying about, and Sokka takes notice of them.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Look at all those messenger hawks. You know, I've been thinking about getting one for myself. That way, I wouldn't have to talk to anyone... I could just send them messages!<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(jokingly)</i> I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you.<br><b>Aang:</b> So, guys, what are we gonna get with our last silver piece?<br><b>Toph:</b> We can get more money. Right there. <i>(She points to a street below, where a con man is fleecing a crowd of Fire Nation citizens with a shell game.)</i> This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending.<br><br><i>(By this time the kids have descended and joined the crowd around the table. The con man spots the innocent-looking "blind" girl and decides she is an easy mark.)</i><br><br><b>Dealer:</b> You there. Want to play a friendly game?<br><b>Toph:</b> How could I possibly play? I'm blind.<br><b>Dealer: </b>You don't have to see to be lucky.<br><br><i>(She gropes her way to the table and lays down the last silver piece. The dealer practices his sleight of hand with the pea, sending it flying from one shell to another, but Toph can't be fooled.  She guesses correctly and the dealer tosses money her way.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Flamey-o, Toph!<br><b>Dealer:</b> Wow, fancy guessing. You are amazing at this. Would you like to make the game a little more interesting?<br><b>Toph:</b> More interesting? How? <br><b>Dealer:</b> Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there. Then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.<br><br><i>(Toph grabs Sokka's sword and hands it over, to Sokka's distress.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I'll do it for forty silver pieces.<br><b>Dealer:</b> Forty silver pieces it is. <i>(The shell shuffling begins again, faster and more furious. The dealer flicks the peas up into his sleeve, removing them from the game, but Toph earthbends one of them back just in time. She points at one of the shells. The dealer smugly lifts it.)</i> Sorry, little lady, but... <i>(to his shock, the pea is still there)</i> ...huh? <br><b>Toph:</b> I won!<br><br><i>(Cut to the gaang's campsite. Aang, Sokka, and Toph are returning, arms filled with provisions.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(startled)</i> Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff? <br><b>Aang:</b> Toph got us money. She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like.<br><b>Sokka:</b> She used earthbending to win the game. Classic!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>Ah</i>, so she cheated.<br><b>Toph:</b> Hey, I only cheated because he was cheating. I cheated a cheater. What's wrong with that?<br><b>Katara:</b> I'm just saying, this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.<br><b>Toph:</b> Why? Because its fun, and you <i>hate</i> fun?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(indignantly)</i> I don't hate fun. <i>(She seizes Momo and drapes him on top of her head.)</i> See? Fun. <br><br><i>(Momo slides off her head with an annoyed squawk.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Katara, I'll personally make you an Avatar promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.<br><br><i>(He lifts his headband to reveal his arrow and solemnly bows to her.</i><br><br><i>"Avatar promises" apparently not being worth much, the scene immediately shifts back to Fire Fountain Village, where Toph uses her powers to rig a dice game, win a strongman competition, and extort a merchant after tricking him into thinking he had run her over with his carriage.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the campsite, where Katara is remonstrating with the cash-flush flimflammers.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.<br><b>Toph:</b> Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up? <br><b>Katara:</b> Oh, I'm sorry. You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child?<br><b>Toph:</b> Yeah, maybe. Maybe then, you'd see how great we have it. I mean, look at us. We're traveling around the world, making easy money, having fun, with no parents to tell us what to do.<br><b>Katara:</b> Ah, I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(dismissively)</i> Whatever.<br><b>Katara:</b> They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.<br><b>Toph:</b> I <i>do</i> hate them!<br><b>Katara:</b> I don't think so. I think you miss them. But you just don't want to deal with that, so instead, you act like this crazy person.<br><b>Toph:</b> Look. I ran away to help Aang!<br><b>Katara:</b> You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that. We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Speaking of that third-eyed freak... I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of..."Sparky-Sparky Boom Man"! <i>(The gaang are unimpressed.)</i> Just think about it.<br><b>Katara:</b> We have enough money. You need to stop this!<br><b>Toph:</b> I'll stop when I want to stop, and not when you tell me!<br><br><i>(She walks away.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later <i>(Cut to Fire FountainVillage, where Sokka hasjust fulfilled his dream and bought himself a messenger hawk.)</i> Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner. And as such, I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't want to see any fighting. <i>(He pokes the hawk affectionately and coos baby-talk at it.)</i> Good wittle messenger Hawky. Who's got pwetty feathers? <i>(He walks by a wanted poster of Toph, and does a double-take.)</i> You're right, Hawky. This is bad.<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The scene opens on the campsite. Sokka, with Hawky perched on his shoulder, walks towards Toph as she sits counting money.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Toph, when I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like.<br><br><i>(He unfurls the wanted poster.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Well, it <i>sounds</i> like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's <i>on</i> the sheet of paper.<br><b>Sokka:</b> It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you "The Runaway."<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(enthused)</i> A wanted poster. That's <i>so</i> great. "The Runaway". I <i>love</i> my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?<br><br><i>(He checks her against her likeness.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, yeah, actually, it does look pretty good. But Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.<br><b>Toph:</b> Don't be such a worrywart like your sister. Think of it this way. Now you have plenty of money to help with the invasion plan!<br><br><i>(She dangles a sack of money before him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, that <i>is</i> true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa.<br><b>Toph:</b> Here's a little extra so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what? Make it an atlas.<br><br><i>(She hands him the entire bag.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I do like expensive atlases.<br><b>Toph:</b> Of course you do. And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret.<br><br><i>(She snatches it from him, hides it beneath her vest and walks away as Aang and Katara walk up.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka, tell me you didn't buy a bird.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Not just a bird. A messenger bird! Now we can send messages all over the world, even to Gran-Gran.<br><b>Aang:</b> Wow, how does it work?<br><b>Sokka:</b> Hm, uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky: Gran-Gran, South Pole. <i>(He points helpfully. Hawky shakes his head in confusion.)</i> I think he gets it. <i>(Momo appears over Aang's shoulder and dashes at his new rival. They wheel furiously about Sokka's head as he tries to calm them.)</i> Hawky, make nice! Bad Hawky!<br><br><i>(Later in the day. Sokka and Toph are returning from further hijinks in town, arms loaded with money.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Well, look who decided to join us. Where have you two been? Off scamming again?<br><b>Toph:</b> Yes, we were.<br><b>Katara:</b> And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?<br><b>Toph:</b> No, I don't.<br><b>Katara:</b> Really?<br><b>Toph:</b> Yes, really.<br><b>Katara:</b> Well then, what's this?<br><br><i>(She flourishes the wanted poster before Toph.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(exasperated)</i> I don't <i>know</i>! I mean, seriously, what's <i>with</i> you people I'm <i>blind</i>!<br><b>Katara:</b> It's a wanted poster of you. "The Runaway". Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?<br><b>Toph:</b> Where did you get that?!<br><b>Katara:</b> It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is...<br><b>Toph:</b> You went through my stuff! You had no right.<br><b>Katara:</b> Your stuff was messy, and I was just straightening up and I happened to stumble across it.<br><b>Toph:</b> That's a lie! You're <i>lying</i>, Katara.<br><b>Katara:</b> Fine! It's a lie. But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up. I knew you were hiding something, and you were. <i>(Toph knocks the poster from Katara's hand and walks away.)</i> Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!<br><b>Toph:</b> Oh, really, <i>Mom</i>? Or what are you going to do? Send me to my room?<br><b>Katara:</b> I wish I could.<br><b>Toph:</b> Well, you <i>can't</i>. Because you're not my mom, and you're not <i>their</i> mom.<br><br><i>(She points to Aang and Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I never said I was!<br><b>Toph:</b> No, but you certainly <i>act</i> like it. You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not. You're just a regular kid like the rest of us, so stop acting like you can tell me what to do. I can do whatever I want!<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(chagrined)</i> I don't act that way. <i>(in a shrill and anxious voice)</i> Sokka, do I act motherly?<br><br><i>(Sokka, alarmed, decides discretion is the better part of valor.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey - I'm staying out of this one.<br><b>Katara:</b> What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(digging nervously at his eye)</i> Well, I...<br><b>Katara:</b> Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(chastened)</i> Yes, ma'am.<br><b>Toph:</b> I can't be around you right now!<br><b>Katara:</b> Well, I can't be around you!<br><br><i>(They storm off. Hawky squawks plaintively.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?<br><br><i>(Still later in the day. Aang and Sokka, sitting together, observe Katara and Toph sitting resentfully at opposite ends of the camp.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka: </b>Hey, Aang, you want to test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.<br><b>Aang:</b> Sure.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm gonna send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.<br><b>Aang:</b> I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Eh, it's a gift. <i>(He takes pen and paper and composes a missive.)</i> Dear Katara. Sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph.<br><br><i>(He slides the note into Hawky's dispatch tube and the bird sails over to Katara, who reads the message and stands up facing the boys.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I <i>know</i> this is from you, Sokka. Toph <i>can't write</i>. Ugh, you're all driving me crazy!<br><br><i>(She walks away.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Yep, we're idiots. <br><b>Aang:</b> I guess plan B is, we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I think we're gonna run into a similar problem. Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help. <i>(He walks over to Toph.)</i> Come on, we need to talk.<br><br><i>(They repair to an overhanging cliff, unaware that Katara is bathing in the water below. Their entire conversation is audible to her.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> So let me guess. You brought me out here to tell me your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Nah, she's pretty much a pain. <i>(Katara scowls.)</i> She's always got to be right about everything, and she gets all bossy, and involved, and in your business.<br><b>Toph:</b> Yeah, I don't know how you can deal with it.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Actually, in a way, I rely on it.<br><b>Toph:</b> I don't understand.<br><b>Sokka:</b> When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara, she had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.<br><b>Toph:</b> I guess I never thought about that.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly, I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like, my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there, and now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture.<br><br><i>(Katara is overcome with emotion.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> The truth is, sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me. You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom. <i>(Katara lowers her head, in sadness or perhaps shame.) </i> Don't <i>ever</i> tell her I said any of this.<br><br><i>(She punches Sokka in the shoulder.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, my lips are sealed.<br><br><i>(As the sun sets, the kids reunite at the camp.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Hi, Toph. Um, I want to...<br><b>Toph:</b> Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(slyly)</i> Actually, I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say... I want to pull a scam with you!<br><br><i>(Aang and Sokka gape in astonishment.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> What? <i>You</i> want to pull a scam?<br><b>Katara:</b> Not just any scam...the ultimate scam! <i>(The boys collapse, stupefied.)</i> What do you say, Toph? Just me and you... one last go. You in?<br><b>Toph:</b> You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours?<br><br><i>(The two conspirators walk off together. The boys lie supine on the ground, foaming at the mouth.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The campsite at sunset. Toph and Katara plot.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> The plan is simple. This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money. <i>(Cut to Fire Fountain Village, presumably the next day. The scene from the beginning of the episode replays, with Katara's plan as a voice-over.)</i> Ten times more than you've made in all your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way.<br><br><i>(By this time, Toph is captured and falls to the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> How could you do this to me? You betrayed me.<br><b>Katara:</b> You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.<br><br><i>(The mayor walks up to Katara as Toph is dragged away.)</i><br><br><b>Mayor:</b> You did the right thing by turning in "The Runaway".<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(sanctimoniously)</i> The right thing is its own reward.<br><b>Mayor:</b> Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(disconcerted)</i> But... I still want the actual reward.<br><b>Mayor:</b> Of course. Right this way.<br><br><i>(Cut to the town jail. Toph is dragged past a metal cell and flung into a wooden one. She gropes around and is dismayed to find her "sight" inoperative.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(alarmed)</i> Hey, what kind of cell is this?<br><b>Female Fire Nation Officer:</b> <i>(through the bars)</i> A wooden one.<br><br><i>(Cut to the mayor's office. The mayor is opening a moneybox for Katara when the door creaks open. The mayor points to Katara and speaks to a person in the doorway.)</i><br><br><b>Mayor:</b> That's her. That's the girl you were looking for.<br><br><i>(Katara turns around to see the hulking figure of Combustion Man looming over her.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the campsite, where Aang is pacing back and forth.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long? <br><b>Sokka:</b> I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out. <i> (Leaving, he admonishes Hawky and Momo.) </i> You two behave. Appa's in charge. <br><br><i>(The two creatures begin to squabble anyway, but a reproving roar from Appa puts a quick stop to that.</i><br><br><i>Cut back to the jail, where Katara has joined Toph in her cell.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Wait. It's a trap!<br><b>Katara:</b> Really? No kidding. Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?<br><b>Toph:</b> Not for <i>us</i>, Katara. We're the bait. He wants <i>Aang</i>.<br><b>Katara:</b> I can't believe I was so stupid. See, this is exactly why I'm against these scams. I knew this would happen.<br><b>Toph:</b> But...this was <i>your</i> idea. <br><b>Katara:</b> I know. I wanted to show you that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.<br><b>Toph:</b> Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with. <br><b>Katara:</b> I know your relationship with your parents is complicated, and I shouldn't have said what I said.<br><b>Toph:</b> It's ok. I was really mad when you said that because; well, because maybe it's true. I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.<br><br><i>(She sobs. Katara comforts her with a hug.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the strangely deserted streets of Fire Fountain Village, where Aang and Sokka are searching for the girls.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Where do you think they might be? <br><b>Aang:</b> Where do you think <i>anyone</i> is?  <i>(Combustion Man appears on a rooftop, just above the boys.  As he draws in his breath preparatory to firebending at them, Aang hears the intake of breath and, looking upward, spots him.)</i> Sokka, watch out! <i>(Combustion Man lets loose a blast; the boys barely manage to dodge it.) </i> It's "Sparky-Sparky Boom Man"!<br><b>Sokka:</b> You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.<br><br><i>(Combustion Man leaps to the ground and fires another shot at them. </i><br><br><i>Cut back to the jail cell, where Katara and Toph can hear the sounds of the fight.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> What are we gonna do?<br><b>Toph:</b> I don't know! I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables!<br><b>Katara:</b> What about your meteor bracelet? You could make a saw.<br><b>Toph:</b> I left it back at camp. I was worried they would take it. <i>(Katara wipes sweat from her forehead... and has an idea. She stands up and begins running in place. Toph is understandably puzzled.)</i> Um, Katara...are you ok?<br><b>Katara:</b> Just fine.<br><b>Toph:</b> Well, what are you doing?<br><b>Katara:</b> I'm making my own water!<br><br><i>(She dashes the sweat now pouring from her face against the cell bars, cutting deep swipes in them.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Katara, you're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!<br><br><i>(Katara sticks her hands beneath her armpits and flings the sweat from them towards the bars.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the town square, where Aang and Sokka are frantically eluding Combustion Man's assaults.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> This guy is too good. He shoots fire from his brain!<br><b>Aang:</b> We should split up. He can't chase us both.<br><br><i>(They split. As Aang runs along a roof, Combustion Man spots him and fires. The blast sends Aang careering into the chest of the statue of Ozai, whence he falls to the ground, prostrate. Combustion Man walks up to him and is about to deliver the coup de grace, when a bolt of ice suddenly encases his head. He stumbles away to reveal Katara and the gaang behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Aang, get up!<br><b>Toph:</b> Let's get out of here.<br><br><i>(The gaang flees, but not before Combustion Man shatters his ice muzzle. As he prepares to fire at them, Toph bends a rock at him. He destroys it with a fire blast, but a piece of the rubble flies into his forehead and strikes his tattoo, knocking him to the ground and apparently causing him extreme pain. He gets up and tries to resume his attack, but his power has somehow been turned against him; as he tries to focus his "laser beam", the air around him ignites and explodes.</i><br><br><i>Cut to the kids, running out of the village.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, I got it. The perfect name for that guy! "Combustion Man"!<br><b>Toph:</b> Good job, Sokka. Now let's get out of here before "Combustion Man" catches us!<br><b>Sokka:</b> See? It fits so well. <br><br><i>(Cut to the kids on Appa, descending towards a new campsite. It is nighttime. Sokka yawns and stretches as they land.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy? <i>(affectionately)</i> Yeah, you're such a lazy little bird.<br><b>Toph:</b> Katara, I need your help.<br><b>Katara:</b> What is it, Toph?<br><b>Toph:</b> I need you to write some things down for me. I want to send a letter to my parents.<br><b>Katara:</b> I'll be happy to help.<br><br><i>(The letter written, Toph slips it into Hawky's dispatch tube and the bird soars into the night air. It takes only a few seconds, however, for Sokka to notice that someone is missing.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Hey, where'd Hawky go?<br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br><br>

Cut to a shot of a field of red flowers. A single, large mountain is seen in the background underneath the bright moon. Cut to a shot of Appa fast asleep inside a cave. The camera pans right to Aang and his friends gathered around a campfire underneath a gnarled and twisted tree. Cut to a close up of Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Suddenly, they heard something down the hall, in the dark. Oooh... It came into the torchlight. And they knew the blade of Wing - Fun was haunted! Aah-ah...<br><br><i>(Sokka dramatically pulls his sword out and wails in an attempt to be scary. Aang, Katara, and Toph are unimpressed.)</i> <br><br><b>Aang:</b> I think I liked "the man with a sword for a hand" better.<br><b>Toph:</b> Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.<br><b>Katara:</b> No, wait, I've got one, and this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?<br><b>Katara:</b> No, it happened to Mom. <i>(everyone focuses their attention on her)</i> One winter, when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom realized she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home, just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice, <i>(little girl's voice)</i> "It's so cold and I can't get warm." Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue, like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but... when every one came back, Nini was gone.<br><br><i>(Aang wraps Momo's ears around his head nervously. The camera pans left to Sokka, who is hiding behind a tree trunk and peering over.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Where'd she go? <br><b>Katara:</b> No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day. But sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out from a shot of the gang huddled around the fire, looking through the twisted tree limbs. Ominous music is heard in the background. Cut to a close up of Toph. She gasps and places a hand to the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> Wait. Guys, did you hear that? I hear people under the mountain, and they're screaming.<br><br><i>(Aang, Katara, Momo, and Sokka all hug each other, trembling with fear. Sokka soon regains his composure.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Pft, nice try.<br><br><i>(Cut back to the shot looking through the tree limbs.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> No, I'm serious, I hear something.<br><b>Katara:</b> You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories.<br><b>Toph:</b> It just stopped.<br><b>Aang:</b> All right, now I'm getting scared.<br><b>Old Woman:</b> Hello, children. <i>(Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Momo all scream and run off, revealing her. They all gather around and hug Toph. She walks into the fire's light)</i> Sorry to frighten you, my name is Hama. You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night. I have an inn nearby, why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?<br><br><i>(The camera pans across the faces of the group, stopping at Sokka.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Yes, please.<br><br><i>(Hama smiles and walks away. The scene shifts to a shot of several houses situated on a steep slope. The camera tilts up to an old in at the top of the slope. Cut to a close up of a small cup being filled with hot water. Cut to a panning right shot of everyone gathered around a square table under a single lit lamp in the dining room. They all have cups of tea, and Hama is pouring Katara's.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.<br><b>Hama:</b> Aren't you sweet? You know, you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.<br><b>Sokka:</b> What do you mean, disappearing?<br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(ominously)</i> When the moon turns full, people walk in, and they don't come out. <i>(cheerfully)</i> Who wants more tea? <i>(she frowns. The camera pans across the table, showing the fearful expression the kids all have)</i> Don't worry; you'll all be completely safe here. Why don't I show you to your rooms, and you can get a good night's rest?<br><br><i>(The scene shifts to Sokka's room and zooms in on him lying in his bed. Momo is asleep on the floor. The creaking of old trees is heard outside. Cut to a close up of Sokka rolling over, unable to fall asleep. He shuts his eyes, but opens them in terror when he hears a high pitched squeak from inside. Sokka grabs his sword and quickly sits up, drawing it. Momo chirps and hides under his covers. He looks around, but nothing is there, so he sheathes his sword.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I know Momo, this place is creepy. I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep.<br><br><i>(Sokka pulls the covers up to his eyes and looks left and right nervously. The screen slides upward like a roll of film and transitions to a shot of Sokka fast asleep, snoring and drooling. Cut to the wide shot of the room and pan right. The scene fades to morning and Sokka is now lying over the side of his bed on the floor. Cut to an upside down close up of Sokka snoring. Someone walks up to him, casting their shadow over his face and waking him.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> Wakey-wakey. <i>(Sokka wakes up and rubs his eyes. Cut to Sokka's perspective as she leans over him and smiles)</i> Time to go shopping.<br><br><i>(Katara walks into Sokka's view, smiling happily. Cut back to the close up of Sokka. The camera turns counter-clockwise and fades to a similar close up of Sokka dressed and carrying grocery bags with his sword in the town market. The camera quickly zooms out to a close up of Hama handing three coins to a merchant. Cut to a shot of Hama and Katara walking away as the old merchant smiles and waves goodbye. Cut to a close up of Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages.<br><b>Hama:</b> You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man? I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly.<br><br><i>(Katara and Hama walk off camera and reveal a townsman talking to a different merchant.)</i><br><br><b>Townsman:</b> You won't have any ash bananas till next week?<br><b>Merchant:</b> Well, I have to send the boy to Hing-Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.<br><b>Townsman:</b> Oh, right, tomorrow's the full moon.<br><b>Merchant:</b> Exactly, I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.<br><br><i>(Sokka, Aang, and Toph walk past the townsman and merchant, overhearing their conversation. </i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff during full moons... this just reeks of spirit world shenanigans.<br><b>Aang:</b> I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.<br><b>Sokka:</b> And then you can sew up this little mystery, lickety-split, Avatar-style.<br><b>Aang:</b> Helping people...that's what I do.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of the entire group. Hama stops and turns to Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> Why don't you all take those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.<br><b>Sokka:</b> This is a mysterious little town you have here <i>(looks right into Hama's face).</i><br><br><i>(Cut to an extreme close up of Hama.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(cryptically and smiling)</i> Mysterious town for mysterious children.<br><br><i>(Hama walks away. The camera zooms in on Sokka, who has an odd, confused expression. Cut to a shot of Hama's inn, then to the kitchen inside. Sokka places the wooden bucket of groceries on the table and the camera tilts up to him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.<br><b>Katara:</b> That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay. She kind of reminds me of Gran-Gran.<br><b>Sokka:</b> But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids, camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?<br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm gonna take a look around.<br><br><i>(Sokka walks out of the kitchen and up a nearby flight of stairs. Katara, Aang, and Toph follow after.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing? You can't just snoop around someone's house.<br><b>Sokka:</b> It'll be fine.<br><br><i>(Sokka proceeds to open one of the doors upstairs and glances inside the dark room. It is only a simple bedroom and he closes the door back.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b>She could be home any minute.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(nervous)</i> Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble, and this is just plain rude.<br><br><i>(Sokka finds a cabinet in the wall and grabs the door handles, trying to open it, but they are stuck.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> I'm not finished yet. <i>[grunts]</i> Come on...<br><br><i>(Sokka yanks the doors open. Cut to a close up of several marionettes falling forward, being held in place by their strings. They all yelp in surprise. Sokka jumps back and draws his sword at the puppets in fright, his back against the wall and sliding to the floor.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Ok, that's pretty creepy.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(closes the doors)</i> So... she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that. Sokka, you've looked enough. Hama will be back soon.<br><br><i>(Sokka makes his way up into the dark attic and tries to open a nearby door, but it is locked. The other three walk up the stairs and join him.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Just an ordinary, puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Then why does she have a locked door up here?<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(angry)</i> Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff.<br><b>Sokka:</b> We'll see. <i>(peers in through the keyhole. Cut to his perspective. The camera zooms in on a small chest, sitting in the light shining through the attic window)</i> It's empty except for a little chest.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(excitedly)</i> Maybe it's treasure.<br><br><i>(Sokka smiles gleefully at the thought of treasure. Aang and Katara frown at Toph. Sokka draws his sword and begins to pick the door's lock with its tip.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I have to see what's in there.<br><br><i>(There is a click and the door opens. Cut to a close up of the chest. The group can be seen walking up to it from behind.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> We shouldn't be doing this.<br><br><i>(Sokka reaches down and picks up the chest. He tries to open it, but the chest is locked.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Maybe there's a key here somewhere.<br><b>Toph:</b> Oh, hand it over. <br><br><i>(Sokka hands Toph the chest. She takes the armband made of space earth from her arm and bends it into the shape of a key. Toph pushes the key inside the chest's lock and begins turning it.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Come on, <i>come on</i>!<br><b>Toph:</b> This isn't as easy it looks.<br><br><i>(Katara looks over Toph's shoulders, blinking nervously. The sound of a bell is added to her blinks for humorous effect.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(nervous)</i> Guys, I don't know about this.<br><b>Katara:</b> This is crazy, I'm leaving.<br><b>Sokka:</b> Suit yourself. Do it, Toph.<br><br><i>(Katara begins to walk away. Cut to a close up of the chest as a click is heard. Cut to a shot of Toph as she gives a thumb up to Sokka and Aang. Both gather around the chest and even Katara runs back to try and look inside. They all inadvertently push Toph to the side. Their cheeks are pressed together comically. The lid of the chest is slowly lifted until a voice is heard behind them)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> I'll tell you what's in the box.<br><br><i>(Aang, Sokka, and Katara yell with fear and alarm. The four quickly turn around and Sokka hides the chest behind his back. Cut to a tilting up shot of Hama standing in the attic doorway as she walks forward. Cut to a shot of the kids. Sokka, Katara, and Aang look down with guilt as Sokka hands the chest to Hama. <br><br>Cut to a shot from inside the chest as Hama opens it and reaches inside. Cut to a close up of Sokka's eyes, wide with fear and anticipation. Hama begins to lift the object from the chest. Cut to a shot of the four kids. They look up in fear as Hama lifts the object in front of the camera. The tension is lifted when the object is revealed to be nothing more than a simple blue comb made from whale bone. Hama smiles at them cheerfully.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(disbelief)</i> An old comb?<br><b>Hama:</b> It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I owned from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.<br><br><i>(The camera zooms in on Sokka and Katara as a wave of shock goes through them. Fade to black, then commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(The episode returns to a shot of the kids staring at Hama in shock.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You're from the Southern Water Tribe?<br><b>Hama:</b> Just like you.<br><b>Katara:</b> How did you know?<br><b>Hama:</b> I heard you talking around your campfire.<br><b>Sokka:</b> But why didn't you tell us?<br><b>Hama:</b> I wanted to surprise you. I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big, Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes, if you stew them long enough.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(grimaces in utter disgust)</i> Great.<br><b>Katara:</b> I knew I felt a bond with you right away.<br><b>Sokka:</b> And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right. <i>(Katara punches him in the arm)</i> But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.<br><b>Hama:</b> Apology accepted. Now let's get cooking.<br><br><i>(The scene cuts to the outside of the inn. It is night, and lights can be seen in the windows. The camera pans left as Aang runs outside to a small barn. Cut to the inside of the barn where Appa and Momo are staying. Aang opens the door and tosses a cabbage into Appa's mouth. Momo jumps to the ground and chirps furiously as Appa. Appa spits the cabbage out. Momo grabs the cabbage and carries it off screen.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a close up of Hama placing a bowl of soup on the table inside the inn. Cut to a panning right shot of everyone seated at the dinner table, empty bowls placed in front of them. Cut to a shot of Aang leaning over to Toph.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I'd steer clear of the "sea prunes".<br><b>Toph:</b> I thought they were ocean kumquats.<br><b>Aang:</b> Close enough.<br><b>Hama:</b> Who wants five-flavor soup?<br><br><i>(Aang, Katara, and Sokka raise their hands. Hama places her hand over the bowl of soup and bends the liquid out of it. With a flick of her fingers, Hama bends the soup into everyone's bowls, much to their amazement.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You're a Waterbender! I've never met another Waterbender from our tribe.<br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(sadly)</i> That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one.<br><b>Sokka:</b> So how did you end up out here?<br><b>Hama:</b> I was stolen from my home. <i>(fade to a flashback of a young Hama in the Southern Water Tribe)</i> It was over 60 years ago when the raids started. <br><br><i>(Hama walks over to a young Kana and they both giggle. Hama looks up as black snow begins to fall from the sky. Cut to Hama and Kana running up the steps to the top of the wall surrounding the village. The camera tilts up to reveal Fire Nation ships floating out in the water, and large fire balls flying towards the camera. Cut to an overhead shot of the village being bombarded. Cut to a close up of several firebenders marching away from the ships, ash and soot falling all around them. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of a firebender throwing fireballs in every direction. Villagers run away in fright, and another firebender runs onscreen behind him. A waterbender emerges from underneath the snow behind the firebender, encasing the firebender in the background in a pillar of ice and knocking the one in the foreground away with a trail of ice from the ground. A large net is thrown over the waterbender and he is dragged off screen.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of Hama and several other waterbenders as they fight of the firebenders. To of the waterbenders behind her are captured by the nets. A net is thrown over Hama, but she cuts it in half with a blade of water.) </i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> They came again and again, each time, rounding up more of our Waterbenders, and taking them captive. <br><br><i>(Young Hama watches as the other waterbenders are dragged off towards the ships. Fade to a close up of Hama panting. The camera zooms out to a shot of her and several other waterbenders raising their arms upward. Cut to a far shot of a Fire Nation ship being pushed up and trapped by the ice underneath that Hama and the other waterbenders are bending. It is the same ship that Aang<br>and Katara explored in "The Boy in the Iceberg.")</i><br><br><b>Hama>:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued. <br><br><i>(The waterbenders behind Hama fade and disappear until only Hama is left. Cut to a close up of Hama. The camera rotates around her and zooms out to show firebenders surrounding her. She lowers her hands in defeat. )</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Finally, I too was captured.<br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of Hama surrounded by three large rings of firebenders. A Fire Nation flag flutters in the foreground. Cut to a shot of Hama being led up the steps of a Fire Nation ship, her hands shackled.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> I was led away in chains. The last Waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Hama standing at the top of the steps, flanked by the firebenders. The camera zooms out before cutting to a shot of young Kana, tears in her eyes, and a few other villagers looking back. Cut to a close up of a tears eyed Hama. A shadow passes over her. Cut to Hama's perspective as the stairs are pulled up. With a loud thud, the flash back ends and the scene shifts back to Hama in the present. The camera zooms out as Katara walks to Hama and puts her hands on Hama's shoulders consolingly.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.<br><b>Sokka:</b> How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?<br><b>Hama:</b> I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.<br><b>Katara:</b> We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.<br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(patting Katara's hand)</i> Oh, you poor things.<br><br><i>(Aang and Sokka lower their heads solemnly)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor, you're a hero.<br><b>Hama:</b> I never thought I'd meet another Southern Waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know, so you can carry on the Southern Tradition when I'm gone.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(excitedly)</i> Yes, yes of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Hama and zoom in as she smiles. Cut to a shot of the town on the next day.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Growing up at the South Pole, Waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. <i>(the camera tilts down to Hama and Katara walking over a rocky hillside outside the village)</i> But, as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.<br><b>Katara:</b> I know, when we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.<br><b>Hama:</b> That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.<br><b>Katara:</b> I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.<br><b>Hama:</b> That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you can even pull water out of thin air? <i>(throws her hand out and creates a circle over her head, collecting the moisture in the<br>air)</i> You've got to keep an open mind, Katara. <i>(cut to a close up of the water forming around her fingers and turning into icicles)</i> There's water in places you never think about.<br><br><i>(Hama swings her hand around behind her and throws the icicles. They lodge themselves into the trunk of a nearby tree with ease. Cut to a close up of Hama. The camera pans to the right slightly and zooms in on Katara standing behind her, looking on happily. Cut to a panning right shot of a river in the Fire Nation countryside from the top of a mountain. Aang comes into view.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> This has gotta be the nicest, natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.<br><b>Toph:</b> Maybe the moon spirit just turned mean.<br><br><i>(Sokka takes a big whiff of some yellow flowers before turning to Toph.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(furious) </i>The moon spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and... lunar goodness.<br><br><i>(A traveler walks down the nearby trail and Aang turns to him.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?<br><b>Traveling Townsman:</b> Only one man ever saw it and lived, and that's Old Man Ding.<br><b>Toph:</b> Where does Old Man Ding live?<br><br><i>(The scene shifts to Katara and Hama walking through the field of red flowers dotted with large rocks. The mountain can be seen in the distance.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Wow, these flowers are beautiful.<br><b>Hama:</b> They're called Fire Lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants, and all living things, they're filled with water.<br><b>Katara:</b> I met a Waterbender who lived in a swamp, and could control the vines by bending the water inside.<br><b>Hama:</b> You can take it even further.<br><br><i>(Hama waves her hands in a large circle, being the water right out of the fire lilies surrounding her, making them dry, black and shriveled. Hama completes the circle and chops her hand downward at tall rock. The water hits the rock and passes through, cleanly slicing off four pieces.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> That was incredible. <i>(stares down at the flowers sadly)</i> It's a shame about the lilies, though.<br><b>Hama:</b> They're just flowers. When you're a Waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight, I'll teach you the ultimate technique of Waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its <i>peak</i>.<br><b>Katara:</b> But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.<br><b>Hama:</b> Oh, Katara. Two master Waterbenders beneath a full moon? I don't think we have <i>anything</i> to worry about.<br><br><i>(Katara and Hama begin walking away towards the forest. The camera tilts up and fades to an overhead shot of Aang, Sokka, and Toph walking through town at night. The camera tilts up to an old man at work on one of the small houses. Cut to a close up of the old man steadying his hammer as he holds a nail against a board.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Old Man Ding?<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out slightly. Old Man Ding glances back behind him just as he brings his hammer down on his thumb, causing him an immense amount of pain and to drop his hammer.)</i><br><br><b>Old Man Ding:</b> Eeh, yeow! Aw, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old. <i>(crouches down to lift up a board, but is too weak)</i> Aww... well, I'm young at heart. <i>(Aang reaches down and helps him lift the board up to the window)</i> Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster, yet, at least.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(takes the hammer and nail and proceeds to nail the board down)</i> We wanted to ask you about that. <br><b>Aang:</b> Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?<br><b>Old Man Ding:</b> Didn't see no spirit. Just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain. <i>(cut to a close up of Ding's finger pointing at the mountain)</i> I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my <i>own</i> limbs. <i>(walks around a bit like he is possessed)</i> It just about had me into a cave up there. And I looked up at the moon, for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light. But then, the sun started to rise. And I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!<br><b>Sokka:</b> Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?<br><b>Toph:</b> Oh, no! <i>(she startles Aang and Sokka)</i> I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there.<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out from a shot of them all staring up at the mountain. Cut to commercial.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(The show returns to a shot of Toph's feet running across the ground. She, Sokka, and Aang sprint through the woods until she stops and places a hand on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> I can hear them, they're this way.<br><br><i>(Toph, Aang, and Sokka all run towards the mountain. Cut to a close up of the full moon shining brightly in the sky. Cut to a far, overhead shot of Katara and Hama in the woods.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> Can you feel the power the full moon brings? <i>(inhales deeply)</i> For generations, it has blessed Waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things. <i>(Cut to a close up of her arm as she flexes her hand and as her veins begin to pop out. Cut to a shot of her staring at the moon, arms outstretched, then to an extreme close up of her face)</i> I've never felt more alive.<br><br><i>(The scene cuts back to Toph, Aang, and Sokka making their way to the foot of the mountain. Cut to a shot from the inside of a cave as the three come to its mouth.)</i><br><br><b>Toph:</b> This is the place.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I can't see anything down there.<br><b>Toph:</b> <i>(takes Sokka's hand)</i> That's why you have me, let's go.<br><br><i>(They all jump into the darkness of the cave. The camera zooms in, and the scene fades to darkness before returning to a shot of the inside of the cave. The camera pans right to a wall and metal doorway that are lit by two torches. Toph, Aang, and Sokka run up to it. Toph stops at the door, stomps her foot down behind her for support, and punches the door with both fists, knocking it off its hinges. They make their way further into the cave, Sokka and Aang lighting the way with the torches. Cut to their point of view as they enter a new chamber. They stop, and Sokka and Aang stare with shock as the torch light reveals dozens of men and women chained to the walls of the cave.) </i><br><br><b>1st Male Prisoner:</b> We're saved.<br><br><i>(The three enter the chamber. Toph takes her armband off and begins unlocking one person's shackles.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> I didn't know that spirits made prisons like this, who brought you here?<br><b>Female Prisoner:</b> It was no spirit. <br><b>2nd Male Prisoner:</b> It was a witch.<br><b>Sokka:</b> A witch, what do you mean?<br><b>Male Prisoner:</b> She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster.<br><b>Sokka:</b> <i>(angry)</i> Hama!<br><b>1st Male Prisoner:</b> Yes, the innkeeper.<br><b>Sokka:</b> I knew there was something creepy about her. <br><b>Aang:</b> We have to stop Hama!<br><b>Toph:</b> I'll get these people out of here, you go.<br><br><i>(Sokka gives one of the freed prisoners his torch before running with Aang. Cut to a shot of a cat-owl sitting on a tree branch, directly in front of the moon, hooting and swishing its tail before flying away. Cut to a panning right shot of Hama and Katara, their backs to the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> What I'm about to show you, I discovered in that wretched, Fire Nation prison. <i>(fade to a flashback of a close up of young Hama staring through the bars of a cell and looking down sadly) </i> The guards were always careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air, and had us suspended away from the ground. <br><br><i>(Cut to a panning right shot of the prison. The cells hang from chains, and there are pipes lining the walls. The guards stand on walkways between the cells.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(voiceover)</i> Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend. Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution. <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of a guard holding a cup attached to a long pole up to Hama mouth. Her hands are chained and pulled up above her as she drinks the water. The scene flashes white and returns to the present to a shot of the full moon.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> And yet, each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy. There had to be something I could do to escape. <i>(fade back to young Hama in her cell, staring at the moon shining through the grate in the prison ceiling)</i> Then I realized that where there is life, there is water. The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage, were nothing more than skins filled with liquid. <i>(an elephant rat crawls over the chains and into her cell. She flexes her hand, and the rat stiffens)</i> And I passed years developing the skills that would lead to my escape. <i>(fade back to a close up of Hama in the present) Bloodbending</i>. Controlling the water in another body. <i>(Katara stares at her in horror)</i> Enforcing your own will over theirs. <i>(fade to the flashback to a shot of young Hama controlling five elephant rats with her hand)</i> Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men...<br><br><i>(Cut to a profile shot of a prison guard walking down the walkway. He suddenly stops and his body begins to jerk unnaturally. He watches with fright as his own hand moves on its own and grabs the keys at his belt and he is dragged forward. Cut to a shot of Hama pulling the guards in with her bending and forcing him to unlock her cell. Cut to a shot of the guard falling to the floor. Hama jumps out of her cell behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> <i>(voiceover)</i> And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades. <i>(the guard tries to get up, but Hama presses her hand down, forcing him back down. Hama walks away, her legs unsteady and wobbly from months of inactivity) </i> My cell unlocked by the <i>very</i> guards assigned to keep me in. <i>(the scene flashes white and returns to a shot of Hama and Katara)</i> Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything... or anyone.<br><br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(uneasy)</i> But, to reach inside someone and control them? I don't know if I want that kind of power.<br><b>Hama: </b>The choice is not yours. The power exists...and it's your duty to use the gifts you've been given to win this war. Katara, they tried to wipe us out, our entire culture... your mother!<br><b>Katara:</b> I know.<br><b>Hama:</b> Then you should understand what I'm talking about. We're the last Waterbenders of the Southern Tribe. We have to fight these people whenever we can. Wherever they are, with <i>any</i> means necessary!<br><b>Katara:</b> It's you. <i>You're</i> the one who's making people disappear during the full moons.<br><b>Hama:</b> They threw me in prison to rot, along with my brothers and sisters. They deserve the same. You must carry on my work.<br><b>Katara:</b> <i>(defiant)</i> I won't! I won't use bloodbending, and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town.<br><br><i>(Katara points her finger at Hama, but her arms twists to one side, then the other side, and behind her back. Katara grabs her arm and tries to stop it.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> You should have learned the technique before you turned against me. <i>(makes Katara stand straight up, stiff)</i> It's impossible to fight your way out of my grip. I control every muscle, every vein in your body.<br><br><i>(Hama uses bloodbending to twist Katara's body around and throw her from side to side. Cut to Hama's point of view as she causes Katara's body to twitch and jerk erratically, her hands in the foreground. Cut to a close up of Hama as she slowly brings her hands down, smiling sadistically. Katara is forced down to her knees. Tears begin to form in her eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Stop...please.<br><br><i>(Hama cackles sinisterly. Cut to a shot of the full moon. Fade to a close up of Katara looking down, tears streaming down her face. Cut to a close up of her hands on the ground. She clenches her fists, and the grass around them shrivels and dies. Cut back to the close up of Katara as she lifts her eyes at Hama<br>in anger. Cut to Hama as her smile quickly fades and her laughter ends. Katara stands back up and takes a deep breath, lifting her hands.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You're not the only one who draws power from the moon. My bending is <i>more</i> powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me!<br><br><i>(Hama and Katara both enter their battle stances. Katara lifts her arms up and bends the water out of the grass and into a ring around her. She hops forward, spins once, and flings the water at Hama. Hama takes the water with her bending and redirects the attack back at Katara. Katara skillfully takes the water back, spins back around, and flings the water back again, countering the counter-attack. Hama extracts the water from two trees, creating two large torrents, and throws them forward before taking Katara's attack and flinging it back again. The three torrents all form one massive torrent of water and fly towards Katara. Katara steps back and presses her hand forward, blocking the attack. The scene goes into slow motion as the water is completely blocked, exploding into a spectacular shower of droplets. Cut to a close up Katara, the droplets reflecting her eyes, then to Hama, the droplets reflecting her shock and fear. </i><br><br><i>The scene goes back to full speed as Katara dashes forward and circles her arms inward. The water hanging in the air is bent into two torrents, one hitting Hama head, the other her feet, spinning her in mid air like a yin-yang and knocking her down as she yells. Hama slowly rises up as Sokka and Aang run into the area.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> We know what you've been doing, Hama!<br><b>Aang:</b> Give up, you're outnumbered.<br><b>Hama:</b> No. You've outnumbered yourselves.<br><br><i>(Hama raises both arms and Aang and Sokka's bodies stiffen. Hama flings them at Katara. Katara leaps between the two, dodging them, gathers more water from the grass and flings it at Hama as she rises. Hama extracts the water from another tree and creates a massive spinning wheel of water in front of her body to forcibly block the attack. Katara is ready for more when Sokka comes at her with his sword.)</i><br><br><b>Sokka:</b> Katara, look out! It's like my brain has a mind of its own. Stop it, arm, stop it!<br><br><i>(Hama waves her arms to the side, controlling Sokka and making Katara back away. Katara extracts more water from the grass and knocks Sokka away with it. Aang is then controlled at is forced to attack Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Aang:</b> This feels weird.<br><br><i>(Katara smashes the water hard into Aang, knocking him into a tree. Katara throws the water at Aang and freezes it, pinning him to the tree.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> I'm sorry, Aang.<br><b>Aang:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> It's ok.<br><br><i>(Hama bloodbends Sokka to attack again. Cut to a close up of Sokka swinging<br>his sword, his face full of fear. Katara quickly extracts the water from a sapling and flings it at Sokka's sword arm. He is sent flying back and hits a tree. Katara freezes the water and pins him there. Cut to a close up of Hama.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> Don't hurt your friends, Katara... and don't let them hurt each other.<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out to a shot of Hama with her arms outstretched. She lowers her stance and pulls her arms in. Aang and Sokka are both pulled off the trees, and are sent flying towards each other. Sokka's sword is pointed forward intended to impale Aang. Both of them scream in terror. Cut to a close up of Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> No!<br><br><i>(Sokka and Aang both stop just before the sword can pierce the airbender. Both stare at their hands, realizing they have control again. They look to Hama, who stiffens and twitches, full of fear. Cut to a close up of Katara, her hands stretched outward, bloodbending Hama. Katara is shocked at first, then slowly brings her hands down, forcing Hama to her knees. Hama struggles to get back up, but glances back when Toph and the prisoners arrive. The scene cuts to a close up of Hama's hands being bound by shackles. The camera quickly zooms out to a shout of everyone surrounding her.)</i><br><br><b>1st Prisoner:</b> You're going to be locked away forever.<br><br><i>(Two of the prisoners begin to lead Hama away.)</i><br><br><b>Hama:</b> My work is done. <i>(cut to a close up as she turns her head to Katara)</i> Congratulations, Katara. You're a bloodbender.<br><br><i>(Cut to and zoom in on Katara as she puts a hand to her mouth and slowly begins to cry. Cut back to Hama as she begins to laugh with evil. The prisoners take her away and Katara drops to her knees. Cut to a shot of Katara sobbing, with Aang and Sokka resting their hands on her shoulder to comfort her. Their backs are to the camera, and it zooms in on the full moon hanging overhead.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Momo approaches him)</i> It was just a dream Momo, I still have my pants. <i>(cut to wide ground shot of Aang getting up) </i>Well, I better keep training.<br><br><i>(Close shot of Aang with an extremely intense look on his face. Cut to a shot of Zuko in the balloon's basket, holding on to the ropes and staring off at Appa. The camera zooms in on him. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

The scene fades to a flashback of the same shot of Zuko, bandage covering his eye.)</i><br><br><b>Zuko</b>: If I have to, I will spend every day of the rest of my life hunting the Avatar. I know it's my destiny to capture him.<br><br><i>(Iroh places his hand on Zuko's shoulder from off screen and the camera zooms out to reveal him.)</i><br><br><b>Iroh</b>: You know, Prince Zuko, destiny is a funny thing. You never know how things are going to work out. But if you keep an open mind and an open heart, I promise you will find your own destiny someday.<br><br><i>(Cut to the same shot of Zuko, then fade back to Zuko in the present, smiling and nodding his head. He then opens his eyes with slight alarm and turns his head. The camera turns towards the door to reveal Katara leaning against the frame. Zuko stands up and faces her, about to say something, but Katara speaks first.)</i><br><br><b>Katara</b>: <i>(venomously)</i> You might have everyone else here buying your "<i>transformation".</i> But you and I both know you've struggled with doing the right thing in the past. <i>(walks up to Zuko and leans forward threateningly)</i> So let me tell you something right now. You make one step backward, one slip-up, give me one reason to think you might hurt Aang... and you won't have to worry about your destiny anymore. Because I'll make sure your destiny ends right then and there... <i>permanently</i>.<br><br><i>(Katara turns and walks away. Cut to a close up of Zuko and slowly zoom out. Cut to a wide shot of the room from behind them and slowly zoom out as Katara leaves through the door and closes it behind her. Fade to white.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
